All-in-all it was a fabulous, tasty meal - leaving one feel nicely fed but not stuffed - and all for a very reasonable price. The quality of the cuisine could have come from a kitchen charging 50% more - if indeed you can find it.
Why the restaurant wasn't bursting at the seams, I really cannot understand. It deserves to be rammed. I hope to return soon.

Name: Moathouse Café
Title: Lunch
Review: A friend was visiting and we took her here for lunch we all had a sandwich which was excellent value for money freshly prepared and served with salad,very enjoyable plesant surrodings the staff are very polite, recomend this lovely cafe.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Overpriced
Review:
We stayed on the 14th June and assumed that we would be staying in the main building which is a beautiful old coaching inn, but no we were in the Annexe, that is the Premier Inn that is in the car park of the hotel. We stayed last year and had a fabulous room in the main building for less money. When I spoke to the duty manager she was ambivalent about the fact we felt the room was over priced and implied that we should have asked to be in the main building even though we were unaware of the existence of the annexe.
On the following Monday we stayed at The Spread Eagle hotel in Midhurst and we were on a room and dinner deal that was the same price as the Norfolk Arms room only and that was a lovely experience, we will not be returning to the Norfolk.
Read less

Name: The Lion
Title: Delicious dishes !
Review:
Just enjoyed an excellent meal at the Lion. The Salmon in white wine was delicious, beautiful pork belly and a tasty Surf and Turf. Served with a range of fresh vegetables.
Quick and friendly service what more could you want.
Great chef Guy and his team.

Name: Butlins
Title: Family Group Visit
Review:
18 family members with ages ranging between 3 & 89 staying in 8 rooms/deluxe suites visited for long weekend on a food court basis. A well run resort with plenty to do for all ages , great funfair , pool facility & day long entertainment. Food ,although a tadge canteen style was hot & plentiful and the staff were more than happy to help with allergies.
No negatives from our group and all the staff we encountered were very helpful and cheerful.
Drinks were not too expensive. so all in all a great trip.
Shout out for Louise in the Coral Beach dining who went the extra mile with an elderly relative.
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Family Christmas Dinner
Review: Paid £55 per head/7 for very poor meals. The quality was not there, one of the meals had clearly been kept warm as the sauce was congealed, the fillet steaks left a lot to be desired as did the quality of the turkey dinners. Two people had ice cream bombs which were served with cold sauce hence they could not melt the chocolate; therefor fairly inedible. We were the last people for dinner (4pm), which showed in the standard of cooking, also some of the service was dreadfully poor; had to ask for water on 3 occasions. Will not be going back anytime soon, £400 wasted, shame on Beefeater, spoiled our Christmas Day.

Name: Monsoon
Title: Extremely rude and arrogant waiters/staff
Review: As a regular I have always been aware of the rudeness of the two guys in front of house but I could deal with it. To cut a long story short I work away a lot and get back at late hours and sometimes waiting for food while I have a wine (or two) let’s me combine a drink after work while getting a take away. However, the staff are rude (considering I am a very regular customer) but last week was enough...snide comments, lack of professionalism, being judgmental and totally lacking any kind of customer service I have decided to never go back. PS- if you live in the Rustington area then opt for Cinnamon in Littlehampton, food is Devine and service impeccable- lacks a bit of atmosphere is the only downside.

Name: Denmans Gardens
Title: Disappointing
Review: Sad to see that it has lost the character and magic experienced under the management of the previous owners. Particularly disappointed with the lack of plants for sale - previously there was a huge choice of unusual plants, etc. - and the cafe which used to have a superb menu and food. Now very lackluster and totally without character. Service was poor too. Won't be visiting Denmans again.

Name: River Breeze
Title: Never opens on time
Review: Good food ....but if on a tight schedule best go else where we rang said they open at ten its 10.20am and still not open and we are still waiting think we will now go elsewhere

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Time on your hands
Review: Went there on 27th September because we were staying in the premier inn next door for convenience, the staff was fine no problem, ordered the food friends had prawn cocktail no problem with that this is where it went tits up I had the curry others had the hunters chicken ONE HOUR AND TWENTY MINUTES LATER. The curry was ok but the hunters chicken was dry burnt, chips was dried up, it was made then left under some heater lamp to dry up, how the hell premier inn can use a badly run establishment we really don't know. Won't be going back

Name: BailiffsCourt Restaurant
Title: Set in the most exquisite grounds
Review: Was treated by our friend to the three course set luncheon menu, each course had a nice choice and hard to choose, the food was outstanding as also the restaurant. The staff very attentive and will definitely be returning again. You can also opt for the set price two courses if you wish.

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Rude welcoming...
Review: Having recently moved to the area, we had been told this little pub was a must to try. I called and booked (knowing how busy Sunday's get in a good pub) plus we had a dog - they were more than happy for us to bring him. We had been for a long walk before hand but made sure our boots were clean before entering the pub after seeing signs stating boots should be removed if dirty (completely understandable if ours were!) Unfortunately we walked into what I can only describe as very clicky locals sitting and judging at the bar (I LOVE going to a pub with welcoming locals which I expected but unfortunately this was not the case) and not one greeting from the staff. The first word which was said to us by an older lady was "please can you leave and take your boots off, you're making my carpets dirty" no 'hello, how can we help' or anything. I'm completely understanding about the removal of boots when dirty but no dirt was on our boots and quite frankly her attitude stank. I've been the owner of five successful pubs in Sussex and if a bit of mud on a carpet in a COUNTRY pub is an issue then they need a rethink or learn that sometimes mess does happen but a hoover or dust pan and brush can be a quick fix. Unfortunately we walked out and found another humbling and welcoming pub down the road which we had visited prior for a drink. We will not be returning.

Name: Church Farm
Title: Miss
Review:
Upgrade a few weeks before from Standard to a Platinum caravan, I must say I wish I hadn’t bothered. Could book in at 1, by the time I have rang Reception Twice, to sort out the Problems and still wasn’t sorted I walked down to speck to the manager. Most of the problems were sort by 6.30 pm . Over 5 hours of holiday wasted. Blinds broke, rubbish, in bin, toilets not cleaned, bedding had ash on it and someone had been on it, cushions over the floor , marks on windows, drity marks on bathroom cabinet. We asked to move and was told there was nowhere, it was busy the weekend but Monday/ Friday was not many caravans Occupied but was still told they couldn’t move us . Very unhappy, then to top off the start of our holiday the restaurant gave our food to the wrong table and we waited over 40 minutes
Read less

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Terrible!!
Review: We booked in Sept for our christmas dinner special treat as a family, we expected a great service & lovely meal at £58 a head, as this year was a treat for me to not do the cooking. The staff were dis-interested, never once were we asked if everything was ok with our meals (That is usual practice & something they should do!) The starters were shamefully small & disappointing to taste. The mains were no better, & the desserts also mediocre (everything was dry & rubbery!) I personally left there not eating any of my courses! And the other guests on our table didn't want to complain as its christmas day, but for me? If you dont want to work christmas day (understandable!) Then dont work in that line of work! My experience there today has been So bitterly disappointing that I will never eat there again at any time of the year as we have done many times previously. Their website says that they will make our day special, which is what we wanted.. but never again! Totally ruined our christmas day!

Name: Best Western Bognor
Title: Great way to see in 2019
Review:
Attended NYE gala dinner and stayed over. Good size room, very clean and well maintained, modern fittings. Friendly welcome from very efficient staff. The dinner was excellent, good food and good service, the manager was on the ball and kept it all going well. Good music tho the dance floor was quite tiny for the number of people attending. Good breakfast. Excellent location right next to the beach and pleasant promenade. A bit of a hidden gem
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Dinner before going to the cinema
Review: We went for dinner at the Harvester as we felt it would be convenient as we didn’t have a great deal of time as we were going to the Cinema afterwards. I can honestly say we wish we hadn’t bothered I had ribs which used to be good years ago but tonight they was dry and there was barely any sauce on it at all so very disappointing and the corn on the cob was over cooked but the chips were passable. The salad bar which I used to really enjoy there was also poor most of the salad was gone and hadn’t been replaced and what was there didn’t look fresh and the sauces were all in the wrong place so not good. My partner asked specifically for his steak to be cooked medium rare and it came completely over cooked and was inedible so he asked for a refund which they gave quite happily as they could see that it was. The restaurant-was very noisy and not very clean we certainly won’t be rushing back anytime soon. I was looking forward to going so very disappointed indeed.

Name: World's End
Title: Great pub for a family dinner
Review:
Visited on a Friday evening in the summer holidays.
Very friendly staff, great range of beer, Cider and other drinks.
Excellent food, with a good children's menu, gluten free and veggie options.
Happily catered for a child with Coeliacs.
Would recommend booking as very busy, we reserved the last table.

Name: The Diner
Title: Fab
Review: We had the best service at the diner.The young lady who made our meal so much more enjoyable is wasted in here whom ever is in charge at butlins bognor regis should make her a redcoat next season.Thankyou Chloe.Oh and the food was good too!

Name: Arden B&B
Title: Much needed friendly welcome
Review:
After walking for two days on the South Downs we ended up at Arundel and Arden House.
We received a much needed warm welcome from Lucie. The room was nice, very cosy, it was clean and had all the things you'd expect. The breakfast was decent and served with a smile.
For the price I would say this was good value for money and I'd come back again if I was in the area.
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Well Done Sunday Lunch
Review:
The restaurant was really busy but they found us a table and we ordered very quickly. Excellent service but the meal was disappointing. I ordered the half roast chicken Sunday lunch with all the trimmings. I received two chicken legs, roast potatoes that were so solid I couldn’t cut them. I told the server to be told that the two legs were half a chicken and what do I expect when I order a supermarket chicken...

Still the salad and service was excellent.

Name: Greggs
Title: Going Downlhill!
Review: I occasionally call into Greggs for one of their pasties that I find very tasty indeed. Sadly the past two occasions they had run out, this morning was the same so I asked for a Sausage Roll. The assistant muttered 15 minutes, nothing else so I assumed I would have had to wait. That cabinet didn't have much on offer so I had the plum for a make do snack to satisfy my appetite.The shop is in great need for attention, regular replenishment of the hot snack cabinet and staff training would be a good start. Sorry to sound so negative but I cannot find anything complementary to say on today's visit.

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Not very good!
Review: Came here for Mother's Day. The fish and chips I had was okay, but my parents told me the roast was dreadful, as indeed it looked to me at the time. The fact the dining room was practically empty at one o'clock on Mother's Day was probably a give away. Got the impression it was a drinkers pub, not at all classy. Will avoid in future.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Awful bar maid
Review: Come to have a meal with my family who have come a long way to visit me; get told we need to eat for our table as we had arrived early which is absolutely fine and the young man who told us this was very welcoming and accommodating for us. We then go to order a drink. Now I have worked in loads of bars; I am a 22 year old who has many visible tattoos. I was ordering drinks for my family only to be ID. Now this again is fine but when I told the lady that I was indeed 22 and had been here many times and I wasn’t drinking and also having a meal here I got the foulest response saying that I still need to be ID which wouldn’t have been the issue. The issues was the way this women treated me as if I was stupid. Then once we were seated me and my family felt like we where being watched and it made our time every uncomfortable. This is very unfortunate as the other staff members where every nice and welcoming. Truly a massive shame.

Name: William Hardwick
Title: The Willy Hard
Review: This pub has been transformed from a dodgy gross city pub to a beautiful communion of local townsfolk. There's a pool table for all your sporting needs, a gambling machine for all your gambling needs and a bar for all your drinking needs (of which I know we all have.) They have my favourite tapped lager, amstel. The staff are friendly. My only negative comment is the lack of pork scratchings. Real kick in the balls that one.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Lovely Breakfast
Review:
This is a great cafe/ bar that’s open all day for food.
Great outside seating too on summer days.
We regularly call in as the food and service is always good.

Can see why the chain of “ lounges” continues to grow. We have been to quite a few around the country and they are all great.

Staff are friendly and helpful and there is always a great atmosphere.

Name: Out of Bounds
Title: Not subtle about closing down!
Review:
Took our eldest to a birthday party so decided to take the younger one to have a play too. Soft play is excellent and both boys enjoy it.

I ordered food for our youngest and myself. At 5.30 just as I had collected our food the soft play closed. The staff then started to clean up the seating area by the soft play where we were sat. They were putting the chairs up on the tables around us, and not quietly either.

I recommend ordering a kids burger instead of an adult one as you get more for your money on a kids meal.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: This is the real thing
Review:
The other reviewers say it all. This castle and beautiful little town deserve the planning that it takes to get here. Arundel is a slightly out of the way village. That's good, as you don't want huge tourist crowds anyway. I had only time for the cheaper ticket, chapel and gardens plus entry to the shop and cafe. Those indoor areas give you some idea of the grandeur of the placce. The chapel is truly ancient and to me it did feel........ Well, awesome. The gardens are magnificent on a clear day. Huge stone walls surround them. Check the website as the castle has a long off season and is closed from autumn through to spring. It is still a family home, nothing like a ruin. You need plenty of time to see it to good effect. You would be disappointed if you set only 2 hours aside, that isn't really enough time for the whole thing. Take a small picnic to the gardens if you want, not a huge basket as you may have to leave that at security. Outside the castle the Arun River is nearby, where you will often see real white swans. Further up the road is a kind of Wetlands park, not cheap but it's supposed to be excellent for kids, and if you keep going, in under 15 mins you will get to a pretty lake with some nice walking behind it. It's just a pity that all accommodation for miles around is so expensive. Still, you can make it a day out, travelling from a hostel in Brighton.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: visited some years back
Review:
there was an event same day, extra rooms open too and good gardens and a church too. thought it one of the rare good value stately piles to visit. had a cupper only but passing ham on plate looked freshly sliced and made a change from normall stuff offered elsewhere
Read less

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Ms
Review:
This hotel is one of the worst places I have stayed. Rooms are extremely dated and in need of repair . Nothing like the photos don't be fooled . Should be rated 2 star hostel . Very expensive for what you get
Read less

Name: KFC Bognor
Title: If you want lousy service and greasy food visit here
Review:
We visited here on the 17th June as it was convenient to where we were staying.

The server couldn't be more uninterested and unhelpful if he tried. We took our order away with us and didn't realise the following until afterwards. The food order was half wrong with different food to what we'd ordered and was so greasy it got thrown into the bin.

We'd asked for sauces, napkins and hand cleansers and none of them were given. They probably would have tasted better than the food ......

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Had booked into the restaurant for lunch on Sunday Feb 17th
Review:
The meal was average...not the best for such a renowned hotel..small portions as well as not enough vegetables for the 4 of us. Our whole experience was ruined when we were told we'd need to pay £10 to park our car at the back of the hotel. Never again...daylight robbery
Read less

Name: La Campagnia
Title: What a find!
Review:
It was our first visit to La Campania in Arundel but we needn’t have worried. From the moment we arrived, on a busy Saturday evening, we received friendly efficient service.
The extensive menu covers all tastes and I would recommend the ‘Trio of fish’ as a main course.
We’ll definitely be going back!

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Sunday lunch 19th May 2019
Review:
Horrendous, I ordered the chicken roast. Arrived with no gravy upon I waited for 15 more minutes for it to arrive after my dinner was served. The roast potatoes and Yorkshire puddings were burnt. I reported it to the waitress ( Lucy) who said she would let the chefs know.( the chefs couldn’t of missed !)
I emailed after and only a received an apology.
I won’t be going back there

Name: Vardar Restaurant
Title: Delicious
Review: Found this fantastic restaurant in Littlehampton for dinner with the in-laws. It's a family run business and this shows in high quality of food and customer service. I had the Macadonian beef slices (I think it was called!) and it was absolutely delicious, we'll definitely be back again! Looking forward to seeing the garden in the summer. Thanks to all for a great evening.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Worth a visit
Review:
Spring is definitely the time to visit and admire the extensive and well manicured gardens at Arundel Castle
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: sunday lunch family get together
Review: Friendly service on arrival ,restaramt a little grubby and in need of a refurb . It was busy but not overly for sunday lunchtime . Took twenty minutes to take our order luckily we had already bought drinks at the bar area . Starter was probably the best part of the meal , although its difficult to go wrong with garlic bread . We warned of a 40 minute food delay but not that they were running out of the ingredients to serve , When the food did arrive my daughters chicken was like leather, the slow cooked beef pieces were tiny ,not sliced like a normal roast .Roast potatoes were hard to describe , it was a disaster on a plate to be frank . We didnt order a sweet as the meal as a whole was two hours ,luckily we had two for one vouchers ,which still outweighed the value of the meal . We came here three years ago ,we thought in reality it couldnt get any worse ,we will not return it has . The photographs of the sunday lunch had absolutely no similarity with the poor meal we had served to us today.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: FIRST AND LAST VISIT
Review: Booked via phone 31st Oct at 14.22pm for Sunday lunch on 3rd November, said we wanted the carvery and how much was it. Was told it was £14 and given the time of 2pm. At no time was I informed there was a "carvery system" and now wish I had looked on here and read Helen of Brighton's review of the 18th August. First off they said they could not find my reservation in the book then someone had a look and found it! Told them we wanted the carvery but waitress said she would put our name down for it?? meantime get our drinks. 30mins later still no news re carvery yet see people coming back with food from there (remember we did not know about the carvery system then), asked waitress again how long it was going to be and she said she did not know! Err what about going and finding out for the customer! I had not opened my bottle of drink and we decided to leave then without eating as could see this was going nowhere and it was getting late for lunch, went up to pay for partner's bottle of drink which had been opened and half-emptied (both soft drinks, not that that matters), they then tried to charge me for both, said I was not paying for mine as I had not opened it and had wanted it with my dinner which did not seem to be coming - we had pre-ordered carvery on the previous Thursday and no mention made of their carvery system to which man on duty at counter said he only works weekends! No appologies made whatsoever. This establishment might look the part, but needs vast improvement on customer service, safety, eye sight tests/reading classes and their so called carvery system (never ever come across this before) which I was informed was due to being in a small area with too many people going up and live flames of candles there ... HEALTH & SAFETY is this safe with young children around? Lit candles on all tables, as a family eatery would be safer for battery candles hence still look the part. Our table also was sticky - needs to be spray cleaned after every use, simply health and safety requirements. We really had been looking forward to this but still got our Sunday roast.... further down the road at the Swan... no "carvery system" there, and meal was delicious and cheaper! Even on an off busy day, no excuse for poor manners towards customers and have the courtsey to keep them informed especially of your so called "carvery system".

Name: Belinda's Tearooms
Title: Lovely food and tearoom
Review: Popped in to escape the weather, food very nice with plenty of choice, service excellent. Highly recommended.

Name: Wimpey
Title: Amazing place to gave a meal
Review: I have not been into a Wimpy in years but found mysrlf in the Littlehamptons branch today. Well all I can say is that the staff on duty this afternoon were amazingly polite, quick and attentive wonderful service. The food was delivered quickly,nice ,hot and well presented. Lovely meal better then Macdonlds will be going back. Gold star service what more can you ask for. The place is very clean nothing was too much trouble for the staff. A big thank you from our party to you guys.

Name: Pagham Beach
Title: Haven holiday
Review: Well kept sight . Lovely caravans everything you could want in them . Lovely walkers around Pagham harbour lodes of wild life to see .

Name: Zeera Lounge
Title: Not impressed
Review: Delivery was quick but the food was very disappointing, tasted like it had been cooked the day before and reheated

Name: Inglenook
Title: Crimbo
Review:
We came as a family to get away from having the effort of doing it ourselves. The food was amazing and the staff couldnt be more attentive to your needs. My nana and grandad have older people needs and they were met amazingly that made the whole trip even better!
Come here if you want a family run, more private and personable experience and you wont regret it!

Name: White Horses
Title: Lovely stay
Review: Excellent cosy room with en suite facilities, very private; and superb breakfast. The fruit salad was outstanding and the cooked breakfast was very good indeed. I liked the 'locally sourced' emphasis. Very pleasant people. Stay here!

Name: The Norfolk Tap
Title: Great find!
Review: This place is quite a surprise, the staff are very friendly, Martin is a great host, and the food is divine! well worth a visit!

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Girls weekend
Review:
We went twice to the restaurant once for evening meal and Sunday lunch
The service was good and the food was lovely only thing I will say is that the roast could have had more vegetables but other than that all good
Louis our waiter was very good

Name: Littlehampton Beach
Title: Great walk
Review: Park at harbour park and walk along the prominade. Lovely beach and views. You can also walk along the river and get food and drinks along the way. A river ferry is available if you want to cross the river without walking to far.

Name: Denmans Gardens
Title: Food much better
Review: Although the new menu isn't as extensive, the food is much better, rather sad the clutter has gone, it is no loner to go on a Sunday if you need to buy a gift urgently. The loos are much better.

Name: Kenmore
Title: Great stay
Review:
We really enjoyed our 2 night stay at Kenmore. Booking was very easy and we recommend the Kenmore’s own website. We were met at the door by the friendly lady owner who got us signed in, showed us to our room, and explained everything we needed to know.
The room itself was nicely furnished, well equipped and absolutely spotless. Nice and warm but also lots of windows to open if fresh air is what you’re looking for at night (which we like). The en-suite was functional and also very clean. The room was quiet and the bed wasvery comfortable, so we got a good night’s sleep.
Breakfast was excellent – plenty of choice and everything freshly cooked. Also, quality ingredients from the yoghurt through to the bacon.
Overall this was an excellent experience and very good value. If we visit the area again we will definitely stay here if we can and will recommend it to friends and family. Thanks.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: understaffed & overbooked
Review: We booked a table well in advance but, after queuing for 20 minutes were told they had two large parties and the wait was at least an hour! we went elsewhere....

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Traditional country pub with delicious food
Review: Myself and my partner came here for lunch whilst in the area to visit Arundel Castle. The pub is lovely, a really traditional feel inside with lovely views over the countryside. My partner had the sausages and mash and I had the burger. The food was homemade and delicious. The 2 ladies behind the bar and very friendly. The waitress was very knowledgable of the area. We will defiantly return.

Name: Kenmore
Title: The Body Shop Ladies
Review:
We were staying at the Kenmore overnight due to a business meeting. Though we were late for check in, the owner was very patient and accommodating. The facilities were clean, spacious and of an excellent quality. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was lovely. Nothing was too much. Would highly recommend and will definitely be coming back next time we are at head office.

Thank you

Name: Osca's
Title: Osca's every time
Review:
Our favourite place for fish and chips and always go here. The best way, we think, to have our fish n chips is to buy it here, and take it to the beach on a warm summer's evening and eat it while the sun goes down over the lighthouse. Oh, and wash it down with a glass or two of Prosecco.
And obviously dispose of all the wrappings in the relevant recycling bins on the prom. Roll on warmer evenings.

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Great - as always!
Review: Six of us met for one of our regular breakfasts at 10am Sunday morning. The cafe was extremely busy and had a great atmosphere as always. Despite the large number of customers we were all served quickly. The breakfasts were all very tasty and piping hot! Staff friendly and polite. It's great to support a successful local business like this. Well done Maria and team!

Name: Pizza Hut, Littlehampton
Title: Not same as in Pizza hut restaurant
Review: Pizza from takeout pizza huts dont taste the same, can be oily at times even on crust which should be bread like but seems to be coated in some kind of oil. not good pizza. topping are cold and pizza base warm not hot. hmmm Dominos Fail every-time and pizza hut pizza tastes awful, seems no place in town to get a decent pizza

Name: Café 75
Title: Best food in Littlehampton
Review: The new Cafe72 in Littlehampton is an amazing place! We had the best ribs we have ever eaten and a vegetarian burger! Everything was simply delicious! The chef and the rest of the staff were wonderful! Don't miss it out if you are ever around!

Name: Butlins Day Visits
Title: Mislead dirty not much open
Review:
Came to Butlin’s 70’s weekend with 10 other work ladies.
We paid extra to be on the ground floor and together. (Gold) We got the ground floor but were in different blocks😬. On complaining the receptionist said we were never going to be together as they do not have two 6 person rooms together so we were mislead on booking. She said she would listen to the taped conversation to see what Butlins had said and call us back, still waiting.

Room block 4 floor was filthy and there were no shelf’s in the oven, shower head kept falling of.
Room block 5 floor was also filthy and all our pans etc had not been washed. Lots of cigarette buts out side our room which kept getting walked in. Was told they would be cleared up but never was.
A cleaner did come over and clean the rest of stuff that we hadn’t finished cleaning on arrival.

Wanted to hire the bikes out, but apparently they do not hire them adults only week ??
The fair was not open either.

We all paid to have a spa, the changing rooms had two toilets and two showers no changing separate room which is uncomfortable if you don’t wish to get changed in front of anybody, we were all queuing for a shower.
The main changing room was very small and hot, very uncomfortable considering you should be relaxing.
The spa itself seem to have to many people in at once. It was over an hour before any of us could use the hot tub also the ice room was broke.
I did have a facial and that was very good.

The floors in the clubs were awful so sticky, your feet came out your shoes as you danced.
The bands were excellent
So overall not a good experience with Butlin’s but it did not stop us having a good time no thanks to Butlin’s

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: So disappointing
Review: What a disappointment the Spotted Cow is now. Used to frequent here on several occasions in the past and always had a lovely meal. If the meal 5 of us had recently is anything to go on, we will definitely NOT be back. It took ¾ of an hour to actually place an order, although there were hardly any customers. The starters were okay, but the deep fried Brie was overdone, hard on the outside and cold in the middle. The vegetarian options seemed good, until we tried them. The veggie lasagne was small, approximately 3 inches square; bland and tasteless. The Squash was just average and dry, no sauce. I left most of it. The steak had a 2 inch piece of grizzle. The two Ploughmans however, were fine, nice big pieces of cheese. But the 'piece de resistance' was the treacle tart. Yes I am joking. There was no treacle in the treacle tart. It was just pastry that stuck in the throat. Inedible and most of it was left. We did complain, but it seemed to fall on deaf ears. Such a shame as this was a great place, and a lovely meal could always be guaranteed. Expensive for what it is. Not a go-back-to.

Name: Arundel Historic Tours
Title: Great Tour of Arundel
Review: We visited Arundel for the weekend as a group of friends to celebrate an impending marriage! Having looked up things to do in Arundel on Tripadvisor, we came across Martin’s tour and the fantastic reviews that he’s had. I can honestly say, you will not be disappointed! It was a wonderful tour with Martin, and so lovely to hear stories of his childhood growing up in Arundel, and very reasonable at £5 per person. Thoroughly recommend to anyone visiting the area!

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Lunch
Review: Had lunch with family on Thursday and food was delicious, the waitress was so attentive and friendly would highly recommend it .

Name: Ristorante Al Mare
Title: Great value, great food, lovely people
Review: Four of us went for a meal here on a Saturday evening and nice to see it was busy. I hadn’t been to the restaurant for over a year even though it’s local to us and we should visit more after a lovey meal. Nice simple Italian menu and all freshly cooked, pleasant staff and reasonable prices. The four of us ate two courses each with drinks for around £110. I hope they continue to do well and maintain these great standards.

Name: Fish and Chips
Title: Very poor food
Review:
What a disappointment, we ordered two cod and chips and one separate portion of chips, unfortunately there was no vegetarian option for my stepdaughter. The fish was that horrible smooth, light look, and when you cut into it a lot of it was hollow with very little fish inside. The chips were possibly frozen, I’m not sure, hard to get chips wrong but they managed it, they weren’t cooked through and tasteless. They had no knives and forks, no serviettes and didn’t serve tea either, that had to be purchased at a ice cream parlour next door. You can usually rely on a seaside resort to provide a good fish and chips, but sadly,
not here. Safe to say we will not return, ever....

Name: Church Farm
Title: Nostalgic trip back to Church Farm
Review:
We came here on the Sun Newspaper £9.50 holidays and I chose Church Farm as I had many holidays and happy memories coming here every year as a child before Haven took it over so it was a real nostalgic experience.
We were greeted by Ray who is on the security gate as you enter, very nice chap who made us very welcome. The check in staff were very professional and polite.
When I booked the holiday I upgraded to a comfort plus caravan and we were extremely happy with it as it had multi room heating, as the weather was very cold this was a bonus. We were in Ballast Rise which isn’t too far away from the entertainment and swimming pool etc so it was a nice short walk to get there.
Our only gripe when we entered the van was that the cleaners hadn’t hoovered the floor and dining benches and they were covered in bread crumbs.
We were given a three bedded caravan and this was very welcome as when we hired a high chair for my friends little toddler the very helpful chap that bought it along didn’t hesitate when I asked if he could move the single beds in one of the rooms so we could place the travel cot in there.
You will need to bring your own cleaning products i.e washing up liquid, washing up sponges and tea towels and oven gloves. There’s lots of cutlery, utensils and crockery supplied though. Nice big TV too.
The park is very well maintained, we loved the indoor swimming pool, the amusement arcade and soft play area was such fun for the little one. There is a restaurant called Mash and Barrel which we ate in one afternoon, the food was really good. There is a shop on site too, but further down the road is a local Tesco express and near the seafront is a CoOp.
We also used the local Chinese takeaway along the road just about a one minute drive from the site called Jasmines, very good food.
We will definitely come here again and looking forward to next time.
Read less

Name: River Breeze
Title: Very disappointing
Review:
Only 1 option for a vegetarian child, pizza and chips. This looked and tasted like a crusty microwaved £1 pizza. Peas were a weird shade of green (from a tin).
I ordered cod and chips, not sure how they managed to produce a meal with so little flavour.
Can’t understand the good reviews given.
Outside of the shop is very deceiving, promising old fashioned good food but in reality should have to gone to Iceland!

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Disappointing experience
Review: My son and his partner took me to the restaurant for a birthday meal on 20th July 2019.We arrived as arranged at 7.30. We were shown directly to our table. Eventually we were asked to place our orders. However our starters did not appear till 8.30!!!!. No one came to our table to apologise for the long delay. The customer service was not good. Even when I finally received my main course the salmon was very dry although the risotto was tasty. We actually gave up on the dessert and didn't order. When we were asked if we would visit again we said no. The man explained that they only had one chef but did not offer to reduce our bill. It was a very disappointing experience.

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Not great
Review: Really disappointing to visit and hear the owner speaking to staff in a way I wouldn’t speak to an enemy. There are nicer ways to explain that things aren’t up to her standard. Ordered our food from the takeaway. Got home ready to eat to find such small portions. Sat to eat and the chips were the worst we have tasted. Frozen chips done in a fryer. Hard, Luke warm and like rubber. Completely inedible. The scampi was ok but £5.50 for 8 small pieces was a real shame.

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Best in the area
Review: I cannot find better food at any restaurant or pub in the area. Our visit was to celebrate a friends 80th birthday. The welcome,service & food quality was first class

Name: Motte & Bailey
Title: rude staff, noisy restaurant, mediocre food
Review: Noisy restaurant with the waitresses and kitchen staff thrashing about the cutlery and plates with absolutely no regard for their guests. Limited menu with very few desirable meals and very overpriced for what is mostly cheese toasties and scones. Customer service obviously not a priority here.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Rude female staff member letting the place down!
Review:
We were there for a family meal. One member of staff was very rude. We were told we couldn’t sit in an area requested as it was booked but nobody in the whole time we were there sat at this specific table.
We were also guests at the premier attached so had breakfast there. Two days the young lady that seated us was very warm, friendly and helpful. The last day once again we were told that there wasn’t a table big enough to fit 5 people and a high chair that hadn’t been booked. There were lots of available tables much better than where we were seated and much more suitable not having wine glasses behind our heads on a shelf like where we were seated.
This morning happened to be ran by the and rude woman the first evening.
The food was however beautiful and it was a shame this one woman was so rude as it lets the place down.

Name: Fino
Title: Excellent!
Review: This was our second visit to Fino and it was as good as we remembered it from the first time. Very friendly staff and delicious food. Already planning our next visit!

Name: Rustington Manor
Title: Perfect Location , Rooms and Breakfast
Review: The rooms are very comfortable and quiet with everything I needed. I really enjoyed the location as its a short walk to the beach , into town and to the railway station. Excellent Breakfast included. Would highly recommend and look forward to returning. Many thanks to Billy, Lewis and the whole team.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Overpriced Xmas dinner - couldn’t fault the staff!
Review:
So we booked Xmas dinner here for 4 adults & 1 child, were met by cheery staff whom I’m
Sure would rather have been elsewhere on Xmas day.
The meal was expensive at almost £60 a person and didn’t even include any drink.
I just hope at that price that the company that own the Beefeater pay their staff handsomely for working this day and don’t leave them to rely on tips!

So the meal was a bit of a mix - my starter of a soufflé came out cold in the middle.
On our main courses I paid extra for cauliflower cheese and also one tiny Yorkshire pud and a few small sausages - a bit rich considering they missed off the carrot mash that was advertised on all our meals- I don’t know if this was a genuine error but none of us had this on our plates!
No biggie but when you charge £3 for some cauliflower cheese but don’t even bother putting the advertised menu on the plate then it kind of sticks in your throat!

As with another reviewer we also opted for the chocolate bombs and although we ate earlier around 12.30 we had the same issue.
The bomb didn’t melt because the sauce wasn’t even hot!
If this was a normal day then I’d say the amount we paid £260 (just for the food) was an utter rip off - sadly you’re not paying for the food or even the quality of the food - you’re paying for the day you eat, however with that said it would of been nice if you actually got what you paid for!
The veggie roast I have to say was delicious, actually the saving grace of the meal.
The staff I couldn’t fault, the service was great and they were all very happy and polite.
Shame the big company that owns this establishment don’t invest in the quality on
Such a special day.
Next year I think we will stay home!

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Great service, great food, always recommend.
Review: Kelly C, our server, was, friendly and cheerful. Excellent service. The food was served quickly and with great banter.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Disappointing
Review:
A lovely hotel, the grounds are stunning. I booked for the first time a Valentine hotel/spa break. Wasn't too impressed with the Spa, the treatment was average!! The room looked dusty, stains on the carpet & single beds pushed together (not acceptable). We went out for dinner & breakfast was again ok. Both disappointed with our stay.
Read less

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Disappointing
Review:
A lovely looking pub I have driven past a couple of times and thought, I must go there one evening. That evening came about tonight. My friend ordered pizza and sweet potato fries which he did enjoy. I opted for slow cooked beef rib with bubble and squeak, carrots and a jus. I will start with the beef rib. It must have come from a miniature cow. It looked very small on first glance, when I cut into it over 2 thirds of it was just fat. There were 3 mouthful of beef.there was no bubble and squeak, just mash with 2 pieces of carrot. For 14.50 I expected a lot better. Was the worst meal I have had in the area.
Very very disappointing.

Name: Putting Green Café
Title: Putting
Review: Had a lovely game of putting with my boyfriend , he won. Went into the cafe and enjoyed a lovely ploughman’s lunch , very large, fresh and well presented , my boyfriend had a steak pasty and beans which he enjoyed. As the winner he got pay and luckily they now card payments.

Name: Howards Coffee Shop
Title: Disappointing
Review:
Not that good food board outside not same as inside.
Couple bits wanted not avalible.
Staff not that pleasant more places avalible.
Toilets could do with a good clean

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Friday Lunch
Review: Third visit to Fish Factory. Very disappointed. The member of staff who greeted us was off hand and dismissive - no eye contact at any point. We should have left then! The place was cold. The Mushroom Wellington was mediocre - served on a plate of 'sauce' and accompanied with chips which lacked any flavour. The one leaved lettuce salad that accompanied the Red Snapper contained random pieces of lemon rind and lots of un- pitted olives. Not what I expected for £14.95. A shame, we like to support local businesses but we won't be returning.

Name: Spice Paradise
Title: Not a happy vegetarian customer
Review: Have used this takeaway a few times over the years. Tonight was one of a few occassions my order (and my mums partner on separate occassions also) has been wrong. A particularly appalling experience when you are a vegetarian and recieve a meat dish instead, the second time tonight. As such I clearly asked for a vegetable peshwari curry on the phone. I drove to collect the order. When I dished this out to myself and partner at home we were disgusted to find out too late after the first mouthful that it was in fact chicken. Already extremely annoyed that I had to interupt our dinner and make another journey to the restaurant. I was further dissapointed to be greeted with small apology and wait for a replacement curry; but no offer of a goodwill gesture refund for the trouble and insensitive mistake. As a customer who may not be regular but has used their business for many years this is not good business, or good business in general.

Name: Harbour Park
Title: Lovely arcades
Review:
Best arcades i've been to in a seaside resort, state of the art equipment, good value prizes to win (you can win a Littlehampton Harbour Park teddy for 500 tickets) amazing place, I certaintly want to return!
Read less

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Poor experiance
Review:
I booked this online and had a good deal- so I thought.

I was traveling from wales for a family funeral and asked if I could check in early. I didn’t hear anything back until 24 hrs later saying I could but at an extra cost of £20.

I declined this and said I would review this service once I return home from my trip.

The room I stayed in was room 11. This was at the top of the hotel in what felt like the furthest corner. The hotel had a funny smell which wasn’t very pleasant.

The room was ok but you could tell that it needed some work with it- bath had a hole in that looked like it was filled in with some putty. The paint was knocked and chipped away. I was rather disappointed and felt I would’ve been better off at a local travel lodge.

The hotel was dead and it felt like I was the only person in it- no offer for upgrade like most hotels would offer. I felt like the hotel cared more about the money than customer service and experience.

The food did smell nice but due to poor experience from start I ended up going to local competition which I was glad of.

I spoke to family who live in area and they laughed at me when I said I was staying in this hotel- they advised its been going backwards in recent years.

Say the least...I won’t be coming back.
Read less

Name: Mustards
Title: wonderful
Review: went here last night (Saturday) had a lovely meal can highly recommended both the food and staff erre excellent

Name: Best Western Bognor
Title: Luxurious Beach Hut
Review:
We had one night in one of the new 'beach huts' and it was wonderful. Don't be fooled by the term 'beach hut' - these are not what you would imagine! They have rainfall showers, a lounge area with bifold doors that open out onto a balcony with views straight out over the sea, and a lovey mezzanine bedroom with Egyptian cotton bed linen. The lounge area is beautiful and has a tv, fridge - stocked with complimentary Coke, milk, water and wine, coffee machine and tea making facilities, games and a very comfortable settee. There is also a decanter in the lounge containing complimentary sloe gin. The bathroom has a rainfall/power shower, complimentary toiletries, shaver point, toilet, heated towel rail and basin all completed to a high standard. There is a children's bedroom which we didn't use but it looked very comfortable. The mezzanine bedroom has a king size bed which was so so comfortable, a built in wardrobe and also a tv. You can sit on the bed and look out through the bifold doors and see the view over the beach. The balcony/terrace outside the lounge has teak chairs with foot stalls which you can slide together to make a sun lounger. We sat there in the evening sun and felt we could have been on holiday anywhere! Although we missed breakfast the following day we had a beautiful three course meal in the evening in the hotel restaurant where the staff were very attentive but not overwhelming. Looking forward to our next visit to this little oasis by the sea.
Read less

Name: Belinda's Tearooms
Title: I am amazed at how many good
Review: I am amazed at how many good reviews there are! We called in for breakfast today. How disappointing! The menu choice was extremely limited. We ordered poached eggs on toast and scrambled eggs on toast with cappuccinos. When I heard the microwave “ping” I was worried! My husband’s scrambled eggs were extremely yellow, dry and overcooked. My poached eggs looked and tasted odd. The coffee was undrinkable. We definitely won’t be returning.....

Name: Avisford
Title: Teerible rooms, poor room allocation for large parties but reasonable food and outstanding events manager.
Review:
A group of over 80 people booked loads of rooms for a dinner dance. The rooms were in poor state of decoration and cleanliness (see pictures). On arrival people with the same surnames and room types were allocated rooms on the opposite site of the hotel to each other where common sense would suggest that they would want to be close to each other. Rooms for disabled people were at the bottom of the garden in an annex a short drive away? That said the food was good and catering/bar staff tried hard to impress and the events manager on the Saturday night was awesome, even tricky problems that were not under his control he took on and sorted them. In summary good staff except the lack of common sense on room allocation but the venue is tired and needs a refurbishment which is a shame as the location opens up great potential.
Read less

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Exceptional.
Review:
Myself and my life partner, Ant, went to the Arundel festival this weekend and swung by the Norfolk Arms for lunch after a recommendation from a friend. We were more than a little bitty impressed to say the least!

The food offerings were the best we could find that day, service was speedy and everything we had was truly delicious. Outstanding.

Speaking of outstanding... my only thought is that there could be more seating outside, since it was very busy when we visited and there was not an outside table available.

All in all, an easy 5-stars. We will definitely be returning to try out some more of the menu!
Read less

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Fish & chips (with a cocktail)
Review:
Had a lovely fish supper (with a cocktail )
Staff was very nice
Food was very nice
Cocktail’s was very nice

Name: Lemongrass Thai
Title: Average For Price
Review:
Booked earlier in the day, quick to answer and easy to reserve a table.

On arrival, I already knew what I wanted so opted for the usual Panang Curry, sadly was disappointed as I had high hopes. It lacked the usual punch you'd expect and was very watery. Unlike that experienced in Thailand last year.

Service wasn't that quick and we were at the very back near the toilets, taking a long time to get the attention of the staff when we needed to order and a refill. Others around were having the same issue.

I've tried the Chichester one and in my opinion much better.

Maybe a different seat and another night may have changed my review but for the price in the area I think there are better alternative.

Positives - location of the restaurant, decor and cleanliness.

Name: Anokha
Title: Very bland and disappointing takeaway
Review: Just had a takeaway delivered this evening as the restaurant had been recommended to me. After an hours wait the food was not very hot and was bland and tasteless. Biryani had big clumps of rice in it and sag aloo had hardly any spinach. Will not be ordering again

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Dean
Review:
Had a fantastic meal with a very good service from louis who ensured our food was up to scratch provided a very prompt service when ordering additional drinks after our meal. Would highly recommend.
Only down fall was i had no cash to leave a tip for his brilliant service and they did not offer the option when paying by card.
Other then that great food nice environment for the kids with a nice friendly play area.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Sunday Visit to Arundel
Review:
If you are staying in the area then a visit is a must do really.
We bought the Gold + tickets which gives access to all areas and with gift aid you get a generous voucher to use in the cafe or restaurant. The gardens are superb and the castle is fascinating. Everything kept in such amazingly good order. There are lots of guides around to answer questions and give advice. Everyone of them we interacted with knew their stuff and where eager to share their knowledge..
Read less

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Lovely Evening
Review:
Visited The Parsons Table this evening and what a lovely place...Excellent food, great wines , fantastic attentative knowledgeable staff....
Highly recommend this little jem, we'll definitely be back very soon....

Name: Black Horse
Title: Father’s Day Lunch - rude manager !
Review:
We visited the Black horse for Father’s Day for Sunday
Lunch and waited over and hour for our Main course,
and when I mentioned this to the Manager he was
extremely rude and not sympathetic to his customer
at all - he just seemed to think he was in the right and
didn’t seem to have the no how to deal with the situation
just have an aggressive manner, after this confrontation
we all got up and left his pub as we didn’t feel welcome
and we also felt why should we spend our money with
such an arrogant manager at the helm, we will certainly
not return!!!

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: A collection of muddy ponds.
Review:
Not worth the expensive entrance charge. The site is a collection of dirty , muddy ponds. Not many exotic waterfowl present but lots of noisy seagulls and magpies which together with a visiting heron made off with the ducklings .
Read less

Name: Littlehampton Beach
Title: Ruth Ashdown
Review: Wonderful walk with the dog!Easy to park, quiet, dog can run! Beautiful and refreshing anytime of year

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Wedding at Arundel Castle
Review:
Took the Bride to the lower road that runs along the castle grounds to get some nice set back shots. Really nice backdrop to set the wedding photo off. Not so good on parking but managed to pull in to the hedge for a moment to allow the bride not to walk far in her dress. Worth the visit if only for a photo.
Read less

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Really good food and pleasant service
Review: I had a lunch of ricotta and spinach cannelloni which was really delicious and a generous portion. I followed it with an orange pannacotta which was equally good and tried two different types of prosecco. I would absolutely come back again.

Name: Grandads Front Room
Title: The Clues In The Title
Review:
LoveLoveLove this shop and everything that it holds and stands for! Great place for unique finds, my friend's 12 yr old son visits weekly looking for an antique! The community atmosphere is overwhelming and to see first hand the help and support that goes into our town is…
Read more

Name: Inglenook
Title: Nice food, charming waiting staff BUT!!!!!!!
Review: My husband and I eat here often and I have never had the need to post a negative review before - lovely homely food in a nice relaxed atmosphere. I do however take exception when a female “manager” fails to charge us for our drinks when preparing our bill then actually stated it was OUR fault they missed them off. This is the second time this has happened therefore prompting this review. Such a shame a wonderful team are being repeatedly let down by such unprofessionalism.

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Birthday dinner
Review: 5 of us came to this lovely venue for my mothers birthday dinner after a family tea party in East Preston.... from the moment we arrived the service was friendly...it was a Sunday evening & they close at 9...lastfood orders at 8....very efficient happy staff...beautiful food. My husband & Ishared the homemade chicken liver pate, with caremilsed onions...wow...my mother & sister in law had the prawns,avocado,& melon...again wow...my bro had Calamari which he also thoroughly enjoyed... My main course was ...excellent...Sea Trout with prawn& creamsauce...fabulous...soft creamy...best fish dish in a long time...well done those chefs...served with hot...perfectly cooked fresh veg My husband had the mixed grill...thoroughly enjoyed....ribeye steak,gammon,chicken breast,butchers sausage,egg,....with the best fries he’d had All the way through the staff were efficient friendly & apart from the food being wonderful...my mother had the best time...definitely recommend...

Name: Mustards
Title: Wonderful food - we WILL be back!
Review:
So often you go out to eat and come home disappointed by mediocre food and service. Mustards by contrast was a revelation - lovely service and really really good food.
We were three generations and all three of us loved our evening out. My 81 year old father - whose birthday it was - said the scallops were the best he could remember eating. My daughter was equally blown away by the salted caramel fondant.
Such a lovely place to go - can’t wait to return!

Name: White Swan Arundel
Title: Disgraceful
Review:
We went to the White Swan last Sunday as a family, the meal went ok until we ordered the dairy free icecream for my 2 year old son as he has several severe allergies - the menu didn't say this contained nuts nor was this pointed out to us. My 2 year old went into anaphylactic shock and an ambulance had to be called. At this point we were tried to be moved to a private room several times, my cynical side believes perhaps to move us out of the way. Whilst waiting for the ambulance we were also charged for the meal before being blue lighted to hospital and spending 12 hours there. The manager was meant to call us to see how my son was, they didn't. When we called them, they told us they are fully compliant with any laws as they had an allergy matrix, which at no point was given to us. They have promised to change the wording on the menus and that they are legally compliant but we will be making sure with further advice.
When I pointed out to the manager that taking payment was at least distasteful at that time as we were fully distracted they have just posted us details of receipts so we can check them - at which point they pointed out that the ice cream ordered wa dairy free (even tho the issue is with the cashew nuts)! they have also charged us for the icecream that had a bite taken and put my son in hospital. We feel we are fair and have raised points directly before writing any reviews but i just feel the lack of customer service and respect here has been appalling and I fear for what could have happened. We will never be returning here.
Read less

Name: Rowan Park
Title: late night check in!!
Review: NO WHERE on the website or confirmation booking form does it state a SPECIFIC TIME for last check in (only a late check not available). At 7pm we were stuck in traffic and told the receptionist that we would ARRIVE AT 8.07 AND SHE SAID THAT SHE CLOSES AT 8pm WE WOULD NOT BE ALLOWED ON SITE. It was Goodwood weekend and so we would have struggled to find another campsite at short notice. Staff were not friendly at all.

Name: Beachcomber Inn
Title: Fab food!
Review:
I recently took the boys on to the resort for the day.

We went for lunch at The Beachcomber Inn. Service was prompt, staff were really friendly & the food was delicious. We had the gammon steak, pulled pork baguette & the goats cheese & beetroot salad. The gammon steak came will all the trimmings & looked amazing! The baguette was generously filled, My salad was delicious! I would highly recommend this venue when visiting Butlins.

Name: Butlins
Title: Thank you Butlins!
Review:
Myself, my friend and our children visited for the Tots week and I just want to say how brilliant our stay was. All the staff were so good, especially Elisha in the Skyline Cafe. Every time we saw her she had a smile on her face and made every single one of the kids laugh, which can be hard work! We all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!
Read less

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: An on the spur of the moment visit that we thoroughly enjoyed.
Review:
We visited on the spur of the moment, as another plan didn't materialise. We were so glad that we did. The staff were so welcoming and helpful. A boat trip around the lake was very interesting, the guide was excellent. We were lucky enough to see a water vole whilst there. So good to see how well these endangered creatures are doing. The bird life was great to watch. We had a lovely panini and a pot of tea by the wildfowl lake. A thoroughly enjoyable day.
Read less

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Don’t bother
Review: Staff are rude and food was cold when it arrived. did not enjoy anything about the evening. Much better places in the area

Name: Bailiffscourt Spa
Title: A wonderful getaway!
Review:
Wonderful hotel with beautiful grounds and incredible staff. If you’re looking for an excellent getaway look no further. It’s an amazing facility, wonderful rooms and first class dining.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Family day trip from London
Review:
Had a wonderful day here. Approaching the castle from a distance is amazing and I was surprised at the size and beautIful gardens. I did not go up to the keep which has 130 steps but photos were taken from the top for me to view. There is a golf cart for transporting visitors up the hill to the formal gardens, fountain and church if unable to walk. Well worth the entry fee. Pretty town to wander in but some streets were quite steep.
Read less

Name: Hotham Park
Title: Plenty to do
Review:
Amazing cafe & popular kids train ride.
Dog walks & park runs. Crazy golf & kids play area & bandstand events.
However: Unused boating pond and one section almost permanently closed.
One man takes great efforts to maintain this park, credit to him
Read less

Name: Belinda's Tearooms
Title: Cream Tea
Review:
Always a delight to visit these charming and atmospheric tea rooms in the heart of Arundel.

Quintessentially English, a cream tea is a must!

Name: The Beresford
Title: Sunday Carvery
Review: Went today very disappointed beef tough as old boots, supposedly roast potatoes aneamic looking and tasted deep fried we’ve been coming here for about 5 years and has always been very good really disappointed

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Great tasty food with flair!
Review: We enjoyed our lunch at this restaurant and found the food both tasty and well presented. The service was attentive and friendly. The portion size could be a bit larger, given that this is quite a pricey restaurant. Would definitely recommend to visitors in Arundel

Name: Crown Music
Title: Mr simms
Review: It was a lovely public bar until they employed a female called Louise who has a disgusting mouth on her as she doesn’t care about who is around her being adults or children it’s totally disgusting what comes out of her mouth I certainly won’t recommend the crown Littlehampton to anyone.

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: Fantastic value and service
Review: From the moment we came in the door, we were made to feel welcome. we opted for the,buffet, great value for money. Our waiter Martin was very helpful and provided great service. We definitely will be back.

Name: China Palace
Title: Good enjable Chines meal in an historic setting
Review: Friendly service - but a bit slow at busy times. Excellent menu and reasonably priced. Lovely historic building.

Name: The Town House
Title: Best place in Arundel
Review: Six (4 adults & 2 children) of us had reservations for dinner after visiting Medieval Days at Arundel Castle.What a pleasant evening.The special starter of the evening was the absolute best local Asparagus, so good we had 3 orders. We had corn fed Chicken, Roast Lamb Rump, Chateaubriand, can't remember what everyone had, but everything was excellent. This is a small place & small staff but very efficient and friendly. I met the owner and she was very gracious. I would certainly recommend going to this restaurant if you are looking for good food & service.

Name: Rustington Manor
Title: Worst breakfast I have ever had in a hotel!
Review: Words almost fail me. Dried and cold bacon, no orange juice, no napkins. Only the company lifted the meal.

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Front of house lead the way
Review:
Went for a family meal to the lamb inn. Lovely local pub interior and exterior.

Service was amazing the waitress was lovely and couldn’t be more accommodating.

Food was a slight bit hit and miss, some was lovely and very well cooked. Unfortunately some meals where a little disappointing maybe the chef should of checked the plates before sending them out(no response needed chef).

Nice experience

Name: Clymping Beach
Title: Official car parking barriers and payment machines are not working - suspicous chalked payment instructions.
Review:
The Environmental Agency are doing major work in this area and there are prominent warnings to keep off the beach near their machinery.

The car park barriers are not working and payment machines locked up and the barriers missing.- the car park seems abandoned!. The Beach Café was not open when we called and we did not see the chalked sign.

The driver of another vehicle was also perplexed by the situation.

The name of the operator or owners of the car park are not clearly shown

Very suspicious about handwritten messages scrawled next to barriers asking people to pay at the cafe.

In contrast with beaches to the West of the cafe the first beach East of the concrete sea defences is the first gently sloping one that is potentially safe for children,

No clear warnings about penalties for non-payment or enfoorcement action .

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: Nice but slow
Review:
Our food, when it came, was very nice but although we had been warned of a thirty minute wait when we ordered, the food didn't actually arrive for around an hour and a quarter, and some people didn't get what they'd ordered (two orders of ham, egg and bubble & squeak transformed into ham, egg and chips without mention by the waitress). We had to gobble our meals and get out quickly to avoid being late for the event we had met for.
I appreciate that the pub was caught off guard by a lot of people in different parties needing to be in the cathedral next door at the same time but staff should have stopped accepting food orders or warned of the longer likely wait.
I would also strongly suggest that, being the cathedral's nearest neighbour, someone at St Mary's check the cathedral website for big events coming up (or even ask the cathedral staff!) and have more kitchen and bar staff on to cater for a predictable increase in numbers.

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Better than expected!
Review:
Doesn't look much from the outside, & hallways need urgent decorating, also staying on one of the hottest nights of the year with no air conditioning - two little fans for company - isn't ideal.
But the room was decent & comfortable, and we slept well, with little external noise.
Also, a big thank you to 'Seth' the Canadian guy on reception. Helped us greatly, especially when our baby was sick on the bed! Very good customer service, thank you.
Read less

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Mrs AM
Review:
Food overpriced and nothing special.
The size of ice cream scoops depend on a waitress mood as one day they were big the next day half of the size?! Won’t go back

Name: Avisford
Title: Pamper spar day
Review:
On arrival my daughter and I went into the gym reception to book in. Staff friendly and helpful however the indoor pool wasn't available as something had gone wrong with it , no jacuzzi just sauna and steam room, the gym facilities were mediocre to say the least.No facility to sit back and rest as this to was out of action too. Decor of the whole spar area was very poor and in need of a good make-over. Mold on windows,peeling paintwork.Very tired looking indeed. The facial was very nice with elemis products used. Lunch option very poor, basically it was 4 choices of salads or sandwiches and sweet. Meal service very slow with little enthusiasm from the waitress.
Read less

Name: World's End
Title: Excellent
Review: Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful especially as we’d booked a table, then brought the dog, then chose to sit outside, then the weather changed and they still made sure our table would be reserved whatever our choice! Oh and the food was lovely too!!

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Never again
Review: Food was absolutely vile. Had a weird under taste which may have been the oil? Service was slow but they may have been down to only having a couple of menus for several tables to share. The place had an overall grubby feel to it & I personally couldn't wait to get out of there.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Disappointing
Review: Worst fish and chips ever. Fish was totally dry and over cooked. Will not be returning. Would have expected more from a Premier Inn

Name: The Bear Inn
Title: Lovely place but lack of service for the restaurant
Review:
We waited over an hour for our food to arrive, which normally would be fine as we were a big party- however we booked prior to coming and most of it was burgers and there was two other tables in the restaurant. We also had to wait a long time to get served, and never got checked on if he wanted more drinks.
 We asked to pay on 4 separate cards and the remainder in cash (we were a party of 12) we were told they didn't have the technology to allow this. We weren't told on arrival and none of the party could have paid the final payment amount on their card. We asked the waitress how she could accommodate this and she was very aggressive and said it was up to us to sort it, even interrupting our friend and upsetting her afterwards.
 Very disappointed especially as friends traveled down for this dinner for a special occasion. However the pub side looks great and we have never had any trouble with service on that side, normally served by a smiley gentleman.

Name: Sylvan Oak
Title: Dinner with family
Review: Excellent and friendly service, the halibut with beans and red onions melted in the mouth, we even tried discreetly to ask for the recipe but they would not give that out.

Name: Wimpey
Title: Disappointed
Review:
The first time we have felt we wouldn't want to return.
The staff were superb but the food was poor. Burgers and sausage were very watery and sadly, tasteless.
My wife and I visited as a nostalgia trip from when we first met in the early seventies at the Wimpy in Chichester, but this time, it was so disappointing.

Name: White Swan Arundel
Title: Lovely Sunday lunch
Review:
Came in for Sunday lunch today I had the burger and my boyfriend had the carvery. My burger was really good an my boyfriend really enjoyed the carvery which had a good selection an great quality.
The man who was on the carvery is the main reason I’m writing in we were sat near the carvery an could hear him asking everyone how their day was going an if they had been before to know how it worked. He is a real credit to the white swan and felt like he really liked his job an was so smiley ! sorry he wasn’t wearing a name badge to get his name.
Will be there again
Read less

Name: Ship & Anchor
Title: WOW
Review:
What a disgusting approach to customers! On arrival we were attacked by two cooks out of the kitchen (one still in her pyjamas with an apron on) telling us that it was private property and we weren’t welcome there, because they were worried that we might have been thinking of launching our paddle boards from there. We wanted to go into the pub for a drink but was told they didn’t want us.
I’m absolutely disgusted that they can speak to customers in this way and manage to legitimately stay open and gain enough trade to pay the wages for the amount of staff they appear to have.

Definitely do not recommend even popping in here for a drink, let alone camping here. There’s many other deserving businesses in Arundel for food and drink. And for camping I think you’d be better off in a lay-by somewhere

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: surly staff, sticky grubby tables and unable to hear anyone in our group speaking because of ridiculously loud quiz.
Review: Terrible evening completely overtaken by ridiculous over-reaction of the staff to me when I (stupidly) threw a bit of napkin at the table where the questions were being read out by the quiz master - the tissue hit her arm instead of the paper. The senior bar girl came over to tell me off which I totally understand as it was a really silly thing to do. I admitted doing it and said I would go and say sorry after the quiz had ended and I had finished eating. My apology wasn't accepted and the bar girl just stood over me and kept going on and on and on until eventually I had to ask her to leave me alone. She came back again in about 30 minutes and had another go. Again I admitted it was a really silly thing to do, I was sorry and would go and apologise. Again I had to ask her to go away as she just would not stop telling me off. I went and apologised to the girl the tissue landed on but this apology was also not accepted. I ended up asking the bar girls what else they expected me to do. 30 minutes later the bar girl came back to me for another go!! she told me she had spoken to the manager and I was barred! This was all over a a bit of tissue that I stupidly threw, admitted it was stupid and apologised for. We will not be returning to Establo

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Friendly barman
Review: Visited the other day for a few drinks before going to a show later that night. Lee was on the Bar and he was so polite and very friendly. Didn't try any food but will on our next visit.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Expect a long wait
Review: Stayed in the premier inn for 5 nights. Gave up eating in here after 3 of them. Ridiculously long wait for food even though the place was pretty empty and sub standard when it did arrive. Alarm bells start ringing when the chef can't even cook a steak and half the dish comes out cold.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Excellent experience but a bit pricey
Review:
Lots to see here and the castle is well worth exploring. Bought "gold" tickets and these seemed to do the job.A bit of walking and lots of steps, some very steep so the very elderly may prefer a garden only ticket.Some very interesting history and some lovely views.
The gardens are really beautiful and I love the meadow feel to much of the grassed area.
Make sure you visit the chapel and look out for the very unusual " momento mori"
Read less

Name: Arundel Jailhouse
Title: Murder Mystery Evening!
Review: Visited last night for a murder mystery. Didn't know what to expect but it was a brilliant evening. Very funny show. We were put with a group of 6 who gave us lots of giggles.It started at 8 and finished just after 11. We had starter and pudding served to our table and the main is a buffet which had a huge selection, lots of vegetarian dishes too. There's a cash only bar too.Would definitely return and recommend to others.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Nice cosy pub
Review: Ate here while staying at the Premier Inn next door . Lovely cosy pub . We ordered our food at the bar and it arrived very quickly , nice large portions ( cod & chips and Hunters chicken) and very tasty . Also serve an excellent pint of Abbot's

Name: The Spur
Title: Very very poor food...
Review: A Sunday roast that gets served with 3 rock hard potatoes that were reheated from the morning, 2 slices of reheated 2mm beef delivered already cooked a few days before or at least that's what it looked like, vegetables at least 5 minutes after the beef and potatoes, totally soggy and over cooked, the only reason it's not 1 star is it was not poisonous and the only option apart from going somewhere else which I will do in the future, there's so many good places to eat in the area, no idea why anyone would go here twice apart from being bad cooks themselves and not having any imagination, or maybe if you like sitting in the pool table room on old cafe tables then this might just be your cup of tea...

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: The Worst Ever
Review: Weather a bit showery so I took my Grandchildren in for some traditional seaside food. The order was mixed up. The chips were hard, the fish tiny & the mushy peas were mostly water. They charged a fortune & told me their card machine was broken so I could only pay cash. Never again. Be warned, wish I’d looked on here first!

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Got there at last and not disappointed
Review:
Have noticed the castle on several trios where we flashed by between A and B on the A27 but this time we planned a visit and were not disappointed. Even on a cloudy slightly damp day the gardens were magnificent arranged in rooms - we particularly liked the" stumpery" but would have happily taken the whole thing home! Though smaller than Alnwick it certainly competes. Perhaps the Duke should organise conversion of the raised bank across the drive from the formal gardens into a'Potager garden' - then he would certainly be giving Rosemoor a run for its money.
The castle itself, including the keep with its displays, will take a couple of hours or more to appreciate and are worth spending time in, whilst the small restaurant serves good food and the design of the tables and chairs are unique to the place. Everywhere the staff were friendly chatty and informative.
This is one castle - part Norman, but mainly now Victorian gothic revival, that is not to miss.
Read less

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Dreadful service by uninterested staff.
Review: Special on Tuesday evenings. Staff at bar were unaware of special. Food was good but bar staff had no clue as to what wine was on offer. Food was eventually served. Tables were not cleared for 2hours. No table service. Seemed like 16 year olds working with no experience and no interest. Great location but service has dropped beyond belief from original standard.

Name: World's End
Title: Pub Quiz
Review: Just attended the fortnightly pub quiz, great fun, great atmosphere!! Quiz master was great and the quiz it’s self was faultless. Highly recommend to fix those Monday Blues !

Name: Church Farm
Title: Dirty sewer overflowing and horrendous stench.
Review:
We booked a long weekend (4days) at church farm. A sewer at the entrance of the caravan was overflowing and absolutely stunk. We complained straight away and asked to be moved. We weren’t moved and the drain wasn’t looked at for 3 days. We left early and are totally disgusted by the staff and site.
Read less

Name: Riverside
Title: Family break
Review: What a lovley little caravan site! We booked a basic bronze caravan for 4 nights, myself, my daughter and my 2 grandchildren aged 2 amd 9. We were right at the back and it was quiet and peaceful.
