After a wait of over 45 minutes (from initially queuing) we decided that enough was enough, and left without bothering. We would have complained there and then but couldn't find anyone to complain to - and after the attitude of the member of staff we did talk to anout the food issues, we thought we'd be wasting our breath anyway. This Hilton was terrible value for money, and to be honest I have stayed in better budget hotels, definitely one I will avoid in future!
Read less

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: A close-by comfy bed.
Review:
Just back from Arundel visit, staying just the one night at this hotel. Beautiful olde world charm, reminiscent of the ‘close-by castle’ days, but rooms inside modern, airy and oh so comfortable. We had 2 rooms, both had been upgraded (for whatever reason), so thanks for that 😜. But clean, comfy and so centrally situated. Morning breakfast in the bar - fresh tasty ingredients and beautifully cooked and presented. Just one gripe - stairs up to the rooms and down to the rear parking (pay and display) were grubby with fluff and dirt and looked as though they had not been vacuumed for days, maybe weeks. Let yourselves down guys, hence the 4 stars from me.
Read less

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Disappointed
Review:
I never write bad reviews, but feel I have too. We heard such good things about this place, we dropped in around 4.45 on a Sunday (maybe the wrong time) I ordered a carvery and hubby ordered a venison burger. All the veg on the carvery was cold and soggy, the roast potatoes were not crispy and soggy, the gravy couldn’t have been hot as it didn’t really warm up my Luke warm dinner. My hubbys burger arrived and the chips were just soggy, the waitress (who was lovely) asked how our meal was and I mentioned mine was cold and hubby didnt even answer she just said she would report it to the kitchen. After we half finished our meal we decided to call it a day not even bothering with the free pudding, the waitress did say, was everything ok and we did complain, the manager came over and apologised and said the chips were cut this morning, can’t help thinking they were cooked this morning too! He did take our drinks off the bill £8, but I feel taking one of the meals off at £15.95 and £13.95 would have been better as we left a lot and we enjoyed there drinks! As I said I’m not someone that complains and only do if really necessary.

Don’t think we will be returning

Name: The Lion
Title: Fantastic
Review:
What a fabulous pub this is!! Discovered the Lion by accident but so glad we did. The food was fantastic and the staff were very accommodating when my husband wanted to change his order as he didn’t like the curry.
We enjoyed it so much we back later in the week! Highly recommend the fillet steak!!

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Dreadful Christmas Day meal
Review:
Booked back in August for Christmas Day lunch. Visited in November to check where we would be seated as we needed to fit 2 prams next to the table. Was advised it would be a table in the main restaurant area with plenty of space - perfect - or so I thought.

We arrived on Christmas Day and were seated at a table in the conservatory area on the opposite side of the restaurant and it’s as if we were completely forgotten about. No Christmas decorations in this area and absolutely no atmosphere. We waited almost an hour for our starters and then almost another hour for our main courses. The majority of the food was lukewarm at best and when someone on our table asked for mustard, they were told there wasn’t any. The wrong food was also brought out several times. A table next to us were brought out desserts before they’d had their main courses! We also asked for some jugs of water for the table and were told they didn’t have any jugs available.

A very disappointing experience to say the least.

Name: World's End
Title: Absolutely superb
Review: Came with parents and brother and had the best lunch! The menu choice was amazing and I have to say the steak frites were maybe the best I have ever eaten. My father enjoyed the hake special . The staff were so friendly and efficient. My new favourite pub.

Name: Boat House In the Marina
Title: Overpriced and very poor food, will never go back
Review:
My 'monkfish scampi' consisted of 5 bitesize chunks of breaded fish which was overcooked, dry and rubbery as well as being almost completely tasteless with some chips and a few bits of limp leafy green vegetable.
When I complained I received a half hearted apology and was still charged full price for a meal I didn't eat.
Awful food, awful customer service.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Poor food
Review:
The food was a poor standard using frozen chips
Not traditional fish & chips has stated was disappointed
Wouldn’t waste money here again

Name: Cedar
Title: So so food but terrible service
Review: We spent a night at the Hilton and decided to eat at the restaurant so we didn’t need to drive. Food was ok (but didn’t think worth the price) but service was awful. We had to ask multiple times for our food and drink and spent over 2 hours eating our meal. Really disappointed.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Good food, excellent value
Review: The food is very good here but the service has much room for improvement. There never seems to be enough staff on duty and the wait is sometimes very long.

Name: The Diner
Title: Disappointing
Review: The service was very slow, beer was flat and the food was a bit tired looking to say the least. It looked like the chips had been left under the lights for an age - very dry. Wouldn't return!

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Great staff, lovely day out!
Review:
We loved the friendly staff, enjoyed our little tour in the row boat with one of the guides learning about the birds and water-based animals at the centre.

It was a beautiful setting to take a stroll in, with lots of beautiful and unusual birds to delight you.
Read less

Name: Beachcomber Inn
Title: 80s theme Vintage style
Review: The Beachcomber is a light, vintage style, beach side themed venue, where you can relax and take a step away from the buzz of the skyline activities. The menu ticks boxes for those on a heath kick with various salads and also those in need for a hangover cure, burger or full English. Those working were always smiling and interacting with guests and nothing was too much trouble. A northern girl (Catherine I believe) was very informative, although very new to Butlins and was genuinely interested in how our weekend had been. Will be back soon to Butlins and also the Beachcomber

Name: Avisford
Title: Absolute disgrace!
Review:
I cannot even explain how disappointed I was in this hotel stay. This was booked for my birthday as a surprise pamper night away,my partner saved up for a while to take me away.
We were given a tiny box room with a miniscule window, we wanted to relax swim and use the spa...
Instead we went to Arundel for the evening as we couldn't relax in our old, dank teeny box.
Pool closed, spa full, could barely walk round the bed in the room.
May as well have set fire to £200. Absolute joke.
If you're going cancel ASAP!!!!
Read less

Name: Reema
Title: Always a great meal
Review: Reema is a relatively small restaurant so has a great atmosphere. The food and service are always faultless. Book in advance for busy periods (and have the chicken Rajasthan!)

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Close it down now!
Review:
How does this place even exist. Why have the council not closed it down. We paid £17.40 for fish and chips here today. Took it across the road and fed it to the seagulls.
This isn’t food. Run a mile. Run. Keep on running.

Name: Harbour Park
Title: Outing with family
Review:
Really good place to go ,nice cafe and good food ,plenty for children to do lots of amusements, good place to go if raining . A very enjoyable day out
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: access to wheelchair users
Review:
I would like to offer a great review BUT I am fully dependant on using my manual wheelchair and cannot use the site Buggy to get from the visitor entrance to the castle which is up a long and steep gradient. This in reality makes this attraction impossible for me to see as cars are not allowed to enter the site. Surely the site could invest in a buggy that takes people in a wheelchair that cannot transfer to the Buggy. I am really disappointed that they have not really understood the real meaning of access for all
Read less

Name: Robin Hood
Title: A bit quiet, but great service
Review: We visited early evening on a Friday and, initially, were the only people in the restaurant. As time went by, two larger groups arrived, but it still seemed very quiet for a Friday. Food was great - the mushrooms and Stilton was very tasty, and the chefs hunter chicken was a substantial meal.

Name: Pizza Express
Title: Miserable staff and a soggy pizza
Review:
Called in here early Friday evening. Was met by the most miserable, unwelcoming 2 waitresses. The one who served our table didn’t crack a smile the whole time we were there. Looking at the other staff, it seemed to be the same with all of them. My pizza was burnt on outside yet soggy in the middle. Wish we had gone to the osteria a few doors along where the staff are friendly and the pizzas are great and cheaper. You also get a better selection of wine. For a £15 pizza, there must have been less than £1 of topping on it.

Very poor all round. Not sure how others have said about friendly staff, perhaps they had left as they definitely weren’t there on our visit.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Was bad
Review:
Keanu and holly: was awful food was cold beef was terrible and pork was under cooked all veg was cold would never come back and wouldn’t advise anyone too
Tony: was disgusting

Name: World's End
Title: Just a meal out midweek
Review: Great location. Good beer selection. Food was fab. Sharing meaty platter to start, chicken & chorizo, sausages, burgers, steak frites and steak and ale pie were all.v good. Busy so quite a long wait but good food.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: T.B.S as advertised on their store front - Total B S
Review:
Took my wife here for our anniversary, as i have heard some rave reviews, we are big foodies and love a good burger. Starter - Wings in buffalo sauce - dry breaded wings with a 'drizzle' of buffalo sauce, garnished with chive, hmm, not sure about this, if you like American wings like b-dubs this didn't even come close. The cocktails were expensive, poor tasting and very weak. i asked for a cocktail not a fruit juice...

i was certainly holding out for the burger. i ordered 2 - the flamin chicken burger (My wife also ordered this), which was flamin wrong - a whole block of stilton appeared to be smothered on top of the dry crispy chicken; the smell of which made me feel sick - buyers beware...A little tip to the restaurateur's - perhaps put the stilton on the side so you don't ruin the burger for everyone? The second burger, a fairly reasonable gourmet beef burger with bacon and cheddar, caramelised onion, lettuce, pickles in a brioche bun which i would give a 3 out of 5. For desert i ordered a sticky toffee pudding, hoping that my sweet tooth would provide solace. i was given a Cold sticky toffee pudding that stuck to the roof of my mouth forever churning like a cement mixer..come on guys, Chef Mic (rowave) cant even help you here...

Moreover, Already complaining about the copious amounts of Stilton on the burger, a cheque comes to the table, and i see the flamin chicken burger x 2 were still on the bill. One of which had bacon added (£1.50) in addition, did this little piggy run away as i never received the bacon. We again complained and management kindly decided to give us 50% OFF ONE burger after ordering 3 burgers, 3 cocktails, beers and a desert i thought our server was joking. My wife nor I even ate the flamin chicken burger it was so bad, of course as i have decorum i thought lets just pay, get out of here and take to the review sites and wherever else i can to deter people from visiting this establishment. A poor, poor attempt of a burger shop, go to the States and do some research guys, so cliché, Elvis music, really?...after this ordeal we will NEVER be going here again.

Name: Riuchi
Title: Delicious Indian food
Review: We eat from here once or twice a week most weeks. Whatever dishes we chose always come so flavourful and you can tell them how hot you would like it. My favourite dish is the Chicken Tikka Naga and pilau rice. I always get to try a bit of my wife and my daughters dishes so have tried a good selection of the food. We also ask for a chilli cheese Naan which is delicious. We always get prompt service here.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Chips
Review:
Been here before and last time said we would go back just to see if the food was any better. Overall the food was the same, mediocre uninspiring food. Opted for the hunters chicken with triple cooked chips. followed by the banoffee pie. Leaving aside the meat on the plate which was OK, but it all fell apart at the chips. These were NOT triple cooked, at best double cooked and all four plates of chips were the same. In complaining the answer was 'I will let the chef know'. Maybe a 'sorry' or a little more than 6 words.
Banoffee pie was more base than anything else and as dry as a teabag that's been left in the sun for a day!
All in all this is one place we will NOT be going back to and if you want low level pub grub then enjoy.

Name: Carlton Hotel
Title: Not my cup of tea
Review: This is my opion, I will never go there again. Sea view and balcony. No its a back room facing the town. Football hooligans welcome but not for peace loving couples. Staff, don't get me started. No staff just the owner with no people skills. I would ask for my money back but, hay ho. So disappointed 😥

Name: Chopsticks
Title: Takeaway
Review: After waiting over 2 hours for delivery received chicken balls not cooked properly. Kids had already started eating as served them first. After driving down to restaurant and showing them they refused to give a partial refund even though meat was pink. They stated was against their policy and when asked for copy of policy the gentleman pointed to his head and said policy was all in there had no proof

Name: Wheatsheaf
Title: Inexpensive but uninspiring and not worth eating out for
Review:
We ate on a Monday night enticed by the "kids eat for £1" offer.
Walking in from the carpark you have to enter through the bar and everyone turned to look at us. I strongly considered leaving and going elsewhere. It just felt too pubby to be a family dining venue.
The kids were happy enough with their mini toad in the hole - it really was mini though, shame a larger version isn't available for older kids as at least it's a bit different to the options on every other kids menu.
I ordered a pie which was really not worth it - I'd have got a better one out of a freezer box from the supermarket.
Hubby got sausage and mash which were fine.
The kids of course wanted the build your own sundae which they were pleased with.
Service was slow, no one came to clear our plates and I had to chase up on our food as it was taking so long to appear.
Overall if you are eating out for anything other than necessity I wouldn't bother.

Name: Digby Fine English
Title: Loved everything about this place
Review: We popped down from London to Arundel for the day and fell in love with the Digby Fine English Tasting Room. Arundel is stunning - a perfect English setting with castle, cathedral, beautiful countryside, antiques and delicious food and drink. We stopped by Digby on the High Street for a tasting and ended up spending the afternoon in fabulous company and enjoying award-winning English sparkling wines. We thought the tasting flight and nibbles were surprisingly good value and bought some beautifully packaged bottles to take to friends. We’ll be back with friends and family and for corporate events. It’s worth the trip!

Name: Famous City
Title: Almost perfect!
Review: The actual food is lovely, well priced, delivery was quick, everything delicious, genuinely filling. Didn’t have that tired or hungry again an hour later feeling.... only fault is the curry with chips doesn’t come with enough sauce. Would be better to have a bag of chips and a pot of sauce instead of premixing. We’ll be back!

Name: Butlins
Title: Be careful when ordering the Premium dining plan - you don't get what is advertised on the Butlins website
Review:
My family and I saved up for a few days in Butlins last December and as a treat paid for the Premium dining plan. What is advertised on their website isn't what we got. They advertise a carvery, live cooking stations and theme nights including Tex-Mex, Italian, Indian and Chinese. We saw none of these and on phoning Butlins we were initially told that due to an overspill we were given Food Court dining by mistake. On complaining we were then told we were miss-advised and we did get Premium dining even though we didn't even get a sniff of any of the above. You will also waste your time with the complaints department as they need a complaints department to deal with the complaints about their complaints department. If they have done this to us then how many other families have not got what they paid for? A totally shocking experience from what is supposed to be a family based company.
I am now having to go through the legal route due to the false advertising on their website and am building a case against them through social media as they just don't care. They also said they could not log this as a complaint as this was not done within the 28 days after our stay even though we have just recently found out that we didn't get the Premium dining as first thought - this is a very sneaky way of keeping their complaints stats down.
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: First Visit Excellent - Second Visit Not Good
Review:
With this hotel it really depends what room you are allocated - the first room we had was impressive, modern and comfortable. On the other visit we had a really old-fashioned attic room which looked really tired, small and shabby. Breakfast was nice. The pool is small but nice to have the facilities - room service was fine but breakfast was better and had a good range/ choice. One receptionist was very friendly and the other female was very direct and a bit rude. Mixed feelings as to whether I'll go back.
Read less

Name: China Palace
Title: Excellent Restaurant
Review: On arrival we received a warm welcome. We choose a set menu which was excellent, the staff were very friendly and helpful. It was nicely decorated. We would definitely go back if in the area.

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Don’t ever visit here on Christmas Day!
Review: We visited here on Christmas Day, and all I can say was that the food was dreadful, and they tried to overcharge us. Won’t be going back there ever again.

Name: Black Horse
Title: The best liver and bacon
Review: Firstly, this is a pub. Secondly, its food is a good as most good restaurants. Thirdly the welcome from the bar staff and service from the waiters was impeccable. I suppose I could leave it at that but I have to say that the liver and bacon was a joy. It's one of those main courses that can either go well or not. This went very, very well. My only worry was that there was rack of lamb on the specials board...but I had a five hour drive in front of me! My wife is a little less adventurous but she said that her ham, egg and chips was about the best that she'd eaten. We also met the new owner / manager who was very helpful. I really look forward to visiting again.

Name: Premier Inn Arundel
Title: Not great.
Review:
The room was hot, the fan supplied was very dirty and on a timer so through the night useless. The breakfast was poor. Service at breakfast was lovely. Overall I am sorry but could not recommend staying here again even though it is in a great location.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Tulip Festival
Review:
It is a joy to see these wonderful tulips coming out to bloom so beautifully. The colour is lovely and in many different shades and types. The gardeners are so clever to make the gardens so lovely.
Read less

Name: Church Farm
Title: Thankyou
Review: I would like to thank the lady I spoke to on reception who promptly sent someone to check on my 20 year old son who is staying there atm, he rang me as he had cut his head and they sent help straight away to his caravan, I am very grateful

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Laid back luxury.
Review:
The hotel is quite quirky and cosy with a laid back luxury feeling. It was so nice to be able to stay in a place that respects our dog as much as we do. He had treats and poo bags and bowls for water and food and was told he could sit on the sofa - what more could a doggy ask for! All that was missing was a dog walking and grooming service (hint hint). We stayed in the most brilliant room with a four poster bed a wonderful view of the gardens (helipad included) and the sea in the distance.

For us, the spa was amazing - really lovely staff and great facilities including outdoor and indoor pools with hot tubs in lovely setting. There are beautiful walks around, on the hotel grounds and beyond.. we saw lots of Great British wildlife including the cutest owls on the hotel grounds.

The only negatives for us were number 1: the food. It was very over priced. It was good / fine! But that was all. Not £68 for 3 courses at dinner level of good. Dinner on day two was a little cheaper but wasn’t quite there either. Breakfast was also just good / nice. Nothing special at all. And number 2: the water pressure in our room was so bad that we had to shower in the spa. Filling the bath took an age and the shower was just a dribble.

We spoke to other guests during our stay that said the same thing regarding the food so I hope that the hotel can take this on board and make a few tweaks! I would expect a fine dining tasting menu at this price and have paid less for much better but I’ll leave that there.

Regardless, we will go back Im sure because the staff were great and the place is a bit special and it’s just brilliant to have our dog share a weekend away in style with us.

I would love to leave 5 stars! Maybe next time ;)
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Quality accommodation
Review:
Lovely comfortable bed in a very clean well equipped room. Free Wi Fi and TV too. Easy to book and pay online. Room was very spacious and could easily accommodate two adults and two children without taking up all the floor space. What more could you want, it's a no brainer.......
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: ABBA Night
Review:
Absolutely fantastic night highly recommend ABBA night fantastic food show staff were excellent very professional nothing to much trouble. From booking direct to Sam one if the restaurant Managers dealing with anythink we wanted for a booking of 20 of us. One of the best nights had for a while food was excellent all served at same time lovely large separate bar catered for all including disabled guests will be booking for all other entertainment nights
Read less

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: Chloe Lovely staff member
Review: Visited the papa johns for a nice family family meal. Got seated and ordered our food by the lovely girl Chloe. Her customer services was 10/10. Feel very welcome here and would definitely come back again. Once again thank you Chloe

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Cosy atmosphere
Review:
We are in the restaurant of the Norfolk Arms on a Saturday night. There is a lovely small bar with a log fire adjacent to the restaurant and it was very relaxing to sit in there and view and order our menu before sitting down to dinner. Food was very well presented and extremely tasty. The staff were friendly, helpful and very attentive. It was not an extensive manu but had enough choices for us and we were not disappointed with our meal. We would visit again if in the area
Read less

Name: Thai Kitchen
Title: Nice food but atrocious delivery time
Review:
Bought a meal via their chosen web portal called Kukd. We were originally told the delivery would take 45 mins which was ok.

Then we received another email to say our order would take another 90 minutes!! That’s a total of 2hrs and 15 minutes!

The Kukd website says you must phone the restaurant to cancel the order. However when you phone the restaurant they say you have to phone Kukd to cancel and get a refund.

Will never use either again.

Name: Dee Dee's
Title: Friendly caring Staff
Review:
Met up with friends and arrived early. Was made very welcome as I sat on my own for a little while

 They seemed especially good with one visitor who needed a little extra help. a cheery voice and a subtle helping hand I felt was lovely.

Had coffee and a toasted bacon/egg sandwich which was done exactly as I requested..

Waiting to see the selection of home made cakes arrive which will boost business to walkers/cyclists I am sure.
Worth a visit

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Food ok. Service seriously slow
Review:
Staying in the premier inn overnight and went through for an evening meal.
Was told we're fully booked all night. No worries we'll go somewhere else. Hang on we'll fit you in. Found us a table that seats 7. 35 mins after ordering we're still waiting for our deserts and a round of drinks to arrive, but to be fair that has been the average for all the courses.
The food when it arrives is really nice, well cooked and presented well even if it is over priced.
The teenager that served us was excellent whilst the older lady was sullen and looked like we were an inconvenience to her.
If we were not staying at the premier inn would I think about using here again,
NOT a chance.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Great restaurant
Review: Visited here with hubby and grandsons forgetting one is a VERY fussy 7 year who ordered a fish finger sandwich. When it came it had tartare sauce on it which is a huge no no! Manager took it away and changed it for a plain one without extra charge even tho we offered to pay for it!! And while I’m on the subject of ‘fish fingers’.... well.... if you call huge chunks of battered cod fish fingers... !! The food was fantastic!! I have dietary needs and they were VERY accommodating with me. Staff were fab with all customers but even better with the children. Prices were really good for what you get. Would totally recommend this place to all! Thanks guys for making lunchtime tasty and easy!

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Amazing dinner
Review: I visited here in Nov 2019. I was so impressed with the lovely service. The waitress was so helpful and the staff were so friendly. The food was amazing. Such alot of choice and cooked to perfection. Highly recommend this place.

Name: Six Bells
Title: Great food
Review: Visited here last night. Welcoming staff/owners ... I can recommend the lasagne and have been thinking about the fracipan pudding all day. Top notch food and a great atmosphere. Thank you.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Visit with Son and Daughter
Review: We visited at lunchtime today was shown to a quiet table in the corner waiter took our drinks order I asked for pineapple juice and lemonade he brought just pineapple juice asked us if we we’re ready to do food order he never came back finally had to go to bar to find him,food took ages to arrive and then cleared away our plates again seemed to be forgotten had to go up to the bar again someone from the kitchen took our order didn’t seem to be many staff working such a shame used to enjoy going there also asked for a gluten free menu luckily I’m not a coeliac otherwise I’d be worried as the menu had a lot of items scribbled out dishes

Name: The Diner
Title: Raw Chicken,Extremely Slow Service
Review:
Was really really disgusted at both the food and the service yesterday at the diner.The service is really shocking,Takes for ever to bring you your drinks and then once your food is then served you struggle to get the attention of any member of staff having too feel that your chasing them down even to get the bill.The chicken in which my partner was served yesterday was raw inside I then managed to find a member of staff who said oh let me check with the chef if it is raw?!.Er excuse me I don't need a chef to confirm what I can see very clearly which is not pink but RED chicken.Our starters came out with our mains? Which was nachos with cheese,There was hardly any cheese and they nachos were soaked in grease.
No apology regarding the raw food and was given the response that it had simply been taken off the bill! Would NOT reccomend the diner sorry!

Name: Ye Olde Fish and Chippe Shoppe
Title: MP
Review: Always delicious fish and chips, cooked to order. Stuart and his staff are always friendly and welcoming.

Name: Tudor Tavern
Title: Lovely Experience
Review: Drank here every evening during our 3 nights staying in East Preston. Service was excellent as was the setting. Lovely beer garden and the interior has a great feel to it. Great to sit out on the front and watch the world go by. Will be back when next in the area! Thank you! X

Name: Avisford
Title: Hotel tarnishes the Hilton brand
Review:
We stayed here for one night. The Hilton group offers a middle of the road standard. Being an old manor, we thought Avisford Park might in fact offer a little more appeal than usual. Unfortunately we were disappointed. This hotel looks so tired and is in desperate need of an upgrade and modernisation. Carpets are worn, walls are scuffed, the beds are very hard and it really is not a four star hotel.
Our room was large and airy but it was old fashioned - in a bad way - no character here. The bathroom was very dated.
Although the food served at breakfast was satisfactory, service at breakfast was poor and the young staff need some training. It was all very basic.
How can this be a Hilton? We will bypass it next time if we are ever in the area again. There are plenty of other nice hotels in the area to choose from.
Read less

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Film
Review:
Excellent old fashioned cinema and very cheap compared to the new ones have got multiple screens so there is plenty of choice
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: Family visit
Review:
Comfortable and quiet stay
 Room clean and well furnished with friendly staff and convenient facilities.Breakfast excellent with wide choice of hot and cold food.Highly recommend for reasonably priced accommodation in the Littlehampton area.
Read less

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Live music and food!
Review: Came here on Friday night for a meal. Staff really friendly and helpful. As we arrived we saw that they had a singer in the bar area. We had our meals as the music started and there was a great atmosphere in the pub. Food was well cooked and good value for money. We asked if we could move into the bar after our meals to carry on listening to the music, this was no trouble and our bill was transferred across. Thoroughly enjoyed our meal and the entertainment! We will be back!!! Thank you again to the waitress aswell forgot her name but was very good.

Name: Mr P's Classic Amusements
Title: Too hot
Review:
My previous review was removed so I have reposted this as it’s fair for all experiences to be shown.

I heard some good reviews about this arcade so decided to visit when I was staying at Butlins with my friends. Unfortunately it is massively overrated. For starters the arcade was boiling never known anything like it. Some games in the arcade were very loud, I had many issues with machines and the guy who worked there was just extremely sarcastic, The change machine kept running out of coins too. Not a place I’d make an effort to return to. I also noticed that machines are not on the percentages displayed. Whilst the bloke was fixing a machine the screen said 72% but it had a 86% sticker on it.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Rotten salad and vegetables
Review: Out waitress was really lovely, unfortunately that’s where the positives end. We waited ages to be seated and the food also took an age to come. The salad with my starter was brown and the vegetables with my main were no better, they looked like they’d been cut a week ago. The manager did take this off our bill and apologise, I’m just left wondering how on earth this food left the kitchen in the first place. My husband’s burger was revolting, like a cheap value one someone tight brings to a BBQ. We didn’t complain about this, he was so hungry from waiting so long he just ate it, I tried a bit and I wouldn’t have been able to stomach it. My pie was the only saving grace, it was quite nice. I think they need to look carefully at their supplies and kitchen practices.

Name: T-Bone Burger
Title: Great place for a quality ‘posh’ burger.
Review: Just had lunch in T-bone burger. Tolga and his staff were so lovely despite being slightly short staffed and a little stretched. 3 of us had fabulous burgers. Nice to have a generous side salad too. All of us had generous portions and everything was cooked perfectly. Will definitely go again when next visiting Bognor.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Rude staff member
Review: Visited on 10th Jan 2019. Young staff member very rude and patronising. No doubt thought he was being "clever".

Name: Rustington Golf Centre
Title: Poorly managed
Review: 5/6th time here...greeted again for 5/6th time by the grumpy older gent at the till not interested in providing any type of friendly customer service ...tee times not managed the fourball who took our tee time gloating they havnt paid to play cos they know its not managed when we paid nearly 40 pounds to play 9 holes for 2...if you are thinking about going to a proper golf club with a well managed course and friendly staff ...go elsewhere

Name: Grub & Gumption
Title: Best breakfast
Review:
We come along regularly for breakfast.
Friendly staff and owner with her lovely family.
Food is perfect every time.
Coffee is best in town
Perfect little haven

Name: Dolphin Hotel
Title: Consistently delicious food,lovely atmosphere and staff.
Review: I've visited there a few times each time I've been to the UK.Easily one of my favorite place!Between it's spooky history,interesting decor,delicious roasts,coffees and chocolate,you have to go back for more!

Name: Anokha
Title: Disappointed
Review: We just ate in here, as we do every boxing day, and ordered 3 set meals between 5 of us. The food wasnt as good as it used to be either. The waiter stated we could split our meals no problem, however when it came to paying he tried charging us for 5 meals!! He also said the same to the table of 10 behind us too, however tried charging us almost £40 for one meal!! Sad really, because we used to enjoy it here. Won't be coming back.

Name: George Inn
Title: Best carvery I’ve ever had
Review: My partner and I were visiting Felpham from London and decided to pop in to this lovely pub that we had passed and loved the look of. The staff were hugely friendly and accommodating, particularly as we hadn’t booked a table and the restaurant was busy! The food itself was spot on. My favourite was the cauliflower cheese which was honestly heavenly. My choice of meat was gammon which was equally as delicious and the veg, potatoes and Yorkshire’s were also to die for. The best carvery I have had topped off with the warmest customer service! I shall definitely be back the next time I’m in town!

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Farewell meal.
Review: We had a family farewell meal with our long lost sister and husband from Australia who's travelling back to Australia on Sunday. The staff are very friendly and Katie B who was our waitress was very friendly and helpful.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: 4 nights
Review: Been her 4 nights business £25 per night food allowance. Absolutely crap service food crap staff just chat on table I ask to clear table 3 out of 4 nights we have a account with premier inn we are now considering going elsewhere not good at all . As we speak still not received meal 45 min in and the restaurant is empty do not recommend rip off crap

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: cold food
Review: we went on a quiet night staff hanging around food arrived cold didn't go back. The waiter was friendly enough I think kitchen staff need to make sure food is hot before sending out.

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Cosy beyond belief on a rainy late Friday afternoon!
Review: Spent a very nice couple of hours in this pub, bar snacks amazing, atmosphere fabulous, host and bar staff great !!

Name: The Diner
Title: Excruciatingly slow service, average food
Review:
Like some other reviewers on here, we as a family of 6 also experienced extremely poor and slow service. We had pre-booked a table for 6:15 two days earlier but it was 50 minutes before our drinks order arrived at our table, even though we could see the tray sitting on the bar counter for about 15 minutes. There were several staff rushing about but the phrase “headless chickens” would seem appropriate here as they didn’t seem to actually be DOING anything other than trying to look busy and keep moving! The diner wasn’t at maximum capacity by any means.

Our food finally arrived about 1.5 hours after we’d been seated. Our 5 year old and 2 year old granddaughters had to be given snacks by their mum whilst waiting for the food as they were hungry by then and understandably bored by the wait. Well behaved nonetheless. The food itself was average at best and not great value for money. We decided we would all like a dessert afterwards but by the time the waitress was ready to take our order (at least another half an hour after our table was cleared), we had all lost patience and this unacceptable delay meant our granddaughters had already missed the tots disco on their last night that they’d been so looking forward to.

In summary, it would seem some cover times are more efficiently managed than others (avoid Thursday evenings!). The food is average. Staff not particularly friendly and certainly not helpful. The place is not child friendly in terms of waiting times. Allow at least 2 to 2.5 hours if you plan on a timed activity afterwards. The manager needs replacing asap if this restaurant wants to turn a profit. Just our table alone lost them six desserts’ worth of business. With so many other food outlets on site to choose from, I can safely say we won’t be eating at this restaurant again if we revisit Butlins Bognor. Shame.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Lack of consistency
Review: Every time the level of service is different. The food is always good but the experience is mixed. It’s a gamble visiting this place- you never know what you gonna get

Name: Angmering Manor
Title: Relaxing Hotel with great staff
Review:
A pleasant stay at this nice hotel. A quirky hotel with some nice touches and equally odd artifacts such as a plastic cow and sheep in the garden next to a lovely water garden.
The food is superb and the staff were very efficient but really friendly
Would stay again
Read less

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Excellent!
Review: We arrived without a reservation and they accommodated us in between bookings. Sunday roast was fantastic with choice of beef or lamb with plenty of veggies. Burger was a bit too dry for medium but still nice and overall good value for money. After you can walk along the river, super quiet and relaxing. If you are feeling particularly athletic you can also start the walk from the car park in front of Arundel castle, walk to the pub and then back to the car. Recommended!

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Hygiene worry
Review: Let me say first of all the food was excellent. However it is the hygiene standard I am concerned about. If I had known that dogs are allowed where people eat I may have had second thoughts about dining at the Lamb, and I would definitely not have eaten there if I had known the staff would look the other way when a largish dog was sitting on the upholstered bench where people would later sit. This was encouraged by the dog owner. When the staff have this lax attitude where people eat, I worry about the kitchen. I was told when booking that we would be seated in the conservatory, however I assumed it would be similar to the main restaurant.

Name: The Windmill
Title: Very good
Review:
Came here to lunch with a friend.Very impressed. A good and varied menu, served by a really friendly man. Food very tasty and served attractively.
Very good value for money. We shall be returning.
We were the only ones in restaurant so not much atmosphere but huge traffic jams outside due to roadworks so perhaps putting people off.

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Very Basic
Review:
Travelodge is going downhill.
Rooms are basic to the extreme. Absolutely no frills. Had a cold bath both nights, no decent hot drinks, room was cold, no extra bedding and not enough towels. I’ve been a regular TL customer over the years, but they won’t be getting my money anymore.
Read less

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Disappointing
Review: Having dined a few times during 2018, I had no hesitation in booking dinner for a birthday celebration. Venue still lovely, staff were all attentive and well mannered. For the meal itself. Starters were okay, a little basic, our choices being seafood cocktails. We were offered complementary pate appetisers which to be fair were delicious. Steak mains were of ‘pub grub’ standard, but well cooked. Having chosen fish dishes from the Specials board, all I can say is, the Red Mullet filets resembled worn out shoe soles and didn’t taste very nice at all. Such a shame considering the waiter convinced me to try this dish. I think my advice to the establishment would be, if you’re going to charge restaurant prices, you need to serve better prepared food. Whilst your team are lovely and courteous, the standard has slipped in the kitchen.

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Very noisy
Review: We sat down at a lovely table overlooking the beach. The restaurant was half full but there was a table of 10 or 12 behind us and five to our right. This restaurant has a wooden floor and the noise was so great that we could hardly hear each other speak. We felt very uncomfortable and left.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Disappointing lunch
Review:
The service was very friendly but also very slow
The steak frites was tough and cold,. The chicken chorizo pie was mediocre and came with a very small portion of new potato’s and a very small and uninteresting salad
The strawberry and Prosecco shimmer trifle little trace of Prosecco or shimmer, in fact it mainly consisted of tinned custard and squirty cream over one parsimonious piece of sponge.
Even the cappuccino at the end of the meal was Luke warm and tasteless
As the venue had been booked by friends we were dining with we felt unable to complain at the time but we won’t be in a hurry to return.

Name: Mr P's Classic Amusements
Title: A lot of room for improvement
Review:
I write my review based on visiting all of the Mr P arcades. I will not waffle on but here is the basics.

For starters, not all of the machines are on their best payout percentages. Their website claims they have the best percentage payouts, this may be true in comparison to other amusements but losing £1000 through a £70 jackpot machine is definitely not 90%.

Any machine player will generally know if a machine is worth playing. A sign for this is “being full up”. Mr P arcades refill their machines and I have experienced this personally many times in each branch. For example, a party time could be full, the coins are dropping, you win £50 collect it and only pays £19 before going empty, then they refill or flick the hopper top up switch after only refloating £31. The next player then thinks it’s full up but does his balls in.

The arcade opening times are very early to close, however, if you are a promoter of their business via youtube, they will stay open till all hours for you, but not to normal customers.

The owners will lend people money who they get on well with, but others they will not, not very professional.

The staff will empty machines whilst you go for a fag or to the bank.

The arcades never ever have enough pound coins in, staff always have to empty machines half way through playing to get coins.

No loyalty rewards given, where as other arcades you get some kind of rewards. However you do get some free play each visit, on certain machines.

Often machines spend weeks out of use because the owners do not drive. The staff on site do not generally know how to fix the machines when they malfunction.

The air conditioning is pretty much non existent in all 3 arcades. It’s very hot in summer and stuffy most days.

You may get refreshments but that has been abused so seems to be cut back a bit.

All in all, the machines are there for “nostalgia” and certainly as with any arcades you cannot “make money” from, it’s all entertainment. You can get lucky, or you can be very unlucky.

The reason for my low score is that the brand continues to maintain they are this that and the other but in fact they are not. I’ve seen various lies, various untoward behaviour, very unfair ethics. All customers should be treated the same, whoever they are. Opening and closing should be set. Filming of other arcade users without their permission should not be allowed. They will write essays on their social media to portray they are amazing people, which some fall for, but let’s face it - they are only in it for the money in reality, nobody starts a business just for the love, otherwise they would be skint in no time.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: 10 couples visit to Arundel
Review:
Party of 20, mainly mountain bikers, stayed at the Norfolk Arms Hotel in the centre of beautiful Arundel West Sussex.
Good hotel with very friendly, helpful staff and great breakfasts. They even set up a separate dining room with large table to enable us all to have a delicious dinner together and looked after us superbly. Not one complaint from the group. We have all said we will go back.
Read less

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Nice spot, atrocious food.
Review:
A nice spot, with plenty of out- and in-door seating, next to the river.

However, the food was atrocious. We ordered some garlic bread (doughy, tasteless) and a mixed platter which contain chicken wings (insipid, soggy), barbecue pork, kofta (disgusting - inedible), and sausage (vile.- swimming in oil).

The kofta, sausage and wings were swimming in grease (see photos), and all were really terrible.

If you come here, stay for a pint, but avoid the food at all costs.

Name: Fino
Title: Mother’s Day meal, really poor
Review:
My husband and I , along with family have eaten in there before and the meal was very nice . Sadly , I booked for Mother’s Day , and it was a different story . Three of us ordered the ‘special’ 6 ounce fillet steak .. all different cooking preferences , one MR, one M and one WD . Came with ‘Fries’ and tomato’s for £25 each .... Restaurant quiet as late booking , waited 50 mins ..steak poor quality meat with a sour flavour .. fries were cold and inedible .. my daughter put a fork in it and it shattered off the plate . Asked for garlic butter instead of peppercorn sauce and a very large frothy mess was piped on the steak .
Sent straight back and left for home .. waiting staff were fabulous . Very apologetic and took the food off the bill and took the first round of drinks off the bill . Cannot fault staff in the restaurant , but the chef ... well , if you can’t get steak and chips right , then you shouldn’t be in a kitchen !
Would think twice before going again despite a previous good meal

Name: Raj Doot
Title: So slow
Review: Finally given the curry an hour later than advised at the time of ordering. Food was OK but the kids were too tired to enjoy it. Will try elsewhere in future.

Name: Butlins
Title: The pub and kitchen
Review:
Had an another excellent weekend at the Butlins in bognor Regis, plenty of things to do acts to see, the restaurants are top notch. The stand out one has to be the pub and kitchen. We have eaten in there at least 6 times and it never disappoints, the last one was a Sunday roast which was served to perfection. And even when your stuffed you can always manage to find space for a dessert! Staff are always happy to see you. Our waiter Tony who served us on the two visits was very helpful and had a genuine interest in how our weekend was going. He kept a eye on all the tables he was serving and was on hand promptly when you required something. Can highly recommend this restaurant when visiting Butlins either for an adult Weekender or a family one.
Read less

Name: Riverside
Title: Dreadful manager who lets the whole site down
Review: The current manager of the site is dreadful and lets the whole site down. Looking forward to using the pool? Don't bank on it, he'll close it whenever he feels like it to save money. Need to use the internet? He switched it off halfway through the season without even bothering to communicate it to the caravan owners. I could go on, these kinds of issues are not isolated incidents. If you address any concerns with him then expect to be stonewalled, sneered at and treated with contempt. With communication and customer service skills like his I'm gobsmacked that anybody would employ him at all, let alone allow him to manage anything

Name: T-Bone Burger
Title: Awful
Review: Came for dinner, service was awful, table was dirty, bits in my water. took 3 people to get me said water! Salad was awful and the staff where speaking about inappropriate bedroom behaviour loudly across the floor and more interested in their friends outside the restaurant, then the paying customers inside. Not family friendly. Will not be coming back.

Name: Butlins
Title: Just for tots
Review:
This was our 3rd just for tots break, and I’ve lost count which overall visit to butlins. Yet again it was wonderful. We’ve stayed in various accommodations and this time opted for a silver room (which we have stayed in in the past) and as previous visits it’s was spotless. The beds were comfy, the rooms were warm. (We were missing an ironing board but that was soon sorted by guest services)
The staff/redcoats were so helpful, polite and cheerful. There was lots for the children to do, most of which is included in the price. The skyline gang are a favourite of my sons, and they were as wonderful as ever.
We opted for food court dining this time, there was plenty of choice and the food was fine. Certainly worth doing rather than self catering, in my opinion.
We loved the Paddington show, and Justin was great. As normal for the big acts, the queue for Justin was crazy. I was expecting this as I’ve been before. We joined the queue at 5.40pm and the doors opened at 6pm and we had decent enough seats for us and our 4 year old. I personally don’t buy into the b-line passes.
Overall a great break. We look forward to the Christmas fantasy break we have booked in December.
Read less

Name: World's End
Title: Superb !
Review: First visit here for lunch. Superb food, I had the fish pie which you could tell was made with fresh ingredients and a huge plateful tooexcellent service from Lucy our waitress and a lovely relaxing atmosphere. The tables were well spaced apart, unlike some places. Which squash the tables in giving no privacy.Most certainly will be back

Name: Robin Hood
Title: very very disappointed
Review:
Went for Xmas function and very unhappy with food. One diner had plastic in their starter, all veg over microwaved and mushy, Yorkshires rock hard, gravy lumpy and thick. Xmas pudd was so hard could not cut through it. And worst of all everyones food was not hot. Upon complaining were given a measley 10% discount.
Have been here many times day and night and ALWAYS the food is only warm at best, even when we have been the only people in! How can this be? Smebody needs to get a grip. Strange all the good reviews are from first time reviewers, what a coincidence

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Mussel heaven!
Review: Came for the scallops won over by the mussels. Deliciously cooked in a white wine sauce ... the serving so huge it nearly defeated me and my husband. All of it was delicious... you should try them!

Name: Hotham Park
Title: an oasis of calm after the overload of Butlins
Review:
a lovely place to escape to from the maelstrom of Butlins . Adventure golf , miniature train and a great cafe , really nice to go and feel normal again . It isn't the biggest park but it does have some great walks , well kept and a number of activities to keep you entertained on your visit
Read less

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Embarrassing
Review: The large, atmospheric lounge, not terribly busy had a good vibe as we walked towards, which I may add long empty bar with just one couple to the far left being served & four bar tenders wandering idly around behind the bar. We approached the bar & were asked what we’d like. Slightly disappointed that cocktails were not an option, and extremely embarrassed when suddenly we were accused of jumping the queue! What queue?! Apparently it’s what you do we were told from behind the pole, a fair distance away! To be reprimanded by the arrogant male bar tender & ridiculed by a group of young girls (who’s ID I hope were checked!), was embarrassing & totally unnecessary. My point to the management is simply this. If you wish your customers to form orderly queue at an empty bar some 8 feet away from the bar (especially when its empty)please make this clear by placing a sign for all newcomers like ourselves to avoid further unpleasant confrontations. Thank you. Oh and clean your bathroom please!

Name: La Cucina
Title: Excellent meal
Review:
We had a fantastic meal here. Service was excellent despite there being a large group dining.
The only thing we were disappointed in was the location of our table. We were sat in the middle of the restaurant. This meant that people were walking around us as we ate. If you are given a choice of table ask for one at the side.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Harvester
Review: Stopped in for breakfast with my wife and to young sons, before a walk on the beech, my wife had the classic and I went for the unlimited option..... the eggs were rock hard the sausages were burnt the mushrooms were limp the bacon was disgusting....all in all worst breakfast ever....4 people complained whilst I was paying the bill won’t be going again

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Used To Be Brilliant
Review:
I took my family to the Black Rabbit today for Sunday dinner. Booked a table for 4:15 (late lunch/early dinner). Not overly busy this afternoon. The girl serving us looked disinterested from the start.

The food came out quickly. My wife’s roast beef was dry and tough, my lamb felt like it had come out of the microwave. I think you can tell a lot by the roast potatoes on a roast dinner and once again they where dried up and tough!

At no point during the meal did anyone come and check on us or offer more drinks. We had a desert board plonked on the table after waiting 15 minutes for our plates to be cleared away.

The black rabbit was a lovely place and holds some good memories for my wife and I, but I won’t be recommending it again, and I don’t think I’ll be visiting for a long while.

If you’re looking for a cracking roast, try The Corner House in Worthing. It’s just been promoted to top of my list of places to go for a roast. Got to say for post meal satisfaction the Toby Carvery beats the black Rabbit on today’s performance.

Name: Arun Sands Rooms
Title: Gorgeous
Review:
I just came from Arun sands, Littlehampton. It was an incredible 2 days.
Arun sands is just 200metres from sea and a very short walk to town centre.
Rooms are sparkling clean.
I think it is the best guest hotel at Littlehampton.
Marina is doing a great job, congratulations

Name: World's End
Title: Roast dinner
Review: Came here quite a few times for a Sunday roast and it has been amazing went last Sunday on the 14th of July to have a roast dinner - the beef tasted off the gravy was tasted like just cornflower and the vegetables were over cooked! Very disappointing ☹️ hope to come back soon to see if it’s any better. But a lovely pub and kind helpful staff.

Name: Boat House In the Marina
Title: Party
Review: I recently had a party for my 16 year old daughter and I have to say that there was no fighting or sitting on tables and as for the under age drinking I made an announcement on the the microphone that I want any alcohol handed in and if I found any one with any then they would be asked to leave . The food was non existent most people thought they had missed the buffet and what was there was made with stale bread I paid a lot of money for this and feel that I was robbed ,as for the smoking it was me and at my age I know I should now better I can honestly say it's the worst place I have been to and would never recommend this place to anyone unless you want to be disappointed

Name: Butlins
Title: Christmas Fantasy
Review:
We visited on 14th December 2018 for the Christmas Fantasy experience. We stayed in a self catering apartment in Guillemot way and it was very basic and in need of some thorough cleaning/repairs and TLC.
We arrived a bit late on the Friday and struggled to get parked, I had to get out leaving my partner with the car and kids in order to grab the keys and welcome pack to get in to our apartment as we couldn't find anywhere near to park. It was dark and I struggled to find guest services as I had never been there before (they do not have drive in check in desks like they do in Skegness).
We eventually found our apartment and it was really quite far for us to walk with all our belongings, a baby and two toddlers.
The parking situation is terrible, you have to get there early to get a space, we got there about 8pm and it was stressful trying to offload our belongings, our family and finding a space to park.
The first full day the weather was bad and all the outdoor activities were cancelled which meant that everyone was crammed in to the Skyline and it was horrific, the soft play area was bursting at the seams and we could see children getting knocked over by kids running past so we didn't let ours go in (much to their disappointment), there was not enough tables for us to sit down at and it was hard to see anything on stage as everyone was standing at the sides so you couldn't see anything let alone the toddlers trying to see. It was a struggle walking past as there were people EVERYWHERE trying to watch the entertainment and blocking the way past. There were queues for most things and a noticeable amount of parents having a lot to drink and ignoring their feral children, sometimes you would hear some of them swearing loudly and it made me feel uncomfortable as I don't want my children to be exposed to language like that.
In our guest pack we received tickets to see Santa in the Character theatre at 7pm on Saturday 15th Dec (which I thought was a bit late for a 2 and 4 year old), we assumed there was a show but when we got there we just got in to a long queue on the left hand side of the theatre, the kids called out for Santa who came out on a stage, then just sat down with the kids in their respective family groups on stage, had a brief chat with them, gave them a chocolate selection box and posed for a photo before being told to exit the other side of the stage. A couple of minutes at the most, pretty disappointing.
I have since found out from other people who went at the same time as us, that they all saw a Christmas show in the theatre or had a private Santa experience in his grotto so I'm baffled as to why we didn't receive either of those experiences.
We ate at Papa J's restaurant, it wasn't particularly busy and a few things were forgotten by the staff I.e. plates for the children despite asking for them twice so my partner and I ate our meals off the plates the starters came on. The food was absolutely delicious and fairly good value for money in comparison to some of the other places, I would definitely recommend eating here.
The swimming pool changing rooms were dirty, like really dirty and not necessarily from people using it that day but in desperate need of a deep clean. There were dirty nappies on the floor, bodily fluids including blood smears and bogeys on the walls and the floor was filthy.
I didn't see anyone cleaning in there at any stage, not even wiping the changing room floor which meant we had to put towels down in order to get changed and not get completely covered in dirt which meant our towels were so dirty we couldn't go swimming again during our stay.
We had forgotten the baby's swimming costume and had to look for a suitable suit, well there was only a pair of cheaply made trunks (nothing else in his size) and it cost us £10!!! I mean come on, his little swimsuit from Next didn't even cost that much, it really did take me aback but needs must. Well the trunks didn't fit him in the slightest they were massively too big and kept falling down, I feel that this aspect should be looked in to by Butlins as the trunks were incorrectly sized and extortionate, almost taking advantage of people who have no alternative.
During our time in the pool my partner took my little boy to the loo where a two young lads (one was a lifeguard and the other was dressed all in red) were having a loud conversation about one of the lads having an STI!!! Thankfully my little boy wasn't listening as we didn't fancy explaining to him what an STI was and it's a wholly inappropriate conversation to be having in a place mainly full of children.
By Sunday we had had enough so went off the site and went to Bognor beach and pier for the day and ate in a local pub, The Regis (Brewers fayre) which also had a soft play inside which the kids loved, we returned back to Butlins and decided to pack up and leave early (was due to stay until Monday).
All in all a bit of a let down and wouldn't recommend.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Brilliant family holiday
Review:
We have just returned from our stay at Butlin’s and loved it. The staff throughout the resort where fantastic but especially those in the Shoreline hotel. They went above and beyond to make the guests feel welcome and happy.
We took our 18 month old daughter and although she obviously couldn’t do everything, there was plenty of things to keep her entertained and us.
The resort was clean and well kept.
We also included the food deal on our package which was so good, lots of choice and really well cooked. Would definitely recommend doing it, although even if you choose not to then there is plenty of places to eat when you are there.
All in all it was a great holiday and brilliant value for money but above all else was the amazing staff. They were with out a doubt what made the holiday so enjoyable 😁
Read less

Name: Pagham Beach
Title: Visit the beach
Review: Poor old pagham beach is being swallowed up, however if you turn left and walk toward Bognor it’s fine and right will take you ali g the spit and eventthe nature reserve which is well worth a few photos

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: disapointing
Review:
we often use the swan for drinks, and this time it was very disappointing, the service was poor, the prosecco was warm, they had no cold small bottles and would not open a large cold bottle, the bar was noisy and the tables dirty, so we left
Read less

Name: LG Café
Title: Beautiful place, lovely staff and amazing food/drinks
Review: Cannot stress how lovely this place is. Me and my partner both had hot chocolates of different flavours and they were the best I have ever tasted (definitely have the cream on them). We also shared a grilled cheese toastie and had a cake each, both gorgeous. The staff were really welcoming and very helpful including looking for us around Arundel when we managed to leave a bag behind. You must go and visit this place.

Name: Kam-Too
Title: Really poor quality
Review:
Bought a takeaway which was £48, my favourite 'the lantern house' is temporarily closed.
The food was gross, the only thing edible was the chips and the prawn balls. Ended up throwing it all in the bin. Greasy, bland, and just not very nice. I will not be going here again. I should have read the reviews first.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Not a pleasant visit - won’t be returning
Review: Took my parents out for a family meal. There was 8 of us. When we arrived we were told we would have to wait a little bit, which was fine, but it then turned out to be about 35 minutes as they forgot about us. The Seating area was not great, dirty table and chairs and walls. The starters were just okay, but the main dishes were missing food, and the roast potatoes and yorkshire puds were burnt. This was not what I had anticipated for a Sunday lunch. I appreciate this is a peak dining period, however we didn’t receive any apology or recognition of our experience hence my trip advisor.

Name: Ye Olde Fish and Chippe Shoppe
Title: Mr
Review:
Was just awful - don’t normally write on here
Fish was like it had been frozen then over cooked
Chips didn’t taste good , peas just had a strangeness to them .
There were people coming in.. maybe they don’t know any better
Was just shocked how bad .

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Excellent hotel and restaurant.
Review:
Very comfortable hotel + food at the attached Chef & Brewer was excellent and the service at both was great. Would definitely stay again next time we are down this way. Combined the hotel and restaurant provide great value for money too.
Read less

Name: Sen
Title: Excellent value
Review: Went with my sister, fantastic food, lovely staff, good value. Prawns were a highlight! Only complaint would be that the rice portion was tiny- all other portions were a good size.

Name: Raj Doot
Title: Customer Service I think NOT!
Review:
I've only had a take away from here via on line at just eat it was fine
Deceided that I would dine in the first time of doing so
Telephone to make a booking WELL.........
Rude, couldn't care less attitude, Thought about it, felt if this is the attitude I don't want to dine there so teephoned back and cancelled got the same couldn't are less response
REALLY terrible shan't darken their doorstep again!

Name: Riverside Fish
Title: A truly excellent fishmonger!
Review: I’ve been using Riverside Fish, in their green weatherboard at the end of the pier in Littlehampton for the past few years and it’s never disappointed. With fresh local fish and Crustacea from Littlehampton fishermen and local markets, and the benefit of Simon, the fishmonger, who knows everything there is to know about preparation and cooking the fruits of the local seas, make this a fishmonger worth visiting.It’s easy to be tempted. Today, I was after a couple of dressed crab. I walked away with the crab, home-smoked salmon (deliciously different), a brace of kippers and a kilo of Norfolk Blue mussels. These were easy to clean (see pic) with not a single dead one, that turned into the best moules à la crème I’ve ever made.In LA and looking for anything from winkles to scallops to delicious local plaice? You can’t go wrong with Riverside Fish.

Name: Boat House In the Marina
Title: Pleasant views over the marina and River Arun
Review: Good service, very welcoming nice breakfast, full English average compared with other restaurants. Good hot coffee, would go back.

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: Excellent Fresh Pizza - The Mexican Spicy but superb!
Review: This is very good Pizza venue within Butlins food is served fresh and hot, I had the Mexican that was a superb Pizza - Spicy but very nice very fresh and fully loaded, the kids loved their Pizza's

Name: Café 81
Title: Poor sevice
Review: Visited Saturday morning with my two children. At the point of ordering I was told that there was a 25 minute wait for food. I had no problem with this, and was happy to be told upfront. We ordered three breakfasts, the first of these was given to the table next to us. They said that it wasn’t what they had ordered, and even suggested that it was probably mine, but even so the waitress left it with them in their table. A couple of minutes later, one of our other breakfasts arrived, correctly to our table. Shortly after that, they realised that my breakfast was wrongly given to the other table. By this time it had been sat there for about 5 minutes, but they just took it from that table, and passed it to me! Meanwhile, our other breakfast had not arrived. I asked twice where it was, to be told that the chef is alone, and was very busy. By the time the third breakfast arrived, (about 45 minutes from the point of ordering), we had eaten the other two!! Awful service, and the waitress didn’t seem bothered by the situation at all!!

Name: Ship & Anchor
Title: Lunch with wife.
Review: Stopped at this pub on the way home from the boot fair. We found a seat and I ordered a hot sandwich between the two of us,It arrived quite quickly but we were very dissapointed. I asked for brown bead but it came as a baggette. We were not asked if we needed any sauces. The menu said it came with chips and salad, it did! There was very little salad and there were only six chips. My lager shandy tasted like lager flavoured lemonade due to the shortage of lager in it.The price was also high. In all a big disappointment.We wont go back.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Lunch
Review:
I met one lf my friends in Establo lounfe for a quick Brunch.
I found the service friendly, environment clean and inviting. The food was decent enough. My steak sandwich was tasty but a little lacki g in Steak. My friend had the sweetcorn and halloumi pancakes which see said was good but smaller than last time she visitted. Perhaps re rhink poetion size vs value.

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Gluten free and allergy delight
Review:
We had a fabulous lunch there. What a relief to find such a friendly and helpful bunch who fully comprehend allergies.
Food was fab and the location is delightful
Great staff.!!!

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Truly Awful
Review:
We arrived at 11:45 only to be told they don’t start serving food until 12 midday when it clearly states on the leaflet we had and the menu it said 11:30 and showed this to the guy behind the bar. He just shrugged. We were shown to a table by a window and soon discovered the carpet was filthy with bits of last nights dinner scattered around. (Disgusting).
On closer inspection we could see the carpets in our area were very dirty with bits of fluff and food. The carpets looked as if they had not been hoovered in months. The whole fabric of the place is awful and needs a complete renovation. The service was slow and the burger was mediocre with a burnt bun and the jacket potato was small and hard.
 Will never return!

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Fabulous friendly service
Review:
We had just finished a Shoreham to Littlehampton bikeride and were ravenous.

Half an hour before they were due to close and they let us in. As we parked and locked our bikes they were cooking our food.

The fish and chips were amazing. Sweet firm hadock, delicous batter, crunchy chips.

But above all, it was the warm, friendly customer service.

Thank you.

Name: Fox Inn
Title: Yum Yum
Review: Had the most delicious veggie roast here on Sunday. Attentive service lovely family pub. And it’s dog friendly too.

Name: Lemongrass Restaurant
Title: Simply tasty
Review: The food was really tasty and excellent value. Service was attentive without being intrusive. It's just a seriously good little restaurant.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Huge Disappointment
Review: Went there last night with my son as we had a discount voucher. Thought it would be nice start to the weekend. We've been there before and it's been average. Last night was a disaster. I opted for the Surf and Turf combo. Was informed that they didn't have any calamari and would I be happy with scampi instead. Not a problem. I asked for me steak to be cooked medium rare. When it arrived it was still mooing! Completely rare. I sent it back and had to wait for a replacement meal. In the meantime my son ate his meal on his own. When I got my meal the steak was cooked ok. I peeled my prawns and took a bite. As I did so I looked down and realised that they were completely raw in the middle!!! I spat out what I had. By then I'd had enough. Appetite killed. When we received the bill we were told that they hadn't charged for my meal. I thought well seeing as I hadn't eaten anything damn right. They also didn't charge for our 2 beers plus gave us 40% discount off my sons meal. I could've landed up extremely ill last night with food poisoning. We will not be going back anytime soon. On a plus I have to say the staff were very apologetic they just need to sack the so called chef!!!

Name: Trevali Buest House
Title: Rude Rude Rude owners !!!! Beware
Review:
On arrival we - 2 adults with our 2-year-old baby were stopped in front of their entrance stating a child is not allowed. Although booking was done via Hotels.com, Lady came up with a paper stating our booking through Expedia is for 2 adults only. Hotels.com had no answer as to why owner had Expedia reference and said they can’t help as child wasn’t mentioned while booking.
Room information on hotels.com stated room accommodates 2 adults and child if child shares bed with parents. B&B’s website states children are welcome. Despite of this they said children are not allowed and closed the door.
Our fault that we did not confirm baby while booking. The thought of this being a problem never came into our mind as baby co-sleeps with us occasionally and we booked a king size bed for that night. We told hotels.com about the treatment that we got there and we had no intention to stay with such uncourteous Owners. Finally, after a struggle of an hour, we arranged alternative accommodation via google. Before moving we just knocked on their door to show their own website policy, to which one of the owners said, ok then a child and mum can stay in the room and also tried to make fun in a sarcastic way. We understood they are after making money without letting us in, hence we left to the next hotel by cursing their rude behaviour.
Beware and be careful while booking this venue, as its near Butlins Bognor Regis where families booking rooms can easily fall into this trap.

Name: The Beresford
Title: Shame when quality declines
Review:
Sad to feel the need to write this review tbh as l have been a frequent visitor in the past and the staff are very welcoming.
I do not have a problem with the calvary sure the meat portions are a bit small and the roast potatoes not always very convincing, my disappointment is the decline of some of the once amazing deserts!
They once had an apple pie that had melt in the mouth pastry that was so delicious in so generous a portion that many people shared!
This obviously couldn't carry on it was too good value and totally eclipsed the other deserts so when it was taken off the menu l found two tasty alternatives the apple and pear crumble (more like a dinky little pie tbh)or a tasty little bannofee ensemble.
Today was my birthday and l selected the apple and pear but what a disappointment the crumble was like flakes of tasteless cake crumbs on top of apple that was either pretty raw or had not been defrosted.
When l complained l was told the chef said it has been changed and the apple is fine.
I did receive a refund and declined choosing an alternative.
Sad to see so much quality giving way to increasing profit along with lack of quality conrol or ownership of faults although l will no longer be a contributor

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Don't go after 3pm if you want a Sunday roast
Review:
This restaurant always runs out of roast dinners by 3pm on Sundays I was told yesterday by staff even though the website states Sunday lunch menu serving till 4.45.
I ordered a meal which came with new potatoes which came clearly showing face up 2 which had black holes/marks with green flesh inside for all to see. One wonders why the staff dishing / serving this up did not see it???????
Also the service was very slow as already mentioned on trip advisor

Name: Greggs
Title: Never have pain au chocolate available in the morinings
Review: Gregs never have Pan au chocolate available in mornings and when their is croissants they look burned

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Excellent, yet again.
Review:
I'm slowly working my way through the menu here, always a warm welcome and tremendously helpful staff, nothing is too much bother.

Last night I decided to share the mushroom pot with my vegetarian wife, despite the fact I'm not big on vegetarian food, I have to say it was one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten.

Everyone loves it here and we've never had anything but a fantastic meal.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Not impressive breakfast
Review: We are local to roundstone and thought try their breakfast. What a disaster. Waited over 10 mins to be seated. Then had to ask for a glass, Spoon, Sugar. Coffe was ok. Then waited 25 mins for someone to take our hot food order. When our breakfasts arrived, bacon was really greasy, scrambled eggs were chewy and the fried egg had a raw top all round the yolk. Not a good breakfast. Won't be returning.

Name: Tandoori Nights
Title: Made me sick
Review: I brought chicken korma and when I had it made me sick and bad the next morning. The food from here usto be good and I like Indian food. But i felt so ill the next morning after this chicken korma.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Christmas lunch
Review: Sadly it’s not as good as it used to be. Chair was wobbly, dirty Prosecco glass, no replacement glass! Tired restaurant, starter was cold, main meal did not look appetising, was lukewarm and didn’t taste great. Dessert was better. Messed up the bill. Will go elsewhere next year.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Great food and fantastic service
Review: We visited Arundel Crossbush Beefeater on 11th July 2019. Our server, Hazel, was very pleasant indeed, and made sure we felt like valued customers. The food was bought out quickly, and was fantastic quality; I had their new ‘Double Short Rib & Maple Glazed Bacon Burger’ and it was quite possibly the best burger I have ever had! I thoroughly recommend this restaurant - having come here many times over recent years I have always left very happy (and very full!).

Name: Best Western Restaurant
Title: Poor quality and value
Review: Oh dear. Meal for 6 in the Tamarisk restaurant. £241 bill and still hungry. Personally I had a crab starter.....£8 and I could have eaten the whole thing in one mouthful. Weird vaguely crabby mousse on a bed of something sweet. No bread served with it. (Did get some sliced, very dry bread while waiting for food and had to ask for more) main course of seafood linguine. So easy to make! This was a pile of overcooked tagliatelle in a thick creamy sauce that tasted horribly like my partners creamy mushroom soup starter. No white wine or garlic here. Then to dessert. It looked lovely...and the sorbet was, but the tart was straight from the fridge, hard and stodgy.....5 mins in an oven and it would have been so much better. Such a disappointment and an expensive one at that.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Excellent service by Bev
Review:
Visited twice now, staff have always been very welcoming. Special thanks to Bev for her hard work and carrying on with a great attitude. Comfy beds, and nice location too!

Would visit again

Thanks
Priya

Name: Butlins
Title: Love love love
Review:
