We come to Butlins about 2-3 times a year 2 adults 3 children we always stay in the hotels and we absolutely love it every time! We came for a Xmas break but to also share my youngest birthday and stayed Mon- Friday this time which was a first and will definitely be booking again! Well done Butlins you always make our stay brilliant!!
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Never again
Review:
Went for Premier breakfast 3 days running while staying at excellent premier inn next door.
Floors were filthy, same debris under table 3 days running.
Only one staff member available for breakfast who was doing their best.
Buffet totally mis-managed every day. Huge amount of items out of stock including basics like cereal, dried fruit and pastries. Even coffee and sugar frequently under-stocked or absent. Would not use again.

Name: George Inn
Title: Don’t go
Review: Really dreadful meal,the fact no-one was eating and the bar was deserted on a Friday evening should have given us a clue. “Luxury “fish pie....was that the one very small grey prawn I found amongst the other grey fish and grey sauce and grey potato. It really was grim,

Name: Wimpey
Title: Succulent, spectacular and splendid
Review:
Now that I’ve experienced the Smoky BBQ burger, I can happily die in peace. I’m a bit of a fussy eater but after speaking to the lovely waitress, Charlotte, she advised I could take out the onion rings and give them to my buddy that I was dining with (which he didn’t complain about HAHAHAHA). The service was amazing, very quick even though there were plenty of other tables in! Everything was spot on, even down to the recommended “special sauce” which my pal made sure was scraped completely out of the pot it came in!
If I could give another star, I definitely would purely because they serve alcohol with lunch!

11/10, would recommend to the rest of humanity

Name: Littlehampton Beach
Title: We love our beach
Review: Clean unspoilt beach and sand. Shallow when the ex tide is out. Dogs can be off the lead on a good portion of the beach throughout the year. I live here and am totally biased 😊

Name: West Beach
Title: Ideal place to take your dogs and escape the crowds
Review: Don't be put off by the long and narrow road that takes you down to the pay car-park. The board walk over the dunes takes you down to the beach past the remains of a fort built to protect against a French invasion that never came. The beach is sandy/shingly and expansive offering you the opportunity to walk for several miles without hindrance. Dogs are welcome all year round as they are at the next beach along - Climping (or Clymping). The only interruptions to the view along the beach are the wooden groins/breakwaters. Lovely views and a good walk for us and the dogs. Once back at the car park, we stopped at the cafe - very good food and good value - just what you would want from a beach cafe. All in all, well worth a visit and a return!

Name: The Lion
Title: great pub lovely staff
Review: dined at the lion the last two evenings, and really enjoyed the pub our food and the staff were lovely too

Name: Timescape
Title: Great way to spend an hour
Review:
I was a little concerned when I booked up for 9 strong-minded 40-something guys to be locked in a small room for an hour and having to work as a team to get out (I had previously considered going with my family including a 12, 11 and 8 year old, but think it would have been too hard overall for them). I needn't have worried!

From the warm welcome to the moment we left, we had a great time. When we first entered 'the room', it looked a little sparse, somewhat akin to some of my student digs from the past (albeit much cleaner). I didn't think there could possibly be enough to keep our 'clever' minds and 'highly tuned (ahem!)' bodies engaged for the full time. How wrong I was! Aside from the countless visible locks, as you delved and dug deeper, there were plenty of puzzles to solve, clues to find and things to work out to keep us all fully engaged and entertained for (almost) the full hour. Yes we did escape but, if I'm honest, only because of the few useful hints that came across the radio to point us back in the right direction.

This is a fun and fairly inexpensive way to sped an afternoon or start an evening. I gather the clues change every few months, so it can be done more than once. One thing is for sure though, it has given me the bug and I will be booking up another Escape Room in the near future.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Don’t waste your money!
Review: This was quite possibly our worse dining experience ever! Did not want to cause a scene as it was an 18th birthday family party. However.... had it not been we would have walked! Filthy chairs, long wait for menus, even longer for food which when it arrived was utterly awful presentation, cremated, dreadful. Deserts had no brownie! Just sauce and ice cream. Felt sorry for very young waiting staff who clearly have no idea what they are doing. Dreadful night. Don’t waste your time or money! Evening ruined.

Name: Toast
Title: Outstanding food and service
Review: We never tire of visiting this amazing restaurant - friendly staff, delicious food, spotlessly clean and very reasonable prices. The Wednesday night banquet offer is outstanding value. I love the place!

Name: Domino's Pizza, Rustington
Title: Shocking
Review: Used this place a couple of times, soggy pizzas appear to be the norm, last time I felt sick after eating one. Best off getting one from Waitrose next door and heating it up yourself.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: I’m pretty sure I’m still stuck to the tables
Review:
Their beer selection was Doom Bar, Doom bar or doom bar. Literally about 5 beer pulls all with doom bar.

The tables were coated in so much sticky mess I am pretty sure I’m still there weeks later. Gross

Name: Butlins
Title: Huge thanks to cassie and Mark
Review:
Last weekend we arrived at Butlins bognor after travelling 200 miles and arriving at 12am. The room we were allocated already had a family in it and the second room we were given was inaccessible for my disabled mom. We were stressed tired and fed up when we came across 2 security guards Mark and cassie. I cannot thank these people enough for their help assistance and compassion. They found a member of hotel staff to allocate us an adapted room. Cassie was especially good with my mom who is disabled due to a brain tumour. She pushed her wheelchair and spoke to her with genuine interest and respect. She oriented my mom to our room turning on lights and shutting curtains tiny things that made a massive difference. As a nurse i see people in the care profession that so not have as much empathy as cassie showed us that night and I cannot thank her enough. Mark insisted on helping my dad unload the car. These 2 members of staff went above and beyond and I can't thank them enough xxx
Read less

Name: Morrisons
Title: Good coffee
Review:
Very good quality cheap food, prompt service and very friendly service.
Wish there was a Morrison’s near where we live.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: My wife’s birthday
Review:
We found the Oystercatcher by chance today and decided to pop in for lunch. Now my wife and I eat a whole food plant-based diet (for health reasons) and when we told the staff they couldn’t have been more helpful.

Carol, our waitress at lunchtime couldn’t do enough for us so we decided to book for the evening as well, and we explained our dietary needs.

When we arrived for our evening meal Liz (our waitress), who had been there for seventeen years looked after us and Hannah, the manager was also on hand to make sure everything was ok.

They chef, who had been made aware of our dietary requirements had actually taken the time to prepare a special meal just for us based on our whole food plant-based diet.

This restaurant and its staff went above and beyond and we were humbled by their willingness to help and accommodate us.

The food was absolutely amazing.

So, if you are a vegetarian, vegan or on a whole-food plant-based diet I can highly recommend this restaurant.

They are friendly, caring and hugely customer-focussed.

More importantly, they are genuinely nice people.

We’ll definitely be back.

Thank you chefs, Carol, Hannah and Liz.

Best Regards

Mark & Deborah Dawes

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Outstanding Food
Review:
Thank you to the girl at the Oyster Pond who recommended this restaurant to us for lunch other wise we would have missed this experience.
Had the sea food platter as a main course and was not disappointed. The muscles in a creamy source with plenty of bread to share was lovely. The calamari and tempora prawns were crispy and golden and the sweat chilli source complimented this dish. Possibly a little too much batter served on this platter, I would personally ask for the prawns without batter next time. Others in our group had the Thai salmon and prawn curry and were full of compliments. The children’s menu was ideal for our two boys and the table mat activities kept them entertained.
The food was delicious and we could not fault it.
We had recently returned from Italy and were pleased to find this high standard of food served locally.
Thank you.

Name: Partners Café
Review: Best breakfast around with out a doubt! Wouldn’t go to a different cafe. Very clean and friendly staff

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Not what it used to be!
Review: We went here several years ago and it was excellent however it has gone downhill substantially. We ordered two ribeye steaks which was a serious expensive mistake. My wife's steak was so tough she could not cut it let alone eat it. Mine was only marginally better. We did complain but it made no difference to the bill. We were told "A new chief is comming next week" but we will not be back next week or ever again.

Name: Avisford
Title: Dated 31/8/2019 - 01/09/2019
Review:
We visited this hotel as we attended a charity event. I was expecting this hotel to be quite posh but as we arrived I was shocked at how shabby it looked from the outside. Then expecting indoors to be better, well it wasn’t. We were put in a room near the event room but got given a disabled room (just me and my husband) which was dirty looking, the bathroom especially. The bed was comfy though. Staff seemed ok but didn’t ask how our stay was when we left.
I certainly don’t think it was worth the money and we had a discounted rate. Given the choice I wouldn’t stay here again. So disappointed.
Read less

Name: So India, Little.
Title: A disappointing takeaway
Review: Several people have recommended this restaurant. We ordered a takeaway and took it home. Some of the dishes would have been returned if we had been sitting in the restaurant. There was a mixed starter for two: onion bhajis, somosas, chicken tikka and salmon. We never saw the salmon. What we got was a container with the mentioned items covered with a tomato and onion sauce. A load of slop, because the bhajis and somosas had disintegrated. The main course was mixed tandoori grill and rice which were okay, but the separate vegetable curry was more slop with a few peas and carrots. A waste of money.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Slow service.
Review: Visited earlier in the week, early evening ,it was not busy about 7 tables only with customers, was seated quickly but took ten minutes to receive a glass of water ( this was in our heatwave). Took the order which then took 45 minutes to arrive. The table next to us said their meal was so slow that they had been there nearly 3 hours! Come on you need to up your game, having been in the catering industry there should not have been such a wait.

Name: Aldwick
Title: ‘’Fantastic 2 Nights Stay’’
Review:
My husband and I and my son who is in a wheelchair stayed 2 nights. We were checked in by Bob who was very welcoming.We got to our room on the 2nd floor via the lift. The room was exceptionally clean, spacious and bright. My son loved the red soft furnishings being a Manchester United fan. The beds were very comfortable and we slept well. The breakfast menu had a lot of choices and the full English was freshly made by Mike. Dena served us our breakfast and she was very friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. Veronica and Mike (owners) were very welcoming and hospitable. I would without doubt recommend The Aldwick. I will most certainly stay again without hesitation. All in all it was like a home from home. 😊👍🏽
Brenda ,Gary and Yan
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Adult music weekend - horrific! AVOID
Review:
Complete lack of security!

Terrible Management and no apparent care for safety of those on resort. Waste of time complaining as you will receive what seems like a template email!

Considering the type of weekend this was I was shocked at the lack of security (no bag searches etc). Perhaps they should invest more money into security as after being attacked and no security arrived to remove the 2 people attacking me for a good 3/4 minutes I am informed that there is no CCTV!!!!!!!!!!!

The policies at this resort are not followed!!!!!! Avoid at all costs! Cheap for a reason
Read less

Name: Pizza Express
Title: Planned End Of Day Our Visit
Review: We booked Pizza Express after a day out in Arundel. The childrens' meals are fantastic value and sufficient enough for our hungry early teen and nearly 10 year old. My wife and I had starters, a main and a side as well as a dessert. We were able to use a 3 course discount voucher. My wife's a vegetarian and was delighted to see the fungi pizza back on the menu. Food was fab and service swift and spot on. We'll be back when we next visit Arundel.

Name: Monsoon
Title: Fab curry
Review: We came here for my mother in laws birthday , fantastic service , fantastic fresh cooked curry with lots of flavour ! Place nice clean and tidy , we will be back x

Name: The Swan
Title: Simply the best Sunday roast!
Review: Simply the best Sunday roast you can get. I love The Swan, everything about it just makes you feel cosy and comfortable. We visited tonight with our 2 children and had a lovely meal, service was superb as always and the food was excellent. Never fails to deliver. Thanks again.

Name: Butlins
Title: Mr Watkins
Review:
Had a brilliant time in Butlins Minehead just for tots week a big mention to Liam and Kellie of the coast diner for excellent host skills and service Especially to my son Ashton and daughter Tillie in which every night made they night by talking to him and spending time with him he was really upset when leaving these two hope my message get back to them many thanks
Read less

Name: Black Horse
Title: Disappointed
Review: We stopped for a bite to eat over the weekend , staff were very friendly and we were seated immediately . Firstly we noticed the strong smell of Disinfectant which smelt like it was masking a wet dog smell . We noticed a dog attached to the bar sleeping in their bed , we have absolutely no objections to animals and consider ourselves very pet friendly . But what we disagree with is that a member of staff that serves food and drink over a period of 5 minutes petting , stroking , cuddling the dog . She immediately went behind the bar , poured a pint without washing her hands , and handed the glass by the rim to the customer . This immediately put us off eat8 g and we drunk up and left .

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Appalling customer service
Review:
Booked a double room during August festival, costing £89 no breakfast, had to pay for parking. At no point were we told the band would be playing outside our bedroom in the courtyard with smoke billowing from a wood burner into our room because the window does not shut. On return to our room at 9 pm it was full of smoke and the music was deafening. We complained but the ‘owner’ just kept saying you knew there was a festival on. Yes we did in the surrounding streets but not in our room! Refused to move us or do anything to help resolve the situation. Appalling customer service, bad attitude by the management. Had we been told the band was playing outside our room we would never have booked a room at this hotel.
Read less

Name: Toast
Title: Amazing, huge, gigantic breakfast!!
Review: Amazing food, value for money and a quirky film related environment with props and memorabilia on the walls. The big breakfast is massive and the staff were really friendly! I live around the corner so do regular trips here.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Sunday lunch
Review:
As always great food, choice and quality and price of. Children catered for amazingly with such lovely little bags of colourings and stickers etc with each child’s meal. Had booked but ended up outside by the river in the sunshine. Staff, very happy, pleasant and nothing too much trouble.
Hall and Woodhouse at its finest!

Name: Tudor Tavern
Title: Christmas meal
Review: It’s a lovely pub, not long been refurbished to a good standard, we got our starters which were all really nice, so looking forward to our mains which were all a total disappointment, the roast beef was tough the veg must of been cooked the day before and reheated, the veg option was more rice cake than nut roast, the desserts were a mixture of good and bad the cheesecake couldn’t be deciphered as what fruit it was and the coffee finally no one enjoyed it as far too strong maybe serve with cream rather than milk

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Poor experience.
Review:
Visited last weekend with friends. The service was poor, staff had to be reminded for menus and drinks, but still we waited.
 Waited over an hour after ordering before meals arrived.
 The food was so poorly presented..... no pride/care shown here.
 The meals were distinctly average and my chicken & tarragon pie was lukewarm.and all of our plates were cold too.... I was violently sick during the night.
 Such a shame! This pub used to be a favourite of ours for many years... had a lovely menu, friendly, efficient service and a good experience all round. I do hope the new owners act positively upon the recent poor reviews.

Name: Butlins
Title: Disappointed stay - don't waste your money
Review:
Very disappointed with our stay, arrived at 4:30pm Friday told to park up and go to Oyster Bay reception to collect keys, would have been nice for them to tell us to take all our belongings on a trolley so we didn't have to walk back and forth!
After settling into our room we headed out for dinner "The Diner" was very nice but expensive, we then thought we would go around the fair big mistake it shuts at 5pm and majority of the shops were closed too even the kids soft play was shut! Note this is closing time everyday for everything except restaurants, pubs and of course the shows.
Alcohol and snacks very overpriced.
Even though our room was upgraded it wasn't the cleanist and the shower smell was vile! Yuk!
Don't be early risers as u can't do anything until 10am, be prepared to que in the Splash Area for an 8 year old and teenager it's alright once they did all the slides then bored same for us.
We were going to go home late Sunday evening but have decided to leave straight after breakfast don't see the point wasting a whole day here.
Butlins seems fine for toddlers wouldn't recommend for older children think we will stick with camping!
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Grim New Pool
Review:
We went on a day pass yesterday, purposely to see the new pool after all hype that was made around it.I wish i had not gone at all. The changing rooms were grim , not clean and pubic hairs all over the floor, it was gross, we overheard a family saying lets get out of here its hell. It was hell, i wish you had kept the old pool open. We wont be coming here for swimming again, the pool is great if you are a toddler or early teens, nothing for adults here, not even a bar or food by the pool, avoid this place if you can. I read other peoples reviews on here before going and thought people were being picky however i agree with them.I also think you should think about doing more entertainment for adults during the day, couples come here not just families and i think it would be nice have a mix of adults and kids stuff. I am also shocked the on site fish and chip shop is closed on a Sunday and Monday yet the takeaway part is open, that should be changed, the whole site should be open not half, you pay enough on a day pass and even to stay there you pay enough I am so shocked at the new pool. GRIM
Read less

Name: World's End
Title: Absolutely beautiful
Review:
Stopped here on the off-chance while travelling to Brighton. What a beautiful pub. Very welcoming staff and such a calm and pleasant atmosphere. Lots of lovely little nice touches.

The food was incredible. Cooked to perfection and really tasty. Everything was brought to the table quickly.

Can not recommend enough!!

Name: BailiffsCourt Restaurant
Title: What a Dissapointing experience
Review:
We booked for cream tea.
My wife's birthday present.
We where told we could not sit outside as they had a wasp infestation!!

Not offered a table in the dining room, we where shown a made up table what looked like a large broom cupboard.

We sat down the only table in the room which is tatty and needs completely redecorating.

Then the food came out, dry flavour less sandwiches, the scones where dry and reheated, the cakes where boring with no imagination or flavour, we only saw our waitress once, not even when we left.

We have had cream teas in many places.
This is the worst and one of the most expensive.
Avoid this hotel, management don't care, no apology.
If your local try south lodge or the Grand hotel

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Poor service
Review:
Visited here today for a family birthday.

Allowing pets into a restaurant is a strange idea and having 2 yappy dogs behind you when your trying to have a nice family meal for a birthday celebration is not my idea of fun.

Starter was average at best. Steak was not cooked medium as requested.
Pudding well.....

We asked for 2 x 3 scoops of ice cream. 2 toffee and one chocolate and one vanilla and 2 chocolate.
The waitress didn’t write it down and when the order came it was wrong. We told the young very done up with makeup who then returned to correct the order.

Another waitress came and asked what we wanted again. So for a third time we were asked what we wanted for pudding.

We will not be visiting again.

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Evening Meal
Review:
Treated ourselves to an evening meal here in Arundel. Lovely evening and we sat by the open doors. Good friendly staff.
We ordered chowder and smoked trout to start and both were excellent. This was followed by the special of the day Hake. My wife’s was very good but unfortunately mine was not properly cooked and I had to send it back and by the time my replacement arrived my wife had finished hers. This was followed by deserts of cheesecake and chocolate with orange. Both were excellent as was the bottle of Picpoul wine. We also got an extra glass as a say sorry, but the undercooked hake unfortunately did spoil things a bit.

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Birthday Meal
Review: Booked a table for a party of 18. Service was good and the staff efficient. Food was excellent a definite 10/10. I don’t usually write reviews but felt this was a must and highly recommend. The whole party enjoyed their meals.

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Grubby
Review: What a wasted opportunity ! Such lovely views but cafe was grubby and tables uncleared. Staff unfriendly when we walked in and at one point a couple walked in and after five minutes of no-one serving behind the counter walked out. Won't bother again !!

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Not learning from mistakes
Review: Again very disappointing visit to this pub. Although placed in perfect location it just lacks atmosphere. Seems like it’s being run by an amateur with no idea how to manage a pub. Menu not very exciting, drinks overpriced. Definitely not recommended!

Name: Rustington Manor
Title: NOT fine dining AVOID AVOID AVOID
Review:
We dined here 4 weeks ago on a Saturday evening.
The menu consisted of a variety of 5 choices of meals one being veggie so we both like meat so this was reduced to 4 meals! The waiter then told us that the fish dish was not available!! down to 3 choices now and that there was no more rump steak but we could have Sirloin.
Well better cut of meat so that is what we ordered.
This was the toughest piece of meat we have had and a total waste of money.
ALL there meals come with chips, (ALL OF 5 when available) and they call it this FINE DINING!!
We decline having deserts or coffee but the waiter insisted we spoke to the manager.
The manager was called and I asked about the wording of 'FINE DINING' he said they was going to remove that and offer a new menu which would be in 2 weeks and took our number and said he would phone us when this NEW menu was available for us to sample free of charge as a gesture of good will as our evening had been spoilt.
The venue is pleasant, and apart from us there was 6 other people??? on a Saturday night speaks volumes.
The Lamb pub is very close with far better menu and far better quality food
We are still waiting for the call from the manager.!!!!! AVOID!!!

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Food..Cold, Stale
Review:
Food and service was so poor..
Rude staff, never been to such a poor place. A shocking experience for all six of us..Such a let down..

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Rude......
Review:
We decided we wanted an ice cream rather than a cuppa and a sit down so chose our flavours before wandering in to look at the view.
Immediately a woman 'commanded' us rudely that we had to sit at a table so she could take our order. Followed to be told loudly "you've walked into a cafe, you need to sit down' order.
I told her we had decided to just have an ice cream...
The curt reply and stare back was "well, the flavours are out there on the board you have to go in THERE to order'.....
Needless to say, we didn't stay and the last thing we would want to buy and ice cream from you!!!
Dreadful social skills. Rude Rude Rude...

Name: The Mezze
Title: Fantastic evening
Review: Yet again I’ve had a fantastic evening, amazing food and excellent service. Thank you for a fab evening.

Name: Fino
Title: Disappointing
Review: We came here for my partners birthday meal, and when we arrived it was lovely the young lady who served us at the bar was lovely and the young bar man was fantastic, unfortunately that was the the best bit of are evening, we ordered a bottle of wine before our meal, the wine we ordered was OFF, and one of our drinks had something weird floating in it, which we showed the waitress, we asked if we could replace the wine and the waitress told us we could only pick from a certain selection, we were offered no compensation for this and to be honest it made us all fell quite sick, the prawn cocktail starter was properly the worse thing I have ever tasted, watery crayfish with absolutely no taste, we all had the same starter and was hugely disappointed, the mains all required seasoning, and we decided to not even bother with dessert, the bill was over £200 for the 4 of us, very unsatisfactory!

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Fantastic services
Review: When we arrived I was a bit worried because how busy the restaurant was. We had pre booked a table for 7 at late notice however this wasn’t a problem for them. We was welcomed by the manager Sharon who was very friendly and professional. Our waitress was Megan, who couldn’t do enough to help and although very busy the service was perfect. The best place I have eaten in for a long time. Not the cheapest however well worth the extra for the quality and service. The staff are a credit to the company.

Name: Bengal Tandoori
Title: My birthday ends badly
Review: Had a curry with my family for my birthday, there was 5 of us. We had a nice meal and the food was nice. The services was OK to. Not perfect but OK. Anyway the problem was we went to bed 4 out of the 5 of us had diarrhoea most of the day and sickness as a result of our dinner. Won't be back again.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Brilliant!
Review:
My friends and I visited The Knight’s Table for a birthday celebration recently and everything from start to finish was wonderful!

Lively, approachable staff, huge portions of wonderful food & excellent value for money, in addition to the ambience created with the Medieval artefacts made this an ideal night out!

They also have a rail of traditional clothing for those wishing to dress up in, which obviously made the evening even better!

The food isn’t all traditionally ‘Medieval’ so there will be something on the menu for everyone!

Would highly recommend this restaurant! We will be paying our next visit in the very near future.

Name: Inglenook
Title: Wonderful family lunch
Review: We were really well looked after for our Sunday Carvery today. Food and service excellent and the garden amused the kids despite it being October. Quality of food was great and plenty of options. Make sure you book as seems popular.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Poor food bad rude customer service
Review: Well done steak arrived bloody and half raw, After ordering no blood and well done after 45 minute wait. Manager had to be called over as no one asked how was meal, sent back blood put mum off, and told you always complain you will have to pay for it.Manager told us not to come back in ever again,Mum left in tears and traumatised. Having had the same meal last week in the rusty cutter Portsmouth mum enjoyed steak and was perfectly cooked. Staff also on hand who asked how meal was,very good customer service here.Suggest chefs and management have some training from Portsmouth rusty cutter they could teach them a lot.

Name: The Bear Inn
Title: On the way to Church Farm
Review: Stopped for a quick lunch, what a treat. Lovely waitress and great food at a very reasonable price. Welcomed our little pooch too. Clean toilets and a good selection of beer for the Mr. Worth a visit!

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Fantastic Food, Amazing Views, Lovely Staff. Highly Recommended
Review: We had a late Sunday lunch here after a walk around Amberley and the South Downs.  We ate on the terrace, which unusually we were able to pre book, which was a great touch (many pubs won't let you book an outside table).  There is a large pub garden with lots of tables, with stupendous views over the flood plain. On a sunny day this is truly a lovely place to be.  We had the ploughman's and a fish platter. the portions were big, but not so much so that you felt overwhelmed. I have to say the food was the best I have seen for a long time, and the staff were very friendly.  We will definitely come back here, as this place is a real gem.

Name: Toast
Title: Great cafe
Review: Just moved into the area and stumbled across this fab cafe. Great food, good prices and wonderful friendly and welcoming staff.

Name: Butlins
Title: Just no..
Review:
If you have a fruit machine gambling addiction and enjoy catching STDs this is the holiday for you, over priced, lacking entertainment, food unfit for human consumption that even a 3rd world dying child would not eat.... it’s full of life’s rejects from London mainly, most think they are rich and a cut above because they paid £9 for a pint and £500 each for a week in what feels like a prison camp,
Swimming pool gave us all some skin eating virus...
Won’t be back.... ever
Read less

Name: Jade
Title: Dont bother
Review: Ordered our food at 7. Called at 855pm and was told at least another 20 mins. Asked if they had started cooking it yet and they said no. Asked for a refund. Person on the phone said fine and put the phone down. Appalling service. Don't waste your time or money.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Lovely afternoon and so much to see
Review:
We had a lovely afternoon here recently with friends who aren’t local. Loved walking around the castle and grounds and immersing ourselves in the history of the place. It’s not cheap to get in but it does take most of an afternoon to see everything. Well with a visit
Read less

Name: Maypole Inn
Title: Great Skittles Night
Review: Felpham Singles group visited yesterday for a skittles night. Great fun and completed with a variety of basket meals well served and plentiful. Thanks Sam and staff an we will be back. Photo of the winning team.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Looks good from outside
Review:
As it was cold and raining when we went to Arundel, we didn't want to spend two much money, (It is rather expensive to enter) as we wouldn't have got our monies worth, but from the outside it looked most impressive, would be great to see it all on a really hot, summers day., the pictures on the Webb site look really good.
The town is very historic looking and worth a ggod look around.
PS---Appears to be many places to park for free in the streets, if you don't mind walking a little way
Read less

Name: Steam Packet Inn
Title: Not open!
Review: Friday 13th September.I checked the opening times on the web site and confirmed that your open until 15.00. Arrived at 13.45; closed.Checked the website again, still saying your open.Really miffed as we traveled to Littlehampton, primarily to come to your pub. In the end, your loss is the Arun Views gain. We’ll not bother in the future

Name: Magna Tandoori
Title: Terrible service
Review:
We visited this Indian last night . Food was ok.

We had1 lady in a wheelchair struggled to get through the front door. Waiter just stood there without offering to assist. The waiter was so miserable . He took the Order incorrectly and stood and argued with me as he disagreed
The service was terrible, didn’t offer us a dessert menu. Rude staff is under statement. .

Name: The Southdowns
Title: Good food.great price
Review: Four of visited for an early meal. Not too busy so Service was good. All our meals were hot and cooked really well. Plenty on the plates for the price. Had not been for as reviews were not so good but must say was not disappointed. Would defo return.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Burgers and fries
Review: This place is ok, burgers are tasty, although hardly mind blowing. They had some interesting drink options which made a nice change but chairs are not very comfy and staff did not seem very invested. Had to wait a while, nothing too much but as it was quiet when we were there would wonder what it is like on a Saturday night or other busy day.

Name: Bah Humbug
Title: Ms
Review: I bought liqourice, bag was brown paper. The Manager served me. He sneezed constantly as serving me. The bag was covered in wet. When i told him, he said it was from the liqourice (much to my dismay). Ive never been back but i did buy it as he had already taken my money. I dont know if there should be two staff on. One for money and one handling the sweets. Gloves were not used either.

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: This place seems to have gone badly downhill
Review: We have been going here for occasional meals for nearly 20 years and have always found the ambiance and food excellent. On 14 February we went for their Valentine's Dinner as on previous years and were sorely disappointed. The Valentine's menu is best described as "interesting" - nicely-cooked but what we'd describe as "specialist" dishes rather than the pub's usual varied tasty home-cooked fare. However, what really spoiled our evening was the service. We were the first couple to occupy one of a group of four tables, which later filled up, but by the end of the evening we were still waiting for our desserts after all the other three sets of guests had finished their meals and left. We asked several times if we could have the course we were waiting for and got a surly "it's on its way" followed by further waiting. Before our desserts arrived, the server cleared our table of everything; our napkins, our cutlery, and the rose in its vase. My wife asked if she could have the rose and it was dumped on the table in front of her. When our desserts finally came and we'd eaten them, we felt the attitude towards us was "hurry up and leave", when the delay was all of their making, so we didn't bother with coffee, paid up and left. We're not fussy people and always try to appreciate things, but this visit was a massive comedown from previous ones, and If this is what the Spotted Cow has become, we won't be back.

Name: Avisford
Title: Dated!
Review:
We came to stay here for an event being held at the hotel. I thought it was going to be quite a posh hotel but when we arrived it looked very dated and not very welcoming. The staff were ok but not over friendly. They put us in a disabled room which was a bit odd! The bathroom was not very clean. Bed was comfy though. I think the room was really over priced, quite disappointed overall.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Fancy a Joust?
Review:
Arundel Castle is splendid and well worth a visit. We took our children to the Joust festival and there were many activities to keep them occupied, including watching the Joust final. My daughter loved her face been painted which was included in the entrance fee.

The Castle itself inside and out is very impressive, I loved the library and castle has a wonderful feel to it, all the attendants were very helpful and informative.

The restaurant is themed as a castle banquet, my only gripe would be i asked for a Caesar salad however was served mixed leaves with french dressing?!?!, I asked for a Caesar salad and they just added Caesar dressing on top!?!?!. You are paying restaurant prices therefore if they serving Caesar salad, it should be with Cos lettuce etc. I was disappointed with this!

Arundel town is lovely to walk around before or after entering the castle. With some lovely boutique shops and a river runn no though it.

Overall it was a memorable day out and a hit with the children.
Read less

Name: The Swan
Title: Disappointed
Review: We stopped in Arundel on our way home from Hastings and visited the Swan to have lunch. We were quite late, it was about 2.30 but as we were told they were still serving Sunday lunch we stayed to eat. Our meals were served quite promptly by pleasant staff but when I started to eat it I found that it wasn’t hot, so asked for it to be changed for a hotter meal. The waitress took it away without any apology and so we waited again for the hotter meal, which came after a wait!! I must say this meal wasn’t a lot better. Also the vegetables were dry as if they had been kept hot since the early morning. The beef was tough, the Yorkshire pudding was dry. All in all it was a very unpalatable meal.

Name: Mustards
Title: FANTASTIC!!
Review:
It was my first visit to Mustards and it certainly won’t be my last! So nice to have a quality restaurant in Bognor. The pollock starter was delicious as was the calves liver and the staff were very accommodating.
Looking forward to my next visit!

Name: King Pizza
Title: Takeaway
Review:
I usually use this place for food delivery and up until now have been good but last night food took nearly two hours to get food to me!
When app said it was due I waited another 15 mins to be told it would be soon so another 15 mins go by so I go to the shop to be told its on its way now. I dash home to meet the delivery bloke but he still hadnt appeared. Another ten minutes and he rocks up. Such bad customer service. Will not be using again

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Great Service and People
Review:
This was a great place to use as a base to explore Sussex.Staff friendly and efficient First Class.Food Great.Highly recommended 10/10.From the point we arrived all was excellent plenty of parking no fighting for a space like so many other hotels. Then we entered to be greeted by a young lady who quickly confirmed our booking and asked us about breakfast which we paid for and booked for the next morning. We then went to our room which was clean and tidy. Had a great nights sleep no noise and a comfy bed ensured we had a first class sleep. In the morning again the service and breakfast was first rate. Thanks to all the staff at the hotel. Special mention to isara who has excellent customer service skills.
Read less

Name: Cedar
Title: Family meal
Review: We used this restaurant for an 80th birthday meal and were given a quiet corner as requested. All dietary requirements were handled with a minimum of fuss. We were well looked after by Gonçalo and Connor who were attentive but not intrusive. The portion sizes are good but not huge and very well presented with a varied menu selection to chose from. The restaurant is full of character being set in a former school in a listed building and part of the Hilton Avisford Park Hotel. Quirky touches such as the bill being presented in an old book add to the charm. We would definitely eat here again.

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: A Lovely Lunch
Review:
What a beautiful location & postcard pretty restaurant and bar.

On arrival we were warmly welcomed by friendly faces.
The food, service and staff were first class, all made for a superb lunch in a relaxed environment.
I must mention Harriett and say thank you to her, she made our lunch enjoyable with her attentiveness & lovely personality.

Many thanks to all, especially those whom aren’t seen, what a fabulous team you all are.

Name: The Waverley
Title: Wedding
Review: Went to my friends wedding here on 22nd December 2018 and it was a great evening. The room looked great and we all had a fab timre

Name: Jerichos Sweet Store
Title: Mrs.j.
Review: Lovely shop for young and old, always a treat for the children (and adults) and staff so friendly and helpful. I think the son owns it and the dad helps out but they are both happy x polite. Thank you.

Name: World's End
Title: Warm, Welcoming pub!
Review: I love the worlds end! The staff are always extremely friendly and polite and the food is always amazing! The Lamb Medallions are a must try!

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Avoid this place at all costs
Review:
We purchased two sausage and chips and one drink and it was very overpriced at £12.50

The chips were greasy and crusty and the sausages inedible and had a thick coating of grease which I discovered after taking one bite and can now taste the grease three hours later. It tasted as though it had cooked in oil which was well overdue for a change

I took our food back and asked for a refund. The gentleman behind the counter was adamant he did not have other complaints but based on other reviews I find it hard to believe. Another lady was complaining at the same time her fish was still part frozen in the middle. I question the level of hygiene in this establishment

Needless to say we will never go back. Terrible overpriced food with questionable cleanliness

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Tulips
Review:
A little disappointed, maybe my expectations were too high. I though it would see swathes of tulips, but not so. However, the gardens were beautiful and so neatly kept. The weather helped too, gorgeous spring sunshine. Enjoyed our couple of hours round the gardens.
Read less

Name: Charcoal Grill Meze
Title: Our new favourite place!
Review:
Having tried other Turkish restaurants locally we couldn’t wait to try this new restaurant to see how it compares.
Not in the best part of town (if there is one) but walk through the door into a wonderful welcome, great decor and the enticing aroma of exotics spices!
Neil and Hakan made us feel very welcome and were attentive and informative.
Gorgeous warm Turkish bread, olives and garlic and chilli dips arrived while we were choosing our starters.
We are not big eaters so starters usually mean we don’t finish dinner so they helpfully let us combine our favourites into a shared dish : lovely soft halloumi and sucky!
I had my favourite chicken shish with yoghurt- lovely! OH had the lamb chops which he declared to be the best he’d had!
Baklava to finish and reasonably priced wine.
In conclusion, a brilliant new addition to Bognor’s culinary options!
I expect to see them climbing up the TA ranks and will be a future regular customer!
Thanks Neil and Hakan for making us feel so at home and thanks Chef for a great taste experience!

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Good eats
Review: Sharon at the bar was very helpful on choice of food and drink.next time I will have normal fries.Pleasant surroundings to eat .Best Sam Miguel for a long time,wife enjoyed Asian beef salad and I had a chicken burger quite moist but wasn’t taken with tikka batter but east was good.SHaron the server is very polite.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Rude
Review: Called in the beefeater crossbush arundel on way home. Service was awful. Rude man with a vile attitude.

Name: KFC Bognor
Title: disgusting, food hygiene should intervene
Review:
disgusting food ever had, they couldnt even do chips, potato with skin and black bit uncut, chicken not fresh, need to change oil. as soon as i had, a bit i am bloated , me hard earned £20.00 went straight down the bin.
i will make sure i report this to relevant places.
KFC should not be neglected, this place certainly damages its brand image.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Amazing Sunday roasts. Came
Review: Amazing Sunday roasts. Came for a carvery , choice of meat and veg. Very tasty indeed and great service from the crew with a free pudding

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: What an absolute shambles!!!
Review: Had a lovely day out with the grandkids on the hottest day of the year and decided to pop into Harvester for a quick bite to eat before heading home. There were no tables available inside but we were told there were plenty of tables outside, which was fine. There were several tables available but, OMG, every single one of them was strewn with dirty plates, cutlery, glasses, dirty tables so really there was nowhere for us lot to sit. I did mention to the nice young lady on the outside bar that it might be an idea if someone could clear the tables (?) This didn't happen - so we cleared one of the booths ourselves and put it all on an other adjacent table. Still no one came to clear/clean the tables. We ordered some tapas style food for all of us to share but it took an age to arrive and they also brought out the wrong items. Also, there were no plastic wine glasses at the outside bar so I had to drink my lovely Sauvignon Blanc from a plastic beer cup, awful, and no Fruit Shoots for the kids - come on guys, it was the hottest day of the year, loads of familes around, sort it out. After an hour, one young lad made a half-hearted attempt to clear some tables but he must have got fed up with it cos we never saw him again. Really was a bad show, need more staff. Next time we'll give this place a miss and stop off on the way home for food. Very disappointed.

Name: Butlins
Title: DISGRACEFUL Cutbacks on Evening Entertainment,to pay for new PADDLING/FUN POOL
Review:
My wife and i have stayed at bognor the same week for the past two years,it wont happen again.and here is the reason why.In 2018 the evening entertainment for the week consisted of 10 different acts 6 of which were live professional groups and a late night venue in bar rosso or hotshots.every night.

2019 6 acts at the weekend all repeated mon-thursday so we had nothing new to watch ,no professional bands whatsoever and only 2 late nights.I complained to the entertainments manager who said in so many words he was ashamed of bourne leisures head office for what they had done to the evening entertainment,Reds was not even open due to low numbers,and virtually every show was the in-house dancers,which if i want funstars I"ii go to haven ,my wife and i left 3 days early never to return which after 58 years of going to butlins,most of which were thankfully before this shower got hold of it is not a decision i take lightly
Read less

Name: Harbour Park
Title: Crying guy
Review:
I decided to bring my kids down to harbour park as I live in London and wanted to treat them, however when I took them on the waltzer a blonde guy was crying and my children didn’t want to go on it.
Read less

Name: Flying Fortress
Title: Not very clean.
Review:
My friend & i visited the Flying Fortress with our two children for the first time today. ( 4 month old & 1 year old) As much as we couldn’t fault the price. The cleanliness specifically in the baby area 0-2 years allowed only. Which in my opinion should be the area that is kept the cleanest for obvious reasons. Was filthy & none of the toys provided for younger children actually worked! Absolutely no staff supervision. And food very over priced. Overall not very impressed!
Read less

Name: Selwood Hotel
Title: Shower didn’t work, do NOT stay here!
Review:
Proprietor nice enough however shower either boiling hot, ie kettle hot or icy cold
Proprietor unable to fix hence no shower in the morning, bad bad start to our day!
Bed seen better days
£85 for the night
Way too expensive for this b&b

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: New Years eve
Review:
Short staffed long wait for food and reception main door to accommodation not secure breakfast cooked to order no breakfast the same undercooked or overlooked unfortunately lack of staff due to sickness but disappointed
Read less

Name: Rowan Park
Title: Noisy site
Review: Stayed here for a week and it was like sitting in the middle of the M1. Had to stay because visiting family and friends in the area. To be honest, by the end of the week got used to shouting over the noise of the traffic! Not pleasant sitting outside so stayed away from the site as much as possible

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: DISGUSTING ALL ROUND.
Review:
Dirty cutlery and menus, vinegar bottles filthy. Toilets really rotten, no seat on loo, no lights at all, no hand drier. The food was very meagre and used old fish that was rubbery. Expensive for a small cod supposed to be large, and when husband complained got a stinking attitude from the owner. (THIS PLACE SHOULD BE CLOSED DOWN ).
( ENVIRONMENTAL HAZZARD )

Name: Inglenook
Title: Lovely!
Review:
We were staying nearby and decided to try the Inglenook for dinner and we weren’t disappointed! We spoke to the lovely Di, and she brought us the menus, giving us the option to mix & match from the Bar menu or the Restaurant menu. I had the chilli and my husband had fish pie, both of which were excellent. The service was great and everyone we spoke to was so friendly.
We loved it so much we went back the following evening, this time having chicken katsu curry and fish & chips. Again the meals were excellent and Scott, who served us was extremely helpful.
We’ll be recommending the Inglenook to anyone who comes to the area. Would also recommend just for a drink as the bar is lovely and cosy and the garden is nbeautiful

Name: Butlers
Title: Good food, excellent service.
Review: Went here with friends, had a lovely evening, good food, good service and not expensive. Very relaxed atmosphere.

Name: Magna Tandoori
Title: Takeaway
Review: Absolutely abysmal service twice ordered in December 24th and 31st. One delivery one collection both over two hours late. Don’t take orders you can’t deliver on, if your busy and can’t get orders out stop taking them. Just greedy and no care for customer service. Will definitely not use again awful service

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: sunday carvery lunch
Review: good atmosphere good food good service ( especially the wenches ) value for money definitely worth a repeat visit

Name: Boat House In the Marina
Title: Utterly unimpressed
Review:
I attended a birthday party here and it is a shame to say that such a lovely venue has been let down so heavily by the management.

The owner was not welcoming in the slightest and honestly made myself (and numerous others) feel very uncomfortable. She even went to the extent of putting a negative Facebook post up DURING the party. This is a highly unprofessional way to conduct business, and this has only been reinforced by this page in which you can see the owner ARGUING with customers who have dared to leave negative feedback, instead of reaching out to find ways in which the establishment may improve.

Not to stereotype, but generally it is not in your typical Brit's nature to go to the extent of giving negative feedback (we will normally just put up and leave, never to return), and the fact that there are multiple comments discussing the rudeness of the staff on this page says enough.

I must repeat, the venue itself was lovely, and I personally did not find the other members of staff unpleasant in the slightest, however the management has massively lowered my opinion of the establishment and I am sad to say that my experience here has been my first and will most certainly be my last.

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Dissspointed
Review: We went here on the last night of a girls weekend Feb 10. About 10 of us went here. We were there sitting down before 8pm. Overall the food was poor. It was lukewarm. And I had the duck salad starter which didn't taste great. As a group we were dissspointed. Staff are nice though

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: First Class!
Review: What an absolute pleasure to eat at this restaurant. My wife and I along with my sister and her husband celebrated my sisters birthday here and the cuisine and service is exemplary! We were fortunate to book the window table which offers great views over the river. Highly recommended and of course, we are looking forward to a return visit in the future.

Name: Victoria Fish & Chips
Title: Nice food but rude and aggressive staff are a cause for concern
Review:
The food was as expected but the gentleman serving me was extremely rude, hostile and abrasive. I've eaten here several times but after said incident, my family and I will never return.

I ordered fish and chips and was given a receipt to which I placed in my pocket. The gentleman in question later shouted out ''pie, burger and chips'' directed at me, to which I stated was not my order. he then shouted ''what number'' and I said that I didn't understand.

Now, I've eaten there several times and have never been asked for a number. After a little while, I noticed that my receipt actually had a number on it, so I then presented this to him. The said gentlemen made some very sarcastic and rude comments saying ''this is why we give number to ticket, I say number you no stand there, you tell me number yes''. he continued to yell at me and I couldn't actually speak over the volume of his aggressive tone.

I requested that he is not rude to me and that it's wrong to belittle a customer and speak with sarcasm. I also stated that his tone was unprofessional and that he wasn't clear originally, which caused the confusion. Bizarrely, the gentleman started shouting at me regarding his disabled eye and I have no idea why or what he was trying to say.

I have never before been shouted at by a member of staff as a customer, nor spoken to with such rudeness. It's especially unreasonable because I never spoke out of turn or even raised my voice. I would say that a staff member with such aggression isn't appropriate to employ in a family restaurant.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Terrible experience in restaurant
Review: Inedible food. Both meals returned. Offered a complimentary dessert but declined. Manager didn't even come over and apologise.

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: Lovely place, but...
Review: Stayed twice for Goodwood Revival weekend (2018 and 2019), all great, it's a lovely place. Sadly though they don't care for repeat business. I booked a room for Revival weekend 2020 but afterwards they gave the room to a booking agent instead, despite guaranteeing me a room on email. Then wasted two months of our time trying to confirm the room and now they just ignore all emails and requests for confirmation. No room, no apology, no care, no respect, not even the honesty to contact me about it. Pretty disgraceful.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Amazing food!
Review:
Ordered the halloumi and lamb ribs and everything was to die for!!! Their complimentary bread was beautiful and the service was really good they make you feel at ease and special.

Definitely coming again!!

Name: Penang Village
Title: Great Food
Review: The food was genuine and I really felt like i was in China! The service was exceptional and the decorative inside was fascinating!

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: The fish factory littlehampton
Review:
My wife and I eat at the fish factory every week and have done so for some years.
We do so because we find the staff attentive, polite and very helpful. The menu offers
a wide selection of fish dishes as well as more traditional fare. Gluten free and vegetarian options are readily available. The decor tables and seating are very pleasingly plain. We have no hesitation in highly recommending this restaurant.

Name: Swanbourne Lake
Title: Peaceful place for walk.
Review:
Went early in morning very peaceful place for a walk, only disappointment was dog poo bags left laying around will never understand why some dog owners go to the trouble of picking it up but think its then ok to just leave it instead of putting it in the bin, as bad as the ones to dont pick up and do an injustice to responsible dogs owners, myself being one of them.
As we were early Tea Rooms were not yet open but looked a very nice place, will be going back to sample.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Mrs Young
Review: Food was great. We went out for a family meal and our waitress Shannon was great very professional and efficient. Would deffo recommend.

Name: Carlton Hotel
Title: Tea (almost) on the beach
Review: Lovely pot of tea, very reasonable at £1.50 for the pot. Sitting outside on the terrace was sunny. You can easily see the sea and beach. Friendly service. Nothing not to like. Just try it - sure you won't be disappointed.

Name: Eagle Inn
Title: Could be nice here
Review:
Nice pint of beer, but this place could do so much more.
TV blaring, some kind of fishing programme....who wants that in a pub, Barmaid very loud, chatting about her road rage issues with a couple of locals who were lapping it up....not everyone wants to know about that... one end of the pub seems to be very neglected. A great big black plastic parcel just left leaning on the wall, shame really!

Name: Rustington Manor
Title: Been here many Times But Never Again !
Review:
Christmas 2018 was a disaster .Untrained Agency staff . Meal cheap . IE Sprouts cooked since last Christmas by a chef in Jeans.Menu an A$ sheet of paper no Christmas serviette just a yellow stuck in a glass . Some of the menu left off altogether.We we stuck out in the conservatory all very dismal we were forgotten , we had to ask for most of our dishes.Very expensive for a very disappointing meal which took from 12-30pm till 4pm.
NEVER AGAIN

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Dinner
Review: Nice outside area you can watch the world go by whilst sipping a nice drink an reasonable range of food a bit noisy inside.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Fantastic service
Review: I visited this restaurant and found it fantastic my server Kim was very good she offered us the set menu to save us money she interacted with my children I would definitely recommend this restaurant the food was tasty and presented well

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: No breakfast bowls on Sundays!!
Review: We stay at the Premier Inn, Arundel, regularly for a 3 night stay when visiting family. We always purchase the breakfast at the Beefeater next door, it’s convenient and usually ok. On this visit however, we encountered a problem on the Sunday morning. The normal cereal bowls had been replaced with smaller glass dishes in a V shape. My partner was unable to fit his weetabix and muesli into the dish as it was not deep or wide enough so he asked for a usual bowl. His request was flatly refused by the waiter, who seemed totally disinterested. He was told the bowls were not available as they were earmarked for the Sunday lunch service. It was 9am!! Beefeater, I can’t believe you couldn’t have found one and washed it before lunch if you are that short of proper breakfast bowls!! Customer care needs a review. PS The cereal bowls were back on Monday!!!

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: Not great
Review:
Room had an awful smell coming from the shower drain, the bed was to low considering it was an accessible room i had lots of trouble trying to get out of the bed had i of been wheelchair bound i would not ever be able to get in and out of the bad and there was a stained pillowcase
Read less

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Nature in her beauty!
Review:
Nice wet surronding dedicated to bird life.
Rather limited in range but terribly interesting.
Hopefullythere are many things to do in the neighbourhood which justifies to spend time to get around.
Read less

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Great out door eating by the river
Review: Slightly out of Arundel the Black Rabbit is a great find. Lots of out door eating next to the river with the castle in the foreground. Good family friendly pub, plenty of parking.

Name: Butlins
Title: Wouldn't go back in a hurry
Review:
Just got back from here, Monday- Friday, 2 adults & 2 toddlers (twin girls 2 1/2 years old) We booked a "Gold" apartment.... nothing "gold" about it... firstly when we got up to the apartment the front door was open.. walked in it smelt damp and stunk of weed so we walked straight back out down to reception to complain... they were nice enough about it but the excuse was they'd just had an adults only weekend. Anyway they "upgraded" us to the Wave Hotel.
The hotel was surprisingly quite nice, friendly staff, we were on the 4th floor with a balcony, we had to bring the chairs in off the balcony because of the kids. mini fridge didn't work so we complained and they replaced it the next day.
They activities for toddlers are a bit limited, firstly the large soft play thing in the main tent kids have to be 0.9m they've section off part of it for toddlers but its really crap its just 3 floors to climb up and 1 slide to get down from the middle to ground floor that's it.. no ball pit nothing.
The fair ground rides they have be 0.9m or 1m even with a parent and the toddler fairground inside the tent was only a couple of rides which our girls didn't want to go on without us which we couldn't go on. we ended up spending a fortune on the little arcade rides £1 a go. The kids loved the arcade putting 2p's in the penny pusher machines.
Read less

Name: Snooty Fox Bar
Title: Easter Day dinner
Review: We just turned up early evening without booking - Paul showed us in and took our orders - he was extremely pleasant and polite - he informed us that we were early so there may be a little wait - actually the service was quick and attentive - the food was delicious- we had the Sunday roasts - cooked to perfection!! Reasonably priced - relaxed atmosphere- a very enjoyable evening. Paul appeared to take pride in his work and went out of his way to make our dining experience enjoyable- thank you Paul!!!

Name: Royal Norfolk
Title: Seen Better Days
Review: We stayed here for two nights, the double room was extremely small, with a small shower room. Although clean, it was very expensive at £114/night for B&B. The breakfast was dismal, very poorly cooked, especially the scrambled egg, the like of which I have never seen before - looked more like a very bland egg custard! The staff were friendly and very busy - rushed off their feet.

Name: Avisford
Title: Tip for the disgruntled
Review:
My husband and I and 2 other couples stayed here some months ago and it was vile, filthy rooms, noisy, and unhelpful staff. I read with some amusement the comments by management haven’t changed for years; the soft refurbishment indeed has been mentioned so many times, how many rooms do they actually have; longest refurbishment in history. Anyway I contacted the head office and after some wrangling we all got all of our money back. I would advise anyone who is dissatisfied to not give up and insist on better compensation. Good luck
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Hoped for three night stay
Review:
Booked this hotel for a quiet three day break, did not stay.

For a start if you look at the photographs of the double rooms you will see that the same photograph is used for different types of double rooms but the daily price is different. We could find nowhere on the site that informed guests that there was no lift. When we booked in we asked for a room with a stand in shower (we should have asked for a walking one) as my partner has arthritis and has difficulty in bending we were shown a room on the fourth floor, up four flights of stairs. The room had a shower over the bath which was unsuitable for us. We asked for a room on a lower floor with a walking shower but all showers are over the bath. The rooms are rather dated and not suitable at all for people with any form of disability. We decided not to stay, which was a pity, the Hotel should make very clear that there is no lift and are not really suited to people who are even slightly disabled.
Read less

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Bleak and very expensive but poorly prepared food.
Review: We'd heard of the Cafe and wanted to see the unusual architecture. Admittedly it was a raint August so it wasn't showcased at it's best but the building is cold and unwelcoming. The young server tried hard but the food was terrible. My guest had the fish and chips which looked fine but he later mentioned he'd struggled to eat it. I had the burger which was an abomination. The addition of both puled and spicy pork with cheese on top did little to disguise the taste of meat past it's best. I mentioned this and was treated to a list of why it was fine. Well it wasn't, we won't be back. It was expensive and unpleasant.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Long wait. Bad service
Review: Went with my family and was very disappointed with the service. Waited 40mins to get served. Food overpriced and poor quality. There was a lot of dirty tables which were slow to be cleared. Would not return to this restaurant every again

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Would recommend
Review:
All staff pleasant and helpful. Room was spacious and clean. Beds were extremely comfortable. Excellent location for access to Chichester, the coast and surrounding area. No road noise even from being located on a busy road.
Read less

Name: Black Horse
Title: Amazing food and ambiance
Review:
One word WOW!!
We heard the Black Horse was under new ownership so we thought we’d give it a go. Firstly We were greeted by such friendly staff. Nothing was too much trouble! It had such a friendly atmosphere and the decor is just beautiful. We had a delicious meal. The steak was cooked to perfection and the Thai fish cakes on the specials board were the best I’ve ever had! Just delicious. Thank you Black Horse for a lovely evening we will be back!

Name: Butlins
Title: Discriminating behaviour towards my little girl by a lady staff member named HAYLEIGH at Butlins Bognor Regis Resort
Review:
On our 2nd night at the resort, we attended a family event at the Reds venue where we had a very nasty experience with a red coat staff member named HAYLEIGH. She singled out my 5 yr old girl and stopped ONLY her from taking a picture with the Mr. Potato head character.
When I saw my little girl close to tears I approached HAYLEIGH and requested politely to grant her just one picture as she was the last child in line. I would have understand if there were more children behind her and all asked to leave but to ask just the last child out??? I was told rudely by her that they had already done the countdown to end the photo shoot and that ‘ I should have used my ears to listen better’ !!!! She also said that instead of dancing with my little son on the dance floor,I should have ‘paid more attention to the queue’.
I was extremely shocked at her condemning manner and reminded her that after the countdown five other white families had stood in the queue in front of my girl and had been granted a picture and why was she, the only one to be left out? Also, what does me dancing with my son have anything to do with my daughter who was waiting her turn patiently in the queue????
What is worse is that my daughter had only joined the queue (after the countdown) once I checked with the male photographer there. He later denied any responsibility saying that he was just there to take pictures! When I reminded HAYLEIGH that such an attitude towards a guest and a child was not acceptable, she very arrogantly pointed to her name tag and asked me to report to whoever I liked, it made no difference to her! She spent about 2-3 mins arguing with me and the Mr Potato head character remained in the background but she couldn’t use a minute of that time to make a little girl happy????

We have been to many other family resorts and have never experienced anything like this. In fact, most other places go out of their way to make the little ones feel special. We were initially very impressed by the Butlins resort, the ocean hotel room, the pool zone and entertainment shows where we did see friendly and attentive staff like the hotel receptionist Kirstie and most staff at the pavilion arcade. I am surprised that someone like this lady Hayleigh works in a resort of this stature as she definitely has a problem with brown/dark skin and clearly does not know how to communicate with guests.
I strongly condemn such obnoxious and discriminating behaviour in a place that claims to be dedicated to families and fun. As parents we did not spend our hard earned money, for our daughter to feel inadequate and reduced to tears just before her birthday! (she didn’t want to attend most character events at the resort after that). We checked out of the resort a day earlier than needed and must say that we have been extremely disappointed by Butlins on this occasion.
Read less

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Unfortunately, not a ‘LUXURY’ Stay!!!
Review:
We stayed here on Halloween as it was our 1 year Wedding Anniversary. I had requested through booking.com for the hotel to do ‘anything they could to make our stay extra special’ with it being our anniversary. This was confirmed back that the hotel would do this. I had no idea or thought as to what that would actually be, but anything to add a special touch would have been lovely. This did not happen which was really disappointing as it was confirmed they would do something. We Got into our room and I have to say, for £124 and the ‘LUXURY’ room, I was very underwhelmed! We needed an iron so rang down for one, the lad said he’d be straight up. Approx an hour later, I rang again and he’d forgotten as it was very busy at the bar and he was on his own. 5 minutes later, he brought the iron. Whilst waiting for the iron, I had a shower in what should have been a flawless bathroom but there was mould around door edges, the shower and the middle of the ceiling. Again, not what you’d expect for a ‘luxury’ room. We went out for tea through the night exit / entrance and found it left on the latch which is a security concern, I took it off to make sure it was closed properly. Got back to the room and I tried to watch the Telly but it was wonky, I tried to straighten it but realised the bracket itself was wonky so I left it!! The lighting in the room at night is quite dark and my wife found it very hard to do her makeup, resorting to using her phone torch!!
The next morning I put the cases on the car and again, the night entrance was on the latch so anyone could walk in off the street! I went to breakfast and picked up my side plate to get a croissant, I thought the plate was stained as I could see a yellow tint on it and then realised it was actually a Dirty plate!!!!! The breakfast was very good and they catered for my specific requests, it was just very disappointing that we kept finding issues. I wanted to make sure I told the hotel about our experience and did at the bar. The person I spoke to did not fill me the confidence that she would pass on my concerns so I emailed the Hotel. I have accepted a refund for my stay, which is fine......I just wish they’d got it right on the night though!!! I have given the hotel a 2 star as we did not experience ‘LUXURY’ and I was told I would be contacted Monday morning for the refund and I actually had to ring up around 6pm to sort it!!!
If in Arundel again, I’ll try somewhere else instead.
Read less

Name: Ford Market
Title: Visited as a regular. The male on the gate is consistently rude. Despite being polite at all times to him I always get sarcasm and snide comments in return for no reason. The female is no better, usually cold and unfriendly. Presumably these are council employees, a shockingly bad image for a profesionall organisation. Both need customer care courses as a minimum. The young lads I must say who who show vehicles in are always polite and cheerful.
Review: Most rude staff I have ever met, don’t visit unless you like being verbally abused

Name: The Thatched House
Title: Good food and lovely staff.
Review:
We were a large party of 11. We had a nice spacious table. The menu was good, with lovely specials, including crab and lobster!
The staff were lovely, friendly and efficient. The food was good. The Sunday roasts were large. Vegetables not overdone.
We enjoyed the pecan pie especially!

Name: Dee Dee's
Title: Wonderful place
Review: We were looking for a cup of coffee before attending a funeral just up the road at Worthing Cemetery and just stumbled upon Dee Dee's. And what a find. They offer a wonderful selection of cakes and the most delicious coffee, a very reasonably priced - and Elvis posters and discs on the wall. As soon as you walk in you see what a gem it is, clean, with comfy seating and the friendliest of staff - highly recommended.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Worst fish and chips and total rip off very poor.
Review:
Was unfortnate to pick this place today while walking on seafront .
The medium cod and chips are total rip off at £8.50 medium fish is very small. and mug of tea at £2.30. Was not a very clean place to eat in.
Most people i guess that are day trippers
That will go in there to eat. Be once only
For many as is so bad , and i expect that view of most people never again.

Name: Ristorante Al Mare
Title: Issues
Review:
Visited this venue for the first time with a few friends.
The service was not good as the food came out at random intervals meaning we were all playing catch up as to when we felt comfortable to commence each course.
Orders for drinks were forgotten without a reminder. And value for money was very poor.
Wouldn't recommend or visit again

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: lovely looking, shame about the food and service
Review: From the outside this place looks so inviting- lovely garden with tables outside, big country style pub. However, the staff are rude, unhelpful, and slow. The portion sizes are very small and not good value for money at all. There are very few vegetarian and vegan options on the menu and the ones they have are very unappealing. I would not bother eating here if you are considering it, despite the appearance.

Name: Galley Restaurant and Tea Rooms
Title: Really good baguette and service
Review: We popped in on a hot, sunny bank holiday Monday for a sandwich. I was really impressed. The service was impeccable. We found a table outside in the shade. The baguette was very fresh and the egg mayonnaise was lovely and homemade. Even the cups of tap water were nice and cold and I was offered ice. We had a very simple light lunch but The Galley still managed to excel in every aspect.

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Lunch
Review: Went to lunch with friends the pub was really comfortable with an open fire which was lovely. Food was very good and reasonably priced that’s why it’s always busy and booking is preferable because of that.

Name: Linden Fisheries
Title: Linden fisheries
Review: See the rude and arrogant man in linden fisheries has gone. Hope it will be better there now. Would not use it before

Name: Butlins
Title: 80s weekender
Review:
Just stayed on a three night break in the ocean hotel and overall enjoyed the weekend. Room great spacious and clean, food better than last year with loads of choice and good value if you take the half board package. The acts I have to say were a little disappointing, the best part was the comedian Karen bailey, shewas hilarious.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Very impressed
Review:
We have had a fantastic week at butlins, we have avoided butlins resorts since visiting skegness a few years back and not enjoying it at all but bognor regis butlins has renewed my faith in this company.

The shoreline hotel went above and beyond with cute little displays as seen below when we came back to our room, all clean and fresh when we arrived and rooms very well equipped with an empty fridge and helpful shelves and clothes rack, just very well designed rooms with a little play area. High powered shower which was very enjoyable. Beds were definitely comfier than the self catering we have experienced with springs before and most people were considerate with the noise they made after a certain time in the evening. We did actually get some sleep, unusual for a hotel on a resort.

We had two accidents whilst we were here and the staff were 100% supportive and caring especially the first aiders who attended my daughter. Very helpful suggestions and recommending further help from other sources if needed. They even dropped by our room on the day after to check on my daughter and follow up.

So many staff to thank for making our stay excellent. Nothing was too much and all smiling and kind to children, they all seemed to enjoy their jobs which is nice to see good morale.

The pub and kitchen is by far the best restaurant in the place with fresh home cooked food, hot and delivered in a good time on the 2 occasions we visited. Being served by Tony who went above and beyond, the service was second to none. We tried The Diner, which took ages to get food and it wasnt anything special, although the staff were lovely. We tried papa John's for free delivery to our room, which was prompt but the food went in the bin as pizza was swimming in grease and soggie and undercooked in the middle. The fish and chip shop had lovely staff and service was excellent but the chips looked reheated and odd colour, my daughters chicken nuggets were dry and chewy and my pie was dry and over cooked and food was slow to be received too. I wouldnt revisit any of the food venues apart from the pub and kitchen. The crepe stand was very tasty too and reasonably priced.
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Breakfast
Review:
After visiting here on Saturday 9th August. We go regularly for breakfast at this premises, but in the last few months it has gone downhill drastically.
No plates for toast, no preserves, no muffins, crumpets and just the crusts
After asking a lovely but rushed of her feet waitress went and looked and came out with a handful of muffins apologising that she could only find these. Coffee was lukewarm.
Long wait for cooked breakfast, fried eggs were congealed where they were left on hot plate. Sausages were so burnt they looked like they were charcoal. If you want a decent cooked breakfast and good value for money may I suggest Morrisons Littlehampton or Mac Donald's.

Name: Inglenook
Title: Fabulous lunch
