Thought we would try the rapids. After queuing freezing cold in front of the open doorway, I was having to push myself all the way around the rapids and half drag my children with me. Leaving the pool it was freezing to be faced with more filthy changing rooms and showers. People need to put dirty nappies in the bins provided!
To compare this to Alton towers splash landings from a few weeks ago this was a total and utter waste of time. How can it already be this dirty.

Name: Mustards
Title: New Year Visit
Review: My husband, daughter and I visited this restaurant in the early evening at the beginning of January. When we arrived the restaurant was fairly empty and we were seated at a small table. The staff were extremely friendly and the service was excellent. We choose meals from the set menu and the food was delicious. However as time progressed the restaurant filled up and it was very noisy. At a large table near the window there were a particularly raucous group of people who were very annoying.So we decided to leave as soon as we had finished eating.

Name: Lamb Angmering
Title: Fantastic
Review:
We stayed just for one night in the Charles Newman bedroom. The bedroom was spacious with a separate dressing room and large bathroom and was tastefully decorated and furnished.
We dined in the restaurant, there was a good selection of dishes and the food was delicious and sensibly priced.
The staff were friendly and helpful.
Wee would certainly visit again and hopefully for more than one night.

Name: Sea View Hotel
Title: Don’t Bother !!!
Review:
I stayed in what is a very nice area with the hotel being in a great location. This is really the only plus point, apart from a friendly helpful barman, who was helpful regarding local restaurants as theirs was closed.
The rooms, or certainly my one, are very dated , shabby and with creaking floors and landing, hence a poor nights sleep. To finish it off, a trickle of hot water resulting in a cold shower before I left. An update all round is required and I certainly won’t be returning.

Name: Butlins
Title: It’s not the same as it was. It’s changed and not for the better.
Review:
Hi we are currently stopping at Butlins Bognor Regis (July 2019) in the gold apartments. This has totally changed since we last stopped in 2014. The entertainment is very limited. Reds and Jaks both closed. This cost me £700 for 5 days. Well 4 nights. Accommodation is alright. Wasn’t very clean. Cupboard to boiler is broken can see the broken walls and cobwebs etc in the cupboard. Asked for some pillows for the beds as I have a disability two days ago still no extra pillows. It looks like butlins but there is something missing from what it used to have. There is something not the same and it’s not the same cleanliness and entertainment there used to be. It’s mine and my kids first holiday since 2014 and we have already changed our train tickets so we can go home on the Thursday evening. :(. Sorry butlins I had been looking forward to this for months.
Read less

Name: Ye Olde Fish and Chippe Shoppe
Title: Good value and quality
Review: We were visiting Bognor Regis for the weekend and found Ye Olde Fish & Chippe Shoppe on Trip Advisor. It lived up to it's great ratings and would highly recommendit for top quality and great value for money.

Name: Toast
Title: Home Delivery - Extremely Disappointing !
Review:
Since first going to Toast some 5 years ago, I have returned many, many times. I have also recommended to friends and family. This cafe always represented excellent value for money, great service and a warm welcome from staff. In fact I’ve written positive reviews in the past about this establishment, so today’s poor review is out of character for me, but justified.

At 11:37 this morning I placed a telephone order for Steak & Kidney Pudding, peas, mash and gravy. I have never ordered a home delivery before, but as I’m confined to home following major surgery this seemed a good idea. I was told the waiting time would be 45mins. After an hour had passed I called to find out where the order was. The woman said it had literally just left. Well it took the guy over 10 mins to deliver and I live literally one road away. Despite the fact the meal was 25 mins late there was no apology whatsoever.

Upon opening the container the first thing I noticed was a piece of white plastic - which looks like it came from one of those disposable knives. The meal was luke warm and pudding dried out like it had been cooked a while before and then left. It certainly wasn’t fresh or enjoyable.

So in summary, I wouldn’t recommend the delivery service. They simply can’t provide quality in a timely fashion. They’re late and sub-standard. Really a complete waste of money.

I think having read other reviews Toast is a victim of its own success. It was once very good indeed, but clearly standards have dropped and with so much competition around I would suggest they need to get back to where they were or loyal customers like myself will turn their back on Toast!

Name: The Waverley
Title: Excellent
Review: Staff were extremely polite and welcoming, the food was lovely. Would definitely return if in the area again.

Name: Premier Inn Arundel
Title: Great Value
Review:
Stayed recently and was very pleased with the friendliness of the staff who were most helpful even to the extent of helping set my new mobile phone so it would act as my alarm. Next door to the Beefeater where you have excellent choice of food at very good prices. The breakfast offered extensive range of continental and cooked English breakfasts. The hotel room offered comfortable bed with tea / coffee making facilities. The cost which is per room is competitive even if you are staying as a single visitor. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.
Read less

Name: Clockhouse Bar
Title: End up here far too often
Review: Very friendly local wine bar that is very dog friendly. As a lone female very happy to pop in for a drink on my own with the hound.

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Great fish and chips and lovely puds
Review:
It's been a few years since we visited. Large pay and display car park outside. Interesting architecture - the bright steel has now gone a rusty colour, good sea view, although it was very wet so didn't see the landscape at its best.. Both ordered fish and chips - service was fast and friendly. Lovely light crisp beer batter with a large piece of white fish, chips good too, came in a tub and with mushy peas and tartare sauce. Highly recommended. My husband had the lemon tart and I had chocolate brownies with choc sauce and ice cream - very indulgent and very very yummy. He washed it down with a pint of Sussex IPA.
We were pleased that we arrived at 12.45 before there was an influx of families. Like a lot of these places with hard surfaces it is very noisy, particularly with children crying etc. Of course it is a cafe/restaurant designed for families but we oldies decided not to hang around for coffee when it was difficult to hear each other. Will definitely go again but possibly at midday when it may be quieter. Suggest you book

Name: Windmill Theatre
Title: Ticks all the boxes
Review: A local cinema and theatre. Easy to park. Good seats. Thursday morning films with coffee and biscuits. Warm and clean.

Name: Hawking About
Title: A WALK WITH STORM
Review:
A wonderful gift from my wife and a fantastic experience to get up close and personal with Storm the Harris Hawk. Kevin is passionate about his birds and his knowledge and guidance were superb. Both I and my wife were thrilled with the whole experience - thanks again Kevin just home my photos do it justice.
Read less

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: A lovely visit
Review:
Arrived late but a very warm welcome from the night porter - he well deserved his employee of the month .......... Rooms quaint, warm and comfortable - us tall guys may well hit our heads on the low ceilings but in fairness well warned.......... Breakfast very tasty and freshly cooked ........ Our three nights here flew and would and will certainly go back .............
Read less

Name: The Beresford
Title: Head of House
Review: Very rude head of house so decided not to eat . Suggest customer ralationship training needed. Need 100 characters to write review

Name: Motte & Bailey
Title: Yummy breakfast
Review: I only bother to write reviews when a place is impressive or terrible. This place was great. I spotted it from the window of my hotel opposite the evening before. Breakfast was scrambled egg on toast with de-caf tea. Perfect. Service very good. Friendly staff. Reasonable prices. Will definitively come again.

Name: Bognor Museum
Title: Brilliant.
Review:
Very well set out, the displays are fantastic showing how Bognor Regis looked in the past. Very interesting and informative.
Read less

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Still have upset tummy
Review: I’m not sure if this cafe has changed hands but if it hasn’t the standard has dropped. A lot of very noisy staff and the premises looking very tatty. I had a prawn sandwich and have suffered with an upset tummy since!

Name: Pagham Beach
Title: beach visit, never got to see it re parking issue, not welcomed
Review: we read the good reviews and thought great, staying in caravan site near by, so off we drive and we thought we must have missed somewhere to park, went along a very bone shaking dirt track that finally came to an end and lots of signs saying no parking,, I do not walk too far so need to park near to places I want to visit. THEY REALLY MUST HATE VISITORS THERE. Other areas we found lots of yellow lines.. So in the end we gave up and drove out of it, after all you either want the custom or you don't and with a huge potential of caravan visitor income they have turned their noses up. We were 2 older people not some sort of riff raff and from what we experience Haven site is alot better than another well known firm who can have lots of nasty finds. Often we are seeing that where there is a caravan site for holidays the areas seem to be run down, question which came first. It is odd that when we came this way before we went west of Pagham for days out and they did not want us in those places either. one place it wanted £10 to park it began with W. so we turned the car around and got out fast. That was quite posh, so again it is not on my door step thank you. We come from the Ashdown forest area re Winnie the pooh visitors and near by spa town too and i have not seen this sort of anti social attitude.

Name: Haskins Garden Centre
Title: Salad bar
Review: Lovely fresh help yourself salad bar. Only £6.95 including quiche. Very tasty. Gets busy but plenty of tables.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: A good lunch ruined by a miserable member of staff
Review: Visited the Knights table today with a Wowcher voucher. Unfortunately one of our party of 4 couldn’t make it but our server was excellent and allowed us to have their complimentary glass of wine and 2 of us to choose a sharing starter between us instead of 2 individuals as we weren’t having the 4th starter OR main. The food was delicious and plentiful and we were leaving vowing to come back again until a surly and miserable man at the till berated us for having the sharing board and said that on a technicality we should pay for it but he’d ‘let it go this time’. Bearing in mind the sharing board cost £12.50 and we could have chosen a starter each costing £6.95 plus a 3rd and a main for our missing person this was totally unnecessary and ruined our whole experience. Won’t be back again.

Name: Simla Tandoori
Title: Best Indian in town
Review: Amazing food as always and always greeted with a smile. Family run business and by far the best Indian restaurant in town.

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: ONE NIGHT ONLY
Review:
Excellent room size and terrific value for money. The cleanliness of the room was tip top and the extra wide bed was a joy to sleep in. Good meal in the restaurant on the evening of our stay. Only slight criticism was the buffet breakfast which was quite poorly presented and lacked the variety of foods we have had in other locations, despite the menu being the same. Some improvement needed here.
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Mr Osborne
Review: Hi come here today had a burger hungry bird the chips come out wrong and cold it was to be sweet potato the chips come out the fat chips my partner burger come out cold the same has mine was very cold to the staff said we come do nothing about it I am not very happy about it I asked for the manager and the same staff said he's cooking and he can't come out not very happy at all I just payed the bill and went not very happy what can you do for me to make it up my email address is tonyck1979@gmail.com

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Planned a visit based on incorrect website so went home hungry
Review: I had arranged to meet friend's visiting from the Netherlands here for dinner. Before making the arrangements I checked the Holly Tree website, which states restaurant is open 6-9 Mon-Fri. So after arriving just before 7pm on a Tuesday evening, and ordering in drinks, we asked for the menu. Being told that they don't do food on a Tuesday because its quiz night, that only people do the quiz have food , and even then offering us to do the quiz (that didn't even start until 8), I was pretty pissed off. My friends and I ended up finishing our drinks and going our separate ways, so what should have been a good evening was ruined by misinformation and damn poor service.

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Shame
Review:
Such a shame for a low rating having stayed at lots of Premier Inns with no problems. Beds are super comfy, staff of Premier Inn lovely and extremely helpful.
It’s a shame some noisy unruly guests ruined our last night and some rude staff at the adjoining pub/restaurant ruined our overall experience.
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Rogers
Review: Had a really lovely steak, cooked beautifully. Our server Marie was absolutely fantastic, told us about 50%off so saved us money. Haven't enjoyed a night out in ages, Marie had us in stitched so funny. All the staff very nice. Well worth a visit.

Name: Butlins
Title: Expensive and Tacky
Review:
Butlins charges a fortune but still you have to pay for loads of extras. The rides are free but lots of activities are extra. Add the cost of food, drinks and souvenirs and it makes for an expensive trip. Tacky teddy machines, overpriced icecream and queues everywhere you go. It's more like a horror day than a holiday. Save your money and take a picnic to the beach or park. You'll have more fun.
Read less

Name: Sen
Title: Lovely food
Review: Really lovely food ,and also really nice people ,definitely recommend the food and company ,very friendly

Name: Butlins
Title: You should go here
Review:
Staff is so friendly and all kinds of places to live and so many things to do. So many things to keep me busy so my mum can does what she likes the most. So can my dad which is resting because he is always busy
Read less

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: This place should be shut down
Review: Visited today for lunch and what a disappointment. Medium fish and chips was more like a small and the chips were just the hard bits at the end of a batch. No real chips in the serving i received. When sitting down waiting for your food you realise just how filthy the place is too. All staff except for the waitress was rude and dismissive. £28 for 2 medium fish and chips and 2 cokes. Definitely not worth the money. Will not return nor recommend.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Fantastic
Review:
Love coming here. Especially Monday or Tuesday when we know Callum will be working. Callum will make sure everything is perfect. We feel valued which is so great for such an informal restaurant

Sometimes we bump into him in Establo when he’s not working. AND guess what? He still looks after us

He is a great asset.

Loving the new vegan burger on the specials menu.

Keep the good work up.

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Good night's sleep @Arundel Fontwell
Review:
Good place. Helpful, polite, interested staff. Clean and comfortable at a very reasonable price. Seth took the time to advise me on the various eating options around about and Dulce was also very helpful at the checkout in the morning.
Read less

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Disappointed
Review:
Unfortunately it’s a lovely central hotel in the little town of Arundel that lacks finesse. The room was suitable for purpose in a back courtyard that was quite and unobtrusive. The most disappointing thing about our stay was the disgusting and virtually inedible breakfast. The cold buffet was mediocre (dried up cheese, ham with dried edges- looked a day old) in comparison to other hotels I’ve stayed in, I asked for a hot chocolate and was told no only tea or coffee, so asked for a flat white and was told no that wasn’t possible so decided on tea which was obviously what they wanted me to have! Anyway let me really tell you about the so say Norfolk Arms Full English breakfast. One shrivelled tomato that was so dried up it was like a rock, a hash brown so deep fried the grease was oozing out, a piece of bacon that was dried up and burnt, inedible scrambled egg that was more like dried shoe leather in a flat thin section, a cold piece of black pudding, cold beans and mushrooms that had the most dreadful flavour of as I’d imagine old socks.. the only good thing was the one tiny little sausage that was probably a local specialty.. I wish I’d just had sausages!! I can honestly say if this place had a decent chef you would not have to go elsewhere, but if you can avoid breakfast do as there are loads of other places in the town that you can eat at! Hotel staff were pleasant and polite.
Read less

Name: Heygates Bookshop
Title: What a great find!!
Review: Stumbled across this wonderful book shop on a weekend trip to Bognor. Such a welcoming place - super friendly and helpful. Excellent treasure trove of books, spent ages just browsing before we finally chose! Will definitely be back.

Name: Galley Restaurant and Tea Rooms
Title: All day breakfast, not
Review: The menu states all day breakfast served until MIDDAY. I asked for eggs on toast at 1pm but was told it was too late. They then offered me a toasted egg sandwich.

Name: Butlins
Title: Toddlers week - really quite brilliant
Review:
Arrival was smooth, drove straight up in the car at 1pm. No queue. We were shown where to park. In silver accommodation so made our way to their desk, told access to our rooms was 4pm, then given wrist bands and keys (the electronic card types) then were free to use the facilities: soft play/indoor/outdoor fairground. I went off to the big Tesco’s (7 mins drive away and they do click and collect!) to get our weekly shop.

They have trolleys (like airport trolleys) to help unpack the cars.

Our accommodation was nice: clean, tidy, basic, but comfortable. We were very lucky with the weather, it was very warm but I’m guessing in the apartment would not be warm without the sun on it all day. In fact, ours felt a little damp in bed at night! They have little electric heaters in the room but I’m not sure how helpful they would be?

The kitchen is VERY basic. Kettle, microwave, oven. Take tea towels!!! Even if they give you one, it’s flimsy and won’t help with drying up a whole families washing up every day for 4 days! As we were in silver accommodation we had no towels so took our own (forgot a hand towel for the bathroom though 🙄) didn’t even think to take soap for the bathroom!

The wardrobes are TINY no way I could have hung much up even for the kids (even if I had remembered to bring hangers).

Dinner at the Diner - poor service and they weren’t even that busy! Expensive food and distinctly average. Very disappointing.

Our ‘keys’ regularly stopped working and we had to keep walking back to guest services - really annoying! Even had to have maintenance come out to check the door for us!

Swimming pool was epic. So much fun. Such a shame that it isn’t open for more hours really.

Fair ground rides are traditional and the kids (4 and 1) loved them. Basically no queues for anything so was perfect for them really.

Shows were great. Didn’t bother with fast track passes and still had decent seats for the shows. Queues for photos with characters were quite long (and ultimately the packages for the photos aren’t cheap), but u can take your own photos.

Beach is a very short walk away (just outside the back gate). It’s pebbles though.

Check out by 10am but you can stay and use the facilities again.

If anything says how good our week was, we booked to go back in August! Even though it was 3 times more expensive and its school holidays! We got a fairly decent discount for booking before we left!
Read less

Name: Aldwick Café
Title: Rude staff
Review: went for lunch today ordered jacket potato with cheese takeway got to office opened box found potato with chill con took back after got the rudest reply from the owner

Name: Silver City
Title: Had food poisoning symptoms after consuming
Review: Big shame here. Have been using Silver City for over a decade yet this time the Beef Curry was watery with less taste and, the most likely culprit regarding the food poisoning I ended up with, the chicken chow mein was different in appearance colour, taste and smell (shouldn’t have chanced it but assumed maybe different chef/owners so different style/recipe). Four days since consuming and still having stomach problems. Have consequently checked with The Food Standards Agency website and found the Food Hygiene Rating for this business is a 2 (Improvement Necessary)! I agree with another reviewer that the sweet & sour sauce portion has reduced in size in recent times also. Time to find a new option for purchasing this Cuisine (once I have recovered from this terrible experience and feel up to trying it again).

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Average at best.
Review:
It's a roof over your head. Nothing fancy and no frills. The shower was quite poor quality and wasn't up to par with my bog standard shower I have at home.The staff when checking in we're polite and helpful (they even offered to give us tooth past and tooth brushes for a charitable donation) The breakfast was poor.
Read less

Name: LG Café
Title: Lovely new restaurant
Review: This is something a bit different, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The food is beautifully cooked by French chefs, and our waitress Kelly made sure we were very well looked after. Friendly owners too and nice surroundings, I hope this restaurant does very well.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: The most friendly hotel I have stayed in ever
Review:
This visit of four friends with their bikes was made all the better by the lovely staff at this hotel.we had a lovely very reasonably priced meal in the bar with a few well chosen beers and ciders and a cracking breakfast the next morning.
The staff were bending over backwards to make our visit enjoyable Thank you so much
Kind regards Andy
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: Nice 2 night stay
Review:
Had a nice 2 night family stay here recently. Staff were nice and helpful. Room size was pretty good. We were in the newly built part, which was really nice, clean, quiet. All usual mod cons, wifi, large TV etc. The Beefeater which was attached had a nice breakfast and a good menu for evening meals. Would recommend and will be staying again.
Read less

Name: Arden B&B
Title: Cosy and comfortable
Review:
We were made very welcome. The room was fresh and clean with some lovely complimentary products. I liked the use of the security code on the doors as it felt safe and I didn't have to worry about lost keys. The breakfast was fabulous with lots of choice for hot meals and a good cold buffet. There was no shortage of food. We would definitely return and recommend to friends and family. Thank you.
Read less

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Service
Review: Sat outside of the restaurant in the front underneath the main sign on a table and went to order food and our table did not have table number. Went to order my food and the women said you cannot sit there to order food as “a member of staff fell into a rabbit hole and broke her ankle”, to where a couple behind me at the bar laughed at the fact that they couldn’t serve me food outside on this particular table. Firstly why is there tables there if I have been told I can order food outside. Secondly there is a path which does not have rabbit holes? Thirdly it’s an extra 10ft to walk ‘along a path’ which does not have rabbit holes as mentioned. So I had to go get a random table number from another table outside and then get the waiter/waitress to give me the food (which was boiling hot having to carry it myself) to that table where I had to walk over myself to get my food and bring it back to my table. To then I had not been offered any sauces or even a nice “enjoy your food”, which I had to then supply myself with salt and pepper and get the mayo myself. Quite simply a joke and rubbish! Do not recommend to eat there at all and it’s a shame because I like the location and to have a drink there!

Name: Beachcomber Inn
Title: Great food,
Review: We visited this restaurant while on the Butlins resort, lovely team, sat at a table quickly, we order our food at the bar, my son wanted potato waffles with his chicken vice chip, the lovely lady behind the bar went and asked the chef if that was ok, the food was lovely, we had a enjoyable time,

Name: Parpadelle
Title: Saturday evening
Review: Enjoyed a lovely cosy meal here last night, food was of a very high standard, service was friendly and professional, would recommend the flat mushrooms and chicken for main, would recommend

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Very poor service
Review:
16th Birthday family meal for my niece and absolutely horrified by the service or lack of it, Food ok but all meals brought out over a 10 minute period with some of our group finished before my wife had even had hers . Lovely location in the secret garden but the way my sister in law was waved away by one of the staff when an enquiry about the delay was made was disgusting behaviour. Bar staff very knowledgeable about local beers and friendly
Read less

Name: La Cucina
Title: Best meal in ages
Review: Had a fabulous lunch today here. It has a real family feel and the fod is clearly made fresh. The gnocchi special was the best I've ever had and a large portion. So much so I've taken my leftovers home for tomorrow. The service was amazing and they were great with son too. I only wish we lived closer so could come regularly now we have foud this place.

Name: Portuguese Grill
Title: Excellent
Review: Dropped by & even though it was crowded was quickly seated & served. Excellent food at very good value with first class service.

Name: Wildforest Falls
Title: Fun for all the family
Review: Treated my two daughters & five grandchildren to crazy golf here today - we had not been here before. It is a an 18 hole course which we all enjoyed & took us well over an hour to complete.The course was clean & quite challenging, but we enjoyed ourselves & were lucky that the weather was fine today. It is not cheap at £5 per child, no concessions for pensioners - it was slightly cheaper to get 2 x family admissions for £40!

Name: Best Western Bognor
Title: Dated but hospitable hotel
Review:
Went Easter Friday we stayed one night.glorious weather.great spot on the front of Felpham beach.hotel needs updating but would still go back.Staff were lovely and everything was spotlessly clean
We were in room 33 with a side sea view. Only gripe was the small 4 foot 6inch bed(we are used to a 6 foot bed)
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Long weekend
Review:
We Went for a long weekend to celebrate a family birthday. It was a very nice experience. We had booked 2 rooms which should've been placed together but ended being on different floors however this was a minor problem as everything was good enough. There is enough to do for everyone. Would recommend a long weekend like we did for a break away.
Read less

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Back to square one
Review:
Historically this has never been a good place for a meal. Drinks overlooking the river - yes, great but they just don't try enough in the restaurant. In my previous review I thought things were improving but recently they have reverted to their old ways which quite frankly are just not good enough. Went again recently (April 2019) and booked a particular table. When we arrived restaurant was almost empty except (predictably) the table we had booked. So we took another table. Then had to get up and find menus for my guests and call for a waitress to take an order for drinks. The disinterest was palpable. To be fair a young male waiter later in the meal was excellent. Food when it eventually arrived was amongst the worst I have had for some time. The bill for four of us including two courses each, two glasses of wine and a pint of beer between us
was over £90. Needless to say I did not leave a gratuity.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Littlehampton Rustington
Review: Like all Travelodges, Rustington offered high quality basic amenities in terms of bed, shower, TV and tea/coffee facilities. Costs are kept down by not providing food and drink but these are available fro outlets on site or in nearby towns.

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: A wonderful family day out.
Review:
We visited on a Sunday and got there just after it opened and it wasn’t too busy, the sun was out and the wind was blowing. For a family ticket of 2 adults and 2 children, it was about £30 which is what we felt was a good price plus it helps out the reserve.

The area is set out in a natural circuit walking along the paths and stopping off at certain hides or water areas to take in views or feed the ducks. At no point in the day did it feel busy as it’s well organised and spread out.
Read less

Name: McDonald's
Title: Not what it says on the TV advert
Review: Last night I saw the advert for the GIANT Big Mac. Two weeks ago my husband collected a take away of two GIANT Big Mac Meals. The chips were great but the burgers were a real let down. Neither Burger had any BACON in them and one burger only had one layer of lettuce and sauce in it. One burger had gerkins and one did not. Both burgers seemed to have been thrown together with everything falling out and were very disapointing. I understand mistakes can happen but this was more than just a mistake it was poor quality control. We will not be having this item again, and if we had lived nearer we would have returned to ask for replacements, which I do believe would have happened. However, how many other take away customers have had this happen to them? and this is why I have posted the review, so that action can be taken to improve.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Awful Christmas Day Meal
Review: Paid £57 per person for a Christmas day meal. Absolutely awful, All the courses had items missing, we waited an hour and 30 mins for the main course. None of the waiting staff offered us any drinks in this time or explained why we were left waiting so long for our food, which looked nothing like the photos on the menu (see photo). Have had previous meals here and never had a problem, but this has put us off returning.

Name: Navigator
Title: Overpriced
Review:
Have eaten here a few times over the years and they have got very greedy with their prices, £11 for a beefburger or fish and chips is acceptable if the food is of a Gastro style but here it's just basic, akin to fast food.

Service also very mixed, sometimes the wait is unacceptable, and this is don to inefficiency as opposed to being busy.

The standards have slipped here considerably unfortunately.

Name: Inglenook
Title: Three nights at the Inglenook
Review: Had a three night stay here as we are looking at properties in the area. Wonderful place. Very friendly, courteous and efficient staff. We were made to feel at home by both the staff and locals. Food was excellent and generous sized portions. Sunday Carvery was lovely. Room was perfect for our needs with easy access to the garden as we had the dog with us too. Will be definitely be returning. This will be our local watering hole when we move to the area.

Name: Snooty Fox Bar
Title: Disappointing and overpriced
Review:
Our meal at the Snooty Fox was very disappointing. My starter of smoked salmon cubes was so tiny it was an utter disappointment and the pate my husband had was completely tasteless. Also the table hadn’t been set up properly even though it wasn’t busy. We had to request cutlery and napkins as it seemed to be overlooked by the staff!
My main course was nothing special but the other main course of sausage & mash consisted of 2 small sausages on top of mash and nothing else not even veg!
All for £13.95 - the other mains were about £1.00 more but a least you had a proper meal including veg.
A very disappointing visit to a local restaurant and unfortunately we will not be going. back.

Name: Cinnamon
Title: Superb food great service
Review: This food restaurant is so nice place to eat service was pleasing polite very clean toilets washroom for lady's food was lovely and wide variety of drink nice place to take children whole family they look after you such a lovely restaurant would recommend.

Name: The Castle Restaurant
Title: Good food, excellent service
Review: We dined here as we were also staying at the Norfolk Arms and thought we would give it a try. We had a lovely meal, for starters I had the Smoked Haddock risotto and my husband the Salmon and Crab cakes, then we followed up with the Chef's dish of the day for me, being pork belly, and my husband the Halibut. We both enjoyed our meals. and were impressed with the service.

Name: The Windmill
Title: Wedding anniversary celebration party
Review: Pub and venue very nice and wheelchair friendly. We paid for a buffet for 40 people @ £10 pp. Very disappointing we had a selection of sandwiches, frozen cheap sausage rolls, mini sausages, mini savoury eggs cut in half, gala pie sliced and Indian mini samosas, mini spring rolls and tea n coffee. I cannot see how this can be justified against what we paid. We might aswell gone to Iceland and done it ourselves for half of the price or less. Was a total let down. We might not pay for the venue but there was extra income coming in through the bar .

Name: Butlins
Title: Excellent
Review:
Now il be honest, I am abit of a holiday snob. Before I had kids I would have never dreamed of coming to butlins but me and my family (partner and two year old twins) have actually had the best time!! So much so we’re looking to book again for December.

We’re current staying in the shoreline hotel in a twin bed family room. The kids have their own room just off from ours which has bunk beds in. I was slightly dubious about one of my twins having to sleep on the top bunk but they’ve been fine! The room is very clean and spacious, there’s lots of storage and you even get a small fridge which is handy to keep fresh milk in.

Most of the fairground rides are free, the swimming pool is free, the entertainment is free, the activities are free and it’s right next to Bognor beach which is absolutely beautiful! We’ve been going on walks over there when the kids wake up early before things on site start.

All in all of you have small children this is the place to come!!
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Hearty breakfast.
Review: I always look forward towards a hearty breakfast at the Windmill. I always come by train and enjoy the walk along the River Arun promenade including the delightful pond before arriving for breakfast. Most enjoyable morning.

Name: Maypole Inn
Title: Disappointing
Review: I agree with a previous review. I had a lunchtime skittles Christmas meal. The skittles was good as was the company but the food was a big disappointment. The basket meal was poor, the chips dry and something described as scampi arrived, but nothing like I have ever had before. It appeared to be a ground up paste re-formed into a scampi shape (like a chicken nugget) and not proper, moist scampi tails. Not good value for money.

Name: Clymping Beach
Title: Waste of time & money!
Review: We arrived at the car park about 11.30am, there was a lad on the car park entrance taking money for the car park as the barriers were gone and the machines not working. We set off for a walk on the beach but decided to go back to the cafe for lunch while the tide went out further. We walked past the car park entrance and found no one taking money anymore. As we approached the cafe which is nothing more than a porta cabin we realised it was closed. The toilets were open so we tried to use them, not all toilets had seats, and no toilet paper in any of them! To be honest we felt robbed of the car park fee as the whole point of going there was the cafe. Please don't waste your time or money!

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Family Stay
Review:
Room was a good size, with comfortable beds, bathroom was small, however shower worked okay and bath was a reasonable size if required for bathing. Sink was marked, permanently pitted. Ceilings needed to be a bit clearer as did some of the window surrounds with a dead bug in.
Checkin and out was fairly straight forward, although we booked two rooms at the time of booking and asked that they be close together,they were at different ends of the corridor which was an issue for my elderly mother.
Overall the staff were helpful enough, although we didn't call upon them for anything other than checkin and out.
Read less

Name: Hotham Park
Title: lovely place
Review:
Nice place with quite a bit to do with youngsters.
Crazy golf,boating lake, play area and lots of place to run around
Read less

Name: The Beresford
Title: Sunday lunch
Review:
Pre booked. Sunday carvery. Very busy. Always a good sign. Food was wonderful.
Staff friendly as ever. To have the whole pub eating says a lot about the kitchen staff. Well done.

Name: Bognor Museum
Title: Interesting Museum
Review:
Well looked after and interesting museum, with lots of local memorabilia. Deffinately worth an hour of your time.
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Supper with a friend
Review:
I had a lamb burger was really hard to say what meat it was could of been beef
My friend had a pie which was all pastry no filling
On the plus side dessert was very nice and the waitress was nice

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Good food, small restaurant
Review:
Good food at a good price.
Fairly quick service.
Pleasant surroundings.
Only complaint that it was very cramped - too many tables in a small space, which detracted from the atmosphere.

Definitely recommend booking!!

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Not the Place for a Good Night's Sleep
Review:
Not a brilliant stay. Our room was clean but very dated, particularly the bathroom. Loose toilet seat and some mould on the ceiling, smelt a bit damp. Half of the rooms appear to overlook the car park and we were disturbed by late night noise from the car park and busy road directly next to the building.

The hotel is directly opposite a Shell petrol station, which is currently under refurbishment. We were woken at 7am on a Saturday morning by construction workers. No air con so we had to have the windows open. We can only imagine it will be noisier still once it's reopened.

On a positive note the staff were great - a really warm, friendly welcome. However, we wouldn't recommend this hotel for families.

Name: Avisford
Title: Wedding Anniversary
Review:
On arrival my husband and I noticed the building looked grubby. We had been a few times previously so could see the differences. The reception couldn’t find our booking so was asked to take a seat. There was cobwebs over the lighting, so first impressions were not good. As we waited more than 40 minutes the room the amount of people complaining was astounding. Keys didn’t work, windows stuck, rooms too hot. One member of staff Esme was bossing the trainee around as she was trying to deal with us, instead of going around the reception desk herself. Also leaning over the desk, as she once again couldn’t be bothered to walk around it so I got an eyeful of her underwear as her dress was so short. Then proceeded to to hum to herself while everyone stood around annoyed.

The room was far from deluxe, basic and in need of some attention. The window wouldn’t stay open as the frame was rotten and there was a window pane missing which was covered up with plastic and cellotape. No air con so the room was scorching. They provided a huge extremely noisy fan which just blew warm air around as the window wouldn’t stay open. Just awful.

The lounge area had several lightbulbs out but was nice to sit in. The garden was lovely for eventing drinks.

The restaurant is our favourite part of this hotel. The food was lovely and the restaurant staff were well trained. Although service was a little slow but as it’s so lovely in the we didn’t mind waiting.

So that will be our final visit to this hotel. As there are our superior to this for the same money.

Goodbye Hilton
Read less

Name: Fino
Title: Last minute decision
Review:
This was our 4th or 5th visit and probably one of the best ones. The 4 star rating is an overall rating for all our visits though.
The reason for this review is that I wanted to make sure the staff know how much we appreciated their kindness and attention! We went on Sunday the 2nd of June, as a last minute decision for lunch. We know that some sundays can be extremely busy, so we were pleased to find that they had plenty of tables free.
We were greeted with lots of smiles and plenty of small talk. And Andrew the bartender even remembered which drink I liked and how to make it to my taste too!
They even made an effort to make me on of their previous cocktail specials, as they thought I might like it.... and I did!!!
We went 4 of us, 2 adults and our 2 children ( 4 and 2.) On our way, we remembered that kids eat for free on sundays and were pleasantly surprised with that including 2 courses for the kids!
And the kids portions aren't small!!!
We really enjoyed our meal, although the pizzas were a little under for our liking and a few of the raspberries on my daughters pudding had gone bad. We mentioned it and we couldn't get enough apologies and they took one of my cocktails off the bill.
Service was definitely brilliant this time. And we're happy it was, as last time, on Mother's Day, service was incredibly slow and rather lacking!

Name: Fox Inn
Title: Sorry no
Review: Went in for a few pints and only had one. Kids running around in a bar that says no kids. Staff more worried about there phones and hair than serving the customers. Waited 15 mins to get the second round and there was only me and on other at the bar. Gave up and went to The Thatch instead

Name: Parpadelle
Title: Disappointed
Review: We went with friend to try this restaurant as our usual choice was fully booked. The service was slow and the food left a lot to be desired. My wife's ravioli was tasteless my seafood risotto was poor with over cooked salmon and prawns. I would not go here hungry as the portions were very small and over priced.

Name: Haskins Garden Centre
Title: Plants and food yippee
Review: Haskins garden centre has a wide selection of plants and shrubs, if you can’t get it here then it’s very possible you won’t find it around. Also they do a wide range of meals, light snacks and coffee/tea.

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Excessive cost Premier Inn charged me.
Review:
I was charged by Premier Inn, £149 for one night for a double room. This is way more than the amount you advertised, of £39 per room per night. I have suggested Premier Inn do something about that, by way of a partial refund. I am waiting for a reply from them.
Read less

Name: Subway, Chichester Rd
Title: Flies
Review: Went in for a sandwiches. Used toilet first and noticed loads of flies. Went to the counter, flies everywhere and flies and bugs on the back of the glass where all the ingredients are.

Name: Butlins
Title: Watch your kids
Review:
My 2 16yr old granddaughters were given a questionable cigarette by two toerags who worked at the resort and we were evicted from the camp. I have complained on numerous accounts but because they were caught with the item they are the guilty ones.
No mention the fact that there was nothing on my kids prior to arriving at the camp.
They were approached by two morons on the afternoon of our arrival who gave them the item and informed them if they liked it they could have some later that night. They were caught in the smoking area with the said item and we were out by the next morning.
Watch your kids and who they mix with or talk too because they are not even safe in Butlins.
Read less

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Awful veggie sharer (nice location though)
Review:
My husband and I went to the Black Rabbit with our 6 month old baby on a Wednesday lunchtime. We ordered the veggie plate from the sharer menu and were very disappointed.
For a bit under £13 the platter offered an uninspiring selection of food that you could easily buy from tesco out of a packet. It included two boring falafels, a tablespoon of tzatziki, one piece of pita bread cut in half with a teaspoon of humous, a handful of cold cabbage and some cold cauliflower. The presentation was also very poor.
An embarrassment, and we were totally gutted as it's such a lovely pub with great views and drinks.
Although it's only a pub, they should be trying a bit harder to get these basics right.
We complained to the waitress who went and spoke with the chef and manager, but did not return to us for 20 mins. They did offer us another small portion of humous and pita bread, but too little too late.

Name: Sea View
Title: Really very poor
Review:
This is a rather belated review of our visit to the Sea View Pub/Hotel in East Preston on Easter Saturday, a few weeks ago. The review is in respect of the pub not the hotel itself – we live nearby so were just visiting for lunch and drinks.
It was our first visit and I have to say was disappointing in the extreme. We had in fact called in a few months previously after walking into East Preston and the barman had shown us the menu which included a fish platter (I can not remember the exact words or description).
However, when we arrived on Easter Saturday, we were told that with the exception of the plaice, they had no other fish at all (a fish platter was not on the menu but that is fair enough I guess as menus do change). We sat down with a drink and perused the menu and further disappointment arrived when we went to order.
As well as no “ordinary” fish they did not even have fish fingers for a sandwich and when I ordered ham was told “It’s still being cooked”.
We therefore settled on two x plaice and two x warm chicken and bacon salad.
It must be said that my wife and her brother who had the plaice described it as delicious (and that is the only thing that saved this from being a one star review). However the chicken and bacon salad were woefully lacking in either chicken or bacon!! Really poor.
With the exception of the barman (I think called Jamie) the rest of the people serving or hovering round the bar, who I think were the owners were all rather aloof and certainly not particularly welcoming.
To summarise, the two plaice meals were excellent, the service was not great and to have so many dishes unavailable at lunchtime on Easter Saturday is unforgivable (the pub was quiet at that stage so it was not because they had served lots before we arrived).
I can not comment on the hotel/bedrooms as we did not see them – I would add, however, that the stairway to the top of the building can be seen when accessing the toilets and the walls have peeling wallpaper and look distinctly unappealing.
As above, this really should be a one star review but the plaice meals meant I could not do that in all fairness.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Best night sleep ever
Review:
Greeted by a lovely lady on arrival I believe her name was sue c. Welcoming and helpful, just what you need when you arrive after a long day. We had renewed our wedding vows and were both tired. Given our keys and told about breakfast etc.
Found our room easily and were greeted by a congratulations card which was a lovely touch. Room was clean and had everything you could need. Tea, coffee, iron, hairdryer, TV and the most comfy bed in the world! Honestly best night sleep I've ever had. No hurry to get up but when we did, we went down to a lovely breakfast, very busy breakfast room but staff were friendly and helpful.
All In all a fab stay, would highly recommend.
Read less

Name: Chez Moi
Title: Excellent Food
Review: Went to this lovely little restaurant, fantastic food, excellent staff, a small but delicious menu, would definitely be returning.

Name: Inspire Leisure
Title: The New Littlehampton Wave
Review: The New Littlehampton Wave is an impression looking building and the facilities look amazing. It is such a shame that the management does not seem to care about the customers. I have been three times. On each accasion I waited 10-15 minutes to get booked in. I tried telephoning 16 times and no one answers the phones. They just ring. The staff on the desks are stressed and are doing their best. The management have to realise that more staff are needed. This is not acceptable.

Name: Sen
Title: Disappointing inhouse menu
Review:
We went to SEN and were given a totally different menu to the one that is on their website. The menu was dated and expensive for what we were given.

We had looked forward to some great sounding dishes from their website but the dishes on their inhouse menu were the usual unexciting dishes served in many English tapas bars.

The starter of meatballs in tomato sauce consisted of 3 small meatballs costing nearly £5. The 4 thin slices of aubergine were also nearly £5.
The chicken shish kebab was tasty but did cost nearly £13.

All in all it was not the meal we had anticipated from the online menu which sounded great.

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: Really Not Impressed
Review: We were really disappointed with our visit to Papa Johns. The tables were sticky, the service was awful and the food was mediocre. The ambience of the setting needs sorting out along with the layout - feels like sitting in a school hall having lunch!!!

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Disappointing
Review:
I visited this restaurant on Saturday night. We usually go to the Worthing one which is always busy and buzzy on a Saturday. Also the food is consistently good. However Littlehampton was so different. By 8.30 we were the only table with one other so no atmosphere. I ordered Hadock fried in matza meal with chips. the fish was over cooked, almost burnt and therefore the fish dry. There were 8 chips on the plate - far from generous. They did bring a bowl of chips when I commented how small the portion was.
I shall definitely stick with Worthing on future.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Absolutely awful!
Review: My family and I visited this fish and chip shop after spending a couple of hours at the seafront...i wished I had checked Trip Advisor first! The chips were refried bits,dry, hard and tasted of greasy oil which left a horrible after taste in our mouths. The chicken nuggets tasted of a cheap quality as did the sausages, had alot of chewy gristle bits in them which put the kids off eating. Very expensive for the portion sizes and overall poor food

Name: TAO
Title: Just call it a sports bar
Review: Awful, no atmosphere, awful music. I'd rather watch paint dry. Feels like a weatherspoons. I'd love to get my hands on this venue.

Name: Butlins
Title: In need of a make over
Review:
Having spent a lot of my childhood at the site I was excited to come back as an adult with our family. We booked a kids weekend with my sister, brother in law and child (just under 2), my parents and my parter (I am pregnant).

The accommodation was basic but clean. Couldn’t complain about location or facilities in the room apart from the uncomfortable beds. All members of the party woke up with back ache every morning. Housekeeping were really good, and made shapes out of the towels every day which was fun!

The food in the deck was good with a lot of variety. Only comment would be that the one night I had pasta from the pasta station the guy was too busy talking he forgot to actually cook the pasta and only realised once the sauce was ready so I had to wait double the time for the meal.

The resort itself is perfect for kids, however it is looking tired and in desperate need of refurb. Feels like there’s too much accommodation and not enough activity for the masses. All good and well spending money on new additions (the pool) but what about maintaining the facilities you already have?

Also barely saw any red coats during the trip. Isn’t that what Butlin’s is known for?!

Haven’t decided if I would go back.
Read less

Name: The Mezze
Title: Lunchtime
Review: Fantastic meal and service well done to you all, food hot yet wasn't rushed this is what myself and family like

Name: The Locomotive
Title: Lovely traditional pub
Review: Finally a proper good English pub!!! Very friendly and welcoming. Perfect wheelchair access. Went with hubby and friends to watch football and decided to have something to eat. A good variety of choices and a good vegetarian menu. Food came out hot and tasty. Will be visiting again!!

Name: Butlins
Title: Avoid Ocean Hotel
Review:
I’ve left a full review of the hotel on the hotels page, but let’s just say we were less then happy with the noisy doors, light switches, lifts, and neighbouring guests. It totally ruined our holiday from the first night, with noises into the early morning, all 5 of us were kept up and I personally did get a wink of sleep, I’m so disappointed with butlins ocean hotel, the design of the rooms, corridors, the actual doors and the sound proofing.

We have visited butlins every year for 4 years, the wave hotel is so much better for noise and layout. But this year also saw a huge influx of lower end clientele, unfortunately I would call them chavs, I understand that this isn’t butlins fault, but it’s a fact. These guests are load and anti social, we will be taking our money elsewhere from now on.

The plus side is every single member of staff on that resort is a credit to the organisation, so friendly, so up beat and just fantastic, shame about the room and guests.
Read less

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Great family day out
Review:
went as a family group (3 kids, 2 mums and grandparent) during school holidays. Lots to see and do - boat trip; pond dipping and a 'celebrity duck trail'; even a play area to burn off excess energy! There are hides available for serious bird watchers - even saw a Red Kite over the trees nearby.

Had lunch in the restaurant; choice of soups or sandwiches etc. Sandwiches came in compostable packaging, but unfortunately there wasn't anywhere to compost it (one of our party took it home to be composted)
Read less

Name: The Southdowns
Title: Lunch review
Review:
My husband and I have eaten at southdowns pub on many occasions and the food has been good. Today we were there for a meal with a friend. The food was not at all good my friend had fried beef chilli strips with rice. She could not eat it as it was grizzly and horrible. My half chicken was dry but OK. The chips and onion rings were limp and cold. My husband had penne arrabiatta which came in such a small bowl like a kids portion.
To say the least the meals were horrible. I don't know if your chef has changed and your menu changed as well but after so many good meals there I doubt if we will go there again in a hurry to eat.
Peter Smith email p.h_smith@btinternet.com

Name: Littlehampton Museum
Title: Small but local
Review: Nice little place small amount off ww1 and ww2 items and some vintage toys which I was interested in only spent about 35 minuites in there but was worth going and is free.

Name: Church Farm
Title: Don’t even bother
Review:
Arrived to find caravan not ready, then our vouchers not ready. Had to wait 30 minutes as apparently they were not informed! ???
Then given the wrong keys to our caravan.
Meant to check in at 2pm, finally about 3.30pm.
Terrible start to our holiday as very upset children.
Will not be returning again. Strongly suggest people find a different holiday park.
Staff shrug and don’t care.
Read less

Name: Black Horse
Title: Boxing Day gathering.
Review: We had the skittles alley booked for a largish group, including a group of young children. The young ones enjoyed the skittles, the adults enjoyed the Boxing Day menu, a number of us had the bubble & squeak with cold meats, etc, it was very good. Not to forget the bar does have a very varied selection drinks as well, including one of my favourites HopHouse 13. Staff were very attentive and even though busy always pleasant and helpful. It was a very enjoyable few hours.

Name: India Gate
Title: Good food and service
Review: Lovely restaurant with pretty normal menu but better than average food. Good service and nice modern decor.

Name: 47 Mussel Row
Title: Always outstanding!
Review: Cannot fault anything. Staff were friendly and helpful, food was beautiful and atmosphere welcoming. Already booked another visit

Name: Osca's
Title: Very bad
Review: We went for lunch after reading good reviews about this place,we ordered cod and chips when it arrived the fish looked very flat,I waved to the waitress and said I order cod she said that is cod in a very rude manner,halfway through the meals I said to my wife you know what this fish is basa not cod she said that's what I was thinking unbelievable this place.

Name: The Mezze
Title: The best Hummus ever!
Review: Despite only being open 7 months this establishment is a roaring success! The service, atmosphere, staff and most importantly food are all superb. Starting with a simple hummus and lavash bread was something of a divine experience. Our mains were delectable - succulent meats with well dressed salads with rice and traditional condiments. All washed down with Turkish tea. I would make a trip back to Bogner Regis, simply for this meal.

Name: Royal Oak
Title: Low grade poor quality
Review: If you want old food or something straight from the freezer then head on down. If you want fresh tasty food then keep looking!

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Wet, wetlands.
Review:
Called in to view visitors center in pouring rain. Asked if we could go into cafe and was informed it would cost us £50 membership to enable this. Returned to rain and watched birds from car park. Lady who was being served informed us she had been allowed in without being a member. Suggest two month retraining course.
Read less

Name: Fusion
Title: Not impressed
Review: Six of us visited to celebrate a birthday on a Friday evening. We were the only customers in the restaurant. Ordered our pizzas, first one arrived, then over five minutes later the next pizza arrived, then over five minutes later the next one arrived.... you get my drift. By the time the last pizza arrived the first one was nearly finished. Round pizzas served on square plates overhanging the edges! Weird. No choice of red wine. Extremely confusing gin list. Music far too loud. Personally I won't be going back. I wish i had read the previous reviews about them only being able to cook one pizza at a time.

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Sunday lunch.
Review: Lovely pub tucked away in the country. Food was excellent. We all had Sunday roast but had a good choice and puddings were lovely. Situated in ideal place to take nice country walks as well. Would highly recommend

Name: Parpadelle
Title: Poor seating
Review: I just felt l needed to share my experience today...we have eaten in pappardelle’s on a number of occasions and had a coffee or two in Osteria - having never eaten in Osteria we decided to give it a go (never again) the main seating is a large long copper top table which looks lovely but not at all practical....when we arrived about mid day, customers were seated at both ends of this table and the chairs back onto the wall, l kindly asked the customer seated at one end to allow me enough room to pass behind him, so l could be seated further along the table (in the middle)...this did not go down well with him !!! and he basically refused to move and gave me such an uncomfortable look - not tolerating this behaviour we walked out, as we did the waitress (to which l have no issue with) asked why we were leaving - l obviously explained and left annoyed and frustrated with the whole situation. It’s such a big shame, purely because it’s nothing to do with the food or service, it’s just the impersonal, impractical style of the seating that will stop us going back.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Okish!
Review: The pub/restaurant itself is nice and the food we had tonight was ok, but it wasn’t anything to write home about. I had the pork belly which considering it was slow roasted was very tough in places, the flavour however was really nice but the veg and potatoes it came with were non existent. The green bean has been boiled to death and had no crunch to them and the 2 carrot sticks I had were very tasty, however would have been better if they were peeled first and more of them, like wise with my potatoes. My other half had hunters chicken, which was nice but the gammon was very fatty, it’s worth noting this doesn’t come with any side dish of veg or salad so you need to order extra. We also shared the garlic flatbread, again it was nice but not enough garlic butter or cheese! The best bit about our evening was the waitress who was very polite and friendly. All in all It was ok, however it isn’t on our places to eat again!

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Lovely staff but the food was disappointing
Review: We had dinner at the Black Rabbit, the staff are lovely, friendly and helpful. The pub is on riverside and gorgeous views to the castle. The food was very disappointing, dry and tasteless. The ‘homemade pie’ definitely tasted like a commercial pie reheated. Chips dry and tasteless. Very disappointing. Would come back just for views and drinks.

Name: Rustington Manor
Title: Three night stay for special occasion
Review: I recently stayed at this hotel with my sister who was visiting from Australia and having lived in Rustington forty years ago wanted to re-visit. How disappointing, the bedrooms certainly don't appear to have been updated, ie old plumbing, old and dirty lino/ carpets, very narrow beds. Good to have tea/ coffee and biscuits however. I would agree with a previou reviewer a 2* B&B would be more appropriate rating, particularly for the money paid. Very narrow steep staircase for maneouvering luggage. Breakfast in the conservatory was very poor particularly for what we paid. The same muffins, croissants fruit were brought out each morning and crockery not very clean. We never saw the bar open. On a positive note staff were friendly and helpful and there is free parking. Close to beach and shops.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Impressed
Review: Very lovely service! Fast and friendly ! Beautiful food , freshly prepared and tasty! So much flavour! Would definitely recommend for an evening meal. Very worth the money brilliant for kids!!

Name: Tandoori Nights
Title: Not great
Review: I had been recommended this restaurant and don't get me wrong the service was good but the food very bland... no real flavour.. couldn't taste any spices... I wouldn't return...

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Disappointed
Review:
Restaurant environment lovely. Food average.
Cheeseboard appalling
Service attentive but too quick - felt rush not relaxed
Came here a few years ago - came back based on previous experience- won’t repeat mistake !!! Thoroughly disappointed
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Weekend Break to see daughter at University
Review:
Nice big room and bathroom, good shower, comfy bed, massive car park. Nice quiet location. Our room was very clean. Our second time staying at this hotel and would definitely stay again. Good display of information of area.
Read less

Name: Rustington Manor
Title: Afternoon Tea
Review: So completely and utterly disappointed booked an afternoon tea about three weeks ago for today as a Mother’s Day treat for my mum and a friend. At time of booking specifically asked what was included and was advised selection of sandwiches, cakes scones baked on the day, a glass of Prosecco and unlimited tea or coffee. When we arrived our booking didn’t seem to have been made. The front of house staff didn’t know what an afternoon tea was, there were no scones or cakes available but the could make us a sandwich, Melba toast and biscuits. We decided not to stay and went elsewhere and would not return or recommend. The only positive was that the member of staff we were dealing with was very polite and apologetic.

Name: Inglenook
Title: We were ta
Review: We were taken here by friends on a Saturday evening The food was out of this world and the staff were lovely especially Di Had a really enjoyable evening Thankyou

Name: The Lion
Title: Horrendous
Review: Worst service in history, repeated delays meant lunch today took over four hours and food of poor quality too. Shambolic beyond belief. Wouldn’t eat here again under any circumstances and completely baffled as to how they have so many excellent ratings - a Russian algorithm perhaps?!

Name: Tea and Biscuit Club
Title: ks eBritish Delight
Review: This is a lovely shop that stocks everything for the tea drinker, the staff are both charming and knowledgable . The product range is diverse and the tea's we bought were delicious.

Name: Butlins
Title: Butlins Bognor are the worst company.
Review:
What can I say disgusting people. So we arrive 23rd of December was meant to be there till the 27th December cost £600. So when we arrive the rooms were dirty fag burns in the carpet black mould in the bathroom the bathroom floor kept filling with water no one had even been in there using it so was leaky pipes. Went out that night with me my partner and 4 children I bought 6 drinks 4 soft drinks coke and 2 alcoholic drinks that came to £30 which I think is expensive plus a pizza on way back to Chalet got a pizza and 3 side and a drink £45. I wasn’t bothered about the cost at that point but thought it was expensive. We are inside when we hear shouting outside there is a women 4 young children 1 a baby there had been a fight and her husband had been arrested thought what a loverly place. So we wake up in the morning my partner suffers with really bad anxiety she realised that she forgot her tablets so on that on its own she became anxious she went off to try clear her head I then get a phone call saying we have an hour to get off the site because she was about to smoke in none smoking area she was walking to our car which was still on site but far away from anyone or anything the fag wasn’t even lit. So we waited for for someone to come then 5 big blokes all come up to remove my partner from site DISGUSTING people they had took her Wristband so she wouldn’t of been able to go in anywhere so this has all gone on I said so what about the people downstairs they used Physical violence the night before and you’re coming up here to remove my partner from our chalet I think you’re disgusting people. Then I said I can stay with my four children but my partner has to go who in their right mind is going to kick people off of their holiday camp on Christmas Eve there’s not much more to say but I am making formal complaints to managers and I’ll also be going to local papers to expose how disgusting the place actually is. If you look at all the crime around Bognor Regis Butlins result there is higher crime within the result stay clear disgusting place. AVOID AT ALL COST we spent less than 24 hours there they would not refund any money so they had nearly a £800 off me in less than 24 hours cost off accommodation £650
Spent £50 in there onsite shop
£120 on first night there
So £720 on that site without travel expenses included.
Also the plan was to spend Xmas at Butlins so was not prepared to be thrown off site on Xmas eve they also said that we will not be getting any refund. I think in total Butlins Bognor have cost me around £1000 for less than 24 hours.
Read less

Name: Butlers
Title: Nice meal
Review: My wife and I visited Arudel on Easter Sunday & decided to have lunch in this restaurant. The staff were friendly the meal was a great Sunday roast lunch. The only moan I have is I was charged £2 for an extra which was a jug of tap water.

Name: Arundel Park Hotel
Title: Unloved and basic
Review:
First thing that hits you is the stale smell of curry/old people, quite unappealing, the decor is incredibly dated throughout, with woodchip wallpaper, dark old patterned carpets, worn paint, terrible artwork on the walls.

Met at the reception/bar by staff member who was reasonably freindly, producing the booked bill to sign on arrival. No introduction of her name however.

Other staff were reasonably pleasant, but not overly friendly, and again not a mention of a name.
Breakfast was cooked quickly, with a reasonable selection of choices. No frills but filled a hole.

Bed linen was straight out of the 80's, and a bit holey/threadbare in places. Bed was useable but not the most comfy.

Overall the room was a bit grubby in the slightly less obvious places, and again just felt unloved.

Bathroom was fuctional, the shower worked but had seen better days, showerhead quite heavily scaled and worn.

Towels provided are rediculously small.

Overall I would not choose to stay again and certainly wouldn't be recommending anyone I know does either. For £85 a night rather stay in Premier Inn.

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: First and not the last time.
Review: Sunday dinner with family. Such a nice restaurant. Food was delicious and big portions. Service Superb very friendly waitress. Nice atmosphere very relaxing we didn't feel rushed at any time. We will be back very soon. Thank you!

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Dog friendly and warm
Review: Really appreciated a dog friendly warm spot after a long fresh walk down the front. Wouldn't have minded semi or skimmed milk as an option and hot chocolate was warm rather than hot but overall enjoyed it and very grateful for the warmth!

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Not the best place for breakfast.
Review: We thought it would be nice to have breakfast on the beach,very poor sandwiches for breakfast bread to small,bacon lacking any flavour,Chairs and tables taty.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Nice restaurant
Review: There was a good choice of food and it arrived quickly and was piping hot. Our waitress Carol was very friendly and welcoming, we would return if we were in the area again.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Terrible service
Review: They may have a system they like but that does not equal good service. We were lucky to have a table due to a no show, but then it went downhill. The waitress told us she would take our drink order after she clears the next-door table (??) really? what is more important the newly arrived customer or a table that needs cleaning? We told her we knew what we wanted to order, a carvery, which in theory is quick because all the food is there ready... wrong, she said there is a system whereby they take tables to the carvery to be served so that there isn't a long queue, and it would take max 10 min. she got our drinks order and we waited 40 min, looking at them several times and asking twice. At one point we thought of leaving but every time she said you will be next. The carvery was average, had much better in local pubs, so all the paraphernalia with dressing up is really for the show and maybe for kids, but if you are hungry don't bother, there are many other places to go with much better service and cheaper food.

Name: Butlins
Title: Not impressed!!!
Review:
After hearing fabulous reviews of the Bognor Regis revamp we decided that we would take the plunge and go for it! My husband and myself work very hard for very low wages, we only get to holiday every few years so it's important for us as a family to choose the right holiday do that we can make the most of every moment! We arrived on site and had to wait for our silver room to be vacated by a staff member before we could get in, on entering there was good on the carpets in both bedrooms and an overwhelmingly bad smell of deep heat, we didn't want to start being negative and so we opened the windows and set off to explore! On returning the smell was just awful, but by then the oyster bay reception was shut; we phoned the emergency contact number for assistance - nothing was done, we then hunted down a member of staff on foot a few hours later- nothing done, we tried to make the best of it but my husband and myself couldn't sleep, I was physically sick as the smell was so bad and my husband was very angry - on holiday and we couldn't sleep because of the stink of deep heat! We soon realised the smell was coming from the mattress and pillows, they were absolutely covered, we were covered- my husband and myself absolutely stank too! For our third attempt the next day we went to the main reception in Butlins and asked for some help- thank God we were finally listened to and the kind lady contacted some one to change our mattress asap! Our room also had exposed wiring in our uplighters next to our bed, they were very low down - we had to keep warning our daughter to stay away from them as we were worried she would get an electric shock! We had pre-booked action passes - though the website fails to mention you need certain shoes for the go karts- which left me unable to ride, very upsetting! It also fails to mention that the bungee ropes also require you to wear short or trousers no skirts or dresses allowed- my little girl was devastated! Why not mention specifics on website so that you know what is required for specific activities?! Very disappointing and distressing! We loved the fair rides and spent alot of our time there, the arcades were also good. I was disappointed in the night entertainment- 'late night quiz? And disco?' Was this a joke? As a family we were excited to take part- expecting pens, paper and bundles of fun.... A couple of questions flashing up on a tiny t.v. with the answer following shortly is not a quiz nite....it's a let down, an awful excuse for entertainment! And the disco...? A couple or redcoats flailing about, crammed in between the stage and the chairs is not a disco-its depressing! We loved the sleeping beauty pantomime- amazing job, really fabulous and funtastic! And we loved the circus - really brilliant, made the whole experience bearable! We made some friends with some lovely members of centre stage staff Charley, Jaime-Lee and manager Steven- can't sing your praises enough, shining examples of wonderful people doing an amazing job!!! My daughter was refused to be able to join the line to get her magic kit signed by Steven Mulhern as she was a few seconds late - they gave 10 seconds for people to join line- we couldn't make it in time, no matter how many times my husband asked he was not allowed to join line with my daughter, he promised to sign each and every set purchased, my daughter was distraught and beside herself...long after Mulhern had left, way after the disco and quiz had finished along came Charley and her angels; Charley was so concerned about my daughter being upset and let down, she took time with Jaime-Lee to make her feel special- a million thank you's to you lovely lady's, you really bake a difference! Then Charley and Jaime-Lee got together with Manager Steven, who tracked down Mulhern and requested magic set to be signed as promised! My daughter was so happy - thankyou to you wonderful and caring staff- never stop being amazing, you make a difference in the world!!! Overall we were very disappointed with the whole fiasco, we worked hard to afford this holiday, and we couldn't even sleep whilst there! Would we come back? Unlikely!
Read less

Name: Mustards
Title: Who knew heaven could be found in Bognor?
Review:
Our new favourite restaurant ! We stopped at Bognor Regis partly by chance but are now planning to return, just because we enjoyed the food here so much. Nothing past our lips that we didn't think was delicious.
I had scallops, beef wellington and 'down the rabbit hole'. Oh my, I'm salivating now writing this five days later. It was all cooked and presented like the place/chefs should have several michelin stars. My wife had the tuna loin and hake and felt similar to me, and having tasted them both I agree hers was good too. Especially the tuna.

The service was also fab, right from when we wandered in randomly to see if we could book a table for later to when we finished the last delicious wine.

What a wonderful find.

Name: Church Farm
Title: Terrible experience! dirty, old and wrong caravan, Haven guest relations not professional!
Review:
We have booked a Prestige Caravan at Haven Church Farm. arrived Friday after 6pm and we were shocked to see the state of the Caravan, terrible! all dirty, I wrote on the dirt of the windows to show to management. I will upload pictures as I also did send to management. There was a very polite receptionist, Victoria, who understood but said that manager wasn't there, I went to look for the manager 3 times, but I couldn't find him. We decided to avoid staying at the park and organised two trips, one for Saturday to Chichester and one for Sunday to Portsmouth (we end up spending a lot of money but at least we saved the break that supposedly was going to be a fantastic time in a Prestige caravan with decking.
When we left on Monday at 10am, I have spoken to the manager who apologised many times and said that this wasn't acceptable and asked me what I want, I said a voucher to use in the future so we will be able to rent a proper and decent Prestige Caravan for 3 nights, he said "OK", after apologising more times I asked him what are you going to give me: 3 nights in a Prestige Caravan or a voucher, he said a voucher, after 4 days I wrote to him and ask about my voucher, he sent an email with a £50 voucher, a complete liar, dishonest person, his name was Sam, the manager.
I have complaint to Guest Relations, no help, very useless and unprofessional, they rise up the refund to £100 then after many more emails they rise to £150 as they said they accept the "problem with cleaning" this is not a case for cleaning, first is a case of cheating a customer, allocating a Caravan that not even is acceptable for a standard level. £150 is not acceptable for making us waste our time and push us to make different plans when we travelled with 3 children for more than 4 hours in the car, it was impossible to abandon the break and we use it only for sleeping as it was difficult to move to a different resort as we have a child with special needs who is very difficult to understand transitions, we have explained everything to customer services, guest relations but they don't understand, we are not asking for a free break but to be offered the high amount we paid so we can organise another break in the future and the only amount they want to reimburse if £150, this is less than the third of the amount paid.
Guest Relations are not competent, and I have asked for a general manager to look into this situation, but they just don't give a flying flamingo about this.
