We would have had desserts but at this point had been in there so long and were so unimpressed we didn’t see the point in waiting to see how they could mess up that!

We got the bill (reduced thankfully, although should really have been free after all that), paid some in cash and asked to pay the remaining £18 on card, split half each. This ended up being £8 on the first card and £10 on the second. How is it hard to half £18?!

Total utter disappointment, a bit of a joke really. Out of the 5 of us, only 1 had no issues with their meal!

Name: Waterside Café
Title: A Hidden riverside gem within yards of the main roundabout yet with views of the River Arun and the Downs, great food, f
Review:
The cafe is hidden away behind the museum, by the big car park and right on the river bank. From the outside it doesn't look much, a collection of gaily painted wooden sheds, and I'd also read a review that some rather obviously disgruntled customer left yesterday.

However after talking to the waitress over the fence (!! ) exchanging pleasantries, and finding she didn't bite ,we decided to go in. We were probably the first customers of the day but the daffs were on the tables ready and we were made to feel welcome by 'our waitress', as were our two dogs.

Great views of the river, and the ancient bridge and also the south downs national park in the background. Really please we decided to go in, sitting in the sunshine by the sparkling river - delightful. We tried the loos, as you do ... freshly cleaned for the day and sparkling.

The owner must be particularly enlightened because not only are dogs welcome but even better there is a strict no smoking and vaping ban. Lets face it, 99% of people visiting are going to be walking on the Downs or along the river bank, they are not the sort of people who want to breathe in other people's second hand carcinogenic cigarette smoke or, worse, some sort of synthetic sickly sweet vape mixture.

I must admit I do have to wonder why the person who left a comment about the coffee not being to their taste didn't have the intelligence to get off their backside and ask for a new cup, or more milk or whatever.

We, and our dogs will be back, and soon.

Name: China Royal
Title: Not good this time
Review:
I am sorry to say this but I ordered last night and we were not happy with our meals.
We ordered on just eat for a take away delivery
We have never had a bad meal from you before but this wasn't nice.
My Fiancè is a chef and he wasn't impressed.
The egg fried rice was clearly a few days old and was stodgy and tasted awful
My beef chow main was dry and tasteless
Overall I was very unsatisfied with our meal £20 wasted

Name: Ship & Anchor
Title: Bank holiday weekend at the Ship and Anchor caravan site
Review: Arrived at the site and paid cash for the May bank holiday weekend. Before we where shown to our pitch we had to listen while she read out the rules of the site despite notices all over the place. So £26 per night plus 50p for a shower! I thought this was expensive for a basic site with electrics and extra charge to have a shower. No motorhome waste disposal and the water in the washing up area was warm not hot. Not impressed with the lady (owner/warden) and her rules. Strictly no visitors, why? I think our group was on edge just in case she came over to remind us of the rules. My friend wanted to park his motorhome by driving in with the awning on the left, but this wasn't allowed because he wouldn’t have been on the hard standing, well grass with the reinforced plastic underneath. We won’t return.

Name: Butlins
Title: Lovely Break!
Review:
Relaxing midweek break with friend .
Enjoyed the entertainment And the new splash pool is excellent for families 👍
Fish and chip shop on site would highly recommend ⭐️
Chalets perfect for what we needed -standard and beds very comfy !!
Will return with children 😃
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: awful service
Review:
Waited an hour and a half for mains, waited 45 minutes for table to be cleared, no one came and checked if food was ok or to offer dessert menu, had to go up and ask for it
Wouldn’t come back

Name: Bognor Charcoal Grill
Title: Worst kebab of our lives
Review:
We had a chicken donner and chicken donner wrap with stuffed vine leaves on the side. The vine leaves were inedible and out of a tin which was confirmed when I called to complain.
The kebabs looked partly raw and the meat was slimmy. If there was a zero rating on the stars i would have selected that option.
The worst kebab shop in bognor regis
Trully disgusting.

Name: Butlins
Title: Butlins discrimination
Review:
Butlins discrimination.
Any single people planning to book a break at Butlins, don't bother. Same sex couples need to read the terms & conditions too.
On Wednesday 17th July I booked a 4 night break for Monday 22nd July to Friday 26th July.
I booked a single room for a single person and then an extra payment for breakfast and dinner for 1 person each day. Butlins accepted my booking, took my payment and sent me a confirmation email.
Today, Friday 19th July, I recieved an email saying that my booking had been flagged because I am a single person going on my own. I thought the email might have been a scam so I rang the number on my original confirmation email to be told that, as a single person, I can only go on a live music weekend to a Butlins resort and that it's in their terms & conditions. I was also told that I would have to wait a further 2 or 3 days before I got my money back, so roughly by Sunday 21st July. Seeing as I've planned a break commencing from Monday 22nd July this leaves hardly any time to book another break using my original holiday fund.
During the phone call I asked if it was ok for a married couple with no children to go on a Butlins break and was told that it was ok for married couples of opposite sex but same sex couples would need to prove they are married. On that basis it would be interesting to know if an unmarried, opposite sex couple, would have any booking problems.
The fact that it's in their terms and conditions doesn't change the fact that it's discrimination and, let's face it, how many single people would read the terms & conditions to find out if they had to be accompanied by a child.
Conclusion: If you are single or gay then Butlins don't think you're safe to be around children.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Butlins Shoreline Hotel
Review:
Shoreline hotel rooms extremely well presented and family friendly. Great view of seaside. Well equipped with fridge and tea/coffee facilities. Comfy beds & cones with bunk beds for little warriors. Great housekeeping services.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: A castle and restaurant that is a London Must Go To!
Review:
Of all the places in London I have been to, I will in the future recommend this castle to everyone as a “for sure visit” that is not in local London and needs to do a little advance planning on how to take the train out of Victoria Station to get here but definitely worth the extra travel to have this unforgettable experience! 100% recommended!!
Read less

Name: Elmer Tandoori
Title: Elma tandoori
Review: I always order from this takeaway as I think the food the coast and presentation is amazing and super friendly when visiting. I rang up to place an order before 10.20pm took my address and my whole order witch took 10mins to be passed on to another gentleman who explained rudely that he can’t deliver to me with no explanation. This is more for the restaurant eyes in hoping they read this and treat people a little nicer on the phone you may have business but no wants to order to someone who is bloody rude and not polite!! The words can spread you know might want to have a few with your staff!!!

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Not as good as expected
Review:
Four of us visited one evening on our 3 night stay. I ordered the regular cod and chips, one of our friends had the large haddock, another had scampi and 4th was large cod. Long wait for the food. Regular cod was the size of a fish finger. Haddock was dry, chips were warm. Not the best start. 3 of us had desserts, one being crumble and ice cream which consisted of half a small melted scoop.
When it came to paying the bill, a senior member of staff deleted my regular cod off the bill as a gesture. He said the cod is sold by weight. I personally feel that people who cannot eat a large piece of fish, as some places it is huge, will be disappointed when they see the small piece of fish in the middle of a large plate surrounded by chips. The cod was tasty but we didn’t recommend the eatery to others of our party.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Yummy
Review: Server very friendly and good her name was Rhiannon. Food nice and hot. Very delicious. Will be back for sure.

Name: Belinda's Tearooms
Title: A little gem
Review: Very friendly and efficient staff. Great range of food which was very tasty and served quickly. Will visit again

Name: The Lion
Title: Always good
Review:
We usually eat here when in the area as it never disappoints.
The service is excellent and the food tasty and plentiful.

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Becky
Review: Friendly and welcoming staff. Food was amazing, loads of choice and portion sizes were good. Would definitely recommend.

Name: Cedar
Title: Lovely Sunday lunch
Review: Had a 3 course lunch here on Sunday. Service was good and the food lovely. Had coffee in the lounge after and read the free paper. Very relaxing day. Recommend

Name: Sen
Title: Catrina & Luis
Review: A first class service with a very friendly welcome from Sam...Our first visit but definately would recommend. The food is excellent and good hearty portions displayed perfectly...a wonderful restaurant and very good value for money. Range from tapas to full main meals the choice is superb!..thank you to all who work at Sen Restaurant in Sudley road in Bognor Regis.

Name: Arden B&B
Title: Fantastic B & B
Review:
From the moment of my initial enquiry all the way until check out Lucie provided fantastic communications and great flexibility to ensure my visit could be the best possible and could fit in with my arrangements for the weekend. If only every B & B experience was like this! Thank you very much - your amazing hospitality was greatly appreciated.
Read less

Name: World's End
Title: Not good enough
Review:
Wild mushrooms for starter, lovely sauce but some of the mushrooms were so wild they ended up being spat out into the napkin as way too chewy, rubber like.

Homity pie that did not live up to the menu description, if this pie wasn’t simply bunged into the oven from frozen id be surprised.

3 game sausage dish was lacking in gravy and too dry.

Didn’t bother with dessert.

At £25 a head this food was appalling.

Staff were great, approachable and attentive, also young and rushed off their feet, I do hope they aren’t on minimum wage.

The place was busy so people obviously like going there, but Hall and Woodhouse seem to be a faceless corporate entity, bums on seats and increase that profit margin.

Won’t be going back.

Name: Angmering Manor
Title: We went to Worthing to a friends Barbecue. We stayed at the Angmering Manor Hotel and it was delightful
Review:
This is a wonderful very old country Hotel, but which is nicely extended and decorated, full of character. The staff are just so helpful, really nice and kind. The room was lovely the furniture and ambience is superb. The gardens are just beautiful with Lilly ponds, water features, a brook, a little bridge and really nice garden furniture. For a very reasonable & economic price for a twin room for me and my wife, a full English breakfast was included. I'd give the breakfast 10 out of 10. Beautifully cooked without any sign of grease. Beautifully done eggs etc. I'm told by other guests that the dinner is also superb. The place is just a joy. We loved it, well done Angmering Manor, FULL MARKS!
Read less

Name: Grandads Front Room
Title: Best Community project ever!
Review:
What an amazing place this is! Staff are friendly, compassionate and have the community at its heart. Well done Grandads Front Room.
Read more

Name: Empress Bar
Title: Great service and setting
Review: Recommended by a host. Great location by the river. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Food very good. Good ambiance. Well worth a visit.

Name: Belinda's Tearooms
Title: I think you have to announce your arrival ...
Review: ... I sat there for 12 minutes this lunch time and the Waitrose failed to catch my eye. Maybe they more than one harried person at lunch time. The one star is for the olde worlds teashop charm.

Name: India Gate
Title: Good meal and tasty
Review:
We were hungry after watching a cricket match all day and we all fancied an Indian meal. As this was the only Indian restaurant in Arundel our choices were limited. The restaurant has a nice decor and was glad to see they used cloth table napkins.

The food was delicious and there was some Bangladesh dishes on the menu. We all enjoyed our food and would definitely go back. Toilets were clean. Service could have been a tad friendlier and quicker. We had no alcohol and the meal cost between the three of us £66 with tip.

Name: T-Bone Burger
Title: Dinner
Review: First visit here was impressed , nice atmosphere, staff friendly good portion sizes, recommend the halomi burger very tasty

Name: Mustards
Title: Ruined my wifes Birthday
Review: Eaten here loads of times before, always exceptional, never felt the need to leave negative feedback for anyone else before, but on this occassion i feel our experience tonight deserves it.Food was disgusting, turns out the local big business man was having a staff get togethor so it appears he's money is more important than mine, oh well they're loss. Eat here but only after asking the question about who has booked on the same evening. Tonight was my Wifes birthday, and they ruined it. Cheers..

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Avoid! Avoid! Avoid!
Review: We were a large party so the restaurant asked is to place our orders several weeks in advance. Having done this, we were extremely disappointed to be told on the night that they were “out” of many of the dishes that we had ordered. How is this possible. Food was pretty awful. Would never go back.

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Top quality pub food
Review: We really enjoyed our family lunch here - tasty and fresh food, lovely personal service in a pub owned by villagers. The selection of beer and wine was also wide enough and the place has a relaxed ambience. Very nice indeed.

Name: The Waverley
Title: Disappointed
Review: Over £17 for a rump steak and the cheapest beer and what is left on my plate is half of what I was given and uneatable ! Totally left feeling ripped off ! The manager tonight was very professional and apologetic but just not good enough was my meal. Especially against my costs !!! She did offer to refund me but that was not what I was after. I had traveled, and just wanted a good meal. Will never return and certainly do not recommend!!! And refuse to be bought off by the fact it is a London brand who apparently use the same suppliers !!! Disgrace of a company in my eyes, who are thieves taking my money and providing me with crap. Pepper sauce was sweet and certainly not peppercorn sauce !!! I am feeling distress as to what I might of just ate ???? I was so hungry too I had to eat as much as I could Muster. Fries were fine, although I said no to tomato sauce, I was bought 3 different sauces. I now think the bar tender probably knew I would need to cover the taste !!! Photo of inedible steak is at least half the size I was served !!! And the sauce certainly no a pepper sauce. Should of known by the immediately spoken bar tender that I had ten minutes. Disgraceful!

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Cleanliness an Issue
Review:
After my first review of Establo I’m afraid things have gone downhill.
The cleanliness is not up to scratch and it feels the place is run by young adults who are not experienced enough to know better.
Twice I have ordered a pint glass of water and both times seeds and remains of cocktails were inside the glass, the tables are often tacky and the cutlery not as clean as it should be. All my friends have the same opinion you have to check before you eat or drink.
Finally last Thurs eve two of us ordered chicken bang bang and there was no Pak Choi, broccoli or sugar snap peas!!
Not as described at all - disappointed with all the failings - the management needs to get the place sorted!

Name: Church Farm
Title: Once again lovely staff and well cared for site.
Review:
We love it here , Walking to Pagham Harbour across the wooden bridge , And to the nature reserve in the evening. Lovely. Caravans are usually very clean ,but ours this time was not well cleaned the shower was a bit stained and windows where filthy.And found the caravans steps very slippery in wet. But will be back and hopefully have a cleaner van. With non slippery steps.
Read less

Name: Victoria Fish & Chips
Title: Yummy
Review: I’d have to say the best fish and chips in Bognor that I’ve had. Myself and my husband both had cod and chips, the cod was absolutely delicious! And the batter was just right.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Worst service from THE MOST MISERABLE FAT GIT
Review: Worst service from the man clearly left in charge EVER. Customers treated as an inconvenience!! Never again!

Name: Arun View
Title: Family lunch out
Review: We all agreed to meet here because it overlooks the river in Littlehampton, whilst being entertained by activity on the river we sat down to three course meal, the service was prompt and very politely given, definitely go there again next time we are in Sussex.

Name: Hawking About
Title: HAWK WALK
Review:
The Hawk Walk was a fantastic experience
from great communication at the very start and easy to organise. Kevin gave us plenty of time on the walk and was very informative about his Hawk , Storm. As we walked through the woods Storm would swoop down onto our gloved hand. It was very laid back and enjoyable, a terrific experience and I would definitely recommend it.
Read less

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Certainly no return visit
Review:
Not a cosy pub at all. It was furnished like a cafe, the pub was cold, no heating.
The lunch menu was a choice of 5 mains. Our food was Luke warm, the battered fish was soggy and all 4 of our meals covered in this fried greasy cabbage. The only thing was nice was the puddings. We were very dissapointed. Can see why the pub was virtually empty.

Name: Angmering Manor
Title: Very nice
Review:
Stayed for one night on a very hot evening so rooms were a bit warm but fans were provided so no problem, rooms are very clean and the hotel is quite with very nice gardens. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very nice.I would definitely stay again, there were no negatives for me
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Poor service
Review:
We had booked a table and were kept waiting for a good 5 mins before anyone actually acknowledged us. We get seated and about 5 mins a women came over and took our order. We patiently waited as it was busy other people were getting impatient but we weren’t. Our food came out and it was all slapped together not worth the £11.49 that they were charging for the vegan burger. The lady who served us was doing too much at once serving about 15 tables at a time which is ridiculous! We ordered 3 refills which we had one drink then the machine broke down. Once we had finish we asked for
Bill got the wrong table bill took me a further 5 mins to get the woman back to say it was the wrong bill. I gave the lady cash she said she would be back with change I said ok thank you. She actually thought I was gonna let have the £6 tip I don’t leave more than £3 in a top high end restaurant let alone here after this service. I the followed and said about
My change who she replied I thought you didn’t want the change! I’ve given this place a dozen chances everytime I come here there’s always something. I no the feeling of it being busy and I was patient I don’t moan etc but it’s everytime I attend here for
Lunch/dinner.
Disappointing as they have such a good vegan range. :(

Name: Cedar
Title: Disappointing!!!
Review: Had a meal for two this evening. There were more staff in the restaurant than customers yet still we had to ask for our drinks twice as someone clearly forgot. My colleague ordered the dirty burger - considering the price this was pathetic!!! Literally was a cheese burger with nothing else. There was nothing special about it and looked like a bad take away! I ordered the ribeye steak just with salad and some Caesar dressing. The "salad" was cucumber, yellow pepper and tomato......since when is this a salad?!? I had to actually ask for lettuce!!! When you're paying £25 you would think the salad would be decent at least!....and the price of drinks at £3.75 for a can size of coke zero....really!!!! The staff need to get their finger out and actually pay attention to customers. Little details-we complained about the food and there was no real apology and the service charge still came on the bill without any acknowledgement of everything that was wrong. Would not recommend for service or food and God only knows how bad it would be if it was actually busy!

Name: Premier Inn Arundel
Title: Very average
Review:
Small family room, expensive for what it was. Dinner in the beefeater was good but the breakfast in the morning was appalling. Cooked breakfast slow and missing items. Continental consisted of one toaster for the entire restaurant and a few straight out of the packet cold pastries.
Read less

Name: Church Farm
Title: Very happy with our holiday
Review:
Me and my family are staying in a delux caravan very nice clean and staff were great on arrival got checked in quickly had dinner in the mash and barbell on our 1st evening our food was very nice my partner had the fish and chips and I had the cajun chicken pasta with the house salad our meals came very quickly and we're hot we sat outside which was lovely as it was a nice day theirs not loads to do on the camp site but we're only here until the 6th of Sept so far our holidays been great would definatly come back staff have been great had 2 tiny issues with the shower head and cuboard door both came times someone came out very quickly to repair can't fault this site the mash and barrel or the staff been spot on 😁 xx
Read less

Name: Inglenook
Title: Mum and Dad's 60th Wedding Anniversay Lunch
Review:
Thank you so much to the Inglenook - especially Sarah and Edna, who went above and beyond - for a magical day on Sunday 17th February!

We had a three course sit down dinner for 57 family and friends - eldest 89 and the youngest 2! The food was delicious, and the function room looked amazing! Beautiful flowers on each table, and wonderful chair covers, with exquisite bows.

A wonderful achievement to still be happy and in love after 60 years of marriage, surrounded by your family, and the Inglenook was the best place to celebrate! Thank you and all your staff for everything!!

Rachel Brooks

Name: Butlins
Title: Let down
Review:
Stayed for a long weekend this month (June) it was ridiculously busy and wasn’t even school holidays! Hotel ocean was good can’t fault it. New pool would of been good fun if it wasn’t crammed with people, too busy waiting times on most the slides/flumes was between 20-40 waiting time, you couldn’t move without bumping into someone which with baby’s is dangerous. Also only saw one life guard around the hole pool other than the ones on the slides. They should have a max capacity or something as it was just so busy. The floors in the changing room were filthy with mud , clumps of hair and god knows what else. Around the resort wasn’t enough for toddlers. My child was just shy in heigh of almost every ride etc so was really disappointed in that. Only thing my child could to was play in the park or indoor soft play but as I’ve said before it’s just to busy. Not enough for adults to do either. We took ourselves out of the resort 2 out of 4 days as was too busy and not enough to do. Also much better mini golf and ice cream parlour outside the resort! Restaurants are ok but nothing special. Wouldn’t return.
Read less

Name: Pizza Hut
Title: Dirty knives
Review: go to grab knife and fork for my pizza to see that 3 knives with somebody else dinner on .staff did seem interested either. Never going again.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Food good but waiting staff are wonderful!
Review: We recently spent the weekend at Butlin’s for my daughter’s birthday. It’s not our usual type of break/holiday - although my daughter loved it and that’s all that matters - and the general food offer wasn’t terrific for us. The traditional fish restaurant was wonderful however. Delicious fish and chips well-cooked and moderately priced, with one or two really nice alternatives on the menu too. We ate their twice. The first evening we had a smashing, cheery young waiter named Jack serve us. He was accommodating and attentive. Terrific stuff. The second evening however, the restaurant was bursting at the seams and the kitchen/bar staff were clearly struggling. We were served by an absolutely superb young guy, Sean, who although frantically busy remained unflustered, polite and wonderfully cheery throughout our visit. He was simply brilliant. What a credit he is to the restaurant and resort. No doubt his parents too!

Name: Littlehampton Beach
Title: Lovely, clean, safe beach
Review: I live near Littlehampton and visit the beach as much as possible, especially in the summer. The sand is lovely and the tide goes out a long way, making for safe paddling in lots of shallow water for children. Coast guards are on duty and patrol the beach during summertime and dogs are not allowed on the beach between April- October.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Poor food, slow service
Review: In a nut shell, waited an age for food and drinks. When meal did arrive, over cooked and cold. When you raise a complaint, manager not interested, made us feel like a big inconvenience. Will not return and advise others to avoid.

Name: Mustards
Title: Very good duck!
Review: I don’t think the photo of the restaurant on here does the place justice. Don’t let it put you off. This is a very good restaurant. The staff were very accommodating when we turned up quite late after ice skating at the rink next door. The food was very good: my wife said the duck was some of the best she’d ever had; the beef Wellington was very good too. In contrast the puddings didn’t live up to the standards of the mains which is why I give this place 4 stars and not 5. Well worth trying. Probably a good idea to book as it’s not very big.

Name: Avisford
Title: Disappointed
Review:
Came here for a weekend stay when was going to the races. Check in was at 3pm, however our rooms were not ready till 4.20 Giving us only 30 mins to get ready, after travelling a long way this was very annoying. 2nd issue they was a problem with payment, As everything was delayed I wanted some room service to eat, after taking my card to swipe I asked how long room service took and lady said up to an hour. So I said forget it. A family member had paid for our rooms, how ever I had the room rate taken out on my card. It took me 3 phones calls to sort this out and also promise of a call back which never happened. Not all but the reception staff I dealt with I found a bit rude. The rooms our outdated and tired. Would I stay here again NO is the answer. I would except a much better service from a Hilton.
Read less

Name: The Mezze
Title: Stopped for lunch and wow!
Review: Interesting menu and the food is a definite wow. Tasty and a good size. Will definitely be recommending to family.

Name: Elmer
Title: The Pub and restaurant.
Review:
the pub and restaurant staff are excellent. Service is very good and the food is surprisingly good..... The restaurant is quite large, for a Pub, and their menu and food are worth going there for. They appear to be a popular venue.
The hotel is not very good. the rooms are up at the top of a long narrow staircase and the bed and linens leave a lot to be desired. the 'en suite' bathroom is barely adequate.
The rooms may be suitable for young people but they lack creature comforts for seasoned, older travelers.

Name: The Spur
Title: Good solid food
Review:
On the spur of the moment we decided to eat here. So glad we did, the starters were amazing especially the smoked salmon & prawn, also the potato skins with BBQ sauce.The mains were wholesome, lamb cutlets, fillet steak, chicken curry.
Good selection of desserts, we were too full to order more! Then two of us relented and had the pannacotta.....delicious!!

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Love this hotel!
Review:
It's such a treat to come annually with good friends to Bailiffscourt. The hotel is quirky and between us we had modern, traditional and in-between rooms, all individual and lovely. We especially like the underground tunnel to reach the restaurant! Service is excellent, food fabulous, the spa inviting and indulgent and the location, with bracing walks on hand (if you choose them). Once a year is not enough!
Read less

Name: The Deli
Title: Lovely lunch
Review:
Popped in today as we were passing for a quick lunch. Sandwich and baked potato made fresh! Lots of lovely things to choose from, great service, tidy modern deli!

Highly reccommend!

Name: Haskins Garden Centre
Title: Trainee Restaurant Manager Karim
Review: Must agree with previous reviewer what a nice person Karim is to have in the Restaurant. Always busy but has a few minutes to make you feel welcome. Nice to find someone so cheerful enjoying their job. Good selection of meals, well prepared and presented. Clean facilities.

Name: La Cucina
Title: Great meal
Review: Food and wine excellent in a busy restaurant. Only minor criticism is everything rather rushed. Otherwise great!

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Good to watch films at reasonable prices
Review:
The cinema is a very economical place to watch movies and offers decent facilities with the latest films. Seating is fine, and is like going to an old-fashioned cinema, which adds to the quaintness and nostalgia.
Read less

Name: China Palace
Title: Valentine Value!
Review:
This was our first visit to China Palace, which happened to be on Valentine’s Day. This is one night of the year that can often be underwhelming in restaurants with inflated prices and bland food.

However, this was not the case at China Palace! We were offered a choice from the set menus which were their normal standard price.

From start to finish the food was delicious and cooked beautifully. One of the main courses was beef which is usually my husband’s least favourite as the beef can be tough. This beef though, was melt-in-the-mouth fillet steak quality and was the star of the meal!

The staff were very welcoming, friendly, informative even explaining the difference between crispy and Peking duck!

To summarise; a fabulous evening and we will return many times, I’m sure!

Name: Littlehampton Fish and Chips
Title: Disappointing
Review: Come here regularly but today the battered sausage was not fresh and crispy, dry and had clearly been sat in the heat cabinet for a While.

Name: Peri Peri House
Title: Wost company iv ever ordered from
Review: worst delivery ever had in my life, said they had acsepted the oerder phoned them after it was 5 mins late and they had not even started to cook the food and claimed it was not acsepted yet, they then said 20 mins after 40 mins it was there with the two drivers sat outside talking with the food sat on the car getting cold, after asking weather r not ther emanager was in tonight i was told i dont care if you dont like it i take it away, after being told to leave my property he insisted to stay after being told to leave and then me being exstreamly angry told them to f off and he then replkyed with me the custermor to f off when it has been the fault of the resternant and there careless attitidue and deleivery drivers who can not do there every simple job, i will not order from there every again and will recommend to everyone i know never to take there buisness there, that place needs to be shut down, or atleast hire some english people who can understand the words customer service.

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: A genuine lucky find in a lovely village.
Review: We are visiting the area briefly and asked at our b& b for a recommendation for an evening meal. We were delighted with this welcoming pub- good, friendly service and an excellent meal.

Name: Waterside Café
Title: quality breakfast by the river
Review: Fabulous breakfast next to the river, with quality sausages. Prompt service and the staff asked if all was OK also asked if we wanted anything else, which was good as I did want another mug of tea.

Name: Westside Café
Title: What has happened?
Review: This cafe was once my go to cafe at the weekend under the previous owners.Since they sold I’ve heard not many good things about this place and months ago I see a sign go up ‘business for sale’.I went in yesterday and the current owner looked like she was severe pain, that or she really hated being there. She did not say hello to me, my partner or my daughter when she walked passed us upon entering. She ignored my partner who was at the counter ready to make an order.In the end, I called my partner away and said come on, let’s go to the syrup cafe. The owner again pulled a face like a stroppy teenager. I will not be parting with my money in this cafe until there is a new owner.

Name: Butlins
Title: Filthy pool changing rooms, tired and dated fair rides - Disappointed
Review:
Visited for our annual day trip and was looking forward to trying out the new pool. The actual pool and rides is very nice, bit of a wait for some of the slides but what can you expect on a bank holiday weekend. What I did take a big exception to was the disgusting state of the changing rooms. There was blood smeared across the walls together with god only knows what else. The floor was filthy strewn with rubbish and hair. Bultins really need to get their act together and get cleaners cleaning more regularly.
Outside the fair rides are looking a little dated and one several were not working.
Food and drinks venues very expensive and not great quality.

Overall a big disappointment, not sure if we will return for a 7th year.
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: AIr conditioned nightmare
Review:
Hermetically sealed rooms are not my idea of a perfect nights sleep. As far as I and other fellow sufferers from claustrophobia and sinus problems these rooms are a no no, Obviosly misplaced faith in the efficieny and durabality of air conditioning systems.
Read less

Name: The Deck
Title: The Deck
Review: Very impressed with the Breakfast. well worth the money. everything you could possibly want fresh hot and very tasty.

Name: The Lion
Title: Always Excellent
Review:
We have visited the Lion many times and have always had an excellent meal,
The staff are friendly and make you feel welcome
The food is excellent and the portion sizes are very generous.

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Very poor service!
Review: Waitress working on a lunch time shift on the 22nd April displayed lack of service. Took our order without asking for drinks and did not ask how are food was. Her name ( Kate ).!

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Friendy, family oriented pub and restaurant.
Review: We had Saturday lunch there after we had walked our dog. They are dog friendly. The lunch menu was varied and had a good selection to choose from. Service was welcoming, efficient and friendly. They welcome dogs in the bar area. Lunch was really nicely presented and delicious. We will be booking to return for an evening meal in the next few weeks. Recommend for a lunch time stop off for a full meal or light bites. Also some good ales if that's your thing. Once we've had dinner there I'll review again. Very much recommended.

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Not worth the money for an "indulgence room"
Review:
Didn't feel "indugent" at all! The walls and paint were scuffed. The double bed was two single divans pulled together so you slipped down the middle of the two of them. No bath, only a bare windowless shower room with lino on the floor. It is stated that not all rooms have a bath but the bathroom itself was tatty, with a cracked sink and toilet lid. Decor was more plain than stripped back. The furniture was stained with other people drinks. No minibar or fridge.

Positives - The room was clean. The bed was comfy if you didn't go close to the middle! A complimentary bottle of Proseco as it was our anniversary. The pub is excellent and the staff and breakfast both faultless. The fault does not lie with the staff or their hospitality. Fresh milk for tea in the room.

It was a large and okay b&b type room but lacked a level of polish that I would expect at this price. I felt mis-sold by Fullers, the room I got is only featured in one of their photographs (and only on the separate booking companies website) whilst the rest of their rooms look far more "indulgent!"
Read less

Name: War Memorial
Title: Lest We Forget
Review: A wonderfully kept memorial to those who gave their lives. Beautifully kept and we found it peaceful.

Name: Ristorante Al Mare
Title: If you like tasteless or undercooked pasta go here!
Review:
A group of us went to this restaurant with 5 of us choosing a vongole dish for main course. We had asked what type of pasta and been told it was Sicilian style but we had not been told it was more like pearl barley than pasta and very odd, more like a baby food. Worse though, was it had no flavour at all and so much grit from the clams it was like eating something off the beach. All four of us who had left literally the whole bowl and yet not once were we asked if there was a problem or how our meal was.
The 5th person who had ordered it, got forgotten and he ended up with a carbonara to eat after we had all stopped trying to eat ours. His though,was even worse than ours. It was so far from al dente it was basically uncooked and other than the taste of flour there was no flavouring at all.
No one seemed to care when all the full plates went back.
We did not stay for desert!

Name: Church Farm
Title: Lovely stay, pleasantly surprised
Review:
Stayed here for 2 nights last week (had to leave one day early due to work). We had a lovely time with beautiful weather. Caravan was quite far away from main areas but meant it was lovely and quiet. Clean and comfy with nice view. Entertainment in evening was great with an added bonus kids can stay until late so myself and my husband could enjoy the evenings whilst little one slept in pushchair.
Great facilities, we loved the pool and the arcades. We will definitely consider booking a haven again in the future!
Read less

Name: 47 Mussel Row
Title: Good for Goodwood
Review: A group of us old friends stay in Littlehampton for the Goodwood motoring events. I am coeliac so eating out is a bit dodgy because of the risk of cross-contamination and thus unwelcome exposure to the dreaded gluten. Mussel Row has always been one of my favourites and their confidence in delivering a `gluten-free' experience, for me, makes our visits much more relaxing. One of our `go to' places and, if you like locally sourced food, well worth a punt.

Name: Silver City
Title: Won’t be using again
Review: Used this takeaway on loads of occasions however the last couple of months quality has got worse and missing items which is frustrating as has always been great before trying others locally now

Name: Golden Grill
Title: Absolutely disgusting
Review: Absolutely terrible!! One of the worst kebabs I’ve ever had. Me and my partner got a kebab from here 2 days ago and I’ve never seen or smelt anything like it. Mine smelt like dog food which put me off straight away so therefore I didn’t even bother to go near it, however my partners looked and smelt a lot better so he continued to eat his, what a mistake that was. We was both up at 3 in the morning due to him throwing everything back up to then was woken back up at 7 to him on the toilet with one of the worst stomach aches his ever had!! I wouldn’t bother getting anything from here unless you wanna be throwing up and on the toilet for the next 24 hours. Biggest waste of money I’ve ever spent.

Name: Avisford
Title: Back to the 1980's
Review:
The Hilton at Arundel isn't really like any other Hilton I've stayed at. The room corridors are very shabby and decorated in a faded mix of orange carpets and yellow walls, which seemed not to have been improved since the 1980's. The room was dingy and pretty small and decorated in the same way. Staff were all very pleasant and the breakfast was good - but for £179, definitely not the stylish and pretty standard experience I have previously experienced with the Hilton chain. I'll check the reviews more carefully next time. I suggest that you avoid rooms 1-42 which are in the neglected part of the building.
Read less

Name: Denmans Gardens
Title: Absolutely wonderful!
Review:
I visited Denmans Gardens today with my daughter (12), son (8) and my niece (11). We had a wonderful time exploring the gardens and enjoying the amazing tea room (Kew Gardens - you need to up your game)! We were greeted by Sindy in the gift shop who shared the Denmans history and gave us some information to read on our way around. It was clear from this moment that we were about to experience something very special! The gardens are just lovely and the design so thoughtful with shape, heights, textures and colours creating such a wonderful layering effect. And lots of benches to sit and admire the views. I was pleasantly surprised about how much my children enjoyed the visit. A win win as far as I am concerned! It was also wonderful to know that by visiting we are supporting a charity whose purpose is to maintain the gardens for future generations to enjoy. The staff are delightful and so passionate about the gardens that I found the visit not just inspiring but uplifting. We will definitely return to Denmans very soon.

Katherine Brown

Name: Tea and Biscuit Club
Title: Great selection
Review: Found the perfect gift for the lovely man in my life. Real gem in a sea of antique shop. Lovely staff and great quality products.

Name: The Diner
Title: Avoid
Review:
We waited an hour for our food order which never arrived. I asked a member of staff how much longer the food would be. He did not know, at this point we witnessed a large amount of people leaving because they had waited for food that did arrive. We decided to cut our losses and leave as well.
This place needs a good shakeup to survive.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Turkish food to savour
Review: A warm Turkish welcome, fantastic choice of many Turkish dishes and all cooked so you can see it being prepared if you wish. Great food and it has quickly earned an excellent reputation with the locals who like me will go back on a regular basis.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: You pay your money and take your chances
Review: Had the Beef & Stout Pie. More like a pudding after it was nuked (soft & spongy) middle was +100 that took time to cool. Green beans not edible. It is what it is a Cheap eat

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Fab
Review: Visited with friends for dinner!! Fantastic food, well cooked steak and excellent service!!! This place is great for a couple of drinks or a meal!! Great atmosphere and friendly staff!!

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Perfect lunch!
Review:
What a little gem this restaurant is!

We were looking for lunch with the kids last week on a day out to Littlehampton, and happened on this place by chance.

The lunch menu is £7.99 per person, which also offers a carvery for the same price, and has lots of variety.

Two of our party had the carvery, which they both attested was delicious, and very generous. I had liver and bacon which was beautifully cooked, and my little daughter had a burger which was obviously handmade and she enjoyed very much.

The service was lovely and friendly too. We can't wait to go back!

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Fabulous Sunday Roast
Review: We have just returned from a late Sunday lunch and the food and service was fantastic. We had booked a table for 4 adults and arrived early but within a couple of minutes, time to order a drink at the bar and our table was ready. 2 of us had the turkey roast, 1 the beef and 1 a beef burger. All the food was great, good generous portions, great vegetables, lovely gravy and we all had ice cream/sorbet for pud. Staff were friendly, chatty, informative and attentive. Great experience, lovely atmosphere, really warm inside. We will definitely be back. Thank you Ann

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: DON'T BOTHER!!!
Review: Family day in Arundel for the festival. Looking around for restaurants which cater for vegan. Came across this one. Luckily it was past lunchtime so we got a table with ease. The waitress handed us all menu's and left us for few minutes, which was the normal thing to do. She came back and took our drinks order. The drinks took 10 minutes to arrive. Then she left us to decide on our meals. Came back five minutes later. Took our order. And we waited. And we waited. Finished our drinks. The restaurant was half empty at this point. So it wasn't because there was a rush on. After half hour my husband got up and asked where our food was and how much longer. We were first told 20 minutes longer. We said ok we're leaving, we'll pay for the drinks but we'll leave it there. Then they said, no wait, where are you sitting? Oh yeah yours is out next, so five minutes not 20. It actually was 10. When it arrived, my burger that was described as mildly spiced was hot spice, and cold in temperature. So we complained and they offered to make another. My granddaughter took a bite of hers, and again it was cold and pink in the middle. The order of chicken wings which again was described as mildly spiced, were hot spiced. So after all the waiting, cold food, half cooked burger, and spicey food we said enough was enough and we left. We said again we would pay for the drinks, but the restaurant said the drinks were free after all the upset. We ended up at the Moathouse cafe across the road. Good service, value for money and hot delicious food!! The food at this burger place was far from nice!! So my advice is, don't bother!!

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Absolutely Appalling
Review: Family meal Granddaughters 11th Birthday. Firstly shown to a table where the smell of urine was disgusting, when I stood up from my chair i realised I was sitting on a chair that had urine on my trousers were wet, when we told the staff they denied this and said someone had split pale ale - don't drink the pale ale if it smells like urine!! We asked to be moved as the smell of urine was overwhelming. They moved us. Kids ordered Margarita Pizza this came out on flat bread with cheddar cheese on my granddaughter hates cheddar cheese!! so did not eat her food. I paid £18.95 for a 10 oz Rib-eye steak when this arrived it looked like a 6 oz steak - honestly I know raw steak reduces in weight when cooked but this was ridiculous. It came with a few onion rings some chips and half a tomato where is the peas and mushrooms? Not worth the money. My husband fish and chips looked like a popular brand you buy from the supermarket nothing fresh about it not like the "Parsons Pig" in Crawley excellent food in there!! To top this our table was not cleared for ages children wanted deserts, someone came to take desert order we had not menus and the plates had not been cleared. Very bad experience will never go back again.

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Great place for eating out!!
Review: Great food and staff here. Very varied menu including carvery. Even been here for my last Christmas do!! Visited many times over the years!!

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Disappointed dogs no longer allowed inside
Review: Hadn't been for a while but on last visit we sat at our normal table with our dog tucked under the table and was told dogs were no longer allowed inside the cafe. We were amazed and really disappointed at the change of policy. On all other ocassions all the dogs were well behaved. I can understand Big or unsettled dogs not being welcome but common sense doesn't seem to apply these days.

Name: Gaston Farm
Title: Very good - Although a little let down by one of the volunteers
Review:
We visited here Easter Sunday and enjoyed a couple of hours on the farm. The tractor ride is lovely and the set up is great for getting close to the lambs, chicks and ducklings. It wasnt too busy so my daughter got lots of turns to hold the chicks. We have been here before and always been impressed. The volunteers are very good however left a little dissapointed by one this year, a young chap in the lambing section handing out the lambs to those who wanted to hold them. My daughter was waiting to be passed a lamb and as he got one and came over he was spoken to by another member of the public. He stood there holding the lamb he was about to put on my daughters lap and continued his conversation first leaving us waiting......all well and good had the conversation not been about how they "Have a bolt put to the head" obviousldy describing how they end up being killed and what is involved. I appreciate this is sadly the reality of what happens to some of the lambs but felt it a really unneccesarty conversation to have in front of children and whilst holding the lamb in his arms as we waited for him to finish describing a lambs final moments. Wasnt impressed by tis and luckily i do not think my daughter heard the conversation otherwise that couild have potentially been quite upsetting.
Read less

Name: Butlins Day Visits
Title: Total bargain
Review: When centre parks charge over 40 quid p.p to spend a day with your family, butlins invite you to visit for £12 p.p. You get to do everything the residents do and you can bring your own picnic. They even provide areas to sit and eat your own food. You can visit in summer from 9 am till you’ve had enough. A brilliant day for all the family and not a rip off price.

Name: Butlins
Title: Just for Tots Break third Visit
Review:
I visited just for Tots break this year for the third year running. My daughter always loves these breaks and being four years old this break should of been perfect for her. But here is a lost of how things have changed this year:

* Hardly anything open and what is open they are shutting before they are supposed to

* Advertised fair ground but they have removed a few rides for Toddlers height so were two rides she could actually go on

* Dont go midweek you wont get to book breakfast with the characters or any extras because people who go there at the beginning of the week have booked it all up and they dont save any spaces for mid week guests

* stayed in shoreline hotel, breakfast was cold evry morning

* New pool is great when you get to go in it, they shut it earlier than advertised and completely closed on one of the days of our stay.

* They now repeat the same shows throughout the week rather than performing different ones so if you stay for a full week be prepared to no each of the few shows available word for word

I spoke to Lyn Barlett from Butlins customer service and her response word for word was the following:

Whilst we endeavour to have all available and open as advertised, Butlins do reserve the right to make changes without prior notice across the resort.
Turning to your comments regarding the bookable activities. Unfortunately, booking these online isn't currently an available option. I appreciate that guests booking these on the day of arrival may have put you at a disadvantage.

Even after my feedback Butlins has determined that I am not entitled to any of my £250.00 back for a two night stay with breakfast. Even though we could not do the activities we wanted, the breakfast was cold and most things were shut or shut early.

My advice would be to stay away and that's coming from a loyal customer who has previously enjoyed their stay. They do not offer the same standard of service of activities anymore.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Please do not book an Oyster Bay apartment
Review:
The apartments are disgraceful, actually so depressing to stay in we left first thing Thursday of the Tots Week. We would of left Tuesday but wanted our little boy to enjoy the entertainment. This is a really shame you haven’t demolished these buildings.
If you would like to discuss further Butlins then please send me a message, your guest relations didn’t even question why we were leaving?
Read less

Name: The Bear Inn
Title: Beautiful
Review: We stopped here for a meal and a drink, we were greeted very friendly, shown to a table and was asked which drinks we would like, the menu was explained to us very well, we had the 2 meals for £10 and after we were told we could have an ice cream for an extra £1, which we did, not just plain ice cream but mint/choc chip ( my favourite ) all in all a lovely place to go,

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Delicious food, wonderful service
Review:
Enjoyed a superb Sunday night dinner at the Swan recently. My other half went for the roast chicken, which she said was one of the best she’s ever had, and I devoured a succulent sirloin steak that had been cooked to perfection. Washed down with a beautiful Malbec. It was heavenly.

The restaurant is very cosy, and the service was exemplary. Couldn’t fault anything.
Read less

Name: Ford Market
Title: Parked my car in a slightly wrong area as I wasn't familiar with the site. I was asked to move it by a woman and was discussing this with her when a man over 6' foot tall came over who verbally abused me threatened to f*****g kill me and move my f*****g car now. He shouted swore
Review: Verbally Abusive & Rude staff ignorant and a potentially violent manager

Name: Cedar
Title: Lovely food
Review:
The restaurant is in the Hilton at Arundel. My sister in law and I had a groupon deal which included use of the pool and sauna. Here I will just rate the restaurant and lounge. We had 3 courses each all of which were delicious. The service was unhurried and polite. Wine by the glass is usual hotel prices. I ate here 5 years ago and the restaurant was posher (if that’s a word!). Now it is more conference centre. There are no tablecloths on the table which does make a different feel to the place. Last time we came to celebrate my husbands 50th. I wouldn’t come here for a celebration again. That “special” feel is lacking in the restaurant. The adjoining lounge is great to have a coffee or beer and to relax and chat.
I would come back with the Groupon deal as the food is great but it needs to be less conference hotel to entice me back for a special occasion

Name: Butlins
Title: Christmas 2018!!
Review:
First Christmas away from home with the Beans. We were apprehensive about going and what to expect but Butlin’s you exceeded all our dreams! We stayed in a seaside appartment and it was perfect for all our needs. The Beans were made up when we arrived to find a selection box on their bed and the crackers, napkins, horns and raindeer food where a lovely gesture! We stocked up our fridge and small freezer for lunches and ate out every night. We enjoyed fish and chips, pizza and Burger King all of which were reasonably priced. The children enjoyed throwing away their money in the arcade and watching the shows in the evening! We enjoyed our break so much that we have booked to come back next year for Christmas again!
Read less

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: dinner
Review: very good pub for food good service could have done with more staff on but food excellent good range of gin wich i like

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Just amazing
Review:
This place is just awesome and well worth a visit, get the ticket for everything otherwise you'll miss out. The gardens are incredible and well worth a visit on their own. So much to see in the castle but could make a lot more of the history. Still well worth the visit...
Read less

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Great service
Review:
Really lovely food good service staff helpful, reasonable money wise
Nice and clean would go to this restaurant again

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Weekend break
Review:
Lovely hotel, perfect location, really nice room, almost......can’t fault the standard of our room just don’t understand why there was no shower in the bath, even a shower attachment rather than a proper shower fitting would have been more practical than both of us having to have a bath and me having to borrow a jug so that I could wash my hair 😕
Read less

Name: Wheatsheaf
Title: Christmas lunch
Review:
Fantastic time at The Wheatsheaf, perfect for a get-together.
Lovely food and very well looked after. Thank you guys xxxxxx

Name: Butlins
Title: Just arrived what a joke
Review:
Well just arrived at main entrance no disabilities parking have to sent from main entrance to axe entrance no one knows what to do this is just start will now they have given us some else booking room real.
Read less

Name: Spring Cottage B&B
Title: A lovely week at Spring Cottage
Review:
We have just come back from a lovely week at Spring Cottage.

Nothing is too much trouble for Michele the host, breakfast is amazing and the rooms are beautiful. Out room was stylish with lovely artwork and bed linen, with all the added extras anyone could ask for.

The garden and terrace allowed us to make great use of the lovely weather too!

Name: Tea and Biscuit Club
Title: Tea for two
Review: Popped in last week and to be honest wasn't to sure what we wanted. We were doing the wondering tourist thing. We were warmly welcomed and invited to look at and smell the scent of many different teas with advice on how to blend them correctly. We ended buying 3 packets and have been enjoying them since. It was also good to see that arundle castle was also using them. Great local business.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Still not great
Review: Revisited after a bad meal last year , though I’d try it again , food was ok but not brilliant , the salad bar was virtually empty and wasn’t restocked for a while . Sadly I think this is our last visit , shame

Name: Town House
Title: A short stay...
Review: Great accommodation - right next to the castle. Cosy and comfortable rooms with a lovely view from the top floor. Close to everything you would want to visit. Perfect spot! Amazing, warm welcoming staff. We will definitely go back!

Name: Swanbourne Lodge
Title: Lovely area, bad service.
Review: It was nice sitting near all the birds on the lake but the service left much to be desired; the woman who served us was very rude to us and didn't seem like she wanted to be there. Lovely area though- maybe bring a picnic instead.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Established a place for itself in Rustington
Review:
Been a few times now for drinks and food. Can’t argue with their statements below although not sure “elegant is the best word”, maybe stylish.
“On the corner of Ash Lane and the street, elegant Establo Lounge is in the heart of Rustington. We’re a cool, light and airy open plan space stretching across two floors with full height windows (that open up all the way) and a fantastic terrace at the front, perfect for people watching. We pride ourselves on serving a really great range of food and drinks (including full kids, gluten free and vegan menus) in a warm, welcoming, laid back atmosphere”

Name: Anokha
Title: Delightful takeaway as usual
Review: All I can say is wow. Anokha is our usual fave Indian restaurant for both eat in and take away. Last couple of takeaways have been delivered later than advised and I was a little skeptical to order again. However when I called the man who answered the phone remembered we had a long wait last time and was apologetic and open an honest with tonight’s delivery time. It arrived well within time scale he had promised and omg the food was fantastic. Fresh and abundant. Anokha remains our all time fave still

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Great place highly recommended
Review:
Many thanks to bev the manager extremely helpful friendly very polite excellent place to stay very clean and well organised
Bev is a great manager very professional with great knowledge of the area great advice on where to eat and where to go
Many thanks

Name: Arun Leisure Centre
Title: In real need of some TLC
Review: I have been going to the arun for years and cannot fault their swimming lessons. They are such a reasonable price and both of my children have loved them. My main issue is with the general care of the place. It just seems that so much money has been spent on a glitzy reception and cafe whilst the poolside and changing rooms are frankly disgusting. The reception staff also barely acknowledge you and are often quite rude which is very off putting. I've been a regular visitor for nearly 9 years and in that time the same family cubicles/baby changing facilities are broken and it seems have never been repaired. Half the showers never work in the ladies and if they do the water is always freezing. The toilets are also so dirty that my son nearly had an accident on the way home from his lesson as that was preferable to him using the facilities available. Come on Arun. The fundamentals are there, the lessons are amazing. Money just desperately needs to be spent on cleanliness and basic repairs.

Name: Parpadelle
Title: Lovely looking restaurant - shame about the food
Review:
I ate here with my 3 year son after looking for a casual Italian restaurant. Typically you can't go wrong with italian food for a little one and Parpadelle looked cosy yet casual from the outside. It turns out the menu downstairs is different from upstairs (I didn't realise there was an upstairs until later in the meal). I ordered a kids margherita pizza and moule frites

The kids pizza came up. The base was flavourless and undercooked and it was smothered in cheese and covered with herbs and rocket salad. Fine for an adult. Not fine for a fussy 3 year old.

The mussels were worse. I ordered it with chips but was offered bread as there was plenty of sauce. I said yes to this but then turned out it was bread OR chips so never received the chips. It didn't matter in any case as the mussels hadn't been washed and I after 4-5 mouthfuls of grit and sand I gave up and sent it back and picked at the equally inedible pizza.

On the upside the service was friendly. The waitress did apologise and said she would tell the chef / not charge for the mussels which was fine. But in the end I just left hungry and would have preferred to pay for food I could eat.

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: No idea I'd be stopping in a cresh.
Review:
First of all the motel is clean ish! Very very dated compared to the other over the road.
The staff on reception are helpful and polite so absolutely no problem there.
I personally am booked in here through my work I have little choice where I stay when you work for a very large corporate who do all your bookings for you .
This is my second week of staying in this motel and between 9 am and 12pm the place has become a cresh, the cleaners have obviously brought there children with them to work as its school holidays and yes child care costs a fortune but on the same foot staying here also does.
My job involves working into the small hours and therefore being in bed all day ( or trying to be )
All around the corridors are signs saying please keep quiet people may be sleeping and I Personally hang the sign on the door to say I'm sleeping.
Now I've done this for years and I sleep with earplugs in but sadly here I'm plagued by children playing in the corridors outside my room it's a big place and I've looked outside to have a word with the cleaners but they are not even on this level the kids are just running around being kids because they don't know better.
Just be warned if your thinking of staying here .
Read less

Name: Arden B&B
Title: One Night Stay
Review:
Lucie is a wonderful host and will look after all of your needs and requirements. I can not recommend Arden House Bed and breakfast highly enough for a stay, in and around the Arundel Area. Its very well situated within the centre of Arundel along with off street parking and is also a very short walk from the pubs and restaurants.
Read less

Name: Robin Hood
Title: A tasty lunch down the pub
Review: Cosy, friendly and relaxed atmosphere in this beautiful old English Inn. We have two lunchtime meals here recently, both lovely. Our server for both occasions, Becky, was helpful, friendly and attentive.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Visit to gardens and festival of tulips
Review:
Great way to spend s few hours. Since our last visit to the gardens, 5 years ago a lot of money and time has been spent. The results are spectacular. The visit was eye warming and worthwhile. Glad we went! I'm not sure how much longer they will last. Maybe one or two weeks.
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Hot room and woken by staff
Review:
The price of the hotel was very reasonable but the room we stopped in was extremely hot and had to request for the heating to be turned down. This was sorted but the room was still hot.
Secondly at 8:00 in the morning a member staff tried to enter our room without knocking or making themselves present. Luckily we had the latch across the door. In result of this we was fully awake and was at unease.
Thanks, Shane.
Read less

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Awful customer service, mistakes made & very rude.
Review: We ordered a takeaway, the vegetatrian korma was instead a chicken korma. We phoned up to tell them of the mistake, they re-read our order to us which listed the veg korma, the phone was then passed to the "manager" who told us we were wrong as he personally packed the bag and definitely packed a veg korma. He questioned if we'd checked our order properly... which obviously we had... this is why we were complaining. I understand mistakes happen, but to be told we were wrong and argued with was not acceptable. We had a break from this restaurant for a few years as we had the same experience then. We thought as it had been a long time since our last experience (of being sent the wrong order, then argued with when we phoned up to complain) that things should have changed, only to have the same experience again. Really poor service. We won't be back.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Disappointing lunch
Review:
We were looking forward to a special 3 course lunch but after the first course it went rapidly downhill. We received a lovely welcome from the waiters and thoroughly enjoyed the delicious home made rolls and celeriac and apple soup which was excellent. However we had a very long wait for our main course of hake. The plates were only just warm. Then when we eventually were served our sticky toffee pudding it was cold, the pudding was hard and solid, the ice-cream portion far too small for the amount of pudding and rich sauce. The restaurant itself was lovely and the tables beautifully laid however.
Read less

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Very disappointing
Review: My vegetarian selection was absolutely tasteless, lukewarm and I had stomach cramps and was very sick that night. My partners' meal, which was a vegetarian burger was basically a jumble of vegetables that just fell apart in a mess from the bun. We have eaten at the Spotted Cow several times in the past but it seems to have gone badly downhill and the food was extremely disappointing and certainly not worth the money.

Name: India Gate
Title: Very Dissapointing!
Review: I did not read all the reviews, wish I had. A very dissapointing meal. My Lamb Samosas were small and tasteless, as was my husbands onion Baghi. His Tandori mixed grill looked a mess and poor quality meats- my Madras did not arrive and I was told I had not ordered it-it did arrive and I wondered if it was Mircowaved , the rice portion was small portion. I have been a restaurteur/chef and I took pride in the meals I served. The staff appeared to not want your patronage, with no smiles or asking if your dinner was ok. The food is overpriced, I will not be going back.

Name: Church Farm
Title: Worst week ever !!
Review:
When we arrived there was no one on the gate to welcome us or direct us.
We had a 20minute wait to get the keys as the caravan wasnt ready. We found drugs in the kitchen cupboard, used straws and lollipop sticks under the bed, creams under the sink. It was filthy. The kichten blind was broken,the toilet blind fell off and the window in the double bedroom had a 2inch gap at the top where it had dropped. There was cigarette butts everywhere around the caravan. We complained to reception, security came to take the drugs. Someone did come and fix the window. The kitchen blind wasnt fixed and the toilet blind was just hung back up but only resting on the clips. We wasnt even offered an alternative caravan. And was told "the cleaners only clean what they see." The water went off on the Tuesday, we had no communication until I received I text on the Wednesday at 10am. Luckily we had spoken to the security guard and he had explained what was happening. All we heard from reception all week was it's not our fault. We had to buy our own bottled water for drinks. I've complained again since coming home and have been told we could have used the toilets in the complex. We were the furthest point away from the complex with a 4 year old and our elderly parents, that all use the toilet throughout the night. The complex dont open through the night!!
Read less

Name: Ristorante Al Mare
Title: Had a brlliant evening!
Review:
We celebrated my wife's birthday with over 20 of us gathered around the table and we had a fantastic evening!
The food was top quality, the service was amazing, all the staff worked really hard and were successful in making it a memorable celebration. Nothing was too much trouble for them
There was a lovely atmosphere as soon as we walked in and continued until we left. If we could turn the clock back would we change anything? Absolutely not!

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: A Hidden gem in West Sussex
Review: Visited the Oyster Catcher on Saturday night with some family . Just a short drive from the seaside town of Littlehampton . Grant firsts impressions , very nice building thatched cottage effect . We were seated immediately by our server Liz who I cannot praise enough . WE were offered two menus the weekend special and the regular menu . Liz explained both menus in detail . Great value weekend menu with lots of variety and choice including drinks . Food was excellent , served in a timely manner , desserts were gorgeous especially the gin and elder flower brûlee . Definitely worth a visit .

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: retirement meal
Review: never been here before was recommended. everything great. staff service food.Several of the party had eaten here before.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Lunch
Review:
Had lunch here after swimming
Food was nice portions size was ok
Think opening times need to be extended

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Sunday breakfast.
Review: A very relaxed and enjoyable family breakfast. We were greeted and served at our table by Sharon. Food and service were excellent and can easily recommend the Crossbush to everyone

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Great location / very average food which is overpriced.
Review: Nice location for a riverside drink on a sunny day. However, the food was cold and overdone. It felt like half the meal was microwaved and which meant the parts that should be crispy (ie chips) were cold. The burger was overlooked and my wife’s pie was salty! The worst part is that it was quiet when we ate, which in my opinion is when the they should be able to serve the best food. Overpriced for what should be a great meal. Very disappointed.

Name: Carlyle's Café
Title: A great brunch...
Review: A very pleasant experience... clean and neat... excellent value with really nice staff... Extensive menu for day time eating... Lloyd

Name: The Beresford
Title: The young man serving the
Review: The young man serving the food was extremely rude to a guest in front of me, so much so I was embarrassed to the point I talked to the guest and said I felt so bad for him. However! the roast beef was chewy and I explained this and was told I should have said earlier, which I tried to do but the waitresses were busy. I would rate it as a school dinner with a rude prefect serving. Will never go back it was my second time the first time was as bad. Sorry I may just have been to better places, and cook a good roast myself..... and will go other places in future.

Name: Butlins
Title: Rooms disappointing
Review:
We paid £586 for 4 nights in the silver rooms. We had a double and a twin room.

Neither of the TVs had any signal.
There were only two sockets per room. All were far away from the bed - which is problematic because a family member has respiratory equipment that needs to be plugged in and used overnight.

Pretty disgusting they’re ripping off families for profit.
Read less

Name: Black Horse
Title: Excellent
Review:
Had Sunday lunch a few weeks ago on the recommendation of friends and it was excellent. Went back with different friends from Bedfordshire to try the regular menu.

Not cheap but worth every penny. I had the steak and Guineas pie after a bad steak and ale pie elsewhere ( review queried because the owner falsely accused us of not having eaten there). My wife had the curry, her friend the salmon fish cakes and her friend’s partner the same as me. Desserts were ice cream (me), Banana caramel mess (my wife), her friend had Creme brûlée and the partner sticky toffee pudding. Faultless.

The only problem is the small car park but the road is very quiet so you can park off site easily.

Name: Avisford
Title: October stay
Review:
We stayed her for a quick relax before school half term as a small treat. The staff are good but dealing with a hotel in need of repair and restoration. The rooms are tied no heating and the noise from hall ways and above made it impossible to get any sleep. We booked for dinner and when we sat down later that evening were told basically there was nothing on The menu. Because we hadn’t booked anywhere else or told they didn’t have anything we were stuck with picking a few thing off the snack menu. Food came out at different times and we had finished by the time our daughter got her food as they prepared it wrong. I have always believed in the Hilton chain but this site is terrible and we got far from the usual Hilton experience. What a shame :(
Read less

Name: White Horses
Title: Friendly Hosts
Review:
We have just spent a lovely few days at the White Horses. Lovely location, very close to the sea front and a few minutes walk from a good selection of pubs/restaurants.
Bognor Regis itself is only about a mile away along the level promenade. There is plenty to see and do in the area and if you like walking, the promenade stretches in both directions.
Jacky and Mark were excellent hosts and very friendly. The bedroom was spacious With a lovely large en-suite bathroom. The bed was one of the most comfortable we have slept in.
The day started with an excellent choice of fresh fruit salad, yoghurt, cereal, toast and traditional English breakfast, which set us up for the rest of the day.
It was such a friendly and welcome place, that we are already looking forward to a return visit.

Name: Sea View Hotel
Title: Good Bar and Restaurant
Review: Good menu choices, and selection of drinks, in a large room and beer garden with plenty of tables. All great taste and quality.

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Very Disappointing
Review:
Following the Swan's recent refurbishment we thought we would try Sunday Lunch it has never really appealed in the past but it had been a given a lovely 'makeover'
We booked a table for 1.30 and were very disappointed when our table was out the back somewhere even though there were tables free in the main restaurant but were were told they were reserved why that was different from booked in advance we couldnt determine.
It was even more disappointing when this appeared to be the area reserved for people with children who unfortunately treated it as a playroom!
We ordered 'roast ' which was a long long time coming and frankly when it arrived it was dry and not up to the standard of many other restaurants in the Arundel area. The portion was also mean two small slices of beef!!
All in all very disappointing !! Shant be going back!
Read less

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Rude and unfriendly staff
Review: After a visit to Arundel Castle, we called by at this cafe to check it out only to be pounced on by a rude and aggressive member of staff who insisted we sit down immediately or leave, and then went on to conjecture that we had already eaten in town, which was not true. It was all very odd and we certainly didn't feel tempted to stay.

Name: Foxwood
Title: Bank holiday
Review: The campsite itself is very nice but I struggle to understand how they can charge so much for a pitch when they offer no facilities. We paid £170 for three nights and stayed in the forest section. We were told we couldn't forage for wood to make a fire (surely that's part of the fun of staying in the forest) and had to buy it from the reception. Showers were good but that's about it!

Name: The Deck
Title: Great Food
Review: Just really great food. 8-year-old daughter always loves it and eats well. Plenty of buffet-style food with plenty of choices. Staff always smiling and very happy to help.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Lovely day out
Review:
We decided to visit Arundel castle as it's been a few years since our last visit, they didn't have the garden last time, but they are just beautiful to wonder around and the staff in the castle are so helpful, we also enjoyed the call to arms crusade day.
Read less

Name: Moathouse Café
Title: Not good- very over priced and food terrible
Review: Ate there today, it’s everything I dislike about tourist town cafes overpriced for really poor quality food, it’s not good and as a family £29 for lunch seems reasonable but when you don’t eat most of it as so poor not good. please don’t waste your money try somewhere else

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Food not great
Review: Very hit and miss with food. Convienient location but would avoid anything on the menu that wasn’t a burger or chilli. Tapas is very poor, the large basket of bread you get with it doesn’t make up for it. The staff seem friendly if there are no queues, but honestly avoid the food, overpriced and poor quality.

Name: Portuguese Grill
Title: Never had a bad meal here
Review: Located In the precinct in Littlehampton, this is an authentic Portuguese cafe. Very friendly staff, and very good food indeed. They also have a licence, so you can enjoy a drink with you meal.

Name: Cockburns Tea Rooms
Title: Fabulous Afternoon tea
Review: My daughter and I enjoyed a fabulous afternoon tea. The sandwiches, cakes and scones were all delicous. We were offered refills of everything plus scones could be requested to be warmed, which made them even more tasty. Service was excellent. Definitely recommend and will return. It was lovely to find a teashop that served tea in fine china cups.

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Worst Sunday lunch ever.
Review:
Well - I have just returned home at the end of a day when my family and I experienced what must be one of the worst lunch experiences ever.
