Sure the prices may have increased in recent years but the Picturedrome is still fantastic value and has been heavily invested in on the last 10 years adding 2 additional screens and improve the amenities. Definitely the best value cinema for miles! And the added value of the unique setting of a historic building styled in bygone era of movie theatre.
Read less

Name: Findon Rest
Title: Handy for Worthing Cemetery But
Review:
Booked for me, too Budget. Staffless so serviceless. Two of the 4 poor parking spaces occupied by stone horse trough. Last arrivers must park outside naighbours properties, which I bet they love. Room too small for 2 to walk and dress in, even with only a 4.5ft bed. Noisy Massorator plumbing.
Advertised as a motel but is 4 bed 2 floor shed on small triangular plot.
Even in little Findon there are other better options.

Name: Swanbourne Lodge
Title: Freshly made sandwiches
Review: Our crab sandwich was so good and freshly made . Eat in or take to eat on a bench by the lake. Watch out for greedy seagulls however. It is just a 15 min walk from town, or find a parking space in the lane.

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Non returner
Review: Despite reading previous trip advisors regarding The Spotted Cow we thought we would come for Sunday lunch, the service was attentive yet slow to receive drinks to our table. On ordering Roast dinners that we opted for they came quickly to the table, the meat was very fatty and the food itself was not hot which I would expect! We had to ask again for more drinks and for dessert menus. Very disappointed visit.

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Wonderful
Review: Visiting friends locally and they chose this location for a meal as they had heard good reviews. We certainly weren’t disappointed. Lovely lively restaurant very busy on a Saturday night . Great menu with plenty of choices for all courses. Service was excellent and attentive. Really loved all of my food. Would definitely return. .

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Family members birthday meal
Review: A party of 12 family members went here on 29th september, most of us ordered the roast lamb or beef, the lamb was chops without the bone not carved slices that you would expect, the slow cooked beef looked like liver and was dry, the roast potatoes (that you can have as many as you want) i am a trained chef and i would say were frozen although when i emailed beefeater they denied this, the potatoes were hard and unpleasant, the roast dinners cost £13.99, the service was okay, although we did have to wait quiet a while, we spent over £200 (luckily one of the party had a voucher, we will not be returning, we will just go back to the Toby.

Name: Cissbury Ring
Title: Ancient
Review:
The walk from Findon up the path to the Cissbury ring is tremendous. The views along the way are stunning. And on top of the ring, ponies. Enjoy this walk.
Read less

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Disappointed!!!!
Review: A friend and I went to our local pub for a meal today and upon asking for the menus we were informed they had stopped serving food as they had a quiz starting at 8pm. We wanted to order just before 7.30!!! Not really the way to treat local regulars with this kind of service so left extremely disappointed especially as we had been told that with the new landlord taking over things had improved greatly with the food. It would have been better customer service if the bar had announced that they had stopped serving or a notice was written somewhere on one of their boards informing people of the kitchen closure. It will be a while before we return which is a great shame having both worked there for two years and have continued to use the pub since leaving...

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Mr
Review:
Love it here. £3.50 a seat Fair price refreshments. Pleasant staff. And local. What's not to like. Good selection of movies. Caters for school holidays really well
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Great food
Review: Have eaten in here many times before. Staff are always very friendly and service is good. A great choice of meals on the menu and always tastes good.

Name: Regency Rooms
Title: Great find!!
Review: This little hotel is very boutique, what a great find in a lovely location. The hotel contacted when I booked and before I checked in. Attention to detail is everything for me and they really do have everything on hand. I wish I was staying longer and I will definitely stay again!!

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Stunning....
Review:
Beautiful location and breathtaking buildings. Gardens are incredible and leaves in awe of the beauty surrounding this incredible castle! Well worth a visit
Read less

Name: Monsoon
Title: Best curry in Sussex!
Review: We were very impressed with the food here. The chicken, veg and prawns dishes were cooked from fresh and the food was delicious! The surroundings were stunning and clean. Service with a smile and great hospitality from Fahad who took back our swooning compliments back to the chef. We will be coming back!! You had two very happy curry lovers singing your praises!

Name: Butlins
Title: butlins bognor regis 4 nights stay for tots break programme 3rd june -6th june 2019
Review:
This my first time coming to a butlins resort, i expected high service and standards , i was checked in a place that was noisy and in the middle of there entertainment area called skyline dome for the children which i never expected, i hardly could hear the representative and felt i had to raise my voice, The room location was good near the main entertainment are skyline dome, however it was inconvenience to get up there with a pram and a toddler and my luggage. the room was up a flight of metal staircase that stated its dangerous as it had slip signs. I was not impressed there was no lifts to reach your room. My luggage had to be left by the stairs and taken up gradually, There no security or safety as anyone can help them selves to luggage especially as we had to take our toddler up the stairs with his pram first and put in the room and have 1 of us to look after toddler, whilst the other loaded the luggage 1 by 1 up the stairs to our room.
As a result my nikon camera and camera bag went missing, it was stolen off our trolley, and we did not get it back, be aware there a lot of thief's ,they can be EITHER \ the guest and staff in the resort. if there was a lift we could park our trolley in front of the room and load instantly without losing our belongings to a thief.

Our dinner plan was ridiculous we could not eat later then 6pm under the basic dinning plan which was not stated at the time of my booking I made online or when I went to the resort, I only found out when i was turned away from the restaurant. They have premium dining but you only get another extra 1. 5 hours.

The toilets in the resort do not flush properly you have hard time getting the tissue down let alone your own number 2's. In Our room I had to call for the plumber 3 times ,twice for toilet and once for the shower as the water wasnt going down in the shower tray.Then the hot water tap all of sudden stopped working and my husband and i needed a shower, they was no one at guest services as they close by 8pm. my husband could not find where to go , he enquired with burger king staff as they open until late, they told him to go to the first aid room for security. The security put an alert out for the plumber to sort our hot water out. this was not done until 11pm. he was quick to come but its not great again we have no phone number to call for assistance.

 the entertainment also has restrictions the rides inside catered for my toddler, however the soft play had 2 areas and he was restricted as he was under the height and they do not allow adults to accompany child in the soft play, bizzare as my son a member at cheeky chimps and he can do all the soft play areas without me being there or if needs assistance ,im not allowed to enter and help. They had a animals area but did not know the times for animal to be let out for child to handle. This was not on there programme itinerary. It was great lots of fun activities for children to do on their itinerary programme from play-dough and art crafts and( pottery painting and go karts and mini golf was all extra charges which i did not think was fair as I paid alot of money for the entertainment passes 90 pound person including this rate for my 2 years old.If your into the teletubbies mr men and milkshake mr potato head and paddington bear you enjoy the shows.

The BRAND NEW splash pool thats there has new water pool and slides area it is fantastic for the adults and kids. however again there was restrictions on 2 of the slides my child too small and they would not allow him in the lazy river or the faster log flume. I agree their health and safety risks however i would not endanger my son safety, i held him at all times when i went on the lazy river and did not let him out of my sight. the fast log flume was not that fast, the racer slide was more faster and that did startle my child. I was refused the lazy river on my last day, other days i went on with my child, their staff neglected there duties here, as they did not check my son height the first 2 days at all and allowed us on the ride together. I been to dubai and turkey and egypt they allow my son on the water slides and rides that had height restrictions as sole person, as long as I accompanied him and for further safety they gave mats and inflatable rings.

I recommend to stay on self catering as you can eat at your own time and pace with out feeling rushed. And have a treat at the restaurants that operate later. the fish and chips and the dinner and pub kitchen i recommend highly. papa johns i did not rate it worsen then pizza hut and i only ever go pizza oven bake places like zizzi or pizza express which better.

You get to have photo shoots with the character that they have for entertainment which is great but they need more time slots. And when i went to collect my photos like everyone else did on the last day we felt rushed. as we needed to eliminate photos so we had the best choose. its expensive it cost 35 quid for 5 photos. even then the assistant cut out the pic incorrectly and was refusing to rectify and kept it professional and said ive paid for a service and it expect it perfect.

My last night at the resort we could not get into our room the door would not open, I had to call emergency phone number that was provided to me after I made a complaint about having to go to the guest services in person as no phone provided in the room to call for assistance on our first night when had to go out to get a plumber service. We had a reception area by our room but it was operational only 3 days out of the 5 days being there and for short period of time only. We was not informed about a 24hr services if they was emergency at all. we just had to wait until the morning to get hold of guest services to complain for services we did not received.
They dont even provide basic to be at hand easily like a plastic rubbish bin lining. We had to pop out to get hold of lining bags.
we waited a bout 15 minutes to get our door reopened so we can enter this disturbed my son sleep as it was 930pm and he needed to go to sleep. in the result he ended up weeing himself as he needed toilet and we could not get inside the room. He also caught a mild cold the next day as it was windy waiting outside. my husband got a cold as well. The door battery was changed by another technician as the first technician just tried using a master key to open the door, so he came ill- prepared. Finally we got in,
The outdoor play areas great you have 3 playgrounds for the kids. then a cars driving school area , archery, football, and mini golf areas. The traditional fairground area looked better in the pictures, when we got there it needs re painting to brigthen up, there restricted times again it opens 10am until 4pm. if only it stayed open until 6pm. Again height restrictions in place for toddler on certain rides, however the most ridiculous was the bumper cars, I went recently to chessington adventure world park, and my son was allowed to go on the bumper cars, I have been to locaL fairgrounds in my area and he been allowed here he was not allowed, even though he be accompanied by an adult who drive the bumper car. As a result not many parents used the bumper cars as they had toddler my son height. I complaint to the guest services and they said the safety regulations are set by the ride company however I been to chessington park which is more of a specialist in rides and they allowed my son? I felt the guest services just made poor excuses and were controlling the situations to there advantage so toddler are kept restricted.

The go karts area allowed children over 97cm on with adult however this was not clear to me I was told as long as my toddler was over 90cm when i waited over 20 mins and it was our turn my son was measured and we told we cant take the go kart course. we went to get refund and told why and it was obvious because of ,my son height. The the helter skleter ride i got to the top and turned away it was a very steep climb and exhausting as i carrying my toddler. refused for not having a long sleeve top on. I wasnt told this before been handed the sacks to sit on by the assistant. I was very annoyed and frustrated. as it was tight squeeze to get pass other parents and children to climb back down the steps.
Yet this was called a tots break events programme.

Overall they good point and bad but the accommodation, checkin area improved alot. and after hours services need to be explained better, the information pack provided did not have any contact number or information to say where to go for after hours emergency. only had an email which isnt gonna be a fast response like a phone call is. Entertainment passes need to be reduced for a toddler rate, Also the fairground rides height restrictions changed on certain rides that are safe for toddler when accompanied by adults. yet this is called a tots friendly break programme

 urgent attention is for wheelchair person could not have the apartments as they do not cater for them and this is the cheaper alternative. there no lifts for them to access either or wide paths to get around and to your apartment room.
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Nothing is like it is stated
Review:
Staff is very nice and trying to do the best comparing to what they can provide or they can work with.
Food is ok, though they do not have anything like it is stated on the menu. The main courses like lamb shank, salmon is spotless, great, but the side dish is not what you order. With none of the orders. They provide a few vegan food, but more then half of it they ran out. (On a Sunday it means the restaurant is not prepared for guests.) It is hard for a vegan person.
Not mentioning the problems with the coffee.
Payment is complicated f you want to share the bill with your friends. Basically a menu is thrown to you and calculate and figure it out on your own what you ordered and need to pay.
A well operated place is doing that you say what you ordered they add up on there terminal and it is done, bill is out.
Very expensive related to the quality and value.
Cheaper, less known places provides better food.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Very Poor Customer Service!
Review: I visited for lunch with a friend and our 3 young children as a half-term treat. The food took ages to arrive and when it did the chips were extremely overcooked. I complained to the waitress who happily brought us one replacement portion (we had originally ordered 3 portions in total). However, we thanked her and carried on with our meal. After the meal my 6 year old found a £2 coin on the floor, he was so chuffed with himself, even having a bit of childhood banter with his brother (finders keepers losers weepers ect). When the waitress came with our bill he happily told her what he had found, she responded by saying that she had lost 1 earlier so it must be hers. I lightheartedly wished her luck trying to get it back off him, and he carried on similar banter with the waitress as he had been doing with his brother (he is 6!). She told him he was rude and that it was hers and she had earned it. I was flabbergasted that a member of staff could talk to a young child like that. When she returned to take our payment she turned to my son and asked him if he was going to give it back to her (which surprisingly he did with out having a meltdown). I could not believe my ears, had it been a note I could of understood it a bit better (not her attitude) but taking a £2 coin from a young child (who thought he had won the lottery) is not acceptable in my book. I had intended on leaving a larger tip to compensate her but no chance after that! I shall not be visiting again in the near future.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Awful
Review: Visited at 4.00pm on Tuesday. Service painfully slow although the place was nearly empty, when the food came it had obviously been under a heat lamp too long. The curry was congealed as was the children’s baked beans. The fries were over cooked and cold, a really bad experience.

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Disappointing
Review: Visited as a small celebration with family. I ordered Halibut as I have had it before here and it was really nice. When it arrived it was clearly not Halibut but Cod in batter. When I questioned it the waitress clearly had no idea about the difference but still told me it was Halibut. When I told her again it was Cod she spoke to the chef who told me it was Halibut. I definitely know the difference between the two but the staff clearly don't which is a bit worrying. When the bill came it did not appear on there which suggests they knew it wasn't what I ordered, but not a single apology. It is also extremely expensive, all deserts were about £7, which for a fruit salad is a lot. I will not choose to go there again.

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Man in Restraunt is more interested in counting his tips on the side than serving!
Review: Visited this pub for a Sunday dinner as it came highly recommended and was nothing but disappointed when we arrived we were told where the restraunt was walked there and stood like lemons for 10 minutes with another couple and the restraunt was nearly empty then a man showed us a table chucked some paper on the table which was what I guess the only menu it took us a further 15 minutes to find him and get some attention whilst he was counting his tips in the jar on the side and kept saying YES one minute please!!! We then got told if we don’t like the menu go and find the specials board?! Couldn’t see it anywhere and felt uncomfortable so left, the restraunt staff clearly need to learn basic customer service very rude and un professional, I might add the other couple also got up and left!

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Third rate hotel
Review:
hugely overpriced
bedroom not made up,no soap in shower. Poor decoration,no bar, no restaurant only a vending machine.
Generally very very very bad value for the money. Although there was a revival on in Goodwood and bedrooms in the area were hard to come by there is no way an hotel of this standard should be allowed to charge £148.00 a night.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Dreadful
Review:
Popped in on the off chance.
Shown to table, told our waitress Emma would be with us soon.
No drinks offered whilst we wait.
After 15 minutes we were asked by Emma was everything okay?
Said we wanted to order our food, she said I didn’t see you there!
Food arrived nicely presented and very delicious.
The manager offered the dessert menu, we declined but asked for the bill.
A further 15 minutes, the waitress appears, we ask for the bill again.
Not a great experience.

Name: Butlins
Title: Day Visit at Butlins......
Review:
We went for a Family Day Visit at Butlins Bognor Regis......
We went straight to the new swimming pool which is awesome and had sections to suit everyone.....a small children area with slides and another section with a splash zone then a wave zone & a area where you can swim and where it's deeper water mostly suited for the adults.....
Lots of slides and a family ride & the Rapids is so much fun we were in there 3 hours with our 3 little ones....
Then went to hv dinner at the pub located on the Resort then headed to fun fair not realising it closed at 6pm.
But that's why I hvnt given 5 stars!
The rides are meant to close at 6pm but most were closing at 5.50!!! My little girl was told she silent go on the ladybird's as he was closing it was 5.52! Not 6pm....then my boys went into soft play area and got to top then told to get out as they were closing!!! Why let children in if your going to close minutes later??
So we headed outside to the slide & it was 5.56 and got turned away again!!! Apparently they only get paid up to 6pm so they were closing up early other rides were still open!!! They were both very rude and said well it may not be 6pm but we only get paid till 6pm so we are off they were very rude!
I went and complained to Guest Services with another 2 guests and upset children and it was arranged to be reopened for our children to all have a go! But I hope that the staff member will be doubt with! As he didn't seem to care much about the children beingnuoset & was not professional at all.
Only downside to the day!
Read less

Name: India Gate
Title: Best
Review: Can honestly say one of the nicest Indian meals I've had, good sign was really busy on a Monday night, only about for couple of days but would of gone again

Name: Norfolk Gardens
Title: Lovely golf setting by the sea. Shame about extremely rude staff who locked us in after hours! Will not be back!
Review: Tagged along with husband and his mate so they could knock around the beautiful 9 holes here late on a Saturday afternoon.A young 6 year old boy who doesn't play golf at all in our party showed and interest half way around so my husband showed him how to do a few swings. The old miserable man working there came and had a go at us calling us dishonest for not paying for him when he hadn't actually played the 9 holes, (and nor did the guys in the end!) He ended up saying that his wife was waiting for him to go home and we had held him up from leaving and locked us in without telling us he would do so.Resulting in myself having to get over a wall/gate when I'm currently 7 months pregnant and also us having to lift our 15 month old toddlers travel system buggy over the wall/gate too! Absoutely disgusting behaviour. He shouldn't work with the public in my opinion. A guy in our party is local there and hes known for being a misery apparently! Wont be back and will not recommend despite the beautiful setting etc. Cant excuse bad staff imo as I work with the public myself.

Name: Pizza Express
Title: Burnt to a crust pizza
Review: Family meal on Saturday evening my wife and I ordered pollo ad astra and pollo forza pizzas on a romana base. Both totally over cooked and burnt. Forza was so inedible it was sent back, waiter immediately offered to discount cost and replace. Credit due they realised just how poor it was. But food of this low standard should never reach the customer. The bases on these pizzas have now become so thin that in a busy restaurant it must be difficult for the chef not to burn them. Children's pizzas were fine. Have eaten many times at this restaurant chain but will not return.

Name: Six Bells
Title: Mr writer
Review:
Called this morning to make a booking and got an answerphone message saying nobody was available.
Checked out on google at 11am which said they were closed so Visited website and there was an option to make a booking which I did at around 11am for this evening 6pm asking for confirmation.
Nothing all day so I called as soon as open 6pm this evening and was told fully booked. I asked why I was not contacted and I was asked why didn’t you call as they were there all day. I told them that I did call and asked why they didn’t check email bookings. They had no answer! Very unhappy

Name: Harbour Lights
Title: 20 minutes for 3 coffee's
Review:
Took my parents in for a coffee yesterday after finding out it had reopened.

How disappointing

They now only have 1 till instead of 3 and although I counted 6 members of staff behind the counter, it took 20 minutes to order 3 coffee's. I must mention that it wasn't busy, only 2 people in front of us.

I'm not sure who designed the new layout, but to only have 1 till is crazy. I've also never seen so many staff in there, in total I counted 8 front of house staff (which is more then it had before it closed and was really busy) and out of all of them, the only one I saw doing any work was the heavily pregnant waitress, the rest were just stood around doing nothing!

Really disappointing to see it like that and certainly won't be returning

Name: Butlins
Title: Centerparcs this is NOT
Review:
With a young family we have stayed at Centerparcs many times and thought we'd give Butlins a try.

We booked a Nelson stateroom in the Shoreline Hotel, arriving on the hottest weekend this year.
 The air conditioning was broken. It took the team 4 hours after much pestering to inform us it was not repairable(no surprise)
After a visit to assess the heat level they agreed it was not acceptable and we would be relocated.
This was to the Wave hotel, the other side of the complex. It was gone 8pm. We were unable to move the car as the Wave car park was full. We trapsed with kids in pyjamas ladden with bags across the complex,with not one teeny weeny offer of help of anysort.

So just be aware, that is the level of customer service they offer if things go wrong.

You can pay very good money but don't expect the level of courtesy to families that Centerparcs on the other hand offer.

On a positive note the show was great,rides well staffed, pool lovely(though not quite as good as Centerparcs) But be prepared for spending a long time queuing for ...everything!
Hope this may just help if you are considering a first visit with little ones.
We lost a precious day of a very short weekend break with overtired kids, thanks to Butlins.
Read less

Name: Punch and Judy
Title: Couldn’t get served
Review: Went in for a quick pint. Gave up in the end staff just wanted to chat to there friends and regulars. Then walked of and went to the toilet. Was flabbergasted

Name: Wimpey
Title: Disappointment
Review: Popped in for a takeaway and was so disappointed by the food. The whole meal ended up in the bin it was so awful. Will not be returning! What a waste!

Name: The Norfolk Tap
Title: Good beer but poor quality food.
Review: Having read the good reviews we called in for lunch yesterday. Nice looking place and lots of comfy sofas. Bit disappointed there seemed to be no cider - neither on tap or bottled (apparently had just run out). My husband though very much enjoyed his pint of beer. We ordered the Fish Finger sandwich, which seems to only come with ketchup and no obvious sign of tartare sauce, and the - and I quote from the menu -" Honey Glazed Gammon and English Mustard". The "Gammon " sandwich arrived and was filled with the cheap, tasteless,mass produced sliced ham. Extremely ordinary and certainly overpriced at £6.50.

Name: Hawking About
Title: Privileged experience
Review:
A unique experience walking through private woodland with Kevin and his two Harris Hawks Skye and Storm. What characters they are, but Kevin knew just how to handle them. Absolutely brilliant time learning about their behaviour whilst enjoying their company and having them frequently fly to our gloved hands. Kevin obviously loves his birds, and the whole experience was professional, informed and throughly enjoyable. Definitely recommended.
Read less

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Superb
Review: Lovely cafe it is located close to the beach near the sailing club. They offer a wide range of food and drinks.we only had a decaffeinated coffee and it was one of the best we have had. The breakfast on the next table looked lovely and if we hadn't already eaten we would have stayed and had one. Brilliant service brilliant staff very friendly and a joy to visit.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Shocking service
Review: We should never have gone tonight because we've had other bad experiences here but as there were 4 adults and 2 children wanting a quick meal we thought we'd try it. We arrived at 6.15 to be told we couldn't get a table until 6.45. Got sat down then it took ages for them to take our order. The kids ordered starters...o my garlic bread and we then waited an hour for this. When they eventually came the waiters said they had started cooking our mains. Then about 45 mins later and after us asking a few times still no food. We gave up and left! No communication and it really wasn't that busy. Really badly managed place. Shame. Definitely avoid.

Name: Sea View
Title: Friday night dinner 6/9/19
Review:
Ambience, busy snd generally ok
Bar staff attentive and friendly

As usual Mine host and partner were typically aloof, unresponsive , unfriendly and showed no interested in their customers
They will not even think to say hello to village locals who have been in their pub many times
Things got worse than the cold atmosphere as the Food served was really awful, yukkkk nasty

Drink selection ok

Even if you consider this as only a local pub it still falls very short of acceptable,

In fact it seems to get worse each time we visit it, the only redeeming point is the garden on a sunny day

It is very obvious that the landlord and partner have no interest in the hospitality industry, they seem to have no interaction with their customers at any point, very strange!!!

SO mr and mrs Landlord “ if you hate this hospitality life then we suggest sell up and move on !!!

The Food really terrible, obviously it was precooked, frozen and then microwaved to within an inch of its life
It was really bland , hot as hell and disgusting , we ordered fish and chips, calves liver and mousaka,
all diners left their dishes ,
at least our tables company was good, and the bright side was at least our dog had a good feast

Best to avoid except for a drink on a summer evening

Name: Royal Norfolk
Title: Older style non-chain hotel, but good at what it does
Review:
Stayed here for one night, with a chosen upgrade to sea view room. A large room, . the ceiling to floor sash windows could have been cold and draughty- but they certainly weren't and provided a great view across the esplanade to the sea, with palms in the gardens of the hotel just outside.

The bathroom appeared to have been modernised in recent times - all really good apart from an 'old fashioned' fixed shower head that was not controllable. A shame, as everything else had been brought up to date nicely.

Tea and Coffee making facilities and hairdryer were in the room as you wold expect, and the TV, although small was picking up the full range of freeview stations.

Breakfast was good in both range and quality - all served with a smile and cheery conversation in the main dining room with mirrors,chandeliers and old world charm.

So, a standard chain hotel this is not - and its also not the most modern in style. However, it is a great place to stay for being on the front at Bognor Regis, and within walking distance of the railway station/town centre. A real 'old charm' hotel with character and personality

Name: Foxwood
Title: Wonderful weekend in the woods
Review: Fabulous weekend with friends and kids. Thd children loved exploring and the rope swing and the adults loved the feeling of getting away from it all. Nice showers too! Really enjoyed the beautiful woodland setting and its handy being walking distance from a nice pub if you don't fancy cooking. We will be back!

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Shockingly overpriced
Review: We were just charged £24.50 for a fish cake, 2 small chips and curry sauce, 1 small cheesy chips and two cans of coke and bottle of water. Apparently chips to eat on restaurant are 3.90 for a tiny portion. Absolutely disgusting.

Name: Linden Fisheries
Title: sadly gone downhill after change of hands
Review: Since changing hands the overall offering has gone downhill. Supply lines have obviously changed and quality now poor and standard of cooking substandard. Will not use again

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Leave bar area to clean half way through RWC2019 game
Review:
Can you believe @premierinn Bognor Regis sent us out of the bar to clean half way through Wales & Australia. Now watching it from bedroom. Absolute Liberty! @wru_community @rwc2019. Will pick an alternative hotel next time!
Read less

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Always come here
Review:
Old school theatre style cinema, it really feels like you’ve gone back in time!

Super cheap too, £4.50 on a weekend and £3.50 a weekday, snacks and drinks are fairly cheap too, much cheaper than the likes of Odeon, Cineworld, Vue etc
Read less

Name: Arundel Cathedral
Title: If in Arundel take the walk up the hill
Review:
It is certainly worth calling into and is suitably impressive albeit on a relatively small scale compared to many cathedrals. Elegance and spaciousness of structure and lovely stained glass windows certainly make this very much part of a visit to the lovely town of Arundel.
Read less

Name: Arden B&B
Title: What a gem
Review:
I only stayed 1 night at Arden House as I was on a fleeting visit. It is run by 2 lovely people Lucie and Iain who cannot do enough for you. I knew that I would be very late arriving (11.30pm) and Lucie was extremely helpful giving me very clear and precise instructions on how to enter the house and how to find my room. I found the accomodation a very clean and homely place to stay. Lucie even found out my train times and connections to get me back to Liverpool. I have no hesitation in highly recommending this place to stay. Ray D.
Read less

Name: Six Bells
Title: Six Bells Experience
Review:
My wife and I were staying at Littlehampton Caravan and Motorhome Club site and one of the nearest pubs is the Six Bells. We went on Saturday night for dinner which was OK.
We also went for Sunday lunch and I can’t remember going for a pub lunch with no flavours what so ever, all the veg was tasteless. Needless to say we won’t be going back.
This pub has a ready made clientele which they need to look after “The Caravan and Motorhome Club” I think they need to do a review of there food or it will be going where a lot more of local pubs have gone “out of business”

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Complaint the harvester littlehampton beach
Review:
Complaint regarding front desk service and steaks not good at all. See full complaint below. Booked a table for 7 people a week in advance. On arrival was shown to a table next to the kitchen doors set for 5 people. We could not all fit in without a very tight squeeze. The man was reluctant to change our table and was very abrupt and quite rude to us. Eventually he reluctantly put2 tables together which was rather a squeeze and most uncomfortable. Our waitress was really outstanding and so accommodating. Our starters were fine but 4 of our main meals were horrible. 2 rump steak rolls and 2 rump steaks. We could not eat this as it was so chewy and we wondered if it was rump! We showed the waitress as we had leftmost of the rump on our plates. We were not offered any kind of refund or even a percentage off our bill. Besides that our friends who were visiting us from Oxford saw the man who was at the reception desk who was so rude to us discussing our group with a colleague and pointing at us as we left. Very unprofessional! My husband and I have eaten here a number of tines and always enjoyed our meal. We will be every hesitant to return again as it was a very embarrassing time for us.
Peter and Heather Smith

Name: Riverside
Title: we liked the area
Review: the accommodation was not very good the gas fire dident work ,the floor carpit was filty and badly stained ,the bedding was disgraceful fit for the bins ,no light in the small room ,and the bed is to small for the double room and uncomfortable the place would of been ok for a short stay ,,but for a week and over £200 out of season I believe was disgraceful I could of gone abroad for the money with better accommadation

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Great food and fantastic Service
Review: Went in for drinks with friends and ended up eating in there too. Food was lovely and hot and loved the chicken pie! The Aussie guy at the bar was full of chat and so friendly and I think the lovely lady we spoke to was kate (I think) and she was very attentive and happy to see we was happy so overall a Fab time at the roundstone! :) See u all again.

Name: Butlins
Title: Disappointing second visit
Review:
As detailed above this was our second five day break at Butlins Bognor Regis and we probably won't return for a third.

We opted for food court dining and the highchairs were so dirty that we couldn't strap our baby in as he mouths everything and the straps were crusted with old food. The food was also very disappointing , not the standard we had previously seen at Bognor at dinner time. It was far too beige and some limp lettuce and tomato with cucumber was pretty much all of the salad that was available. The breakfast was perfectly lovely though.

Also in the food court , we found it to be much , much busier than the previous Easter. There were poor customers queuing for a table with tired children and people hung around our table wait information for us to finish. We went to a paid restaurant on our last night as we were so sick of the dirty , busy food court.

The only good thing about our dining choice was a young staff member named Kieran. He greeted us all with such cheer that every family walked away from him smiling. I hope Butlins are paying him well!

The apartment wasn't cleaned very well , we found a bottle of beard oil , and some sweet wrappers in our bedroom. Also our bedroom door handle was hanging off.

We'll go elsewhere next year I think.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Magical!
Review:
I spent yesterday in Arundel and toured the Castle & Gardens. There is so much history here and such a welcoming, helpful, and knowledgeable staff! I paid for the Gold Plus ticket and wouldn’t recommend anything else. The views of the countryside from the Keep, the castle tour, the gardens and the chapel were all incredible. This is a must see if you’re anywhere near! I took a 2 hour train from London and would do it again anyway!! Don’t miss this place!
Read less

Name: Butlers
Title: Gorgeous: food, staff and ambience
Review: Turned up without a booking and had a superb lunch. Good sized starters and most importantly, a fab menu, well done. We could have settled in for the rest of the day. A great find. Will definitely be back. Thank you

Name: McDonald's
Title: Bad language
Review: I don’t appreciate coming to McDonald’s with my children on Friday evening 4th October and two colleagues (females with glasses and a black high bun each) talking to each other and one of them says “for f@£k sake” in front of my 9 and 6 year old. NOT IMPRESSED. Thought this restaurant was meant to be family friendly!!

Name: Reminisce
Title: Top Class
Review: Delicious home cooked food. Lots of choice and all served by the lovely Elizabeth who can’t do enough for you! You’ll want to go back time and again!

Name: Toast
Title: Loved it!
Review:
I’ll start in reference to the previous review...”probably a great place for middle class families on the weekend but a working class weekday cafe this is not.” this just makes no sense! When did the working class get so snobby?! Obviously you have a personal vendetta against this place since you’ve left two 1 star reviews; if you hated it that much the first time why did you go back!? I’m working class, visited on a Friday and had no problems with the tomatoes. I don’t go to a cafe to watch tv so had no problem with children’s tv being played silently in the corner of the room and if I was a local I would be pleased to hear that they were doing so well especially as a small business in a seaside town in the midldle of winter!

Toast doesn’t pretend to be something it’s not, it’s charming, inviting and potentially the best in it’s class.

And for coeliacs you won’t just have to go for the omelette or jacket potato, they provided gluten free bread.

Name: Motte & Bailey
Title: Birthday disappointment
Review:
My friends booked us in to round off a day at the races for my special birthday .
Will never go back ...
Disappointment of the highest order , food late small portions even for tapas , overpriced , bad attitude by what appeared to be head service person .
When I complained about my wine being off she accused me of shouting and then announced “ we don’t make the wine “ null points .
Younger staff were polite and apologetic but the whole experience was a huge let down for ourselves and for Arundel .
Go anywhere else but here

Name: KFC Bognor
Title: Just awful,
Review:
I think by far this is the worst ever KFC restaurant I have ever visited, The food is completely below the usual standard you would expect.

They clearly have some staffing issues as there was one person serving on a Saturday and the restaurant itself was dirty (the toilets were exceptionally filthy)

I doubt that I will eat at the restaurant again,

Avoid like the plague, u might just catch it.

Name: The Norfolk Tap
Title: Sunday 29 December 2019
Review: Local gins and beers aplenty, a really great place to visit. Thoroughly relaxing, excellent furnishings, just needs a bit more atmosphere on a Sunday evening, albeit the weekend before NYE was not a great time to adjudge The Norfolk Tap. In summary, we liked it and will return for sure. Definitely recommended.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Tried it again. But again was not good. Won't bother again
Review:
Visited last year and food was bad. Manager responded saying would take on feedback. So was in arundel today and thought I would try again.

Place was very empty,with only two families and two staff serving

They were very pleasant and we were given a table and we ordered drinks. These took twenty minutes to arrive

Ordered food which again took ages,was frustrating as the staff were stood around chatting to two friends who had popped in

I ordered the venison burger. Which to be fair was OK. But had salad on the side which tasted really odd

Friend I was with ordered mixed kebab. There was no lamb so was just chicken and pork. This was inedible. The meat was so dry it could not be eaten

The waitress took on the feedback and looked embareesed and went to talk to the chef. Came back and agreed to take the kebab of the bill and offered a free pudding

We waited ages for food. Had a bad meal so did not want to wait ages for a pudding to arrive

One of us left hungry

This place is a nice gimmick but is not cheap. You really need to raise your game on the food

I really wanted to like it but it was ver poor

Name: Fino
Title: Excellent service, attentive waitress
Review:
I visited here yesterday with my Nan & Mother who live in Bognor.
The waitress who served us was very helpful & pleasant.
I had the sea bass which came with a sauce, with 2 crab arancini balls.
The sea bass was over cooked , not very tasty, the Arancini was cold , there was no evidence of any crab & the sauce had a layer (film) on the top like it had been sitting for a long time under a hot plate. I should have sent it back especially as it was £17.
My Nan had the crab risotto which did not have hardly any crab in it, was spinkled on the top.
The timing was out as 3 of our meals came out together & the vegetarian came out 4-5 mins later.
There were only 2 other tables occupied when we were served lunch, so no excuse for food taking a long time & not being served together.
The kitchen door was open & kept banging which was distracting & off putting.
There was a cold breeze, which when we went to the toilets realised it was coming from there as it was freezing in the ladies. My Son said it was freezing in the gents as well ( my son doesn’t really feel the cold) when I touched the radiator’s none of them were on.
The decor was great , very comfortable seats, it is a good location with plenty of parking, it would be nice to have proper napkins as paper ones are not as nice.
Overall a nice restaurant, food is not as good as it should be when paying between £13-£17 for a main course.

Name: Raj Doot
Title: Good value
Review: The outward appearance isn’t promising and the steps might deter older diners but the interior is well presented with tables in booths giving good privacy. The meals are very reasonably priced and of good quality without having any wow factor. They seem to do a lot of takeaways. There were spare tables but glad we booked. So good value for money without being out of the ordinary.

Name: The Bear Inn
Title: Pre Xmas family meal
Review:
We were booked for 1pm lunch 7 adults and 4 children told on seating that they had run out of Turkey! Whilst ordering the majority wanted chicken as an alternative and the person taking our order then had to then check levels of chicken (kids got thigh meat instead of breasts).
On arrival of the food we were dismayed at the lack of veg 4 small sprouts each 2/slithers of carrots and the same of parsnips and some peas (one plate had no carrots, 2 missing peas) no stuffing as there was no turkey and a Yorkshire pudding that looked like a pancake!
This was our 4 year going to the bear as a family previous years have been amazing and we were left full and satisfied this year.... well McDonald's on the way home me thinks!
TOTALLY DISSATISFIED!

Name: Butlins
Title: Terrible experience
Review:
We spent 3 nights at the Wave hotel. On arriving back to our room on the final day we noticed our games console was missing. One of the controls had been thrown on the floor and the console itself was nowhere to be found. From the outset Butlins gave the impression it wasn’t really their problem. They called the resort officer to conduct a door audit to see who had been in and out of the room during that day. It showed only ourselves and housekeeping. They proceeded to check with housekeeping whether any one had found the missing item - and lo and behold - no one had.
We’ve since returned home and had a phone call to say that they haven’t been able to recover the item and their investigation ends there.
All I can say is to warn you - do not be too comfortable in Butlins accommodation. We made the mistake of not putting our valuables in the safe - I would advise everyone to do so to avoid being targeted by the thieves who hide amongst the housekeeping staff. We are lucky enough to have travelled all over the world and never had an item from our belongings stolen from our accommodation.
It was out of the ordinary for us to holiday in the UK and now this has put us off Butlins and the like for good!
My advice, don’t leave any valuables out, don’t trust housekeeping staff and don’t rely on the resort to offer any real help when things go wrong. Not a safe place where you can feel at home.
Read less

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Leisure
Review:
Fabulous well worth a visit, staff amazing, grounds amazing and the food was excellent. Spa facilities are wonderful.
My only constructive criticism is the ice cream served for desert, it came in a brand pot like you would get at the beach or fast food place. It tasted good though. Thank you
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Disgusting hygiene, badly managed.
Review:
We came for a day visit mainly to use the new pool. Total let down after having so much money spent on building it. The changing rooms were nice and large however, they were filthy with rubbish, hair and even what looked like blood wiped down the wall with a finger! There was also hair and floating skin in the puddles in the queues up the stairs to the family raft. In the baby pool there seemed to be something floating in the water that looked like phlegm/snot! There were even people swimming with their outdoor clothes on. Totally unhygienic.
The slides had massive queues (fair enough when its holiday season) but when the queue time is made even longer than it should because they do not have enough rafts to cater for demand. Staff said they started off with 7 rafts but are down to only 4 now. Sort this out managers instead of making people wait longer than the queue time says. 20 minute expected time took 35 minutes just for a slide ride over in less than 30 seconds!
Teenagers were pushing in the queues in front of smaller children, including running and barging past, when I raised this issue with a member of staff nothing was said or done about it.
Two of the slides were also under 18's only. I don't see the sense in that when there were some teenagers around 12 stone or more when there were much smaller/petite adults wanting to go on. It should be done on weight NOT AGE! Never seen a large slide closed to adults anywhere else.
In all, a total and utter let down, badly managed and not once did I see anyone cleaning the filth during open hours. Other leisure centres have staff walking around with watering cans to rinse away hair and grime.
Such a shame it is going to rack and ruin already with no standards for peoples health and safety.
Read less

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Little gem on Butlins resort
Review: Visited this last weekend during our Butlins stay and thoroughly recommend it. Lovely Rib -eye, good kids menu and great service

Name: Ristorante Al Mare
Title: Delightful
Review:
Have to give this restaurant 5 stars as although it was quite simple with a small menu, it was quite delightful and very reasonably priced.
The service was excellent and the food very fresh and beautifully prepared.
Definitely worth many repeat visits.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Awful food
Review:
Im shocked how bad it was fish soggy
Tomato sauce and mayonnaise in heinz bottles but clearly wasn't as watered down n taste awful
Rip of do not waste your money or time.

Name: Rustington Golf Centre
Title: Lovely golf course
Review: Really nice course with a top class driving range. The driving range has screens that tell you how far you hit the ball with auto refil tees

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Not to be repeated experience
Review: Friends local to Roundstone received coupons through their letterbox and invited us to try this restaurant for lunch. We ordered their specials which included fish and chips, 6oz ranch steak, gammon steak and paprika chicken and drinks. The only meal that did not have a negative comment was the gammon steak. The rest left a lot to be desired.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Poor food, poorer service
Review: After booking through their website, could not find a booking. Even though we were lucky enough to be given a seat, no apology was given even after I had shown proof of booking. Service was slow, which I expect to being short staffed, however the staff reflected this from general rudeness to how slow the service was (Spent over 3hours here for starter and main). Other than the items I wanted to order not being in stock, the food itself was well below par for the price we paid. To top off what was quickly becoming a very poor evening, we were then asked if we had vouchers to use, which was a very bold assumption from the staff. Will not be returning, very disappointing from what had the potential to be a fantastic venue.

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Good food
Review: We like to sit out and watch the river whilst we eat. Very nice sandwiches. Very filling. Good coffee. Swans fly over the river which is lovely. We will go to the Waterside cafe many times in the future.

Name: So India, Felpham
Title: When to say No!
Review:
Went last night. Banquet Night - discounted night.
Arrived on time.
Car park full. Restaurant full it seemed.
Dropped fellow guests and went to park.
Arrived to find we are parked in the lobby.
Wait and wait.
Enquire about table - “it is being prepared”.
After 15 minutes - “it is being prepared”.
Is there a table? “Did you make a booking?”
Book showed we are one of three bookings - clearly our table has been given away.
Offer to have take-away. “No”.
Get to table at last. No one to take order.
Eventually food arrives - but our main courses. Where are our starters?
Hopefully you get the picture - chaos!
We did start to eat eventually. However allowing all the guests to arrive at the same time is asking for trouble. Of course the kitchen and the waiters can’t cope.
It would have been so simple to have said “No, we have no table reserved for you. No, we can’t serve you very soon, No, you will have to wait and No we can’t serve a takeaway as the kitchen is unable to cope.
We would have gone somewhere else but returned on another day.
The food is good, the waiter was sorry and able to laugh with us and was appologetic.
Will we ever go again - No we will not. There are other restaurants that don’t provide chaos as an additional side-dish!
Not a good use of Banquet Night as a promotional tool.

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Lovely Cheap cinema
Review:
Was told the old knickname. But was so cheap and perfectly addiquate. Cheap night out. Happily recommend.
Read less

Name: Black Horse
Title: Cant fault it
Review: I live up the road but only just discovered this lovely family run restaurant is now in new hands and you can tell instantly that ALOT of passion and love has been put into the place. The menu is perfect, the decor is clean, smart and comfortable and the service is delightful. We met Jen (the landlady) who is lovely and welcoming and the rest of the team are polite and smiley without being intrusive. The food was outstanding, well presented and plenty of it. Definitely worth every penny. (We shared the veg platter, followed by the cajun chicken burger and a half roast chicken- delicious)

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: visit family
Review:
nice quiet peacfull Travelodge
everything was clean and fresh
staff helpful
didn't have any problems
they have a little car park but they also own burger king car park so can park in that one of one by entrance is full
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Atrocious service, lukewarm food.
Review:
Having booked a table, we arrived 5 minutes early and were seated immediately. 15 minutes later we were still waiting for our drinks order to be taken, whist customers who arrived after us had their order taken, had eaten their meal and paid the bill - before our food even arrived.
whilst I appreciate that any place can be affected by staff absence/shortages, 2 members of staff thought it more important to be setting up a closed area of the restaurant for the following day, leaving just 2 waiting staff to look after the rest of the restaurant. It was very busy with several large parties and several dishes on the menu were sold out. Having made alternative choices, our food arrived lukewarm and had obviously been sitting at the pass for some time as my couscous was dried up and crispy around the edges. This was the worst meal we have ever had at a Harvester and we will certainly not be back any time soon.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Burger Off!
Review: Restaurant was due to open at 12...two starving kids desperate for a burger. Knocked on the window to see if they were opening, we’re were ignored. Didn’t open until nearly 1215. Had to ask for kids menus, then got to order drinks told they only had one Diet Coke left. Waited a while and then told that there were no Diet Cokes at all. Saw a couple walk out after waiting ages to order. We waited ages for drinks...table that ordered after us were served first. Watched as our kids sized drinks were poured from a Tesco bottle. Decided that with limited time - it didn’t bode well for a food order so paid and left. Clearly understaffed and feels like a restaurant on its way out. Such a shame, looked like a good menu.

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: Yet another stay at this hotel
Review:
We have stayed here many times now and find the staff first class and the rooms clean and everything works as it should, the breakfast is always cooked to order and the choice is varied , altogether a pleasant stay again.
Read less

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Evening meal
Review: Saw this place & thought it looked nice inside is but the food is mediocre it advertises Fresh fish & chips but the chips are frozen that were only just cooked so a very pale yellow as for the fish at 1st I couldn't work out why it had pancake batter til I realised it was frozen too probably from Brake Bros (frozen food company to the trade) or even Iceland maybe because we were the only customers they couldn't be bothered to go to the effort of doing fresh food but I suspect this is the norm. The 1/2 we were there the owner spent chatting to some chap about his holidays the she owed him her holiday pics then when asked by another man how hot it was she gave him chapter & verse of the temperature & the fact she'd not unpacked yet!!not once did she acknowledged us it was left to 2 very young girls to do the cooking & serving. It's a shame as its just outside a busy caravan park & could really pick up lots of custom ftom it all season if the fish&chips really were FRESH

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Really friendly place, smart interior and lovely food
Review:
We came as a family of 4, including a 6 year old and 11 month old and were welcomed warmly. We'd had enough of chain places and were struggling to find somewhere decent that was open around 5pm so called the Gravy Boat, loved the friendliness of the lady we spoke to and were soon on our way.

The restaurant is clean and smartly decorated, good amount of seating and laid out so as not to be too close to other tables. The kitchen is open so you can see the chef's busying about getting the food ready. They had their own craft bitter which was lovely and very nicely priced. The carvery spread looked awesome but we went from the a la carte menu; sloppy Joe burger - lovely and juicy, stuffed chicken, again cooked and served perfectly and my little boy had a very generous and tasty spag bol. We were in a bit of a hurry (11 month old on the edge of over-tiredness) so didn't get desserts but never felt the wait was long.

It was nicely busy for a Tuesday evening and I'd imagine booking would be sensible at weekends and during holiday times.

We come to Littlehampton maybe 2/3 times a year and will make every effort to eat here whenever we return. Really well done everyone involved you saved a frazzled family's dinner time.

Name: So India, Little.
Title: Will not be returning
Review: We had the mixed started for two, which included samosas and onion bhajis, which inexplicably had been soaked in sauce and so had turned to mush. In fact, all the items of the mixed starter were in one container and comprised one lump of mush. See the photos. It was inedible.In the pilau rice were hard clumps of rice suggesting that it has been overcooked or cooked earlier and reheated.The chicken baltic was dry and swamped with onion.This meal was a complete waste of money. It ended up in the bin. I feel angry. We won't be returning.

Name: Avisford
Title: Mr M Bourn
Review:
Not good I am afraid !!
Swimming pool needs work , and or less lazy staff ! Round the pool slippery and dirty , tiles loose outside the mens shower , and exposed very hot pipes .
Corridors and communial areas need a little tlc as do the gent's toilet near the reception where I found the door was sporting a large hole due to having been kicked in !
So overall not my best experience with Hilton
Read less

Name: The Dragon
Title: Very dissatisfied
Review:
I have been to the Dragon on many occasions but it now looks like it is on its last legs.
Starters arrived too quickly and looked like the came from Iceland,
Rest of the meal was disappointing, a pity because it used to be a great place
Staff were surly and unsmiling

Name: Butlers
Title: Amazing lunch
Review:
My wife and I stopped off on route for a walk and some lunch, the venue looked very inviting, so we decided to stop for lunch and we were very glad we did!

The venues decor and general presentation was perfect, bright and airy, yet cosy on a winters day.

We were created by very friendly and welcoming staff and service was excellent throughout.

We chose to eat from the lunch time specials board which was great value and quantity excellent, food was full of flavour and couldn’t have asked for anything more. I would particularly recommend the parsnip soup and Guinean foul if available.

If your passing through Arundel we would definitely recommend this venue.

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Lunch 11th September
Review: I really hate to do this but I have been eating at the spotted cow for over 12 years and loved it, was always consistent and very good. However went there for lunch with my nephew and was very disappointed. I sometimes have the ploughmans and chose this again, was advised that the new menu was just launched. I was so disappointed this time, the ploughmans used to be so good but this time, there was hardly any salad, no apple, no relish as mentioned, just a couple of slices of gherkin, my nephew had burger which he said was nice, but the extra garlic bread with cheese was awful and not home cooked

Name: World's End
Title: Friendly staff
Review: Excellent meal husband had the Caesar salad , I had the chicken An bacon burger, with fries . Very filling an really nice well presented food . Easy too order an service was quick . We ate in the garden as weather so nice, also we had the dogs with us . So yes the pub is dog free they even brought are dogs a bowl off water . Lovely garden area with play area For kids as well .

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Terrible!!
Review: We booked in Sept for our christmas dinner special treat as a family, we expected a great service & lovely meal at £58 a head, as this year was a treat for me to not do the cooking. The staff were dis-interested, never once were we asked if everything was ok with our meals (That is usual practice & something they should do!) The starters were shamefully small & disappointing to taste. The mains were no better, & the desserts also mediocre (everything was dry & rubbery!) I personally left there not eating any of my courses! And the other guests on our table didn't want to complain as its christmas day, but for me? If you dont want to work christmas day (understandable!) Then dont work in that line of work! My experience there today has been So bitterly disappointing that I will never eat there again at any time of the year as we have done many times previously. Their website says that they will make our day special, which is what we wanted.. but never again! Totally ruined our christmas day!

Name: Clock House Café
Title: lovely relaxing place
Review: This is a cafe so e marked it on my experiences of cafe's, i found it relaxing with plenty of room, service was excellent, and you get what you want the menu is a guild so dont be afraid to ask they will get what you want

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Poor standard
Review:
This is only any good if you don't mind bad service and poorly trained staff, variable tariff so you don't really know what your getting and doesn't give value for money, though the room was clean and well presented.
Read less

Name: Arun View
Title: Very Average Pub Restaurant
Review: Food served was uninspired, poorly cooked and lacking taste. Car park not adequate for size of restaurant. Service not very friendly and slow. Beware to check the amount you are paying is correct if you use a credit card to settle you bill.

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Fantastic value for money!
Review:
We travelled up from Cornwall to Chichester for an event that was running at Goodwood for the weekend. I booked a room at Arundel Fontwell for one night for myself, my husband and my 7 year old. On arrival we were greeted in a friendly manner, given our keys and directed where to go. Luckily this wasn’t too far as being pregnant I was already exhausted! On opening the door to our room it smelt of cleaning products which is always a good sign! And it felt clean. The bathroom itself was clean and there were fresh towels. There were spares on the shelves just outside of the bathroom which is handy! In the room there was a king size bed along with a pull out single for my son to sleep in. Both in clean condition, clean sheets and both beds comfortable. Extra pillows on the selves as well as a fan if needed. A TV was available with freeview which was ideal as we spent the evening relaxing. There was a kettle with cups/sugar/teabags/coffee/milk for tea and coffee which we didn’t use in the end but was nice to know this was available to us. There is no restaurant on site but there is a Burger King/KFC a 5 minute walk around the corner. There is also a little Pub a few minutes drive away that we passed but did not go in. Chichester itself is only a 10 minute drive away from big supermarkets (Sainsbury’s/Lidl etc) which is ideal if you are staying away for a little time. Overall the room we stayed in did the job for us, there was barely any noise even though the Travelodge is situated by a busy road which some people have previously mentioned in other reviews. It may have been the room we were in but given that we only spent the night it did the job nicely. Thank you very much to the two members of staff who welcomed us. Will be back.
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Rubbish - too long to wait and food overcooked
Review:
Having already heard soo many complaints from other diners, I ws not surprised when my food arrived so overcooked it was in-edible (and that was just the starter). Based on the above I cancelled the remainder of my order and asked the hotel to cancel my breakfast. Pizza place - that's a good deal for you!!!
Then when I complained the staff member told me it was because it was a new menu and this was day 1 - BULL SH1T. The menus were so worn and tethered the above statement simply could not be true. Absolute disgrace whitbread.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Great place to party
Review: Went here on a Friday night with a party of 18!! Situated just inside the arcade, where the cheap shoe shop used to be. Was impressed with the service, not an easy job with some of the boisterous members of the group. The menu offers plenty of choice, and came out quickly. Baskets of delicious Turkish flatbread were placed on the table for sharing, and the Cacik, or tzatziki is thick and luxurious, and so tasty. We tried mainly the chicken and lamb kebabs, and the lamb chops, they were well-seasoned and they could not be faulted. Great salad and dressing on the plates. Chips maybe could have been just a little warmer, but they were quite edible. It was clean and bright inside, and the grill in the cooking area just inside the door, had a very efficient extractor system, so none of the smoke got into the restaurant. I like the window on to the grill so you could see the food being cooked.

Name: Avisford Park Golf
Title: Great Golf
Review: The course was in great condition even at this time of year. Front 9 perfect for a 90/120 minute round. Avoid Mondays unless you can tee off before 0800 as it is members comp. day. Limited food offering in the club house so do not expect the usual bacon roll etc:

Name: Ye Olde Fish and Chippe Shoppe
Title: Reliable old friend
Review:
Have visited this place every time I've visited Elmer over the past few years. The food is always cooked fresh and the fish is very good quality. My favourite is the scami but the huss is also very good.

The restaurant has just had a refurbishment and looks great - clean and bright and more space to wait for orders as well as indoor seating. Well worth a visit.

Name: Linden Fisheries
Title: Delicious Chips
Review: We had a plentiful Large portion of chips and delicious Cod. All the items were delicious and perfectly cooked. The Chips here are always a winner and the batter on the Cod is so crispy and fresh. All freshly cooked in front of you. Traditional fish and Chips done to perfection.

Name: Black Horse
Title: Lovely visit
Review:
First time visit with the new management.
Very friendly staff with welcoming smile.
Lovely menu, generous helpings and a very reasonable price.
Could not fault the management very accommodating.
The pub also has a skittle alley, so much fun.

Name: Hawking About
Title: Hawk walk
Review:
We
Went yesterday on our Hawk Walk and have woken up thinking about it! It was a Christmas present and it was simply amazing. We walked with 2 Harris hawks (Sky and Storm). Kevin was knowledgable, friendly and hugely bird-focused. Their welfare was at the heart of everything.

The birds followed us through the woods as we walked and it was an unreal experience to have them swooping through the trees to your glove.

Hugely recommended.
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Ruined our stay at the Premier Inn
Review: Reserved table for the Roundstone Restaurant on arrival at the Premier Inn. Later Restaurant staff insisted that the reservation had not been received and that they were fully booked. They could however put us in the bar area but there would not be any waitress service. We were in fact shown to a table in an empty cold room devoid of any atmosphere. We were informed later that this room was the restaurant overspill area. We were waited on but the waitress was totally indifferent to our concerns with our experience thus far where we found dirty dining tables, cutlery not laid out, broken, unstable chairs with torn fabric. The food when served was of poor quality, (see photo). Nothing to write home about or recommend. Having said that, breakfast was taken in the main restaurant the next morning with personable and friendly staff in attendance and the full English breakfast that was served was a big improvement on the previous night.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Disappointed
Review:
I went to lunch with my friend who had recommded the food and was disappointed for her as the tables were dirty. The menus needed a wipe down as they were filthy. The food arrived and was very cold and we reordered and it eventually arrived and was at least hot.
I don't think I could recommend this restarant unless the cleanliness and food was greatly improved.

Name: Monsoon
Title: Good Food
Review: This Indian restaurant has modern decor and good food with pleasant staff. It had a good menu with tradional and other choices from the chefs special.

Name: Flying Fortress
Title: Overcrowded
Review:
Visited here on a Sunday morning and had to queue for 20 minutes to enter. Once in we queued another 30 minutes for food. There must have been over 200 bodies there and only a handful of kids overseeing the kids running riot. Safety is the parents responsibility but we are not in charge of other folks kids and some kids are just let loose to run riot. At 13 I believe that it’s too old to go to a soft play but that’s the age the Flying Fortress limits. I took mine out after 30 minutes when the little one was charges into and fell on his head (it’s a stone floor with a carpet) The older child (a girl aged 5) was subjected to abuse from a much older boy who pushed his way onto the slides making fun of her for being a baby. Disappointed in the management but not the kids worked big there on probably minimum wage.
Read less

Name: Murrell Arms
Title: friendly but not at all busy
Review:
was just passing through after helping friends with a house move in yapton
pub was a bit empty.a bit like the atmostphere
only had a lemonade as I was driving back to Portsmouth the owner was certainly a bit drunk I think he drinks the profits talking to a man in there who is a regular said it is only busy on Friday nights and there used to be live music but the profits are low and the only thing that keeps it open is its listed building status.

Name: Boat House In the Marina
Title: Wouldn’t recommend at all
Review: Lovely venue, shame about the owner. Disgusted at how unprofessional she is, to sit there and make a nasty Facebook status about a party in which I attended whilst we were still there! The food was sparse and what food there was was very unappetising. Wouldn’t recommend for any function unless you want judgemental stares from staff the whole night.

Name: Beachcomber Inn
Title: Lovely food.
Review: A nice comfortable pub. Lovely food, fast and generous portions. Friendly staff. Joey kept us entertained

Name: The Beresford
Title: Check your bill!
Review: Whilst the food is good, we’ve experienced a couple of episodes of problems with the bill. The first was a call after we’d left about not paying at all, with proof of our receipt. The second was tonight, having got home and seen six drinks added to our bill from the previous table occupants. Bar tender knew immediately what the drinks were without us saying a word so obviously knew what had ‘gone on’ without any prompting. Had to return for a refund, accused of not checking bill and offered no apology. How many other people have paid for someone else’s unpaid drinks/meal! Be very careful ....

Name: Osca's
Title: Brilliant and overcharged dealt with amazingly!
Review:
Visited Osca’s on Sunday 11 August we were very impressed and delighted with the quality of the food - batter crispy, beautiful fresh fish and great value at £10.50 for fish and chips, mushy peas, bread & butter, cuppa plus dessert! Unfortunately we were overcharged as the waitress charged for the desserts instead of including them with the special offer, however, when I returned 2 days later (with my receipt) the manager was so apologetic and insisted upon returning the over charge of £8 by insisting I take £10.
Overall I would thoroughly recommend Osca’s brilliant food and customer service above and beyond!

Name: Ye Olde Fish and Chippe Shoppe
Title: Very good fish and chips
Review: Service was polite and welcoming. The food was cook-to-order but we still received it quickly. The portion size was hearty and the little seating area outside provided an added bonus. Very good if in the area.

Name: Hawking About
Title: A great show
Review:
Saw this show at Arundel Castle, Kevin, the falconer was in his world with the birds that he had on show.
What a fantastic show it is all sorts of birds,from mere owls to diving Falcons showing a mastery of the air.
Kevin kept the audience spellbound with his skill, his use of the area available to was,indeed fantastic, catch this show whenever you can.
One cannot afford to miss it.
Read less

Name: The Diner
Title: Meal Friday & Saturday 15th/16th
Review:
We arrived on the Friday and went to the diner. We have a great service and this was all down to KENNY. We enjoyed the service that much we went back the next night.

Well what a change that was!!!!!
Drinks had to be chased up 3 times, no drawing for the children and when I asked where it was the manager told me he had given it to another table. We didn’t get any of the starters that went with the kids deals! And then the children’s pasta came out cold. They were to busy they couldn’t cope.

If you do go ask to be served by KENNY

Name: Church Farm
Title: Very nice site
Review:
Very friendly staff, although we did have a delay at check in. Caravan clean and well maintained. Nice site with good facilities. The usual haven menu but food was very good and arrived quickly. Would visit again
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Dump
Review:
Tired place - no way close to regular Hilton brand - very surprised corporate is putting up with this place. Decor and grounds tired and shabby - sad thing is it wouldn’t take much to make the place look great but it seems like no one cares!
Read less

Name: McDonald's
Title: very friendly
Review: I often take my daughters foster children here for a treat they are always made to feel welcome the children love playing on the little computer games when they are working that makes the treat even more special

Name: Golden Grill
Title: horrible
Review: i went there hungry and usually i love kebab, i ordered a lamb donner for myself and chips for my boyfriend the chips were fine however the kebab for me made me physically sick the next day, all day and still couldn’t really eat for 2 days after. i won’t be going again not impressed.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Got it right in the end
Review: Anyone can get something wrong, but it is how they deal with it that counts. I had the chef's signature hunter chicken dish which I have had here before. This time, the gammon was so tough that the knife struggled to go through it and the one bit I got in my mouth could not be chewed - my teeth just bounced off of it. There were no arguments - it was just taken away and then a fresh meal was brought, which was great. The Summer special mango and Chilli king prawns is lovely.

Name: Grub & Gumption
Title: Lovely find
Review: Found this lovely place after a beach walk with the dogs. We stopped they allowed dogs in & had a lovely breakfast. Xmas special smoked salmon bagel & poached eggs , coffee, all very good & tasty. Will certainly go back when next on a beach walk. Oh the cakes looked very tasty as well.

Name: Church Farm
Title: Disappointed - massive change in a year
Review:
Just come back from a week at a privately rented caravan. The caravan, the grounds and the majority of the staff are great and have kept a similar standard every year we have been there. However the clubhouse, restaurant have really gone down hill. The games room had no air con all week, the machines kept braking. The guys working in games area were really helpful but having used some of the machines for the last few years the difference was really quite noticeable. The restaurant, what’s happened. Price has gone up and the quality gone down. Food looks like it just thrown on the plate. Kids food supposed to come with veg, the only one that did came with raw, dried up carrot swirls that were all dried out!! Having eaten in the restaurant most nights for the last 3 years, we only went twice and said we wouldn’t go again. Salmon salad was like old bits of lettuce that should have been thrown out. Stir fry was over cooked, sloppy and tasted horrid. Chicken burger came with a small handful of thrown on chips, rest of the plate was empty. I understand it isn’t a 5* restaurant but having had some nice food and service from that restaurant before it was more noticeable. Every drink we ordered came in dirty glasses, we were told it was just water marks but they were grim with lipstick marks, old bits of dried lemon!! Tried to get a slush on three occasions, each time the machine wasn’t working. It’s a shame as the clubhouse as always been good value for money but this time it was awful.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Interesting and good value
Review:
A step into the past as you gaze at the portraits, armoury, and scale the keep. It's high up but the view is terrific. The other part is a look at the lifestyles of the gentry. The bathrooms were breathtaking in their size. Reasonable giftshop. Found it odd they were selling London busses though!
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Arundel
Title: Never disappoints
Review:
We had a large well-equipped room, the only problem being that we couldn't sort out the air conditioning and the TV stations were in alphabetical order, which was confusing. The hotel has a large car park and is situated next door to a Beef Eater restaurant.
Read less

Name: Mandarin Chef
Title: Best Chinese in Felpham, Middleton, Bognor Regis!!!!
