Maybe if I’d have forked out £15 for a main we may not have been so disappointed- although at these prices I would have hoped staff to have a smarter look and more professional presence. Will not be returning and do not recommend.

Name: Tajdar
Title: Chalk and cheese
Review:
This place used to be amazing. The new people are just odd. Nothing to complain about the food, it tasted great but the service was awful, if not the worst I’ve ever had anywhere.
The waiters were awkward, didn’t give you a chance to settle in your seat before trying to shove the menu at you and ask if you want a drink.
There were two tables in the restaurant and the food took 40 minutes, when we asked how long it’ll be at half an hour we got a weird smirk with an ‘oh it won’t be long’.
When we were eating they kept coming and taking bowls away and didn’t ask how the food was. I hadn’t finished and they tried to clear the table.
It used to be a lovely experience with a smile going here but I’d avoid because there’s so many better places for service. It was always busy and tonight was dead.
They then asked if we wanted to tip and kept watching us? Who does that

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Not that good
Review:
Went for family meal as kids love salad bar and ice cream.
Typical pre ordered frozen food served to the masses.
Nothing special. Always dirty messy floors, salad bar messy and food all over the place and on floor. Kids out hands in, spoons back in wrong dishes. Just not my idea of good food.
Wont rush back!

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Amazing
Review:
We ate here twice in the 3 days we were at Butlin’s. The food and service was amazing. Best restaurant in the complex.
The manager had a wonderful personality and all the staff were 5*
Highly recommend it.

Name: The Spur
Title: Lunch meal
Review: Warm welcome with open fire burning. Service was good from Andrew and the other lady whose name I did not catch. Food was good and plentifull. Pies are good and chunky chips recommended. Plenty of fresh vegetables.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Pretty good
Review: Very friendly staff, food was well cooked. Orders taken quickly. Starters came out a little late, as did the mains. Overall, very good indeed

Name: India Gate
Title: Lovely food
Review: Lovely little restaurant, clean and cosy , friendly staff and food was lovely and fast service , would definitely go back again

Name: Butlins
Title: Great laugh
Review:
Best butlins by far cleanest and good value for the dish you pay .had lots of fun with the hole family. Kids loved it to when they get older I'm sure they will be taking there family to cheers guys keep up the good work.
Read less

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Disappointing
Review:
We have eaten here on previous occasions and food has usually been ok but the service has been routinely patchy. Last night it reached a new low
There was one waitress, who was very pleasant but who was rushed off her feet. She took our drink order which then took over thirty minutes to be brought to the table.
There were several items on the menu that were not available even though it was very early in the evening. The food service was very slow. We had to ask twice for a carafe if water and it finally arrived just as we were finishing our meals.
The waitress apologised for the delays and she was working hard under real pressure. The fault was not hers. It is down to poor management and organisation
We won’t hurry back

Name: Wheatsheaf
Title: Mr r wadey
Review: Great Christmas lunch staff went the extra mile been several times since and been great highly recommend

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Lunch with daughter
Review:
I have been a number of times for lunch and have never been disappointed.

Today was good, excellent bar person (female), who was efficient, attentive and humorous.

Food from the lunch menu was sufficient and tasty.

Name: Flying Fortress
Title: Large Unruly kids in under 4’s only section
Review:
Arrived for opening time with my 22 month old and all was great. Soon after arrival it got busy.

The under 2 and under 4 areas suddenly got busy with either giant 4 year old’s or kids and parents that cannot read the signs as they were running riot with no parents to supervise in these areas.

My daughter was getting pushed all over the place. Staff we uninterested when I complained about it. Not a great experience this time
Read less

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Terrible outcome to my first visit
Review: Working in the area, and visited for dinner after seeing the impressive website and menu. Was very disappointed to be told on arrival that the kitchen was not open tonight. I was subsequently informed that the chief's were all ill. Not providing me with confidence for future visits.

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Good for a short break in Arundel
Review:
Stayed here with my family. We had a quite room with very little noise from other guests. The price was very good for the 2night stay. It is what it is for a budget hotel but beds were comfortable and room spotless. Reception staff very helpful.
Read less

Name: Navigator
Title: Beautiful views and lovely staff
Review: Arrived around 3 o'clock and shown to our room. The room was really nice with BEAUTIFUL sea views. We had like a indoor balcony. It really was beautiful.  We had breakfast daily, which was freshly cooked, very tasty.  All the staff were really nice with a fab sence of humor.  In the room we were we had tea/coffee making facilities with biscuits,replenished daily.  In the bathroom there was miniture shower gel etc available.  We had a TV in the room, plus the hotel had a selection of DVD's available to watch free of charge. They also had a book case of books to use if wanted.  We ate in the restaurant one night which, again, was lovely.  All the staff were very nice and chatty and always there to help if u wanted anything.  All in all a home from home. Thank you! From the Finch's (Room 3)

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Disappointed
Review:
We’re regulars at WWT Washington so thought we’d pay a visit while in the area. To say we were disappointed is an understatement. It’s great if you like swans and ducks but there’s very little else to speak of. Seemed to be very overgrown in places too, making bird spotting/photography almost impossible.
I’m pleased we’re members as I’d have been gutted to have paid nearly £27 for very little.
The staff we came across weren’t very friendly either, totally the opposite from WWT Washington
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Terrible Service Poor Food Quality
Review: Stopped off en route to Brighton for a quick drink and a bite to eat. Sat at a table of 2, nearly on top of the next table, despite restaurant being nearly empty. After trying to grab 2 waitresses who appeared to be doing very little, along with a manager and bar staff, again appearing to be doing nothing more than walking round with a sour face; we finally ordered drinks which took over 10minutes to arrive. We ordered a starter a side and dessert as we were only passing through to receive "we don't usually serve snacks in the restaurant, you should have sat in the bar", completely unnecessary and frankly just rude given there were plenty of free tables. Food finally arrives after 45minutes of being sat in the restaurant, dessert was stale, side barely luke warm. Certainly will not be visiting this "restaurant " again.

Name: Ship & Anchor
Title: Great place
Review: Having stated here a couple of years ago, we were keen to return, albeit at short notice. Helen, the campsite host was so accommodating, friendly and helpful. Facilities were clean, people friendly and it’s a great location. My girls loved the little play park and met lots of friends. A great place to stay. Quiet, friendly and a pub on site!

Name: Aldwick Beach
Title: Private
Review: The reason this beach is a little gem is because it is private and owned by the residents of Aldwick Bay Estate. Of course no one minds dog walkers and holidaymakers passing through as long as they realise the beach is private and for residents and their families and guests only. The private part stretches from one end of the estate to the other but does not include the beach huts part. The Dunes, the sitting area and the boardwalk are all part and parcel paid for by the estate residents. Only residents can park in the Dunes and they all have badges in their cars to show they are residents. I have lived on this estate for 12 years and it always looks good due to the efforts of the residents.

Name: Parsons Table
Title: A great place
Review:
This is a great place. Had a really good meal with a good menu and plenty of daily specials.

Staff are professional and attentive, the cleanliness and decor are as you'd expect.

Name: Motte & Bailey
Title: Excellent Breakfasts
Review: Whether it was the full English or poached egg on toast or a bacon bap there was nothing to fault the food, service and ambience. Also nice to find a Cafe where the tables are not on top of each other or where the noise level is too high.

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Great food
Review:
Superb cuisine. I had lamb jalfrezi,pilau rice & a garlic naan.
Really lovely. It may be a couple of quid dearer but worth the extra.

Name: Avisford
Title: Lovely lunch in The Lounge Bar
Review:
Popped in for lunch with a friend in the Lounge Bar last week. We were looked after by a lovely lady called Verity. Really good food and excellent service. I will definitely come back for lunch here again!
Read less

Name: So India, Little.
Title: Never again
Review: Visited with friends and we were enjoying the evening until main courses arrived.No one had cleared our table of empty plates and glasses from previous course so the staff complained there was no where to put the food?.We had to ask for more cutlery as well.We were about to eat dessert and have coffee when we were abruptly told they needed the table back.The staff were rude and argumentative.My children had to leave without finishing....Absolutely disgraceful treatment.Will never go again!!.

Name: China Palace
Title: beautiful
Review:
beautiful decor, directly opposite castle walls, very friendly and helpful and excellent food, well cooked and reasonably priced.
definitely recommend

Name: Church Farm
Title: Facilities only review
Review:
No complaints with our caravan. Just a review of facilities etc. Mash & Barrel restaurant overpriced & poor food for money, suggest go elsewhere. Evening magician entertainment beyond appalling. Outdoor pool layout not good as have to go out of pool & long way round to get a drink & shut for repair on hottest day of week without warning. Surprised to see a maintenance operative driving tractor along on site road whilst texting when youngsters walking along road. If not on a cheap deal I’d look elsewhere! Ray the gate security guy lovely though.
Read less

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Great as always.
Review: Holiday every year in Pagham and always use this cafe for our meals, mostly takeaways. The food is really tasty and freshly cooked, good value and good sized portions. Staff are friendly, efficient and helpful. You can eat in or out on a large patio with lovely seating and shading. Ice creams at the associated shop are lovely. Less than a minute's walk from the beach.

Name: Angmering Manor
Title: Birthday meal
Review:
Good food and plenty of it with good choices on the menu the staff were polite and helpful well recommended and will be visiting again the restaurant and surrounding areas were clean and well kept came out totally happy
Read less

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: 100% recommend
Review: Great restaurant and has loads of character! The food was amazing especially the halloumi fries! Me and my friends will definitely be coming back and our waiter Josh was very lovely. Thank you!

Name: China Royal
Title: Good food great buffet
Review: Great food, good choice at buffet, good value, service is good, we have been 4 times now and allways nice. We look forward to going again.

Name: Littlehampton Beach
Title: Lovely walk along the beach
Review: Mile upon mile of beach paths starting from the Arun in Littlehampton all the way to Shoreham estary not that we walked it one hit. But great to stop off along the way by car and walk as long as you want with good cafes dotted along the way.

Name: Toast
Title: Goodwood trip
Review: Cinamon was recommended to us by the campsite and we weren't disappointed the food was fantastic the waiter was on the ball with drinks and keeping us happy well done and thank you !! 10 out of 10

Name: Town House
Title: Fabulous hotel
Review:
We noticed this town house with a sign for accommodation when we first arrived in Arundel. After having a wander down to the tourist centre for information about a place to stay, we decided to see if they had a room.
Luckily for us they just had one left, but only for one night. We took it and also made a reservation for dinner in the restaurant.
The room was wonderful; clean and spacious with high end toiletries in the en-suite. The bed was extremely comfortable.
The dinner was amazing. My husband had steak and lobster, he said it was the best he’s ever had. I had cod on a bed of chorizo mashed potato with mushrooms and sautéed Swiss chard. It was delicious. Oh and I couldn’t resist dessert, a raspberry and lemon curd roulade with ice cream. Worth every calorie.
Don’t ever let me hear anyone say the English can’t cook.
I would highly recommend The Town House for accommodation and the superb restaurant.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Despite all I hoped for - food was Poor
Review:
I had driven by a few times in my own and had also read some good reviews of this place, so in made a special effort to take my wife to the Oystercatcher.
With the lunchtime food that I was served it looks like I was the only one who made a special effort!
We had a very pleasant drink of draught lager and ordered some food. I ordered the Chicken BLT and
my wife wanted just some chips with skins on.
That’s where it all went downhill - the chips both on their own and with the BLT were over cooked to the point of them being inedible!
The bread that the BLT was in was dry and almost stale.
We had both had a long day and could not be bothered to raise the issue with the staff as in my opinion they should know if they are serving rubbish food!
It’s a pity as this was our first visit there and it will probably be our last.
Very disappointed!

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Very expensive
Review: Went in on Wednesday evening staff just stood and watched us eat quite unnerving food was ok but I had a tandoori mixed grill with salad, the salad was more like a garnish. When it came to the bill we thought it was extortionate then they had put 10% for service charge for three people which we thought was disgusting. . Before you used to get a shot of baileys on the house but not any more definitely.wont be going back.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Terrible food and overpriced
Review:
Way overpriced and terrible food. Small portions and no major effort. I doubt any locals would choose this restaurant surviving on ripping off holiday makers. Also they suggested pay after, I’m guessing a lot of people walked away paying before.
Same meal for more would’ve been less than £15 back home. Here was £35!

Name: Inglenook
Title: Mr williams
Review: Went on boxing day Absolute rip off No drink on arrival and actually no one to greet us at all Two tiny slithers of meat from carvery then had to wait 15 mins for bill Very disappointing as it all came to £80

Name: Pizza Express
Title: Sub standard pizza's
Review:
I visited Pizza Express Arundel towards the end of May with my wife. We ordered 2 pizza's one was a classic the other on a gluten free base. After waiting 20 minitues our pizza's arrived. The gluten free pizza looked like a child's pizza with thinly spaced topping. I asked the waiter why my pizza was normal size and the other smaller. He said the gluten free pizza's were the same size (I think he needs to go to Specsavers). He also explained that all of their pizza's come to them frozen. I have been going to Pizza Express for many years, however haven't visited Pizza Express for at least 2 years. This was a bad experience not to be repeated.

I Have a wonderful pizza restaurant that has a pizza man who comes from Naples, near to where I live. He makes authentic pizza's (not frozen) and in a wood fired oven.
Pizza Express is not good value for money. I used to recommend them, however never again.

Name: Beachcomber Inn
Title: Awful Breakfast/Ok Lunch
Review:
I’ve just had breakfast here with my family. Absolutely disgusting. Cooked badly, poor quality food and expensive for what you get.
Had lunch here the other day which was slightly better but not great.
We’ve eaten at the other restaurants at Butlins and this is by far the worst. Don’t waste your money or your time.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Mick Phillips
Review:
Excellent. Second visit in 2 months.
Cozy surroundings. Lovely food,nice portions,very good value.Very pleasant staff. Will recommend to anyone.

Name: Out of Bounds
Title: Climbing activity
Review:
When it rains the grandson loves it here.
The climbing is his favourite
The staff are attentive
The briefing before hand is through
On the other hand the cafe staff could improve their customer service skills, I’ve stopped using it because they are so rude.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: NEVER AGAIN
Review:
We chose the harvester today for our family lunch as I love the spit roasted chicken. What an awful experience from start to finish.
The restaurant is dirty. The salad cart was almost empty and completely tasteless! No rotisserie chicken on the menu as run out. My second choice of pork belly had also run out, the waitress Rosin couldn’t care at all, shrugged her shoulders and walked off. Never came back. We asked for the manager who was very friendly and said all the right things, we placed an order of drinks and never saw her again. Had to go to the bar to collect our drinks as 20 minutes had passed. The barman was too busy on his phone to sort the drinks order, didn’t even acknowledge us. The food was not that great and we had to send 1 plate back.
Basically this place is run by kids who have no customer skills whatsoever.
Harvester you should be ashamed of this restaurant.
I will never return to a harvester ever again.
As a local taxi driver I will be telling customers to avoid this place.

Name: Sen
Title: Birthday Meal
Review: As always amazing food amazing service amazing staff. Can't think of a better place to celebrate. Everyone should try here you won't be disappointed. Thank you for a lovely evening. Sean & Ali x

Name: The Bear Inn
Title: Evening meal
Review: Ordered homemade burger and fries. Burger was very nice fries ok. I had no issue but someone I was with complained about the coke. The staff said there nothing wrong with it and didn't offer a replacement.

Name: So India, Little.
Title: Great Food
Review: Very punctual with take away orders and always have a smile to greet you. Portion size is very good and a great taste.

Name: The Diner
Title: The Diner . Butlins. Bognor.
Review: Service was fast,some staff were friendly, the food was very greasy,poor value for money. We had a wonky table throughout the entire meal even though we complained from the start for it to be fixed,ended up with a spillage. Won't go there again.

Name: Butlins
Title: Fantastic long family weekend
Review:
We had a 4 year break from Bognor Regis Butlins and came back because they children really wanted to come back. We were pleasently surprise to find a brand new pool opened on our day of arrival. The splash world facility was well thought of, plenty of lockers, free use of hair dryers and they also provide spinners to dry your swimming costumes. Butlins is good value for money as they have indoor and outdoor fairgrounds, daimy time and evening entertainment included. We also really liked the new Discover Animal display they added. Again new from the weekend we areived. Plenty to do with the family. We also really like Bognor Regis the town.
Read less

Name: Swanbourne Lodge
Title: Rude staff
Review: Didn’t even make it inside before being accosted by a couple of staff members. Decided to go elsewhere. A shame given it’s beautiful surroundings

Name: Avisford
Title: Weekend break
Review:
Stayed Sunday night. Great period property with lots of character. Grade 2 listed. Nice grounds with large outdoor pool & terraces which can be used in the summer. Was going to eat out but found the restaurant seemed better instead of eating out. Glad we did as food fantastic. The indoor pool was quite hot & lovely to swim in. Didn't use sauna or steam room or gym but looked great. Breakfast was also good. Nice views across the golf course. Rooms clean & well equipped. Staff very friendly in all a great weekend. Free car park.
Read less

Name: Cockburns Tea Rooms
Title: Delicious cakes
Review:
Have visited these tearoom a couple of times and both times food and service has been excellent.
The sandwiches have tasty fillings and come nicely presented and the cheese scones are excellent but try the cakes......they are
delicious!
My only negative comment, I believe there is only one toilet which is disabled friendly but it means individuals having to stand in the middle of the tearoom whilst waiting for the toilet which is not ideal plus not so pleasant for the tables closely located.

Name: Partners Café
Title: Amazing!
Review: Went here today and the service was top notch and the food was really scrummy! Looking to return for sure when we return to Arundel!

Name: World's End
Title: Awful lunch
Review: Chicken Caesar burger with cold chips and a rather inexplicable bowl of strong garlic mayo (not Caesar). My sister had chicken Kiev served with school standard boiled cabbage (apparently the green beans weren’t cooked and “still in the oven” ?! Nice enough staff and pretty surroundings but the food was quite dreadful.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Worst service ever!
Review: I’d been here over an hour, I’d only been served starters and drinks. Mains took 1 hour and 25 minutes. The service was terrible. We were basically ignored the whole night!!!

Name: Church Farm
Title: SIMPLY FANTASTIC
Review:
Recently returned from our 2nd break at Church Farm. Starting with a wonderful welcome from Ray bless him, what a gent. A wonderful quiet park with everything we needed. Our caravan was lovely, a few issues were resolved within 15 mins of raising them. Sam on reception was brilliant, and his manager I think also a Sam was great. The groundsmen work extremely hard, the whole place is spotless and very nicely maintained. The entertainment was great for the kids despite being school term. The swimming pool was very good, one gripe was dirty nappies left by some disrespectful humans with no morals in the shower, but overall the lifeguards were fab, especially the young lad in the green top who does the inflatable disco on Thursday. The mash and barrel staff were good but the food was awful and a waste of £50. The arcades were good, a girl named Charley was simply amazing with our little ones and such a nice friendly girl. Security was spot on, again friendly and helpful people, chip shop was nice and reasonable prices. Upon check out, Ray was standing at the entrance in the most treacherous rain for people to hand their caravan keys to him to save them getting wet, what a credit to haven he is. Overall a smashing week and just what we needed. Thank you all.
Read less

Name: China Royal
Title: Worst Chinese Ever
Review: Chowmain was just dry old noddles no sauce or flavour, who knows when the chicken was cooked. Rest was tasteless, couldn’t tell one dish from another. My son had a chicken curry swimming in oil chicken so full of water you could squeeze it out he didn’t eat his meal, some food you can’t put a knife or fork in some veg in cooked. As far as takeaway goes the worst I’ve ever had, as a family on a budget who save up to have this sort of treat a complete disappointment. Have Toast safer and tast better and you won’t go hungry as we have

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Birthday lunch
Review:
I can not fault the staff who were very attentive, the food was mediocre with a uninspiring menu. The pie of the day was ok but no vegetables were with it which is fine if you only like pie and chips. The other meals of lasagna and burger were of a weatherdpoons level.
I wouldn’t waist your money having the lunch time menu.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Fantastic *****
Review: For a portuguese like me, the food is very important! Five star restaurant: the decoration, the service, the food, the friendliness of all. To repeat!

Name: Mustards
Title: Good food
Review: A lovely restaurant . Nice food and nice decor and a central location . Worth trying for yourselves . A rare find for Bognor Regis . We had the set menu and the food was cooked to perfection .

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Worst restaurant in the area
Review:
Went for a family Sunday morning brunch.
We sat down ordered at the till and waited, some of the food arrived, cold and tasteless toast burnt and turned over!!
2 in our party's food dint turn up, no apology, no management to explain why, promises of food will be out soon.
20 minutes later and requests to the staff our food never turned up, we got up and left.
No manager came to us or cared.
Avoid at all costs.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Love it here
Review:
Been many times with friends, wife and family.
Great burgers and fries, well everything really.
Would and have recommended many times.
Beautiful work guys

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Disappointing experience
Review: Disappointed with the service. I have been here several times for family gatherings, but this time my family gathering was ruined by staff being rude after informing them of problems with the food.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Burnt chips and bad service
Review: Chose here as a convenient lunch stopping point on way home from holiday. We arrived early so ordered as soon as food was available at 12pm. My partner and I had burgers which were fine but the chips were appalling, very overdone to the point they were extremely crunchy and burnt tasting- like the overdone ones on a tray of oven chips. No one came to ask if our food was ok so didn’t have any opportunity to complain, no staff in evidence except an overworked bar lady with a queue. My daughters meal was meant to come with peas but arrived without so we had to request them. Sat for 20 mins with dirty plates in front of us before my partner had to request my daughters dessert which came with kiddie meal. When our plates were cleared and I told the waitress the chips were uneatable she said she would tell the chef and we hear no further, no offer of replacement etc. A bad experience, won’t return.

Name: KFC Bognor
Title: try to avoid
Review: We love KFC this has to be the worst one we have visited, food cold had to take back, then when next lot came it was luke warm, if you want a good KFC go to Fontwell Lovely Jubbly

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Better batter
Review:
Saturday lunch for three after a bracing walk beside the sea at Littlehampton.

Found the Lamb on TA and decided to give it a try. Very glad we did.

Very pleasant ambience in the restaurant and a very warm welcome on arrival.

The menu is a nice balance between interesting fine dining options and pub staples like fish and chips and the burger.

Drinks orders were taken swiftly, but maybe not too observantly, as my wife and mother-in-law were the bemused recipients of pints of Amstel and Peroni respectively

However the food arrived swiftly and what food it was; my pork belly was superb, and the girls’ fish and chips were by common consensus maybe the best ever, with wonderful light crispy batter verging on the Tempura, and chunky chips with just the right balance of crispy outside and floury inside.

Perhaps understandably, the ladies were a little full after their mains and pints of lager, so we passed on the desserts.

Good service, great food and a pleasant ambience. We’ll make a point of returning whenever we’re in the area.

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: Great manager!
Review:
(Rest of the staff not bad either!!).
At check in there was a problem - nothing to do with the Inn - but Paul bent over backwards to try and help us resolve it. Even after the matter was sorted, the following day he was still trying to discover how things had gone awry.
Other than that, we had a great stay. Good beer/food in a friendly pub and very comfortable accommodation, with a good choice for breakfast.Looking forward to visiting again.

Name: YHA
Title: Great little stop
Review: YHA Littlehampton has everything we needed and was in a great location. Easy walk to everything and right by the river. Family room was basic but clean and tidy. The host was very organised and helpful.

Name: La Cucina
Title: So good we ate there twice in two days
Review: Very enjoyable modern Italian restaurant. Staff were helpful and friendly. The evening we visited there was an emergency alarm triggered and fire brigade attended. Customers were politely asked to evacuate and the staff were apologetic. We were allowed to return and normal service resumed. The food was most enjoyable. I had chicken supreme which was very tasty. My partner had breadcrumbed chicken with bolognase which he enjoyed. On our second evening I had goats cheese salad which was a circular tower. Very enjoyable indeed. On another visit to Rustington we will return to La Cucina

Name: KFC Bognor
Title: Couldn't even get served
Review: Waiting at the ordering point in the drive through for quite some time with no one requesting our order, we assumed the intercom wasn't working. Drove round to the serving window to be asked if we'd stopped at the ordering point to which we advised yes we had for quite some time. They told us they can't take orders at that window so we'd need to go back round again. If they spent more time serving and less time talking to eachother they would have got our custom. With burger King just down the road that's exactly where we went. Won't be trying to eat here again

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Excellent hotel only let down by one aspect
Review: Always a pleasant stay - we're regulars at this hotel. Staff are friendly and welcoming, and the location is perfect - only 15 mins walk from the beach. Only problem this time was the room itself - normally, the family rooms are off to one side on the ground floor, but we were put in an upstairs central room this time. This meant that the smell from guests smoking outside came straight into our room, which made our children feel unwell. We tried to stop this by shutting the windows, but the cleaning staff opened them in the morning, meaning that by the time we got back to the room at night, the smell had settled in the room. Unfortunate, and hopefully next time we can request a different room.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Restaurant is good value with the £15 2 course lunch promotion
Review:
We have visited Ockenden Manor, Cuckfield and Spread Eagle, Midhurst (all in the same group management) but Bailiffscourt restaurant is the winner! Wonderful atmosphere in the old building, but we were fortunate to be able to eat in the enclosed courtyard on a sunny but windy day. Menu was limited, drinks were expensive but great value for £15pp with high quality food and beautiful bread rolls! Very attentive staff.
Read less

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Dreadful fried selection
Review:
The service was interminably long but the waiter did apologise and said they were short of staff so that was accepted without complaint.

Also I appreciate it is wrong to judge a place on a single visit so allowances there too.

However the meal was the worst meal I have ever eaten - a platter of seafood - whitebait, scampi, calamari and ‘fish balls’.
Without thinking too deeply about it I ordered it with chips as well.

What arrived was a large plate of the items described and everything battered and fried plus a serving of very tired looking fried chips.
The mass of fried and battered items looked awful, was not that nice to eat and I left most fearing heartburn, indigestion and an upset stomach besides a calorie intake that should raise alarm bells.

Ok I was stupid ordering a completely ridiculous fried selection and badly balanced meal but it begs the question why was it on the menu in the first place?

I noted the remains of other similar ‘platters’ being left by other customers.
So nothing that could not be corrected by having menu selections that provided much more balanced and interesting courses rather than a awful unhealthy mass of fried food.

Name: Butlins
Title: Family disaster.
Review:
PLEASE READ THIS EVERYONE. I visited here last year. NOT family friendly VERY unsafe place. Man killed this week by 1 punch. I was in a similar incident last year. No help, no feeling of safety on site. PLEASE DO NOT VISIT THIS PLACE IT SHOULD BE CLOSED DOWN.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: First and last time at Butlin’s
Review:
We come Monday until Friday this week for my birthday but only managed until Thursday , the hotel we stayed in was average although waking up every hour as the air conditioning kept turning on , the “50” million water park was not impressive and quite disappointing , the pools kept closing plus some poor kid had an accident on one of the slides and the lifeguards were acting so unprofessional and the inflatable machine broke so you had to carry the big inflatable up 6 flights of stairs , I’ve just had to book a mid week break to centre parcs to get over how awful and chavvy butlins is ,
Read less

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: My stay
Review:
This was a good place to stay with free parking on site
My only bad points are that the rooms facing the main carriageway are a bit noisy so not good for light sleepers
The other point was shower head was spraying in all the wrong directions partially blocked but was good enough
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Poor
Review:
One person in the front of house on one of their busiest breakfast mornings, very slow service.
Strange egg omelette more like a Yorkshire pudding.

Enough said .

The answer, would we ? Nope

Name: La Campagnia
Title: New Years Eve
Review: Got a table on New Years Eve without a booking. However restaurant was fairly full. Menu very Italian and had all the usual suspects. All the food and wine were very good. Nice evening.

Name: Arundel Cathedral
Title: Very friendly staff
Review:
Fine organ and building nice shop and friendly staff. I enjoyed playing the organ. Do not miss the carpet of flowers in June!
Read less

Name: Angmering Manor
Title: Nice traditional hotel
Review:
Really nice place old school decor and boutique styled rooms the ceilings are very low so watch out if your 6’ or over please have a look at the pictures I can’t comment on the food as I didn’t eat there
Read less

Name: Arundel Historic Tours
Title: Quirky walking tour
Review: We bowled up not sure what to expect as this was mentioned as a daily attraction during the Arundel Festival. We were delighted by the wealth of local knowledge that Martin shared with us, and we shall look at the town and the architecture with newly opened eyes , boring my friends with fascinating nuggets he told us. Excellent value for money and Martin and Karen, his helpful back marker, run this every day, not just during the Festival.

Name: Butlins
Title: The new Splash pool is disgusting
Review:
I went to Butlins Bognor Regis for the first time today with my 8 and 10 year old and can’t help myself but leave a review about the new pool which I thought was so disappointing. The queues were so long for the rapids and the flumes and they were seriously disappointing, I had to push myself through the rapids and I’m tiny! On top of that the floors around the pools, slides, toilets and changing rooms were absolutely revolting, smelly, full of hairs, plasters and God knows what else!! Surely in a brand new pool hygiene should be of its upmost importance! I will definitely not be coming back again, sorry.
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Disappointing breakfast visit
Review: We were so disappointed to find a drop in standards since our last pleasant visit in the summer. There seemed to be a skeleton staff available. Our waiter did his best but the kitchen was woefully inadequate. The bacon was virtually served cold, with barely cooked fat on the rasher, the hash browns were unappetising, the mushrooms tasted unpleasant. Tomatoes and fried eggs were fine. The available croissants were heated on request. The Costa coffee machine came up with warm rather than hot coffee and a latte that had very little coffee in the meagre shot just lots of milk. The dried fruit selection had inedible hard prunes. The fruit salad was good but lacked extra juice. Standards have indeed slipped. There were very few people for a Saturday morning unlike the busy restaurant in the summer.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Cinema stop
Review:
Not been here for a while and now I know why, I booked a table on line for 18-30 and was taken to our table on time.
The service was slow and our waiter did apologise for the delay.
Our drinks took nearly 30 minutes to arrive very slow we had only ordered a main and this took an hour to arrive.
When using the salad bar this was in a state very untidy and empty containers and sauce jugs looking very mucky and the hole area needed a wipe down. This was done eventually but it looked like that this area was not managed properly.
On the desert menu no ice cream as the machine was broken the staff do what they can but I believe that this restaurant is poorly managed tables full of crockery and the toilets need monitoring. This is a sea side restaurant and you will get lots of people popping in after a day on the beach so the management must know that they are going to get busy.
Hopefully if we return things will have changed for the better. Too many restaurants out there plying for our business Havester take notice.

Name: Butlins
Title: February half term fabulous fun!
Review:
Back again (how we can stay away eh?)!

We stayed in the Ocean Hotel, it looking as clean as it was when it first opened. Freddie at Reception treated us as though we were the only guests he'd met all day - so polite, jolly, taking such great interest in my boys - what a great start!
In fact, every member of staff we spoke to went well out of their way to help us / make us feel at ease, as per our requests. And of course, the legend known as Ritchie....! Thanks Ritchie for the advice you gave my boys, and not just about football either.

With the new dining system we were able to eat in a variety of locations, for both breakfast and dinner (we were too full to eat lunch!) - this gave our stay such variation, no day was in no way the same. And as for the choice of food - I think The Deck came out top favourite, but that along with the Ocean Hotel restaurant and Papa Johns too. Another thing I find that people overlook is the 'background' music playing whilst we ate - it was such an eclectic mix, tunes for everyone, so giving the great age range of our group songs to sing along too whilst we ate, so adding to our fun (I wasn't the worst singer btw!).

My eldest son (genuinely!) beat me for the first time ever on the go-karts - at least I had the ice cream from the 'pink cows shop' (so funny) brought for me this year by the chuffed victor!

We must return to experience the much-anticipated new leisure pool - that's going to enhance our stay so much more.

Thank you Butlins - you've again managed to give my family and I such an amazing experience / stay / holiday / total rest.

Just fab :-)
Read less

Name: The Southdowns
Title: Not a good overall experience
Review:
We visited this pub 10.30 am for breakfast. I ordered the food, 1 veggie breakfast sizzling, 2 standard breakfasts plated, 2 filter coffees.
First the guy serving Mr personanaly, not even a hello good morning so I cheerfully said good morning, I got a good morning back, amazing, I'm coming to spend money in your pub.
Went to get 2 coffees from the coffee jug only enough for 1 left in jug, went to inform same guy said he would would bring a refill out, meanwhile my other cup left on the bar, after 5 min noticed the jug had been refilled, we were sitting next to the bar, went to the bar to ask for the other cup, felt embarrassed to ask the 2 staff standing with backs to the bar as they were eating the breakfast filled baps, had to ask for my cup in the end.
The breakfast came not what I had asked for the vegetarian should have been sizzling, politely said this to same guy, he did offer to change this said no its OK.
The breakfasts were all luke warm the sausages were white, the eggs were lovely, could not be bothered to complain again.
As we left my wife said goodbye no response.
I do hope the Rd reads this, we are happy cheerfully people left this pub feeling deflated.
Perhaps training is needed, I can give a list of pubs where the experience is fantastic.
What a pity, this I have noticed is mostly from some of the chains, not including weathspoons.
Mr Kelvin Luscombe

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Sunday lunch
Review:
Heard the news that this is the place for Sunday lunch in Arundel. Lunch was fine but accompanied by eye watering London +++++ prices for drinks. Raised it with manager who shrugged and was sorry about that ... hmm
Read less

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Disgusting dirty room
Review:
Don’t stay here. We asked for their best room, was told we had one of the best, we showed reception the photos they made no attempt to clean the room, just offered £50 refund on a £246 per night double, which we refused. Shower didn’t work, broken tiles, dirt behind broken bathroom door, disgusting brown wet stuff on cushion, mould growing around taps, rotten mouldy wood around the whole bath pigeons nesting in roof woke us at 5.30am. If it was free I would not stay there again. They emailed me confirming that they are happy with the condition of the room that you can see in the photographs. They won’t comment on the brown wet stuff on the cushion. We aren’t regular reviews or complainers but this was so disgusting we felt we had to say something.
Read less

Name: Mustards
Title: Great lunch event at Mustards
Review:
This is a great addition to Bognor Regis restaurants. Quality food at a fair price. This was my second visit and we have booked for a third.
The ambiance still needs a little improvement as the restaurant eating area feels rather open.
Bar staff are very aware and efficient, as are the waiting staff.
If you are local you should try this place and if you are a visitor you will like this restaurant.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Not impressed
Review: We stayed next door at the Premier Inn which was spotless and newly refurbished. We almost didn’t have breakfast but decided to at the last minute - big mistake. Shown to a table by a strict miserable looking woman, who pointed out where everything was then disappeared. The fried breakfast items were already cooked and being kept warm(ish). The pastries were sparse and didn’t get replenished, the fruit salad consisted of melon and melon, am assuming there was originally other fruits that had been picked out and again not replenished! There were no muffins or bagels and just 2 crumpets which looked stale. The Greek yogurt was in a tiny bowl and ran out before we reached it, by which time we’d lost interest and couldn’t be bothered to ask for more. We’ve had numerous Premier Inn breakfasts over the years and they’ve always been delicious. Not here. What’s happened???

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Sunday Dinner
Review: Ordered a bottle of New Zealand rose wine the roast pork for me lamb for my partner. The wine was just placed on the table could not be bothered to open it never mined offered a tate. The meal mine was pork on the plate was belly pork tasteless a thin strip cracklingg opaque, roast potatoes look good but hollow peas and broccoli stuffing an for some reason Yorkshire pudding.. Offered apple sauce but was not fresh suspect mass produced. My partner meal was lamb shoulder it was exactly the same except for the meat she said the lamb was OK but the rest Very disappointing . We both suspect that the meal rather than being cooked fresh had been cook either in morning or day before and reheated overall a very disappoting meal. Was going to have a pudding but decided not to bother in cas it was like the rest.

Name: So India, Little.
Title: Inedible
Review: Dreadful takeaway that was thrown away. Had we been eating in the restaurant, we would not have paid. The mixed starter was unlike any we have eaten before. Onion bhajis and samosas were a sodden mess, drowned under some sort of sauce. The main course was pretty awful too. The rice was congealed and barely warm, the chicken dry and inconsistant and the sauce insipid. We won’t be returning.

Name: Empress Bar
Title: Extremely expensive
Review: Went for a drink with the family on a hot day, ordered a pint of draft lager, draft cider and 2 small orange squashes with tap water, cost £16.40 when I ask for a price list she said they didnt have one. Nice place, strange decor but horrendously over priced drinks, felt like I had been ripped off.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: An absolute hidden gem!
Review:
Our room was perfect with a very large clean bathroom, service impeccable, food wonderful, perfect for a peaceful short break. For a special treat I suggest breakfast in bed. We didn't spend much time in the Spa but it all looked clean and tidy. Will definitely be returning!
Read less

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Saturday afternoon drinks
Review:
Having been here before and had some bad experiences with eating, we thought we’d be safe popping in for a drink. Nope.
Had to wait 10 minutes to be served. And it was empty. To top it off the person that served us was talking to a table all the time we were waiting, in eye shot of the bar! Poor.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Very Poor Carvery
Review:
We went to the Knights Table for a family birthday lunch on Sunday. After reading the many excellent reviews we were really looking forward to a lovely meal in a relatively new restaurant in Arundel.

Unfortunately our experience didn’t match the reviews.

After ordering the carvery for all of us we were told by the waitress that there would be a little wait, about ten minutes, while the carvery was ‘freshened up’.

However when we reached the carvery we were greeted with beef that had literally been seared on the outside and was raw and very bloody, 2 chicken pieces that were so pale they also didn’t look cooked and gammon that was over cooked and incredibly fatty. With the benefit of hindsight we should have refused the carvery and ordered something else but stupidly not wishing to make a fuss we carried on with it. In reality the food should never have been offered to us. There were little veg, the carrots had almost run out, the Yorkshire puddings were cold and tasted like cardboard and the roast potatoes inedible.

Interestingly, soon after we had been served, the carvery food was cleared and replaced. Perhaps we chose the wrong time to eat but again we should never have been served such poor food.

When the waitress cleared our plates, saw how we had left most of our food and asked how our food was she said ‘thank you for being honest and we welcome feedback positive or negative’ but with respect these are clearly just words.

Oh and for the record my husband would only have given a one star, not two as I have.

Whilst the decor is quite quirky, the hard wooden bench seats we were given were quite uncomfortable.

Unfortunately, we will not be returning to the Knights Table which is a shame as we do like to support local businesses.

Name: Mustards
Title: Birthday meal
Review: We have just had one of the best meals I have had in a long time at Mustards. It is situated just off the beach in Bognor Regis adjacent to the main shopping centre. Not the best situation but the food makes it an absolute must for celebrations. It’s not cheap so probably not a once a week thing but we will definitely be going back.

Name: Avisford
Title: Lovely night away
Review:
As previous reviews have said, the hotel is lovely but very tired looking, the whole place could do with redecorating and updating. Saying that, our room was spacious and clean and we had a good night sleep. The outdoor pool was a fantastic bonus and was heated to 30 degrees so perfect for my toddler. The inside pool was also lovely and warm. We ate dinner in the bar, which was good and there was also a good breakfast served the following morning in the restaurant. The staff at the hotel are outstanding. Everyone we met were so friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. It was a lovely night away, I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Read less

Name: Warren's Bakery
Title: Great Pasty
Review: Came here for a for a quick bite i found so much more and have visited a couple times since the staff are friendly and the food is great

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: So Chilled
Review: Could have stayed here all day, food looked amazing and staff were so welcoming! Walk down was lovely too! Lovely sights.

Name: Elmer Tandoori
Title: Total Let Down
Review:
this restaurant hides it really bad food behind its low charges,
the Quality of the food is a mar on the image of the concept of having edible food that represents anything like Indian food,
And not all that was ask for in the take out call was provided.
Pleases avoid this sham of an eatery, do not waste your time or money.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Worst cafe ever!
Review:
Absolutely disgusting! My friends and all our kids decided on a road trip to bognor for the day. All happily sitting down in the cafe waiting for our breakfasts. What a bloody let down !! Bacon wasnt cooked, egg looked contaminated, bread stale it was never ending !
We asked the manager to come over and he refused. We asked the waitress to call him over and again he refused so we ended up at the front with our full plates. And what an terrible manager he was ! No apologies, he tried blaming us and he was so rude. Definitely would recommend you all avoid this place. It wont ruin our day though! Vurals need to close down

Name: Arun View
Title: Nice view...
Review: Meal was no better than OK... lovely Selsey crab not improved by a slick of cream slurry described as Bloody Mary sauce - anaemic rather than bloody. Side salad came with a dollop of commercial sort-of coleslaw and bread was wrapped sliced. Could do better. Service was friendly, swift and the views from the restaurant are lovely.

Name: Butlins
Title: 90s weekend
Review:
Arrived 7.30 Fri evening,left site 8am next morning.completely misold nothing was open burger king or papa John's only.pool closed and restaurants as no staff.was told we would eating in our hotel restaurant that too was closed.most visitors were stag or hen party's drunken fighting ensued had no sleep due music tent full volume till 3am.and screaming drunken antics all night till 7am.weekend completely mis advertised basically a hen and stag weekend so if you want too drink all night and sleep all day it's fine.but if you expecting eating choices and to use pool and facilities that are advertised then stay well away.would not recommend to any one.absolutely disgusting place.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Family group of 16 for my disabled son's 18th birthday
Review:
We all arrived at Butlins on the Monday looking forward to getting into our apartments having a drink and something to eat after a long journey only to find all 3 apartment still in a bad condition and had to wait for them to then be re-cleaned but they only cleaned part off the apartments not a full re-clean which meant we had to spend over an hour cleaning all pot and pans etc. before we could use them with 3 disabled family members in our group it wasn't a very good start a week at Butlins it should off been then to top it all on the Wednesday the day before my son's 18th my daughter brock her foot going down one of the new water slides in there new pool as there was not enough water going down the water slide due to not enough water going down the slide or in the pool at the end to stop them hitting the steps at the end off the pool which resulted in her being down the hospital for over 4 hours and ended up completely spoiling the whole week away so no it was not a good week away at Butlins who will be getting sued for damages sustained by my daughter in the new pool area.
Read less

Name: Partners Café
Title: Simply Perfect :)
Review: Amazing food, Amazing atmosphere! Really lovely find. Highly recommend :) My children loved their meals and that is an amazing compliment :)

Name: YHA
Title: Lovely Littlehampton
Review:
Fab location with a board walk by a tidal river, up to a beach - good fish n chip shops and seafood restaurants on the way! Train station and car park right next to the hostel. Great place to stop.
The dorm room was spacious compared with some other hostels.

Name: Harbour Park
Title: Better than I expected
Review:
I was quite surprised by this place. Our kids (7 and 10) really enjoyed the rides which seemed to last longer than places we have been so we didn't feel ripped off, unlike Legoland a few weeks ago! It is just good fashioned fun by the see.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Weekend away with family
Review:
We stayed in the ocean hotel top floor with balcony and sea view. The room was very nice but failed on the cleaning . The balcony was dirty and when the cleaner came in to do the room it took her 5 minutes so was never cleaned properly. We had to ask for toilet paper as never left us any. Overall very poor value for money.
Read less

Name: The Dragon
Title: Sunday Lunch Buffet
Review: Had a lovely Sunday Buffet here at the Dragon, restaurant was really busy, however we were served quickly. The food was really tasty and hot, plenty of choice I am a big eater so the buffet is for me. We had starters and I had 4 main courses. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone I will be going back again just sorry I leave so far away otherwise I would be there every Sunday.

Name: Butlins
Title: Great visit
Review:
Just returned from a half term 4 day stay at Butlin’s. There is a great deal I could comment upon, but overall the experience was very good.

Excellent place for small children with on site entertainment through-out the 4 days we were there. Pool, shows and the Pavilion all had a range of activities for the little ones.

Accommodation was good, food was reasonable, staff were excellent. The only let down was the behaviour of some of the other guests we obviously thought the break was an excuse to get completely pissed, abdicate all parental responsibility and crash around, shouting outside in the early hours. If you can overlook the other guests, you will have a great time.
Read less

Name: Arundel Cathedral
Title: Took a visitor from australia
Review:
A very interesting castle, It does take a couple of hours to get around the whole thing.
The gardens are fantastic and well worth a visit on a sunny day with a nice book so you can sit and soak up the atmosphere.
Plenty to see worth a visit.
Read less

Name: Hotham Park
Title: The nicest park in Bognor.
Review:
Lovely park with lots for kids & adults.
here is a nice cafe which doe's very good food and ice-cream.
Lovely place to take picnic.
Read less

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: very disappointed
Review:
came here for a meal in the evening, lots of dogs waiting for us to give them food, while I like dogs, should not be allowed to keep worrying people that are eating.
this place used to be more up market. shall not be returning.

Name: Butlins
Title: Disquiet about swimming pool request
Review:
I have just returned from a 4 day visit with my three grandsons. We found the new swimming pool amazing - the boys loved it.
However for a woman of a certain age (60's) I prefer to wear a beach dress over my swimming costume, whilst sitting by the pool or walking from changing area to pool, as my body is not what it used to be. Of course I would not wear in the pool - neither would I consider it to be outdoor wear. I would not wear to work or drive in my car - it is beach/pool wear.
Twice I was asked by young male pool attendants to remove this dress, as in their words it was 'outdoor clothes'. Despite showing that I had my costume underneath, they were insistent.
Butlins - you need to rethink this policy.
Read less

Name: Wildforest Falls
Title: Newly refurbished adventure golf
Review: Wildforest golf is in Hotham Park at Bognor Regis, and is very well done. The golf itself is like many of its kind, but with added interest signposts for children. We found it quite expensive, but well worth the extra to help maintain the course.

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Saturday lunch
Review: Was disappointed with the menu as it was nothing like what I saw on line. Was not given the menu as looked on line the food was reasonably.

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Absolutely lovely place to stay!
Review:
Situated away from the hustle and bustle of the big cities, this is a really lovely small pub/restaurant!
The Food was excellent (we had lunch and breakfast); the menu offered an excellent choice without having hundreds to chose from and the quality of both meals was top notch!
My daughter and I had different choices and loved everything....the black pudding with my breakfast was the tastiest I've had in years!!!
We'll be back....!!

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Noisy, overheated and no hot water.
Review: This hotel is very tired. There's traffic noise, no air-con and the boiler had packed up when we visited. The staff were very good and were badly let down by the hotel. It seems as if this hotel is overdue for refurbishment.

Name: Toast
Title: Meal with friend
Review: Nice food but it was not hot,service was appalling it was Monday night not busy.Most expensive Indian Restaurant I have been to.Curry was bought to our table we had to ask for cutlery ordered 3 poppadoms only bought 2. We will not be going back definitely Would.not recommend to a yone

Name: Reema
Title: Terrible
Review:
No Indian taste is all rubbish .customer service is horrible.
Nonsense restaurant rule if u are 3 people u have to order 3 main course. What kind of uk law is this ??

Name: Chez Moi
Title: A French oasis in the land of fish and chips!
Review: A good choice of excellent dishes both for lunch and dinner. Best croque monsieur to date! Obviously very popular so booking advance to be sure of a table. Parking tricky but only a short walk from the town centre.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: S#it£ hole.
Review:
First impressions last so hopefully I never have to visit this dump again. Ok it was Saturday at 6.45pm so busy time but that's no excuse. Your making money so employ more staff.
Firstly drinks. 2 cans of Brewdog Elvis juice and 2 refill soft drinks £15 something. That's London prices not Littlehampton.
Placed order in good time and headed up to the salad bar. Mostly empty. Shouldn't be hard to keep topped up. It's not like you have a chef making any of it is it.
Food took ages to arrive but it was peak time. Food was ok.
1 wine, 1 g+t, 1 cider, another £15.80 ouch. Shoulda gone to weather spoons.
Desserts. Sundae's were fine. Chocolate fudge cake massive plate of dryness. Think Tesco's value left out in the sun all day. The chocolate orange slice was nice but was a quarter of the size of the chocolate fudge dryness.
Finally the toilets. Men's urinal almost overflowing the whole night. An old mayo tub under another leaking one. Toilet seat broken on the floor and neither hand dryer working. Ladies were no better. Smelly, hand dryer not working. Blue roll all over the place.

You wonder how these large pub/restaurant co's are allowed to operate so poorly. I guess if the money is pouring in, no one's that bothered.

Name: Church Farm
Title: Short Family Break
Review:
4 nights spent at Church Farm, with 2 youngsters and the dog. Booked via the ‘Sun’ holiday promotion. Our stay was the week before the start of the school holidays so the park was reasonably quite.

We benefited from upgrading to a prestige van with 3 bedrooms, which was 2 years old. On arrival it was clean, tidy and well fitted out. Benefited from bedding, appliances etc in a quite location. Perfect for the family.

The park has a great entertainment area with evening shows, arcade and both indoor and outdoor pools. Although the pools aren’t large they are in good condition with a slide. Not sure how they will be in peak session / school holidays esp as changing areas are limited.

The mini market caters for your everyday needs. The shows were entertaining and as a family we enjoyed watching each night.

The only downside of the holiday was the pub / restaurant. Although open all day the quality and organisation was poor. Ordered breakfast (hardly any other customers present) and had to wait over 40 mins. When food arrived it was wrong and had to be sent back. Another long wait before it finally came by which time we had spent an hour waiting and had 2 hungry kids. No apology, no discount, just a shrug of shoulders....... and over £20 which could have been spent elsewhere!

We all loved the location being close to the sea (shingle beach) and near lots of attractions. Somewhere where we would happily return...... but would avoid the pub, hence only 4*
Read less

Name: Littlehampton Beach
Title: Beautifully clean
Review: Had intended to go for a swim, so was fully prepared, but forgot to check the tide times and the sea was waaaay out. But it was lovely walking along the empty beach. Plenty of Sand! I'll go again when the tide is in, as it will be a better depth nearer to the promenade, as the beach is steeper nearer to the top.

Name: Mamma Mia
Title: Great food. You’ll need to book
Review:
We visited this restaurant while on a weekend away. If we hadn’t booked, we wouldn’t have been able to get a table. It was full all evening. We could watch the staff cooking and the chef cane out to speak to anyone who had questions about the menu.

The food was so good, we returned again the next night.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: A waste of a great location
Review: From the outside the place looks very inviting, nice lighting, warm and great location, however when you get inside, reality hits hard. It has an open plan kitchen and the room for the restaurant is actually quite small. I love a good burger, but here they were just ok, then you add in the arundel pricing, uncomfortable chairs, greasy smell everywhere, the wait for the food and skin on fries which I hate it all did not add up to a great experience. Plus the fact that is 2019 and there are plenty of option to make many, test vegetarian burgers so my other half would have been more happier.

Name: Motte & Bailey
Title: Next time, we’ll just post forty quid through the letterbox, apologise and run away.
Review: A lunchtime rush promised much yet delivered very little: a brief half an hour was spent in the cafe yet despondency amongst staff left customers feeling like an inconvenience. Requests for condiments were met with barely concealed irritation. The meals were adequate at best but there was disparity between the price of the food and what was delivered. Having ordered a dairy-free drink due to a lactose intolerance, a regular dairy drink was delivered. On querying the origins of the milk, staff bizarrely asked whether the lactose-intolerant customer would like to finish the drink. A further request for separate bills was met with clenched teeth and a barely concealed sigh. This constant neediness simply added a further dreary layer of tedium to the apparently already bored staff’s troublesome shift from hell. Apologies for inconveniencing you all.

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Best avoided
Review: As we were told the café was full (even though there were empty tables) we foolishly went to the kiosk outside to order food and drinks. It was barely organised chaos. The queue just didn't move, while they faffed about pretending to know how to prepare food and drinks. When we finally got to order they had run out of most things we wanted on the limited menu (sausage rolls and sandwiches) so we ended up waiting 20 mins for some chips to be cooked, which was only a small portion. The tables out on the beach were dirty, with rubbish underneath them. A poorly managed place, which clearly trades on its location.

Name: Interchange Café
Title: Rude
Review: I went into the interchange cafe in search of a coffee and possibly food however when faced with a miserable woman with her arms folded saying ‘ Do you want anything or are you just looking at the books?’ I decided to leave and go to the small coffee booth on the opposite platform. What a rude woman she clearly doesn’t want to be there

Name: Grandads Front Room
Title: Helping hands
Review:
Wow what a place grandads frontroom is from selling and buying items for a house to helping the homeless and vulnerable people to being the Hub if the community well done Danny and team
Read more

Name: The Diner
Title: Disaster meal!
Review:
A booked birthday meal at lunchtime on a Sunday for 7 (5 adults / 2 children) turned into a shameful comedy of errors!
We ordered a sharing platter plus one other dish for starters and main courses.
What turned up was all but two mains with no starters. Waiter said that the starters and main were coming together but kitchen told to hold two mains. Very strange, we said they might as well cancel starters. 5 of us started eating but one was cold so went back and my daughter was missing her side order. No one came over to explain. The other two mains turned up about 10 mins later. Had to ask for daughters side order - again... one of the later meals had to go back as it was cold and had no fries on plate. When it came back it still had no fries!
Daughters side order turned up after 3 requests but they had put warm sweet corn (that she hadn’t ordered) and warm garlic bread on top of cucumber which she then wouldn’t eat as it was v unpleasant...
Floor manager explanation was that quite often people order starters and mains to come together - really?! Why would this be presumed?! Wasn’t v apologetic. Then agreed to take 20% off bill. Had to remind them to take side of fries off as one meal was missing fries. We reminded him as leaving that it was my sisters birthday and offered a free milkshake.
What’s a shame is that the food was actually nice when it arrived correctly and was hot!!’

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Very disappointed
Review: My previous experience of Hall and Woodhouse was a fabulously fresh and artistically presented ploughmans lunch at World End in Patching, Worthing. My friend and I decided on a ploughmans each at the Black Rabbit but it was disappointing. The rocket had wilted, spring onion was the outside throwaway shell, celery again outside section, unwashed so too chewy, bread roll not crusty or warm and salad a little sad as though it'd been sitting around. When we told the waitress she never replied and when paying for it we were asked again if we'd enjoyed it, we said no. No reply, no queries, nothing. We only saw student bar staff and no one appeared to be in charge so did anyone care enough to feed back our disappointment? A worthy establishment would surely be concerned or at least deduct our coffees or drinks off the bill? Poor.

Name: The Swan
Title: Hopefully just a blip
Review: The food and service have been pretty good recently but the menu seems to have gone too fancy. Spicy harissa lamb was not just rare it was uncooked and wasn’t really spicy. Tried hard with the fish pie but I succumbed finally to the lack of seasoning and abundance of dill. Shame because it’s a great pub.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Beautiful building
Review:
The castle was amazing to look at. You come in from below so it looks quite striking as it towers above you. The tickets were a bit confusing as you have four choices depending on how much you want to see! We went for the silver tickets which meant we didn't see the newer area of the castle or the bedrooms. I'm not sure why they have different ticket choices, but we felt that it wasn't worth paying the extra to just see some bedrooms. What we saw was lovely - there was information to read about the old part of the castle and some good views from the top of the tower. The gardens were lovely to walk around and the church is well worth a visit too.
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Disappointed
Review: We booked a table for 14. When we arrived we were placed on 2 different tables. We asked if 2 tables could be moved together. The staff said they would but it didn't happen so we moved the tables ourselves!! We waited 1.5 hours for out first course. They dropped our cauliflower cheese on the floor (which we paid extra for) and had no more, so We were offered more roast potatoes and Yorkshire puddings (which were unlimited anyway!) The extra potatoes and Yorkshire puddings didn't arrive! My daughter's tuna was over cooked and was like a rock. The 2 children's cheeseburgers had no cheese and the tomato ketchup and mayo arrived after the children had eaten their chips as they were so hungry waiting so long for their meals. Altogether not a very good experience! Such a pity as it was a family reunion.

Name: Burger King Rustington
Title: Run out of buns
Review: The woman behind the counter waited 10 minutes before telling us they have run out of buns. we left.

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Great food but very costly
Review:
Went in Wednesday eve. Staff were lovely. Food very tasty. But was somewhat surprised when I was given the bill. £84 for two ok includes drinks but have been to a lot of other places and normally see £55 60.00
Shame as very nice evening but a nasty shock at the end. Perhaps this is why such a lot of discounts pop up on Facebook??.

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Don't eat here
Review: Presently stopping in butlins, everything has been good apart from the bar and kitchen. Expensive food and when arrived 2 meals were okay and the other 2 were awful. The burger was extremely dry and hard, the garlic bread had been sat out for around20 minutes and was burnt and when we told them of the problem they only offered a free pudding even though we never had our main. Would not recommend eating here. The beachecomber was much better service.

Name: Linden Fisheries
Title: Under New Management
Review:
Been going here for few years, Found out the couple that run it have left.
Tried the news guys anyway - Wish I didn't.
 Chips were undercooked and a large portion was very small.
Smallest bits of Huss I have ever had and didn't even taste very nice!
Won't be returning - Bottom find a new Chippy :(

Name: Butlins
Title: Family Xmas trip
Review:
Every year we do something with our grandchildren and this year my brother and sister in law we’re taking their young children to the Xmas Butlins event and persuaded us to come and return it. We bought three of our grandchildren 5-7 & 12 10 out of 10 for good auld Butlins, they all had an amazing time! My Nephew and Niece are 4 & 7 they come often and I’m so glad we came too! The accommodation was a 3 bedroom apartment and was soooo roomy and fitted with all the necessities we needed. The entertainment was 2nd to none!! Amazing I recommend Butlins in the month of December! Your children will love its such good value for money! We will definitely be back next year xx
Read less

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Not very good
Review:
We visited this restaurant at 5pm on 10th March. The scallops were served up cold, the prawn cocktail was served with dry bread and not a lot of sauce.
We all had the roast which tasted as it had been heated up from lunchtime and not not very fresh.

On a good note the waiter dealt with our situation very well and appropriately.

Unfortunately unless we knew that there was a different chef then none of us would return to the restaurant for a meal. Jame party

Name: The Lion
Title: Delicious food and lovely waiting staff
Review: Came for a Sunday lunch recently which was delicious and worth every penny, although food was a little slow the waiting staff were very attentive and welcoming especially the lovely Isobel who made our stay worth while. Will definitely be returning.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: A very comfortable stay
Review:
I arrived around 9pm for a one night stay in Arundel for work. Check in was quick and I was in my room within 5 minutes of arriving. The room was nice and big, full of character, and finished to a very high standard. The double bed was very comfortable, and at the foot of it was a big modern flatscreen TV. The bathroom was great, it only had a bath (no shower) which is no bother to me, it just means you have to relax and do nothing for abit!

Breakfast was very good, options for cooked and self serve continental. Very good for vegetarians.

Overall a very pleasant business stay.
Read less

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: 3 Star Room and Service for a 5 Star price
Review:
How disappointing! The room had none of the features clearly implied on the website and was scruffy. On speaking with the helpful staff they recommended I communicate by email with the General Manager who was away at the time. A week later not even the recognition of a response. A case study for losing custom and referrals through embellished marketing and a low grade approach to service
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: It’s a shame !
Review:
It is a pity and a shame for Hilton name! The hotel must be a 2 stars hotel and nothing more . Dirty ( very!!), old and never repaired, neglected, stinky, with the fitting that I have never found in another Hilton hotel.
The room had a lot of missing items ( in a four stars hotel I pretend at least the fridge with at least one water bottle inside), the ceiling was stained, the room was hot even with the open windows and due to this it has been placed an old ventilator and a noisy movable conditioner, with hanging cables everywhere.
The indoor swimming pool had dirty water and floor around it and it hadn’t even the soap in the ( not illuminated) shower.
In the room there were cables and missed switches, one bed lamp was broken and not working.
In the night we were waked up by the fire alarm ( as all the hotel guests) due - they told us - to an alarm in one room ( or by a mis-contact as we suppose). Then at 6 in the morning it was noisily inserted a apology letter under the door, waking us up again.
We have chosen Hilton and not one of the ( many) other hotels because we supposed to have the grant of quality but we were totally wrong. We just paid a 4 star hotel price (270 pound for one night!) to sleep one night in a old, neglected, stinky hotel.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Half term break
Review:
Great place for a half term break. Enjoyed the weekday break along with hotel stay and the food package. Just felt a little bit of planning is required to ensure we can make the best of the facilities and shows
Read less

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Great Food, Amazing Views
Review: The George and Dragon is a lovely pub/restaurant set in the Sussex downs. We visited on a beautiful day, and took advantage of the opportunity to sit outside. With excellent views it truly is a relaxing place to visit.  The food is first class and the staff are very friendly and attentive. Everything seems to be freshly cooked and using local produce.  We have probably visited four or five times during the summer period, but I hadn’t reviewed on Trip Advisor.  Highly recommended

Name: Sea View Hotel
Title: Family
Review:
Great pub the management are very moody and rude they hate kids and dogs
The manager has a scary rude face she shouted at people today

Name: China Palace
Title: RUDE STAFF AWFUL WELCOME
Review: Avoid at all costs.....on arrival we asked if they had a table for two, we were then asked if we had booked a table when we said no we were tutted at and the staff said something about us in Chinese. We were then marched to a table where the menus were thrown on the table, I was pushed by the staff member and laughed at. Out came a lady who all but threw a basket of prawn crackers in front of us. The waiter with attitude then asked us if we wanted a drink we replied yes do you have a bottle of Chardonnay, this was met by a response of the waiter shoving a drinks menu at us and flicking through it, when he couldn't find the wine on the menu he scowled at us and said " I will come back in a bit" should he not know whats on his drinks menu. We decided to leave as we walked out of the door not one member of staff asked what was the problem. From two Restaurant critics

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Fantastic cinema
Review:
Love this place.

So cheap - £3.50 on a week day, £4.50 at the weekend.

It looks run down and grubby from the outside but it’s not like that inside.

The staff are always friendly, the food and drink are cheap.

The cinema is like an old theatre, the main screen makes you feel like you are going back in time. The other screens downstairs have been revamped recently and look great.

I love this cinema and it’s such great value, since discovering it a few years ago, I really go anywhere else!
Read less

Name: Mustards
Title: Fabulous
Review: What a wonderful find in Bognor Regis. The food was absolutely first rate. Modern and imaginative. The chefs/kitchen obviously love what they do. I highly recommend them. The staff were attentive but not intrusive and were very professional. Thank you all for a really good experience. I must make special mention of the bar staff who's knowledge and expertise of "mixology" was exceptional. Their cocktails were amazing. Such imagination! As they are the first people you see on entering Mustard's I commend them for their warm welcome. Please choose to visit this fabulous addition to Bognor's food scene. You will not be disappointed.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Big surprise
Review:
From the outside the castle is very impressive. However as we climbed to the top I was less and less impressed as I have seen plenty of castles. However on the way down we discovered the Duke’s apartments. We had not realized that this is the ancestral home of the Duke of Norfolk. We were not allowed into the Duke’s rooms but there several guest bedrooms, hallways libraries etc that are still in use and decorated beautifully. Plenty of docents to answer questions. Great place to visit.
Read less

Name: Reema
Title: Perfect Birthday Dinner!
Review:
Ate here whilst staying in East Preston. Everything was excellent and faultless. Service was wonderful and the food was one of the best we have had in a long time.
Will be back when we stay in East Preston again, thank you! X

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Family day out
Review: Went to Littlehampton with our two young girls grandchildren and decided to have lunch at the Windmill Harvester as we usually do only to be told that we could not come in unless we had booked as they were short staffed. The restaurant was empty. Surely they could have served a couple of tables rather than turn custom away. Very inconvenient.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Avoid eating in the bar
Review:
Harvesters are usually low end eateries but perfectly acceptable.
